column13:
Great place for sports beers and good food.  Bartenders get to know you and it becomes a great neighborhood spot.  Evan at the bar best bartender ever.  Your food comes fast and so does the beer.   


Bridget has done amazing she has made the place even better with a great smile and a great service. Scott came and talked us up he is hilarious and made for a great night!

Scott, the general manager, is an excellent host for group events... His bartenders and servers are attentive and provide excellent service... Their burger and fries are a great choice!

We will be back to have another happy hour group event there :-)

Just moved to the area and was looking for a chill sports bar to have a casual drink and some food. The bar is really open and dog themed- overall pretty cute. 

It seems like they need to get a waitress to just serve tables bc there are a lot of different seating areas that need attention. There is ample bar seating and the outside patio is nice - even has a pool table. 

We had some tots and boneless wings as a snack. We had the Siracha chipotle and spicy cranberry - both were good. Standard bar food but good! Bill was reasonably cheap too. 

Nice little place to hang out and chill after a long day.

FANTASIC service with a smile from Johnny, an awesome female waitress who was taking care of everyone, a really chill atmosphere. I asked for a sweeter lemon drop and our bartender DELIVERED! Perfect from start to finish. 
Ordered the fries - solid 'meets expectations' for bar fries!, I got a burger and the man got fish and chips. Perfect batter on fish, my burger had fresh made spicy guac and crispy bacon, cooked perfect to the temp I asked for! Our servers never let the plates pile up or the drinks run out! It was fantastic. Outdoor area was open and had a fire pit and pool table. Inside has large ceilings and was beautifully put together. Very impressed and will be back regularly!

While excited for the corporately owned non-chain chain pub to open up in the neighborhood, I can only give three stars. 

The upside:
They did a nice job cleaning up the inside and building a good space for drinking beer and watching sports. (Around 14 screens mounted up high and they will have the NFL ticket.) It looks like ownership had deep enough pockets to do a lot of things right.

The downside: 
My calzone came out cold in the middle and had to be sent back. Seems like someone coulda noticed the cheese wasn't melted. It was also unnecessarily challenging to get someone's attention when we were ready for the check. 4 people behind the bar, and not one noticed two empty pints and finished meals? Scan the bar! 

I heard another neighbor suggest it was sorta pricey for beers. I can understand that gripe as well: $3 Coors banquet bottles doesn't seem so "special"... 

Still, they are in their first week. I look forward to watching them figure it out. I'll update this review after they've had some more time to establish themselves and work out the kinks.
So glad this place is local - I'll definitely be a regular! Fantastic food, great drink specials, lots of sports & really cool vibe! Love it!

We live nearby and wanted to give these guys some time to get things together before trying - we should have given them much longer.
Food is smoked elsewhere and then trucked over to be reheated, (might as well buy it at Wal-Mart); rice in my burrito was so badly undercooked I thought I was chewing sand; and a "basket of fries" apparently means "tiny plate with 20 fries" for $5...
The staff was attentive and kind but no overlooking the sad food. Eat at home and then drop by for a cold beer... cheers!

Awesome neighborhood bar! Great place to catch a bronco game or grab some beers/ cocktails with friends :).  The bartenders are super attentive and fast at the service!   The outdoor areas are fun and plenty of tvs are mounted to see the football games in progress ... the decor of dog portraits is awesome and a fun theme :)
Garbage service. If you go there, don't expect to be waited on. The servers hardly check if you need anything. The food is decent.
Holy cow that burger was terrific! And the mac 'n cheese was amazingly tasty. This will be my new burger place when I'm in town.
Open and relaxed sports bar with great food!!!  Wings are smoked and amazing!  Try the garlic Parmesan ones, they are a real treat!!!

Tried the Lucky Mutt again on a weekday night. The service was excellent this time. I had the Simms Smash Hash, smashed tots smothered in green chili with smoked pork. It was a revelation. I'll be back on a week day night. Hopefully the weekend crew can catch up.

I can only give three stars for now, but will gladly update my review in the future if applicable. I was not impressed with the food at all. The wings were not good. Seems like they were deep-fried, the oil was dripping off, therefore the sauce didn't stick properly. Not impressed. For the price and amount you get, definitely not a bargain. The service was good, our server did a nice job. Inside looks nice. Loved the large booths. Will come back to give it a go again. 

Updated review: Gave them time, and wow, what an improvement!! Exceptional service and attentiveness. Wings far better!!! Must've been a bad day. Great portion size now!!! Total turn around!!! 5 stars!

So excited for this place! We have been waiting for our neighborhood spot to re-open, with better owners/food/ambiance. The bar has been totally revamped, and the huge patio with fireplace and pool table was great. Scott the GM greeted us upon arrival, introduced the company and the concept, and was super friendly. Tracey was our bartender and she was as equally as friendly. Had a few beers on draft, and the fish and chips (REALLY GOOD). The whole menu looked awesome and I'm definitely coming back to try more. Overall, very happy to finally have a regular spot where we can come and feel right at home!

We've been waiting for them to finally open.  For being the Friday of opening week it was much better than expected.   Service was pleasant.  Food was good.  Mac and cheese was yummy.  Hubby had chicken club mutt.   It was ok.  Tater tot app with green chili was good.  Place was packed.  Inside is VERY loud.  Sat on patio.   Cement benches tough on the back but nice patio.  They have done a good job and we look forward to coming back.
Great food. Great service. It's really close to home and it's super spacious. Can't wait to come back.

Just opened. It's crazy this first week but I am glad they are open. The staff, Bridget, Dannielle and manager Scott all are the first three that took care of us and are machines! It was busy the couple of times but they do make sure you are taken care of. BTW, UFC would be great next time!!

Very excited for this to open but find their food delivery is really slow.  Wait staff seem unable to speed up the kitchen even during slow customer times.  Hoping this improves! Love the redone interior and tvs!
Nice facelift and a great little spot in our neighborhood. Our group ordered three separate entrees and they were all good. Service was perfect. We will be back!

I absolutley love that The Lucky Mutt has opened. We've been waiting for a nice neighborhood spot for a while now. It is so clean and nice inside with a downtown tavern feel. The staff was very attentive and friendly, everyone seemed to be having fun and working at a great pace! We had the chiquitos and fish and chips...amazing! I cant wait to go back with the family and visit the great staff!!!

Great service and cold beer! Loads of TV's for football season. We also tried some of their food which was above average as compared to other bars. Way to go guys....great cleanup of a dumpy old dive!

Been there 4 times - the remodeled bar is great, and I love all the dog pictures.  The food so far has been delicious.  It is pricey, though, for the neighborhood, but I plan on making this the go-to "spot" when we don't know what's for dinner!
Truly a local gem!  Food is fantastic, service is fast and friendly. A must if you if you live within 50 miles

Done dinner and the bar twice now

Likely on of the best spots on the 285 corridor 

Always a nice experience

This place is a hidden gem-

Drove by everyday for years and knew there was a restaurant here but never explored it.

To summarize;

Fresh ingredients, food comes kitchen to table in less than a minute, attentive and friendly wait staff, rotating menu with creative apps and specials. 

The owner has been on-site both times I've eaten here  and really makes you feel welcome. Has a feel of a family run Italian restaurant mixed with a gastropub. Most of the people coming in tonight knew all the staff by name.

Recommendations:

1. Duck wings
2. Saracha fried polenta sticks
3. Any pizza on the menu 

The pizza is made from scratch from the dough to the sauce. Margarita pizza is made with San marzzano tomatoes, motzerella and fresh basil. The steak with gorgonzola pizza is also amazing.

This is a nice place- especially for the Turkey Creek Crowd, or those coming down from the hills.  The food was very good and the Beer selection was solid.  They also had some specials that were quite tasty.  A little Awkward to get into and out of, and I look forward to going back to eat on the deck in the summer.  I will be back. It's always nice to see an independent establishment doing well!

Food and service have been top notch with every visit.  We have introduced several friends and family members to Twin Forks recently, and their experience has been the same as ours.  Quite the little gem on 285.  I would recommend the Sticky Salmon and the olive tapenade infused mashed potatoes!

This restaurant is a gem. Competent and friendly owner, Amber is a great bartender and the food is what you'd expect for 3x the money on larimer.  We had both the pork chop special and the beef tenderloin and will be back. 

If you haven't been, check out the beaver ranch disc golf course and then drop by for a delicious meal!
Decent food, nice atmosphere. The bartender informed us that he was too busy to get us drinks as we waited 30 minutes for a table though.

Food was really average and overpriced for a tavern.  Wine and beer selection was poor as well.  Seems to more be a local place then a destination place.  Unfortunately took an out of town friend there and he gave me grief about it all the way home...

Msde a reservation after seeing great reviews here, before attending an amazing concert at Red Rocks. we were s little skeptical as we pulled up to an empty parking lot, but our hesitation vanished as soon as we saw the cute restaurant and read the menu. Fabulous food, amazing service and very close to Red Rocks. I highly recommend!!

Utterly horrible - my mahi mahi could have been made from cardboard, my husbands beef, two little disks was raw.  Wine list way overpriced.  Dinner for two was over $100, not including tip.  Wish it had been better, will not be back.
The service is always top notch, thorough but not intrusive. The food has always been good in the 3 times we have been. I will go back and would love to try prime rib night. Keep up the good work!

Still phenomenal on the second visit. Duck wings are just as delightful, and the basil-seared Mahi-mahi with lobster butter sauce (that sauce!) put a big smile on my face with the first bite. My husband had  the special, a center-cut filet Oscar topped with lump crab. At $48, we hesitated. The filet appeared heftier than its advertised 8oz.  It was perfectly cooked, and after his first bite, he proclaimed, "You don't try cooking this cut if you don't know what you're doing."  They knew what they were doing. Bravo to the kitchen for consistently irreproachable food and to the front end for warmly professional service.

It's a meal you would expect to get in downtown Denver. Had the butterfly pork chop and it was outstanding. Nice small craft beers on tap that's always a plus. Our server Amber was outstanding and made some great recommendations. Will be back for sure .
Great food very friendly staff and incredible  wine selection, pricey  but you only live once

This place is awesome!!  I can't believe how close it is to our neighborhood.  Just a few minutes up 285, easy on easy off the highway.  The food was great, the service was outstanding and the location is so wonderful.  You feel like you are in the middle of the mountains, but you are only a few minutes from "town".  Skip the run of the mill, dime a dozen chain restaurants in Littleton and head up to Twin Forks Tavern.  We will definitely be back!!

Believe the reviews, this place is great. Definitely in an obscure location Right off of 285, but still easy to get to if you pay attention. And it's worth it. The offerings are first-class, beautiful flavors and combinations; making a selection was really difficult. My wife got the filet oscar special, and I had the halibut with an orange-ginger glaze. Both were outstanding. Great beer menu, full bar to boot. Don't miss it if you're in the area, and if you need somewhere new, this is your place.

My husband and I went here for 5280 Restaurant week and their food was awesome!!  I got the coconut shrimp sticks and he got the duck wings.  They were both really, really good!  Then for our main dish it was salmon w/ wasabi mashed potatoes and I had pork tend.  The salmon was the best we have ever had.  No fishy taste at all!  We will definitely be going back!  The atmosphere was also really nice.  The place is pretty fancy and they have expensive food on their menu along with a couple types of pizzas.  Weird combo, but I am excited to try a pizza next time we are in the area.

We came after a long day in the mountains and were very impressed. First impression we were greeted at the door by Roger and then by every one at the bar on our way to the table. Roger who also seated us took time to talk to my kiddo. Our server Amber was amazing brought crayons for my daughter and drew on the table with her. Kept our drinks full and did her very best to accommodate us. The food was good we loved the brussel sprouts but the service defiantly put it over the top. Thank you Amber & Roger we will be back!

Great staff and friendly service. Food was fantastic. We had the Seared Mahi Mahi appetizer (which was one of about 12 specials that the amazing waitress was able to remember) it was delicious. For dinner my wife had the Salmon and I had the beef medallions and added a lobster tail. Food came very fast. Everything was cooked perfectly and incredibly delicious. It is always a good sign when the menu is small too. That means they keep the stock fresh by having less items to rotate and fortify it daily with specials. Just wish it was closer to Conifer. Please support this wonderful local business. They appreciate their customers. You will not be disappointed.

This place is phenomenal.  The food and service are amazing and although it is much more upscale than most places in the foothills, it is a cozy comfortable atmosphere and very reasonable prices.  The proprietors are extremely friendly and you can tell they take a lot of pride in the place.  Please please please keep visiting this place so it stays open!!!!   We need great restaurants like this in the foothills!  Delicious!!!
Loved this place especially the brussels sprouts. Had a work dinner there last week and they had great service.

We were a little leary when pulling in, but you can't judge a book by its cover...or restaurant by its exterior.  Jen, our waitress, was extremely friendly and informative. Everyone else was also very friendly and welcoming. All the food is homemade...you get that home-cooked meal without the mess.  We had the polenta fries, meatloaf, and pork chops...all fabulous!  Great prices for excellent cuts of meat.  Everything was prepared to our liking and quite flavorful.  We will make this a monthly stop!

been here 3 times total and will be happy to return. we tried a lot of items by now, so here are our favorite ones so far:
polenta fries (seriously order them, only thing you might crave id a bit more sauce...)


beet salad (ok, this is the most flavorful explosion you might have for a long time - its so good it will be an all time favorite 

today we had the surf&turf - omg this should be a daily item - seafood of shrimp and scallops are flavorful BUT the meat ??? seriously its like butter - you immediately want more of it

we tried several deserts and none disappointed us

For several reasons we like to support local businesses and this is one of it - we have not found a disappointment dish here!

ok, sure there are a few things you like to see improvement in but still its a great yummy place

I don't think you'll be disappointed!

great service, great food, local ingredients and you support CO business 

I'm happy I have a place close-by I can just go to and enjoy great meals without any hustle or disappointment,
continue current

We arrived about an hour early before the kitchen opened. They seated us quickly even offered to make my daughter food before the kitchen even opened so she wouldn't be hungry. Very attentive staff, checked on us frequently. The food came in quick and it was DELICIOUS. Gourmet food that was definitely affordable. The best meatloaf I have ever had in my life. We are visiting from California and we will most definitely return to twin forks tavern the next time we are in town. I would recommend them to everybody. The staff was amazing and the food was to die for! They earned five stars for sure.
I have only had food To-Go as my wife picked it for me. It was shocked how good it was. Will definitely go to dine in soon!! Glad to have you in the neighborhood!

I found this place on Yelp and my wife and I stopped here before a concert at Red Rocks. I was a little worried it would be super busy but it wasn't. We started our meal off with the duck wings which were amazing. I had the Pepperoni and  Mascarpone pizza and my wife had the Beef Tenderloin. Both were very good but I think the favorite was the pizza. The wait staff was extremely nice and I believe either the manager or owner was also working the room and striking up conversations with people. We will definitely be back the next time we are in the area for a concert.
Really nice place to eat, get a pizza or get a drink. Great place to hook up midway to Conifer peps. I will be back soon.
It's always delicious.  We come here about once a month.  The meat loaf is incredible, the beef medallions are delicious, the salmon is amazing.  Seriously, try it, you won't regret it.

We just stopped in after a day of playing in the mountains, so we were in jeans and t-shirts. Service was exceptional with multiple wait staff checking in on us, made us feel welcome. Momma's meatloaf was superb, husband had the pork chop which was phenomenal! Atmosphere is very nice and will go back for a romantic dinner!

This place is under new management by the folks who own/run The Vine wine shop next door (same building). It has a great new menu and wine tastings Friday night. Love having this near home! The pizza is excellent. Looking forward to spending a few fall evenings on the patio. I only wish they'd do a kids menu (I'll keep my kids on the patio out of your hair!).

This is the by far, the best restaurant in the Conifer area.  I am so excited to have a place to go that isn't just burgers/pizzas/Mexican.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  The food is fresh and the menu diverse.  The service is excellent.  This will be my go to for dining when I am not up for a drive in to Denver.
Top notch service. A real gem and a great addition to our mountain community. Reasonably priced for the quality. Innovative menu. I'll be back!

My husband and I have enjoyed their  Prime Rib a couple of times and were blown away with the size and quality.   While they are a bit expensive the food and atmosphere were outstanding.   We look forward to the day they serve Prime Rib on Saturday as well.
Unbelievably good service.  I had the short ribs and my wife had the Duck wings and beat salad.  Both were exceptional.  Great to have a new restaurant in the area, try it out.

Went here on a recommendation and far exceeded our expectations. Chose to sit at the bar which turned out very well for us. Our bartender/waiter, Aaron, was extremely helpful on our entree and appetizer selection with impeccable pairing suggestions and articulation of flavor profiles. The Thai chili duck wings were crispy and tender, sweet and spicy. The beef medallions with whiskey peppercorn sauce melt in your mouth and come with the perfect amount of scalloped potatoes and asparagus spears. The fiocchi was to die for. El denti pasta filled with pear and cheese layered onto a bed of walnuts, arugula, and a light cream sauce. The manager even provided a complimentary port to pair with the flourless chocolate cake. Aaron was attentive and conversational without being interruptive. Twin Forks was inviting and unpretentious with an upscale neighborhood feel. Our compliments to Whitney, the chef. Pricing... Fantastic.

We live in the area and had high hopes earlier this year when we saw this place belong remodeled and opening with new owners. Unfortunately, Twin Forks doesn't live up to expectations. The limited menu and prices suggest they were consider themselves more than your average neighborhood bar & grill-- but slapping up some new paint & adding tablecloths doesn't equate to fine dining. Service was good---they do get points for that. But we won't be back.

We stopped by, not realizing that it had changed hands.  We were expecting to get a cheeseburger and a beer.  I'm sure my eyes were huge when we walked in and realized how nice this place is now.  The décor is beautiful, the staff was wonderful and the Manager/Owner made us feel right at home.  I had the beef tenderloin.  So good.  The meat was incredible.  The scalloped potatoes were a bit overdone, but still very yummy.  He had the salmon and said it was wonderful.  We will be back!!  Thanks for a wonderful time and making us feel so welcome.

We really enjoyed our dinner here. We were in jeans and shorts but would have been just as comfortable if we had been dressed up for a nice dinner out. The flatbread was great and the pizza was too. Great atmosphere. Great service...And they swipe your credit card at the table.

The service here was horrible. I will never come back. The waiter was a jerk. Plus, some poor woman came in and kindly asked if her 5 year old daughter could use the rest room. Our waiter responded in the most rude and unkind manner.  I was so embarrassed to be in this establishment and to see how rudely this man could treat another human being. If you are looking for poor service and a lack of basic human kindness this is the place for you.

When I can scavenge enough money to go out to eat as a college student I will pay a bit extra for good food and service.  I am willing to pay a bit extra for both if they exceed my expectations. Good service to me is a waiter that gets your order correct, delivers your food promptly, and checks on my satisfaction but doesn't make me feel rushed to finish eating. When eating out, I have a very weird habit of eating all my fries before the entree.  I would consider myself a "French Fry Connoisseur".  I do still expect the rest of the meal to be tasty but the fries make the meal for me.
 
Parker Garage is a restaurant, and bar in Parker, Colorado that has an automotive garage motif. The first two things I noticed as I walked in were the metal rafters and a large bar.  I ate on the patio during the lunch hour and my waiter seemed to be the only one waiting tables outside. Impressively, the service was very good. The waiter was attentive but not over barring.  I can't say much about the bar because I am still underage.
 
I ordered the smoked turkey sandwich with fries ($11). The sandwich was sub-par.  It consisted of the ingredients of a burger but instead of a patty is seemed like deli lunch meat. I expected the turkey to be a bit more flavorful.  Although, the French Fries were amazing. The fries were thin cut and cooked to perfection with no burnt edges, salted just enough, and weren't soggy with grease. I will definitely be back for the fries. The meal was a bit expensive considering the quality of the entree but the fries made up for it

I have had two great visits here, and tonight was exceptional! My husband, baby, and I came in after hitting up Parker Oktoberfest, and we wanted some drinks and desserts. We got the flourless chocolate torte, and when I ordered, we asked our server if he had any ice cream - you know, for the little one. He apologized, said they didn't have ice cream because of their limited freezer space (they make everything from scratch every day, no need for a freezer). We said that was fine and left it at that.

Here's where the exceptional part comes in - when he brought back our torte, he had with him a cup of vanilla ice cream from Baskin Robbins! Now that's some 'above and beyond' service! He went down the street to get ice cream for my little one!!!

Things like that are what make me loyal to businesses- I will definitely be back.

I really wanted to love Parker Garage. I eat a primarily vegan diet and only bring locally, humanely raised, naturally fed animal into my house. I was so excited to see a restaurant like this open in Parker.  I went with 2 friends on a Friday night. One had been there for lunch and really liked it. I had heard nothing but bad reviews from other I know, but they were paying so off I went.

We sat out on the porch, which was nice. The service was good. I ordered a Moscow Mule and had to send it back twice and finally ordered something else. It was the worst mule ever. I don't know how you can ruin a mule. It's not rocket science. The food was good, not great. I had the pork chop with a sous vide duck egg on top of a really nice corn salsa. It was good, not great and very pricey. The other girls had the ribeye and lasagna. The one who had the lasagna said it was ok, not great. 

I prepare everything from scratch at my house and use only the best locally raised meats, when I eat meat. It's way better at my house. Don't think I'll be back.

5280 recently listed Parker Garage as one of the top 5 places for bloody marys so we decided to try a local place with such a great endorsement. Saturday morning we walked to the store front where no hours were posted (do we really need to use yelp for everything?). We waited until the 11am opening time to find they DO NOT have bloody marys on their menu. After we were seated we were given a small plates menu and told they do not even serve brunch on Saturday. No thanks.

Service is phenomenal even during peak hours.  Enjoyed the Poutine, Spicy Tenderloin Salad and the Carbone.  Our server split them for a shared experience and to do that is exceptional customer care.  Fun place to people watch on the patio.

A fine mess of an attempt to do fine food. The menu had 7 entrée options and they were out of two.  I ordered the steak, medium rare, my wife ordered the 1/2 chicken. 

The steak was delivered with only a tinge of pink. The chicken was small and flavorless. If your going to have a limited menu then you better do those items well. The Parker Garage did not. 1st and last visit.

I must agree with a few reviews. The food was very basic and very bland. Seems as if this Chef is lacking in experience and palate; far too concerned with "design". Food has no substance. "Poor attempt at fine dining" as one review said. As all of us locals know;  Parker and Colorado as a whole is turning into a pretentious mess. This restaurant is a prime example of what is happening. Will not be going back to Parker Garage nor will I recommend it. Find the heart of true Colorado and you might have something.

Very good food great bar selection. I will tell you the reason I am giving them 3 stars. 

My wife and I with another couple went in one Saturday for dinner. 
Apparently we were a little under dressed for the wait staffs taste. The consented staring at us with the look like we were going to dine and dash. We had just came off ranch. Our wives were a little better dressed than us two guys. All this up in till the check came and they saw how we were paying the bill did their prick aditude instantly went away. 

I guess that's what happens when elbert county people meet parker people

When you first walk in you notice the wrenches as door handles and the overall style of a garage. Definitely a unique touch. Later, I learned that this place used to be a garage. I'm guessing that's where the name Parker Garage came from. The staff was very helpful. They seated us and asked what we would like to drink. When I turn my head to look at the bar, all you see is an eclectic amount of beer to choose from. Pretty awesome if you're a beer drinker. After looking at the menu, there are a lot of good choices and the waiter suggested the lobster roll and the lobster bisque. The food came out on time and tasted amazing. The chef happened to come out to talk to us and it was very cool to see where his inspirations came from. He definitely has a true passion for making food. He loves what he's doing and it definitely shows in the food.

I also had the truffle fries and they are simply amazing (definitely order this when you go here). So good that I had to order some to take home to my girlfriend. She pretty much ate it all even though it wasn't fresh and was a little soggy after a 40 minute drive. (Yes, we drove 40 minutes to eat here and it was worth it.)

The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is really chill with TV's to catch a game that you might want to watch. 

Pros: Great service. Awesome food. Variety of beers to choose from. Cool location. Unique theme.

Cons: I wish it was closer to me.

Overall: I would recommend this place to anyone.

It was good but overpriced.  I had eaten there before by myself.  I was familiar with the costs and was fine with that going in.  I had a burger with cheese and bacon.  16 bucks.  For that price it should have been one of the best burgers I've ever had.  It was good, but not 16 dollars good.  My wife had the chicken carbonara. 20 bucks! Maybe if the pasta was made in house.  Also good.  

My kids had mac'n cheese and a burger.  Also good.  The disappointment came when we waited quite a while for a refill and to be asked if we wanted dessert. The bartender was taking care of us and there weren't many people inside.  When we finally ordered dessert, we got the feeling like he didn't want us to.  We ended up ordering the flourless chocolate brownie which was really good!   The creed brûlée on the other hand was so bad we couldn't eat it.  Great texture, no sugar in the creme...only on top.  Either they are trying to do different, or someone forgot to put the sugar in the custard before cooking it.  We didn't eat them.  The bartender gladly removed them from our bill.  We also had the poutine for a app, 3 beers and some kids drinks.  Total was 106! No problem if things are spot on!  Otherwise, the price was high.  

We will be back as we live close and feel they truly care about the guest experience.  Small improvements and attention to detail will set this place apart from all others in the area.  Pricey for what we got on this Sunday evening.

We came here after the Wine Walk Friday night. The food and our server were OK, not great. My salad comprised of wilted lettuce and overcooked tenderloin. The real bummer came after the dinner... during the hustle & bustle to leave, 4 of us left our souvenir wine glasses on the table. We ran back in 1 minute later and were told by the rude, smug boy (same guy who brought the food out and was standing next to our just cleared table) that our glasses have already been 'smashed' and thrown away. He then went over to the left side of the bar to mimic smashing them in the bin with a big grin on his face. I understand not keeping items patrons leave behind forever, but to deliberately smash souvenirs that were left for 60 seconds & be happy about it is just bad business.

Nice little place.  Wide selection of wines, full bar, good food and great service.  Got here late and they took care of us rather than a tell us the kitchen is closing, limited menu of any thing.  It's all good.

I wish I could give them zero stars to start off we went there on Father's Day and had one of the worst meals the cream sauce tasted like it came out of a can three weeks before.  Normally I would not write a review because I have worked in the industry in the past and some times it is just a bad day.  But today they are doing the food for the Parker colorado October fest and that served me raw pork then told me it was fine. That could make someone very sick doing this and their attitude is unacceptable.

We have been here 3x in the last month.  Before this we had never visited since it changed from the War Horse, which was terrrrible!

We have, over the course of our visits, been very impressed with the food, service, and atmosphere.  Service has been friendly and sincere since we first walked in.  Atmosphere is really comfortable and open.  Porch is amazing.  The food has been most surprising in a good way.  Burger is great!  Porch chop was one of the best I've ever eaten, and we always get the Brussel
Sprouts as an appetizer.  Nice cocktail menu (beer list could use some work)

So nice to have the tailgate next door.  Both places are perfect for their own market.  Yes this place is on the higher end of cost, but it's on the higher end of quality in every aspect.  If a $12 burger is something you like to complain about, McDonalds is literally less than 100 meters away!  

So glad that Parker finally has a place like this since Vines was sold and has been AWFUL every time we have been over the last few years.  The awkwardness of elev 5900 left us perplexed every time we ate there.  

This is now our "go to" for a nice relaxing time!  Well done whoever runs the place!

My husband and I decided to try Parker Garage yesterday for lunch. It was not busy so we were seated right away. Hostess and wait staff were very friendly. The food selection is limited but varied. 

I ordered the Turkey Sandwich and my husband ordered the Cuban Sandwich. My sandwich was very good, however my husbands sandwich arrived ice cold. The outside of his Cuban sandwich was warm and toasted but the meat inside was cold to the touch, like it had just come out of a freezer. We had to send it back and the sandwich was reheated and reserved. Also, the bread choice for the Cuban was very dry and hard to swallow. They do have awesome french fries though. 

We have yet to decide if we will return and give them another chance. We like to eat local when we can but for the price, the food experience was disappointing.

I love Parker Garage! The owners did such a phenomenal job right down to having built in purse hooks under the tables! The owner, Megan, is such a sweet and gracious hostess. Always a bright smile and makes her guests feel extra special! I also just love that they truly care about our community!
I really enjoyed the food and service at this location.  I have large party reservations and they were extremely versatile.  I would recommend and I will go back.  Food was great.

Wow! Our server had an attitude! Food was ok, nothing special. Happy hour prices aren't really a deal. I pleaded with my husband to come here after he was not interested, and I can guarantee we won't be back.

Finally got to try this place out.  Been wanting to come here for several months. I was a little disappointed but I will come back and try again. 

Let's talk about the place itself.  Very very...plain. Not too fancy but not too casual. For the prices they charge for the food I was just not impressed at all with the atmosphere.  

Drink selection from what I saw was very decent. Didn't have any wine or look at the wine list so I can't comment on that. I had several single malt scotches and they had a good selection of those. 

Appetizers, there were three of us so we tried three different ones. Let's start with the duck tamales...1 out of 5 stars. Lacked any taste and just didn't do anything for me. Crab and cheese fries dumpling were good but so are the ones at any take out 4 out of 5. The bbq pork belly was pretty good...I've had better 3 out of 5. I'm being really critical but for the prices they charged...I should be. 

The entrees ordered were the whole fish (family style), beef tenderloin and seafood pasta. The whole fish was well...wholefish. They never did tell me what kind it was but I think it was a trout. For $40 bucks it was...ok. They filet the fish and brought out the bones with it. I would have preferred hem just to bring out the whole fish...it would have been more moist. The beef tenderloin was as good as anyplace else but it was pricey. Didn't try the seafood pasta. 

The dessert was very good. I ordered some kind of caramel custard. It was fabulous. One of the best I've ever had. The coffee was good but was never offered a warm up on it or a second cup. 

Like I said I will be back to try it out again but for spending over $300 for three people I would want a better experience....I'll give it one more try.

Interesting place that doesn't seem to know what it wants to be. Football on everywhere like a sports bar but then food much better than a sports bar and prices that don't fit the place.  Almost to the point of get rid of tvs put table cloths down and be a fine dining restaurant especially for the prices. 

That being said our food was excellent across the board. Cold chicken salad, philly steak, and pulled pork sandwiches are all good enough to come back for. Beet salad was simply too small to be called a meal but otherwise tasted great.  Service was excellent as well.  Looking forward to trying a dinner here at some point.
Went here for dinner with family and friends while in town, the food was indeed great. But damn! $35 a person for a decent sized meal and no drinks is insane, especially in Parker!

Atmosphere is nice 

Service was ok.   The food was pricey for what you got and didn't meet expectations 

I would not recommend
Very beautiful place!  Love the community tables and the single tables.  Wonderful food and great staff!  Keep up the good work.  Will be back!

I went here with one of my work friends and was extremely disappointed in this restaurant. First off, the service was terrible. It took at least five minutes for a worker to come help us find a menu to look at, and give us our table. After about 15 minutes or so, after we had been seated, a waitress finally came to help us once I got her attention. The water we received truly tasted like lake water. I could almost smell the amount of iron in my glass! Not to mention, there was no ice and the water was overly warm. To make matters worse, the menu was very limited at this time, therefore I ordered the Caesar salad-which was a HUGE mistake. The salad was $14, so my standards were high considering the price. However, the salad was one of the worst salads I've ever gotten. It tasted extremely bland, there was not near enough dressing or chicken to come with it. Overall, I was extremely disappointed with the restaurant, Parker Garage...
Food way over priced for what it is.  Absolutely not impressed and it is now marked off of our list for good.

If you want to spend a lot of money for no food go here.  I will never go back.  There was absolutely no fish in my fish and chips.  Paid 15 bucks for only one piece of overlooked breading.  I never do bad reviews but this was the worst meal I've had in a while and want to warn anyone from going here.

Never been at a restaurant bar that would not serve me a beer and glass of wine until they saw my wife who was in the restroom. They couldn't serve me two drinks while we waited for our table because I was the only one at the bar and they needed to verify the other drinker?!
Seems to me they want a upper middle class crowd but felt treated like I was in a cheap college bar. Tip for the manager, treat your upper middle class Parker families a little better and you may get return business. Won't be back ..
Italian sandwich was good and service was friendly.  Nice patio to enjoy the lovely afternoon as well.

I really liked the food and the service here.  The waiter was funny and made the stay more pleasant.  The only negatives were that they were out of a lot of the appetizers we would have tried.  I guess we will just have to go back and try again another time.  

Also I had the striped bass for dinner which wasn't bad, but I would say it was just ok. The rice that came with it wasn't as flavorful as I would have hoped.  It wasn't bad but it was ok.  I'd like to give them another chance another day and see how things go.

Horrible service. Took over 20 minutes to get our appetizer. When we asked for silverware and napkins, the server said "Jesus" in a disgusted voice while walking away. Then it took more than 30 min after the appetizer to get our food. We had to look for the server to get our Check. The restaurant wasn't busy.  Extremely disappointing. This is our second visit. The first visit had horrible service as well, but we thought it was just a one time thing, so we gave it another chance. Apparently poor service is the norm
Great service and cool building. Nice wine selection. We love the patio. Food is good, may be a little overpriced.

We were told there would be a 15 min wait but we waited for 35 min. Then when we were seated, we waited a really long time for a server to come over, which never happened. A sweet hostess ended up being our waitress. She was the only positive part of our experience. The food was mediocre. It was pretty expensive for what we got. First 1 star I've given. Bummer.

This is an awesome place to go on Main Street.  It's right by Parker Road and they have better parking then some other places in the same area. The food was a bit pricey but it had that farm to table vibe to it.  So it was more on the healthy side.  The portions are kind of small but it was delicious.  It actually left room for dessert instead of being overly stuffed. 
I had their Salmon and it was delicious.  I would definitely go back there again.

Just moved into the area and decided to try this place for the first time.  The lack of people in the restaurant should have been a warning sign.  Ordered the fish and chips for lunch and basically paid $13 for a boatload of fries and an over-battered, over-cooked, fish filet that was about as thick as my pinky finger. Literally, a total of 4 bites of fish for $13. The server asked if I would like something else but I didn't want to wait another 20-30 minutes. But, kudos to her for offering however, it won't get me to come back.  Over-priced for what you get.

Parker garage checks all of the marks in my book:

1) Great layout and decor.  It has a really cool central bar that backs up to an open kitchen.  The tables are long high boys that allow for big parties or shared seating with a friendly stranger.

2) Waitstaff. Really nice and knowledgable.  They accommodate most any request we have thrown their way (BTW, we have been there four times).

3) Booze.  They stock local beers and a few interesting domestic crafts.  Nice, non-intimidating wine list, though I am no vino expert.  We've had a great cab and some good pinot.

4) Food.  Their opening appetizers have been my favorite items.  Great pork chop, really good burger, poutine, but the gnocchi was a little overdone.

Like it alot.  Better than expected and worth a visit or five!

Was here for an afternoon lunch, and Parker Garage offers a solid and inexpensive happy-hour lunch menu. We ordered the French bread pizza and ham and cheese sandwich. While the service was a little slow, the waiter was friendly and the food was good. Specifically, the ham and cheese hoagie was warm and loaded with ham. There was live music from the bar next door, the Tailgate, which was packed, but we got the live music and hum of people while we were sitting out on the patio. Overall a pleasant experience, though the menu for dinner seems to be what this place is really about.

Great brunch menu with a wide array of choices. Had the big eye tuna sashimi and Brussels sprouts app. That was probably the best sprouts I have ever tasted!  My girlfriend had the French toast and eggs.  Very tasty! 
Love the ambiance of this place as its a converted garage which gives you that industrial pub feel!  Will definitely come back to try the dinner!

We loved Parker Garage! The food was absolutely amazing. The pork chop was cooked perfectly, probably the best we've ever had. The staff was friendly and helpful. They have a nice patio and fun atmosphere. The fact they serve farm fresh food is icing on the cake. Great location in downtown Parker too. We will definitely be back!!

We went there with 3 other couples the day before Valentines day and everything was great until the bill came - what we had thought was $75 per couple was actually $75 per person but our experience/meal was so good that we all looked at each other, shrugged and paid the bill.

The food and service was great, just could have done without the surprise of the heightened bill at the end.

Will visit here again as it WAS that good but will play closer attention to "specials" in the future.

Really a poorly run restaurant with very mediocre food and less than average service.
Our hot food was served cold and our cold food served at room temperature. Plus, the story that it takes 7 minutes to pour a specific beer was either a BS line or a very poor choice of product for a restaurant to serve.
With 4 adults and two under 5 children, it took 15 minutes to get water,25 minutes to get beverage service and 50 minutes to get any food on the table.
It's a nice atmosphere but woefully short on those things that bring me back. This was my second such experience at "The Garage" and it will be my last.

I should say this is BY FAR the most upscale place in Parker and prices are VERY HIGH. We visited for a date night on Friday and the small dining room was half-full at 6, but the bar was quite busy. 
The draft I ordered wasn't cold enough my wife said her wine was okay. We ordered the "poutine" fries app which were in a heavy beef gravy and quite strange. For dinner my wife had the ribeye which she said was decent and I had the tenderloin which was good. However the overriding theme of the menu seems to be "heavy" and "meat". Vegetarian options are nowhere on the menu and the sauces overwhelmed the other favors. Not my taste.

We decided to try a new place while we were shopping main street in Parker. We were intrigued by the menu and were seated immediately. However our waiter was extremely slow, never even took our drink order. Finally we decided to move to the bar where we got better service from the bar tender. Our food, then took a very long time after which the bar tender kept apologizing time and again for the long wait. Finally our food did come but I was exceptionally disappointed with it. I got the Opah, which was mediocre at best. No flavor whatsoever, bland, under cooked, and the rice it came with tasted like it came out of a box. I would recommend this place if you want great drinks and a fun environment, as they had great bar staff and excellent drinks, but for quality food? No.

The food is excellent. We had the Poutine fries as a starter and they were very good. Green chili instead of brown gravy and could have used a bit more cheese curds but very tasty. 

My husband and I shared the chicken dinner. It's pricey as sides are aka carte but is also very good. $36 tasty???  Not sure, but very good. We ordered the bacon creamed corn as a side and again, very good. 

The menu is very limited and is very expensive. However, the food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing and what we tried was also very good. 

Service was good, no complaints there. 

I'd love to say we'd come back for dinner but I'm not sure we can justify spending that much for dinner for what we ordered. 

Looking at the brunch menu I think we'd for sure give that a try.
Overpriced and unappetizing. We ordered the dry ribs...tasted like dried salt. Glad we went just to say we did. Won't go back again.

Third visit to this restaurant was over the 4th of July weekend. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. Our server, Alexa, was not pleasant and seemed to be rushing us out out the door. I tried to choose something other than their steak dinner, and tried the fish and chips. It was okay at best.
Had lunch there today.   Disappointed.   I have been there many times before and got the beet salad which I have had before   4 little pieces of beet   feel cheated.

Hi all, I can't say enough about Parker Garage. The incredible decor you'll see is off the charts, the owners make you feel like your family, the employee's always have smiles on their
faces & are extremely knowledgeable & helpful. All the food & drinks we have had on our 8 visits so far are always GREAT.  My favorite is the philly cheese steak sandwich, yummy. We had the caesar salad today & it not only tasted fantastic it looked like a work of art. This is a must to try as you won't be disappointed. Cheers to all of you @ Parker Garage !  See you all next trip! Jeff, Kathy & Family

The outside seating was ok. Wished it was more cozy but for a place that's called garage it worked. We ordered the dry dock apricot blonde and an Erdinger Hefeweizen. We love those drinks and were thirsty for beer. It took nearly 10 minutes for us to get our beers after we ordered. Yes- it doesn't seem long but when you see others that ordered after us get theirs you question the sevice. 
We then ordered a burger we wanted to share and the waitress brought us the burger already cut in half and fries on each of our plates. That made up for the slow beginning. Burger was pretty good but not $12 worth. Guess we should have stuck with happy hour options. :)

This is my new favorite place! The food is fantastic and so is the beer. The owners are lovely as well. Overall, a great dining experience which can be rare in Parker. It reminded me of some of my favorite restaurants in Cherry Creek.

This place needs some improvement. Went for first time on a Saturday night. We were excited to get a table outside and ordered a couple beverages. $8 cocktail and a very nice large Hefeweizen.  Our appetizer was pretty good. Poutines w/green chili. I never say this but they would have been better with just green chili and no meat. Service was just okay. Simple corrections could be made to sound more polite. "Do you still need more time" could be "would you like some more time?" Table near us, had to order a drink twice due to incorrect order. Entrees were not good. Fish and Chips and Shrimp and Grits, both disappointing. My F&C presentation sucked and the fish wasn't battered like I prefer. It was breaded and tasteless. Wife's Shrimp were over cooked, the grits were very thick, and we were both very disappointed. We hope things improve because it seemed like a nice spot.

My wife and I LOVE the Parker Garage. WE have taken quite a few friends, family and clients to this amazing restaurant!! I personally love the MEATLOAF....the biggest and best I've ever had. I also love the Cosmos!!!!  ANY Martini is GREAT at the Parker Garage!!!
I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!  Robbie V  :)

My husband and I went for a date night to this beautiful new location in Parker and enjoyed the experience. The Valet parking on weekends is nice, as main street can get crowded. 

We got to sit in the side room and enjoyed the quiet away from the loud bar area.

We started the evening with the BBQ pork belly appetizer (which was alright) and the Green Chili Poutine fries - if you eat nothing else on the menu, you have to have these, they are soo good. The Green chili is perfect! One of those rare items that people screw up or do well... chef knows how to do these WELL!!

The rest of the meal was good and the dessert with the variety of wines we had were a perfect match.

It's a nice date night location, however not one that we would do on a regular basis due to the price.
The kids LOVED their Mac n cheese! My salad was yummy, but pretty small - Good thing I wasn't too hungry. Service and establishment were great. I will go again.

We stopped by Parker Garage on Saturday afternoon for a quick lunch.  My wife had a craving for a burger and she was NOT disappointed.  I have never seen her demolish anything like that, ever.  Her burger and fries did not last long.

We arrived at 3:00p.m. and I was still full from brunch so I sipped on an iced tea and enjoyed watching her eat.  At some places, the server would scoff, change his or her attitude, or something else.  She was very kind and made it a point to stop by multiple times to fill up my drink.

We look forward to returning soon.

I'm always excited to try out new restaurants and Parker Garage was no exception. I went in on a Friday night and ordered the Smoked Salmon Two Ways which had hot and cold salmon with herb creme fraiche and capers. The presentation was great and it tasted so good! 

For our entree we shared a 32 oz rib eye with a roasted shallots -Madeira reduction. The steak was good however, it was $69 and it honestly wasn't a $69 steak. 

For dessert I had a goat cheese chocolate cheesecake. This was pretty good, not too rich or overly sweet. 

The food overall was good, but quite pricey. The decor was a little confusing. It was like walking in to a really loud sports bar and then there is a quieter dining area to the side. The service was a little slow, but the staff are very nice.

My family came into town from a small town in North Carolina, Parker Garage had just opened and we are huge fans of the previous restaurant, the War Horse. As we are eating, a lady dressed in a skimpy black tank top, painted on jeans, and stilettos came up and asked if we were okay, asked my god mother for her menu. Mind you, she had to stop eating, put her fork down, and move her plate to hand her the menu, no big deal. 

About 5 minutes later, were still eating. The lady comes back and is reaching over my dads food to grab my moms plate that she is finished with (while my dad is still eating), then came back and it happened about 4 more times. By that time my dad was mad and disgusted that this woman was reaching over his plate to grab all of our plates. My father asked her If she was in a hurry for us to leave. She laughed and said "oh no, just trying to clean up a little." My dad then put his fork down & handed her his unfinished plate. 

This was the worst service I have ever had in my whole life. She was rude and disrespectful to my whole family. I will not be back to the Parker Garage & it was a much better restaurant overall when it was the War Horse. I would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone. I was not pleased at all.

Food is pretty good but it's pricey for what you get. Not terribly kid friendly, but they do have high chairs. Service staff were a tad hipster - maybe the joint should have been called the Parker Automobilia or something more befitting the atmosphere. Also, the menu online is not right. Went there looking for a burger and cheesesteak and only found proper dinners with fancy sides. 

Our server was super nice. Might go back for apps and beers on the patio but it's too pricey for the average night.

I was hoping for more...

One of the things I love about Parker, is that so many restaurants are owner-operated. We have so much great food in our town, but I was fairly underwhelmed by the Garage. 

We were told not to go by a friend, but we went anyway. My wife and I both ordered appetizers, salads, and steaks. The Colorado Poutin was ok. The green chili was, also, just ok. Our salads were good but our steaks were once again just ok. I make better steaks at home for a fraction of the price. This place is a little spendy for what you get given that it's only about $10 off of Elway's or Shannahan's. 

The service was also mediocre; slow and we often waited for refills. 

At the end of the day, there are better restaurants (like Trapper's for steaks), and we probably won't be going back. I hope that this restaurant wises up, lowers their prices a bit, and goes in the direction of gourmet burgers or something along those lines.

A coworker and I ate at the Parker Garage on a Saturday. We arrived midway through the evening and opted to eat at the bar. There was plenty of seating available throughout the restaurant. Interior and exterior looked nice. 

Our waitress, the bartender, was friendly and gave great service. We ordered the grilled Brussel sprouts as an app, and they were fantastic! The entrees weren't amazing but was good. My coworker had the grilled tuna sandwich with fries; I had the shrimp and grits. My portion seemed small for the price but, again, the food was good. Drinks were great and the food arrived in a timely fashion. 

Parking seems to be a challenge in this area (Old Town Parker). I found a spot behind the restaurant on the street, but I suggest giving yourself extra time. 

If we find ourselves in Parker again, we'll definitely consider the Parker Garage.

Best Philly Cheesesteak I have ever had! I asked for their house green chili on my fries and they were amazing.

Nice to have a trendy new bar in the heart of downtown Parker.

At first impressions the menu items seemed pricy but you will quickly forget the pricetags when you take the first bite.

Great beers including local favorites From Dry Dock.

Fantastic food!!!!! 
Horrible service! 
Our waitress is a grumpy b!t(h.
Wish I could give it a higher rating, but I hate bad attitudes!

We ordered a few entrees to-go a few weeks ago and weren't impressed, but nothing bad either.  Just average quality. 

We might come back and try in restaurant, but wouldn't get to-go again.

Love that they finally changed up Warhorse. 

But I was disappointed. I want somewhere I can go every other weekend or a couple times a month. Parker needs something non commercial that is likeable. I thought it was pretty crazy that my fiancé and I spent over $100 on dinner... As we would at Chophouse, or Elways... This was not like either of those. Although the waiter Shane was amazing. The food was just to pricy. Maybe older people in parker can afford that, but parker is a family town as well and I don't see many families being able to go in and afford the prices. Dessert didn't pop out to me to much which is my favorite, but the wine selection was great! Maybe they'll have some changes come along, ill see when I head back in maybe next..

First visit to Parker Garage tonight. I was pleasantly surprised by the very interesting menu and the great service. The server explained the farm to table (hope I got that right) concept where much of the food the serve comes from their own 1,100 acre farm/ranch. I had one of the best pork chops I've had at a restaurant in a long time. The protein and side combinations are really well thought out. The presentations are also very well done. Price to value was fairly good - not cheap, but certainly not overpriced. Kids menu satisfied my two picky eaters. Look forward to returning.

This place is excellent! As far as prices, it is on par with Linger, and Old Major (restaurants that I would compare it favorable to.) It is cheaper then Mizuna, Fruition, and Frasca... Most importantly, it is in Parker, not downtown!!!
What we tried:
Sticky Buns with Pork Belly (Excellent.)
Empanadas (Excellent.)
Lamb Burger (My wife loved this, and I was excited it was only $13, but honestly I would probably recommend something other than a burger at a place like this!)
Filet (Excellent!!!)
We also had a pistachio desert that was very good.

I highly recommend this place!

I had an out of town visitor to entertain. She is a vegetarian and is used to having to simply order sides of vegetables at many places to cobble together a meal. I wanted to take her to a place that had good vegetarian entrees as well as items that I and my meat loving partner could enjoy. We had wanted to try the Parker Garage for a while, so after finding that they did have vegetarian entrees, we decided to make a night of it. We were all very glad we did. I had  the Fish and Chips which were exactly what I wanted...CRISPY. The fries and the fish filet were both so crisp and delicious. I'm used to soggy fries and fish that gets soggy from the condensation below it. This was perfect. My partner enjoyed the grass fed filet steak and it came with these delicious looking cheesy potatoes. I kept asking for a bite that never happened because it was too delicious for him to share. Our vegetarian guest loved the gnochi with vegetables in a light sauce. The gnochi were on the small side, but plentiful. Their small size works to their advantage as they don't just taste like you're eating mashed potatoes like can happen with the larger ones. 
The restaurant has a tavern style feel and has  been expertly remodeled from a 1916 automotive garage. They even used the old wood from the floors to make some very cool looking barstools. 
They source their ingredients locally and have their own dedicated grass fed beef, chickens and quails among other things. They are even developing their own Waygu beef cattle.
I would definitely recommend the Parker Garage, and we'll be returning soon so I can get my own filet entree that my partner wouldn't share with me.

My friend had a birthday party here last weekend, and I was so impressed! The service was on point, and the Rosemary Chicken was so tender and flavorful! I'm a bourbon guy, and their bartenders make a mean Old fashioned with artisanal ice! They also have a few bottles of Pappy ;) shhhhhh!
The nicest atmosphere in Parker , good food , not big portions and slightly over the top  pricey but everything delicious

Last night was my 3rd visit for dinner at the Parker Garage and this time it was A +. 
The food was excellent. Rosemary chicken, Salmon and Marlin and of course the Colorado Poutine. We had the apple pie and the chocolate torte for dessert. 
The best part was Max, we've had him as our waiter before and he is exceptional!!!! 
We took friends and they loved it!! All aspects!!
Keep up the good work!

Going to have to give them another chance soon, cause I was impressed by what we did have. Unfortunately we came during the Parker Wine Walk and they were understandably swamped and out of a lot of stuff, mainly for me the poutine fries which is what I really wanted. I had their steak salad tho which was awesome!! Service was great too. Our poor waiter just had to keep coming back and forth to table to let us know they were now out of something we ordered.

Absolutely Amazing!! 

Honestly INCREDIBLE! For a long time there has been Vines was a little too high end and then Tail gate next door that was 1000% not my crowd and pure grease in the food! 

My mom and I went here during the Seahawks VS Green bay game to see if they had screen to check it out and was blown away!! 

Staff:
Amazingly inviting and welcoming in every way!! Honestly David Evertz was so welcoming and such a nice guy i could not believe it! All the waiters and waitresses were incredible! There was a manager there from Chicago that was hilarious and soooo welcoming! 

The food:
SPECTACULAR!!!! OMG! Only if you order the mashed potatoes is a HUGE serving! Its amazing this is farm to table food but still amazing portion size! The calamari was spectacular and the artichoke was amazing! Also the Veggie sandwich! GREAT!

The place:
AMAZING! Hands down! I live downtown and honestly I wish they would move right downtown!! Amazing! 

Score out of 100 .......... 125!! It was that good and honestly gourmet food with friendly welcoming service and GREAT bar?? You cant go wrong! New Colorado Fav!

Thank you Parker Garage

Menu is limited and the meals they do cook are good tasting but small and simple given the price.  It doesn't help that they are next door to tailgate a very popular restaurant with competitive prices although the garage has a much fancier building.

Three strikes on service. This place doesn't understand customer service or restaurant operations and they apparently can't hire or train servers or managers. This is a no-go for us.  Food is excellent though. Too bad.

We went to the Parker Garage and really enjoyed the meal.  I had the pork loin for dinner and everything about it was perfect.  My fiancé had the lamb two ways and it was also amazing.  The only reason I would give 4 stars instead of 5 is for the mussel appetizer.  While the mussels were good, they did have a bit more fishy taste than what my preference would be.  We did eat every last one of them, but they were by far our least favorite item of the night.  

We will definitely be back but will skip the mussels and try one of the salads instead.

One of the great local restaurants in Parker. Excellent service by friendly staff.  The food was delicious.  Appetizers of Poutine Fries and Sushimi were great and topped it off with a pulled pork sandwich.  Definitely will go back!  Great job PG!

If I could rate them lower I would. Went in on a Sunday morning to try them out. They advertise Sunday brunch, but it's really your choice from only four items. Ordered huevos rancheros and when it came out with poached eggs that were very runny I asked for them to be cooked a bit more. After a bit of pushback from the waiter he took the plate but returned a minute later to say that the chef said I could eat them the way they are or have scrambled eggs. No other option. This is the first time ever that I've had a restaurant tell me eat it the way it is whether you like it or not. Completely unacceptable. ZERO stars.

I will never understand high priced (compared to market average) restaurants that have no acoustic materials in their construction.  When I have a nice meal the thing I like best is hearing everyone else's conversation. This place is loud. Terribly so. 

The food is also average at best. Very good presentation. It all looks very pretty, but I am not sure if the person who created the meal tasted any of it. The favors are muted, unlike the ambiance. 

Everything is hipsterific but completely lacking in substance. If you are cooking a steak salad (tenderloin) cook the steak as a single piece and then slice across the grain, served atop the salad with the marveling displayed, don't chop it and serve it like garden droppings. 

It is expensive. More than it warrants by a large margin. 

Parker really needs some quality food competition. There is plenty of disposable income here, but the food is overall awful.

Wonderful wonderful wonderful.  I keep returning to this place because their food is always delightful. Their meals are consistently delicious.  My friend was visiting from Maryland with her 15 mo old child. Being a slower Tuesday night, they allowed us to dine in a more secluded part of the patio for our fun energetic little man. Anthony our the server was amazing!

NO!!!!

We went there and it was horrible. WAY OVER PRICED! 
Service was not good, my food was not prepared correctly and they did nothing about it.  I told our waitress and she said "im doing the best I can with what I got"

NEVER GOING BACK

Today I'm having beef Tacos. Mildly seasoned/charred beef tips with mild to med spiced Pico de Gallo w avacado and sour cream tops it off nicely. As usual the fries were great! The service was pleasant and prompt. Keep up the great work!
Dude !!!! Freaking great AGAIN !!! Owner running food so the food is perfect  before I hits the tables ! Kind people !!

We visited Parker Garage for 1st time a couple of days before Christmas and was so surprised when we walked in.... it is super cute and very nicely done!  We loved the bar area!
I had the Philly w/fries and it was delicious! Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions.
New to town and so far, this is our favorite!

Popped in for a drink with some family and the place is very nice, cozy.  The menu looked very good and the drink selection was quite extensive.

I'll be back for some real food very soon.
One of the best meals I've had in a long time. Drinks were great, service was wonderful, and the vibe was relaxed and really enjoyable. Great addition to parker!!

Mediocre at best. meals overpriced for what you got. I can make better green chili at home. presentation was poor. really nothing that stood out. service was lacking extremely even when it was slow. Decor was a nice change from the old one but the food at the warhorse was much better. The service was much better back then as well. not sure if there was management staff there, however if they were they didn't make any presence. I wouldn't  recommend this place to anybody living in Parker or outside of the area. There's much better value and flavor at places around. I wish them the best of luck but I won't be seeing them again.

I have been there twice. Once for my birthday dinner and once for brunch after a farmers market.

My birthday.... I reserved the Chef's table. Lo and behold, the person taking my reservation had to frickin clue. Apparently you have to meet with the Chef to discuss the menu. New one on me, usually it is whatever the Chef wants you to have. I have never had to make "arrangements" before at any Chef table (I am not a rookie with this). I was called on the day of and advised that it was already booked; and since I had not met with the chef, I would not be sitting at the Chef table. One Chef table reservation a night? Double booked and they didn't see it till the day of...Dang.

We ended up sitting in the "bar" area behind the host stand. They kindly comped us a credit, so we got a bottle of wine. As our meal, for three, we opted to do ALL their appetizers. There were eight on the menu that night. The highlights were the Pork Belly with buns and the roasted Brussel Sprouts. All in all, relatively good, service was decent and without the discount, fairly priced. Beware of MP though, a little higher than other MP in the area for similar meats/seafood. I guess since they comped us a portion of the bill, despite knowing it was my birthday... you get nothing extra or special. Kind of loud, but a lively crowd and staff. Good team work.

Today, brunch. We showed up 7 minutes after opening. Our host wanted to know if we had a reservation, what? The place was practically empty. It took 30 minutes to get coffee (on the dot). Our server had to "wash the cups" since there weren't any clean ones. WTF? She wasn't that good/organized or systematic. It should not take 30 minutes to wash cups. From what we could tell, someone did not stay last night to do their side-work or come in early to do it. Also, from the grumblings of the not so pleasant staff, they may have been stiffed on staff, they were disorganized and short-staffed. We got our food about 45 minutes. He had their smothered burrito. I had the french toast with whiskey syrup. Hubby says that a good way to judge a place is the standards. We are in Colorado, so a smothered breakfast burrito is the way to judge it. It was delicious. Huge, meaty, saucy, spicy. They nailed it. The french toast was amateurish. A good french toast should be hot, crispy, crusty with a custardy inside. This tasted like a lightly egged and over-cooked texas toast slice. The bacon was a bit chewy, like it was deep fried. The scrambled eggs were super good. I couldn't tell if it was fresh eggs or egg product, but they got it right. While we were eating, a couple in a table near us got their Eggs Benedict (another standard that you can judge a restaurant by) and I could see from where I was sitting that the eggs were not cooked properly. The menu says the sous vide the eggs. The process should be similar to poaching, but the whites were gelatinous. While we were waiting for our coffee, another couple walked out and complained tot he host that it was the worst brunch and service they had ever had. The host simply said OK. Explains why he didn't help the servers with waters or coffee, he is an idiot.

I gave them three stars because of the food, some of it was remarkable, but we won't be going back anytime soon.

Lots of remarks about the price.  So if I did a search for places to eat in Parker...  What do I get? Chains...  Chains and More  chains..  Now say you just got home from work and wanted a very nice meal after a rough day..  Do you jump back in the car and drive 30 minutes for another chain like...  Mortons or del Frisco?  Heck here's how I look at it.   Said you made 30 bucks an hour.  (i mean you should....  You live in Parker)  you got that nice 3 car garage.  Life is great but you'd just wish you didn't have to drive 55 plus miles to have a nice meal.  

Now forget the small hiccups that happens with a new restaurant.  Close your eyes take that 1st bite.  Don't compare it to anything.  Does it taste good?  Is it perfectly balanced?  Is it dry?  Or better yet.  Have you had better? Or better yet...  It's been over a week for me and I'm still thinking about the duck,  the fish,  the presentation of the soup,  the steak,  that chicken! And I can't tell you what I had for lunch today but I know it was 8 bucks.

We have eaten here a few times and in my opinion it is just okay.  Prior to official dinner time they serve a limited menu of fried foods and alcohol.  This was disappointing the first time we came as we were excited about all the hype around the steaks.  The second time we came for dinner and it was fine but not fabulous for the price.  My husband got the pulled pork sandwich and liked it.  If I do eat here again I would probably stick to the lowered price items of sandwiches and such.

We stopped in for lunch before shopping; fabulous service by Dave. I had the chicken tacos (with fries, yay!), and they were very good.  Fresh avacado, tasty chicken,  all around yummy.  The wine was a decent price,  and when I asked for a recommendation I was not automatically directed to the higher priced glass. I loved the decor and that everything,  and I mean everything,  was clean.  Upscale,  but not uncomfortably so. Need I say that I will return?
Had dinner here, was really disappointed with the food. Service and atmosphere is nice, but for dinner, this place is over-priced with mediocre food. I am totally underwhelmed.

Went last night with some friends and what a great restaurant in Parker! Menu isn't huge, but that's ok - everything we ordered was amazing (quality over quantity). Service was great, and managers were also checking on tables to make sure our experience was wonderful. Will be back !!

Fantastic to have another option in Parker.  We had a great meal.  The beet salad was perfect and the salmon and beef tenderloin were amazing.  The people at our table could stop raving about the the beef tenderloin.  Definitely have the apple bread pudding for dessert.


We had two young children with us and even though it's a "fancier" restaurant for Parker, it was totally kid friendly.

When the "out of business" sign goes up, no one will be surprised!!  Staff attitude needs a major overhaul and the food has never really been on track steadily, it's hit or miss.  If the theme changed to a simple bar with bar food, it would be great.  The food is consistently overpriced.  They advertised the chef chosen for this restaurant so highly, but he leaves much to be desired.  Been there twice..... first and last time for us.

Tonight's dinner was a complete joke. I'm serious about my food and left totally aggravated. Before I get in to tonight's dinner I would like to review the last time I was in.  We got the bass sashimi app which we have had before and was very good and this time they had chop sticks. My husband had the seafood pasta again which he enjoyed. I had the gnocchi which had nice flavor, but very mushy. My husband thought it was terrible.  I got the torte again which comes with expresso anglaise. Yummy 

Now for tonight... I was looking over the menu and realized for the first time it wasn't very extensive. Had a difficult time choosing something to eat.  
So We got the bass sashimi- someone didn't know how to cut the fish. It was a complete hack job and just wasn't good. They didn't have chop sticks this time and We didn't even finish it.  Tonight we split the whole chicken with $7 sides of broccolini and scallion potatoes.  The dish not only looked boring, but nothing was very good.  The chicken was plain just as good as a local diner. The broccolini had no seasoning was slightly over cooked and barely room temp. The potatoes were under seasoned and there was not one scallion in the scallion potatoes.  Go figure.  So, I was so aggravated by this point and decided I was never coming back and I wasn't even zzz going to get the amazing chocolate torte. But... My husband wanted desert. They were out of their bread pudding which he liked. So we thought he may like the butterscotch custard with chocolate cookies and I got the torte.  Now keep in mind we ordered the deserts for specific ingredients. The butterscotch custard came out with no cookies. When we asked the waitress about them she said they had no more and it was really just a garnish.  My husband didn't want just the custard he needed to eat something with it.  Now I couldn't wait to have my last chocolate torte with expresso anglaise.  Guess what!? It was vanilla anglaise!  It would have been nice to be told before hand that the potatoes wouldn't have scallions, the custard wouldn't have cookies and they didn't have expresso anglaise.  We wouldn't have ordered any of it.  So no more Parker garage and we felt they were our last hope of good food in Parker.
Great date night & excellent food.  We were impressed the owner came up and asked us how everything was.  We will go again!

Great service and great PHO
My fave for sure 

The broth is so clear and clean you can see the spices.  Oh, and your beautiful face, LOL

It really is that good !!

Very clean restaurant inside and outside.

A nice little spot for this side of town.

This area isn't exactly a hotbed of Asian cuisine, especially pho-related.  But I was straight up craving a bowl of pho one evening, and wasn't feeling the drive to Federal.  I'd seen this place's sign multiple times, and knew I'd eventually be in.  Finally made it in.

The place was oddly clean.  That isn't to say most pho places aren't clean, but let's be honest... most pho places could use a good scrub down and a heavy dose of bleach.  But Pho 63 was spotless, clean, and well-taken care of.

Staff was nice.  They seated us quickly, offered fast service, were smiling, and took good care of us and our fellow diners at other tables.

The food was pretty solid.  Well, the pho was, as that is all we got.  Mine was chock full of tasty meats, and did well some some spice added.  The broth was unique; I think anise was added?  It was certainly unlike any other pho broth I had ever had, and it took me (both of us) by surprise.  It was a good surprise though!

Cheap, as pho prices usually are.  But the bowl was good-sized, full of meat, and hit the spot.

I do like a beer with my pho, but this place does not serve alcohol.  Bummer!

I'll still go to Federal Blvd for my top-notch pho, but Pho 63 is a solid option in the area.

Solid, affordable, friendly place. The pho bowls nest from small to large, and a large is enough for a family of four.
No alcohol, but everything else was really good.
