Before starting this review, I should mention that I would say I only know three foods enough to judge critically: tacos, BBQ, and pho... This place had only been open for about week when I visited. 

I had the large combination pho bowl. Personally, I think Pho Duy on Federal has the best pho in Denver so i often use that as a standard. With Pho Duy being a 10/10, I'd rate this bowl about a 7/10. The broth was flavorful and not too salty, but they were a little light on the meat. I was a little confused when they didn't bring out a plate with bean sprouts, peppers, mint leaves, and limes as typical at pho restaurants. I looked around and this seemed to be the case with all tables. Lastly, the amount of MSG used wasn't overpowering. No matter where you go, the pho will have some MSG in it, using the right amount is very important. If pho has too much MSG in it, it leaves your tongue feeling numb for hours after eating it. That wasn't the case here... 

The service wasn't great. The restaurant had about  8 people in it and it was 20 minutes before I got water and they took my order. It took another 20 minutes to get my bowl of pho. You could tell they were still trying to figure things out because the staff was running around trying to fill orders, which is typical of new restaurants. That aside, everyone was very friendly and everything looked very clean, even the kitchen (you're able to peek into it from the register). 

I will return in a month or two and have another go at Pho 63 once they get the hang of things. This part of Denver does not have many pho restaurants, especially good ones, so I see big potential here. I sparked a conversation with the waiter and he mentioned that they also deliver!!! This is rare of pho restaurants! If this place can make a good bowl of pho next time I visit, I foresee myself coming here often.

This place just opened up and you can tell they are still trying to work out the kinks. They did a great job in renovating the existing space--it is very open, clean and inviting. The servers were very friendly but a little disorganized--kept coming back to the table to take our order and then would forget certain things. This I definitely attribute to it being a new place.

We ordered the Vietnamese Rolls and the filling was okay, but too pasty. We then ordered the Pho and the meat was a little skimpy and the broth could have been more flavorful.

The regular rolls were good.

I found the prices a little high but will come back in a few months to try it out again.

So friendly!  Great atmosphere, amazing food.  I'm not a big Pho lover, I order the noodle dishes and absolutely love them.  My fave is the B1, I literally crave it and have to stop for lunch at least twice a month (sometimes more). I'm never disappointed. My son enjoys the Pho, especially during the winter months.  Definitely recommend, one of the best Vietnamese places on this side of town.
Great service, tasty meat balls. Broth was a little sweet for my taste. Was really packed during lunch.
Well done Pho real!  This place has the best PHO phlavors in the city.  Enjoi, I did, do and will be back!

This place is by my husband's work, which is relatively far from where I live in the Sloan's Lake area.  My husband and I have been here several times, and I love it because the food tastes delicious and is so fresh.  The people are nice too.  I always get the tofu pho and my husband get the traditional beef pho.

Recently, on a Saturday night, we were craving pho and we drove all the way here, even though the myriad of pho restaurants on Federal are substantially closer to my house. This speaks to how much we love this Pho place!

This is one of the worst pho restaurants. I can usually tolerate subpar service for good food, but this place's pho tastes terrible. I know it's extreme but it's to the point where I couldn't take more than two bites. The jerk working as a server was too busy to even check to see if anything was wrong. I even had my hand out when he was handing me change and he puts it down on the table. Overall It shows how little pride this place takes in the garbage they are serving.

I've been to Pho 63 twice now and I really enjoyed both my visits getting pho tai. The broth is flavorful. The rice noodles have the right amount of chew to them. The steak is sliced thinly and dispersed evenly. I read in earlier reviews that some didn't get the garnish tray but that's been done both times I was there. The environment is super clean which I definitely appreciated. The prices are really cheap as well. I usually get a medium and it's only $7.75 here.

I enjoyed my first visit to Pho 63 today.  The restaurant was clean and bright. I ordered the rare steak pho and enjoyed it.  While it was nothing out of the ordinary, the broth was well-flavored and there was a good balance of noodles and meat.  I also tasted the beef from the beef noodle bowl and it was very flavorful and tender.  The service was quick and cordial.  The one ding I would give the restaurant would be the prices as I felt they were just a skosh high.  Pho 63 is a solid restaurant that I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to those looking for good pho east of Federal.
Love Pho and love this place.  They have great Pho!  P9 add tendon is my personal favorite.  So far everything I have had here is great!  And the owner is so nice.  Will eat here many more times.

Mostly a 3.5 star review but i'll round up to 4 as we will likely be back.  The restaurant itself is in a strip mall and offers very little charm.  Huge ceilings, a couple TV's, music playing lightly in the back.  Almost felt like you were in a waiting room or a cafeteria.  The place was pretty clean though just not much ambiance.  Our server was very quick, we were immediately seated and brought waters and menus.  The place was almost full, too.  Food came out in 10 or 15 minutes.  I got the vegetable and tofu pho and the husband got one of the beef ones.  We both enjyoed it but added a ton of siracha and were looking for a little more spice.  Great value for the money, and like i said, the waittress was very sweet.  We will be back on another cold night.
Pretty good place especially with the cold weather! My favorites are their fresh shrimp spring roll and the deep fried shrimp roll.

So far there has been only one good pho restaurant in the south east Denver - Pho Saigon on Arapahoe Rd. Pho 63 is a serious contender. Their Pho Dac Biet is outstanding! Also service is wonderful and super fast! And it's right next to the 24h fitness making it the perfect post-workout meal on a cold day :) Thank you.
Delicious! Fast friendly and a great neighborhood  spot. All the food was super fresh, and the Boba is extra flavorful. I'll be back again soon!

This place just opened and we had to try it out. My husband and I both had pho. I have only had pho a few times in my life, so I'm not an expert, but I really enjoyed this place. I had the chicken, and my husband had the rare steak and flank. We also ordered crabmeat wontons (which seemed to have real crab meat in them...something you don't see too often anymore).

The place was very clean (it is new), and the staff were great. Very attentive and we were able to put our order in within 5 min or sitting. It wasn't terribly busy at the time (around 8-10 other people). 

I hope this place sticks around, because I really like pho and there isn't one anywhere else in this area that I'm aware of. Can't wait to come back!

Had lunch here and liked it a lot. Usually I don't give a 5 star review on a single visit, but we got to speak with the owner and liked her a lot. She is from Vietnam, this is her first restaurant. She is working 14 hours/day x7 days a week. How about the food? Everything fresh and tasty. House made rolls especially good. Located in the same site as a former ramen restaurant that likely violated health code inspections, this restaurant is now spotless and perfectly clean after a complete teardown and rebuild. Give them a try. I think you will be impressed.
This is our new Pho place!!!  Everything is fresh and delicious. The fried rice is AMAZING!!!
So fresh, yummy, fast, huge portions and affordable!! Our new favorite place!! Very friendly!

I've probably came to eat pho here more than any other pho place. They're the only ones near enough that offer veggie broth and it's delicious! My regular is the tofu veggie pho, I highly recommend it! The staff is always so friendly! Love it so far

Yezzir! New Vietnamese place near Tamarac Square. Good food, good service. I just love when a staff member yells to greet you as soon as you walk in the door  no joke. Super clean. Friendly. No questionable meat & their marinade is on point.

Went here for lunch...got the medium brisket pho and the brisket was one of the best I've had in a long time. The broth was a little oily but had good flavor. The sprouts, jalapeños, and basil that came out were all very fresh! The reason for the 4 stars instead if 5 was because our waitress didn't give us water. Also the sauce cups were not provided until we asked for it. And we were charged for a different table's bill. They are brand new so I know there are some staffing kinks to iron out. But based on the food alone, it was good!
Enormous portions, excellent broth and super friendly. This place is brand new but has already become a lunchtime favorite for me and my dad's weekly "meeting".

This was my first order at Pho 63. I got the combination rice plate, my husband the shrimp rice plate and my mother the beef pho, as well as Vietnamese egg rolls. This place is wonderful! The staff friendly and accommodating and the food so fresh and flavorful. The meats were bbq'd to perfection. I couldn't be happier and will definitely be back.
Great place, excellent taste and a nice clean environment.  I am happy they opened a good Pho spot in this area.

**Don't go here**Messed up the order on first visit. Returned the original order then they wanted us to pay more for the order after they miss heard the order..they kept our original food w/ bite  marks in the egg rolls!  The lady said somebody there would EAT it!!! This place is rank & the food is aweful!!!  I hope they don't serve the other 5 egg rolls I already touched to someone else! She even touched them when we opened it up ....
The Pho was excellent! I'm looking forward to this in the colder months!  My husband had the combo vermicelli which was very good. It's a cute, clean place!

We've been here 3 times and have become fans.  The space is clean and bright, if not particularly notable.  But the food is great.  Flavors are both subtle and striking-- this is skillfully prepared Vietnamese cuisine.  Spring rolls featured very fresh ingredients.  The Pho is excellent, but the grilled meats are particularly well-prepared- moist, flavorful, generous.  Service is efficient and friendly.
Good soup, good spring rolls, good portions, pleasant staff. While it is not the best soup in the city,  they do a good job and saves me the drive to the west side.

This place has horrible pricing, if you order online. I checked out the menu online and called to order. When I got there the price was higher than expected. The menu prices online are out of date. Also for carry out they charge per item! Not for the whole order but per item!!! I'll be taking my business to the Pho restaurant near Kennedy Golf, they're more customer friendly.
Alas, when I walked in Saturday  night I was told that the restaurant closed. The space is now solely a karaoke joint.

I was in the mood for lo mein so I decided to try this place out since it has online ordering. I ordered two lunch combos: General tso's chicken and BBQ pork lo mein. The general tso's chicken was good. Nothing special, just tasted how it was supposed to taste. The rice wasn't very good. Didn't have much taste to it and looked dry. The lo mein wasn't special either. Again, not much taste. Was about the oily consistency as your usual lo mein. The egg rolls tasted like straight cabbage. The crab wonton didn't have much flavor. The egg drop soup was okay. Not a repeat for us, but the price was good for the amount of food you get.

The last two times I've called to order takeout (during regular business hours), the phone rang, and rang, and rang... not sure if this business has closed? Either way, I found a new spot for takeout and won't be ordering from here again.

We ordered here last night for delivery and I must say it was worth it. Our eyes were a little larger than our stomachs, so we ordered too much food. Delivery was approximately 30 minutes, and the food was hot. We ordered the egg drop soup, chicken lo mein, chicken curry, magnolian beef, pork fried rice, and sweet and sour pork. I know we are pigs right?! 

The egg drop soup was a little bit different than what I'm used to, but it was good. The flavoring was unique to what I have had before. The lo mein was good and the curry was also very delicious. My favorite was the magnolian beef. Very tasty. 

You guys did a good job! Thanks for the quick delivery!

Don't waste your time or money. 
I was tricked into thinking this restaurant was good on the first dining experience. After eating there multiple times I have come to find that their food is simply not very good and rarely is prepared correctly. I had to re-write my review because they try to get negative reviews removed from the sight. Do not trust this place.

I just tried calling this place and they're either hanging up on me or ignoring me. This is not the first time they've ignored me. I was waiting for a waiter for dine in and they let the people behind me get a table before me. For as much as I ripe them they sure know how to treat the customers like garbage

I had the spicy wings and drunken noodles(combo) take out, from Grub Hub. The drunken noodles were AMAZING!!! The spicy wings weren't anything special though. I'm from SoCal, so delicious mom-and-pop ethnic food is something that I am accustomed to, thus the wings being alright. The delivery was free, and came 20mins sooner than expected & was hot & fresh. 

Worth the money: Yes
Would I order again: yes!!

MAN. Their sesame chicken is bomb. The chinese take out food is so different out here compared to the East Coast and it's good. My boyfriend had General T'sos and he said it was awesome. Never seen all white meat when I order chinese...so I was shocked about that. They also delivered to my house super fast.

Definitely ordering here again.

2.5 stars. Their food is okay, (when they make it right) but they put so much sauce in it that it's more like a soup. I have ordered from here multiple times, and the last time, they messed up an entire dish and told me to never order from them again when I called to tell them. Also they charge you $2 to substitute one vegetable, which sucks. 
Their delivery drivers are just okay and they take an imprint of your card and ask to see your ID which is pretty annoying.. My mom buys food for me occasionally and she lives in another state. Never had any delivery place take an imprint of my card before.. 
Definitely Check your food before you pay, if you so decide to order from here (bad decision). 
Overall, okay food and they can speak English...which is rare for aurora.
Get out of here century Asian ! I ordered delivery and it literally arrived 22 minutes after we ordered and it is all here ! Hot! Perfect

Just ordered the orange chicken and pork fired rice and my wifre ordered sweet and sour chicken with shrimp fried rice. Three words we. are. amazed.
Best chinese food we have had hands down every thing is fresh and made to order it taste amazing and came in 20 mins to our door will return you guys gained 2 lifetime customers all thumbs up!!

I've only gotten delivery so I don't know about their dine in service, but the delivery is always quick and the food is delicious. The portions are generous so the first time I accidentally ordered to much but it reheated nicely the next day.
Awesome service and food. Try the deep fried dumplings they are freaking amazing. Cool place to go out to eat too if you want to eat at a nice Asian restaurant. But they also have super fast delivery

We ordered for delivery and it was sooooo tasty! Fast too, it was here in under an hour. The meat was tender and the veggies were fresh. They have a crazy menu with everything from Chinese to Vietnamese and curries. Definitely a place to order from again and again!

I love Asian food and eat it a couple times a week, all over the US.
This was the worst Asian food I have ever seen. 
The Panang curry was as thin as water. it literally had huge uncut raw uncooked chunks of jalepeno in it, almost no flavor other than the heat from that. The beef drunken noodles were basically just huge uncut chunks of nearly raw hard crunchy vegetables and had almost no actual noodles, It was like they don't even own a knife...The shrimp spring rolls were so bad i don't know where to start, ok, they both came apart on first bite, the sauce was awful (tasted like salty motor oil. Don't bother....

Century Asian is the bomb!  Just tried this place for the first time about 3 weeks ago and I have just ordered them for tonight's dinner too. This will be my fourth time ordering from here since then.  Food is super tasty, hot and delivered lightning fast. The staff are very friendly and hospitable. My new go to place for Asian cuisine!

Nice clean place. The waitstaff was very friendly and professional. This is on Havana and Florida inside the Strip mall. I had the Mongolian Triple wish is how I like it....Spicy. It was very tasty! The prices are really affordable. I enjoyed it and will try something different the next time. Give this place a try.
It was great! Delivery was fast and the delivery driver was nice. The orange chicken and mongolian beef were awesome!

Worst Chinese food ever! I ordered Walnut Shrimp that tasted like old grease and was super bland. The walnuts tasted rancid...NOT FRESH. I was extremely disappointed. Eggs rolls were not fully cooked. The outside was a little crispy and the filling was mushy. My fiancé ordered the Sesame Shrimp and thought it was doughy and lacked flavor. We will NOT comeback.

Century asain cafe is our new favorite Chinese place. Our favorite chicken lo mein, and the pho soup. The place is very clean and the service is very prompt and friendly. They also have a full bar and karaoke rooms, if you're into that. Definitely give this place a try.

This is the worst chinese food i ever ate. I have been several times to PF changs.This time i wanted to try different , hence went to this place for take out. I ordered chicken low mein noodles and kungpao chicken. Both of them are very BAD to taste.The peanuts are bitter to taste.And added to this after we(myself and my wife) ate few bites, both us developed itching likely from some expired stuff in that food.I threw everything away. I would never go to this place in my life time!!!
Though rates are cheap, it is not even worth trying at this place in my opinion

We ended up trying this place as it was one of the few places open on a Tuesday night and we were very pleasantly surprised.  I had come down with the post Comic Con Crud (PCCC) and was too lazy to cook.   I ordered the orange chicken, which actually tasted like oranges rather than some gross sugar laden syrup that some places use.  Their peppery squid was pretty good, not the best in town, but a close second.  The hot and sour soup was great and helped soothe my sore throat and was actually full of onions and bamboo and was very delicious.  This place is a definite keeper, and we will be ordering from them often.

Two of us dined for dinner.  I had the hot and sour soup and Hunan Chicken.  My companion had the lemon chicken.  We both had brown rice.  All was excellent -- as was the service.  Often, hot and sour soup is neither -- but not this soup!  it was great!  I'd definitely return to try other menu items.

Been using yelp for years. And amazon come to think of it, but I m one of those people that doesn't give reviews.  So New Years resolution is to give back some.  

Asian fare from variety of places.  First impression is overall good.  Good service.  Good price.  Food is good.  Free delivery.  

Bottom line.  I will return for more unless things change.

I gave 2 stars for 2 reason, 1: food got here super quick. 2: the dumplings were pretty good. We also ordered the Sweet and Sour shrimp, which was the absolute WORST sweet and sour shrimp I have ever eaten. There was about 1 inch of shrimp, to 4 sq inches of soggy batter, since it was served in the sauce. the shrimp was over cooked and chewy. my wife was very upset that she ordered that. The egg drop soup was ok. The crab&cheese wantons had a tiny bit of cream cheese, I saw NO sign of the imitation crab stuff. The Chicken lo mein wasn't horrible, to me it looked like the noodles were just plain spaghetti noodles.I will not be ordering from this place again mainly because of how horrible the Sweet and Sour Shrimp was and how below average the other items were. The dumplings were the only thing I enjoyed. If you over cook the shrimp, DON'T SERVE IT!!!! and for delivery/to go orders, I' recommend putting the  sauce on the side.
best chinese coof i have had in a long time

Hey...get down and see Shawn/Sean/Siohan at the State Pub (was Aussie) This is the kind of place we need around here (south Broadway/Belleview area).

Beer selection is standard until you get to the crafts they have - great selection. But the sleeper here is the BBQ - give the Redbird legs a try. Don't take my word - it will catch on.

But the real hook is that it is just a friendly comfortable place - he assures me they will have the Ticket and that the Chargers games will be available - although I do want to see Peyton get another one even if I have to get ragged about it - he is what pro sports should be.

Give Shawn and his place a shot - it smacks the corp places! I have only been there a couple of times, no dog in the hunt - just like it!

The State Pub is just a few blocks away from my house. They have food and adult beverages, and they specialize in Colorado products. There's a large selection of Colorado beer on their menu, but only five beers are on tap. There's also liquor if that's your thing.

I took the wife for dinner at the State Pub. We each ordered one of the BBQ baskets, and I ordered a local craft beer before dinner. Service was prompt and very casual. It was friendly enough, but when I enter a new business for the first time, I appreciate a little conversation about the concept, the food, and what makes the business special. We didn't get that at State Pub, but in their defense, I didn't initiate that conversation either.

The place has been refreshed since the previous ownership, but I think it could use a little more refreshing. I'm also not a huge fan of the trend of serving beers in mason jars, but that's a personal peculiarity, so I won't take points off for that. There were quite a few people in the bar when we got there. This part of Englewood is what I'd call a "working class" area, and State Pub fits that working class demand well.

The food was good, albeit served in plastic baskets with plastic utensils. I suppose you can get away with that if your concept is BBQ. I had the brisket which was moist and tender, but I only got the slightest smokey flavor from it. Still, I enjoyed it more than many of the other dry, overly cooked briskets I've had in the past. My wife had the sausage platter which comes with three types of sausage. She liked it, but also noticed a lack of smokey flavor or grill marks.

The sides are where State Pub shines. The house-made potato salad was served fresh and quite cold. The flavors were perfect. My wife had the potato chips which also seem to be made in-house. They were perfectly crispy and salty. The BBQ sauce appears to be made in-house (I would know for sure, but as I mentioned earlier, the staff didn't hang around to chat about the food). There are three kinds of sauce available. Having tried two out of the three, I can say that I'm confident that the third will be tasty as well.

There are some details to work out for this new business. I'd expect a few of those given how new it is. For starters, you've got to make a great effort to make new customers feel welcome and to encourage them to come back. If you're proud of your food (they seem to be), show that pride by telling the customers about how it's made. Service will make or break you in the restaurant industry, and there's no shortage of competition in the bar or the BBQ arena. We found our food to be better than what we had at a nearby competitor, and the prices are competitive (in the $10-$11 range), but there's still some fine-tuning to be done here.

This new business is worth a visit. If you live in Englewood, it's a good idea to support local businesses like this one. Indeed, there are "classier" options around, but for a good old fashioned working-class experience with reasonably priced, fresh food, State Pub is worth a trip. Be sure to try the potato salad.
Dig this dive bar.  Our bartender kept the drinks flowing.  Great atmosphere, and karaoke.  Check it out!

Cute little place, I emphasize little. Don't use your credit card there, you may end up tipping $10 more unbeknownst to you. I work hard for my money, I save my receipts and watch my account carefully. So when I saw an add'l $10 on my bill I went there immediately to get my money back. I can only hope it was an honest mistake  $10 was refunded hassle free by Shawn (sp?), the owner.

I was Impressed with this local gem. The selection of great beer and liquor is Colorado themed. The bbq smoked chicken pops are delicious. Sean the owner is a conversational bar tender. 

Thanks for making Englewood great!

Came here on a snowy day when we were bored and looking to try something new.

What I liked:
* Interesting selection of local beers in bottles / cans (more on this later)
* The homemade potato chips used in their nachos were really good
* Excellent service, although the staff were clearly bored (there was only one other customer there) and a bit *too* attentive...
* Decent happy hour specials

What I disliked:
* The BBQ served was relatively dry and could stand to be a little bit more flavorful
* The draft beer selection was definitely lacking, though they had a ton of different beers in bottles
* Happy hour drink prices were just ok, but I felt their overall happy hour offering (food and beer) needs to be improved to get me to come there over my usual haunts.

Summary:
This local bar has definite potential. Once they improve their food offerings and expand their draft selections, I think this bar could be really good. Right now, it's just another spot selling $6 beers and so-so food... If you end up here, do try their chips!
Great local, familiar, "Cheers-y", pub with many beers, some on tap, 7 bottles, cans. Friendly. Some food, but not pushed.

At first glance, State Pub seems like a great local hangout. They have a ton of drink specials and a large variety of local beers. Great. Right? Not so fast...you think you're getting a great deal but I would almost guarantee the bartender is short pouring. Somebody should take a shot glass in there with them to test my theory. I would except I don't plan on ever going their again. 
They have an interesting food menu with a couple of yummy dishes but they make you feel bad for ordering. Why bother offering food if you don't really want to serve it??
The main bartender, or whatever he is, always seems to either be complaining about his coworkers or bragging about his conquests. No thanks. If you want a cheap drink without being shorted just go down the street to Dubb's Pub.
This was badly needed in my neighborhood. They have great prices on a huge selection of beers. It's becoming a favorite place to hang out and I can walk home!

What's happened to the State8 Pub?  Stopped by there on Friday night after the Bonnie Raitt concert at Red Rocks and it was closed down tight at midnight.  Different name, no flag flying out front and all the signs painted over.  Looked in the window and it looks like it is under construction and the name has changed.  Weird.... what's happening?  The website is still up and on Facebook also.... no explanation of what's happened, when they will reopen or whether the new place is even going to happen.  I would like to hear from someone who can tell me where it went.  Thanks.

Cute and quaint place right off broadway. Pool tables, friendly owners and bartenders, and local beer. Every one of the food options I've had has been amazing. The smoked potato, freaking phenomenal. Or the nachos on the house made kettle chips, yum. 

It's new, it's awesome, try it.
This is my spot. Get it how you live. No plays no judges, we just flyin past the millennium in this space ship.
Fun little spot! Stopped in here with a group of friends and they had good beers, food and service. Really chill and friendly environment.
Very good food.  It's better than bar food! It's also better than most chain restaurants!

The employees are great and very friendly. I had the nachos which are anything but "nachos," and I mean that in a good way. They're served on kettle chips with chili beer queso with a pile of brisket on top. AMAZING. I've already been back.

Love this place! The owner is awesome, the atmosphere is super laid back, and the food is so damn good. Get the nachos. The beer cheese sauce they put on them is mouth watering good. (I'm from Wisconsin and consider myself a tough critic on anything beer or cheese related.) Overall a kick ass place to hang out!

I'm a fan. Great little spot. Don't be thrown off by the less than ideal part of Broadway. Great local beer and spirits selection. Laid back feel. Very clean. Colorado themed and Colorado feel. I didn't try the food but I intend on being back soon!

This place is awful. Went here a two weeks ago for dinner with a few friends. The BBQ tasted like refrigerator. Between the 4 of us, we all ordered different combinations of food & tried all of the sauces and none were very good. They all lacked depth of flavor and were downright runny. When the BBQ meat is not very good, a decent sauce is imperative. 

Service was also poor. Couldn't get anything we needed once the food was delivered because Sean never came back to the table. They use plastic baskets & plastic forks, which didn't seem appropriate for the price. 

We found out after the fact that Sean, who waited on us, is one of the owners, and were quite surprised. For one thing, he looked like a bum. He was wearing old, dirty clothes & looked like he hadn't bathed in weeks. He was not at all friendly & acted as though we were putting him out. He was slightly busy, but it wasn't as though we asked for much & he wasn't "in the weeds."  Perhaps it was just inexperience & he was overwhelmed. Or perhaps he was too busy doing shots behind the bar. I would except an owner to be a little more friendly & at least act like he cares if he gets return business or not.

12/19 addendum--
Sean, I most certainly saw your comment. I have only felt the need to make a few reviews in the most extreme of situations. I know other folks who have gone in your bar from time to time & made the same observations as I have. I drive by your bar every single day & I'm not sure which regulars you are referring to, because there are at most 2-3 heads in your bar at various times throughout the day/evening that I drive by. Same thing the couple other times I briefly dropped in before The time I ate at your place. 
Maybe because I am a bit older than you with eons of years' of experience in the service industry, but I don't see ratty jeans, t-shirts with holes in them, being several days unshaven, & stains on clothes as appropriate wear for an owner, and if you do have the experience that you claim, I expect service when folks dine at your place, not to be ignored. I certainly would've voiced my concern when we were there but you were too busy drinking shots behind the bar for that to happen. We never saw you again after you dropped our food off.  Also, Sean, how long have you lived in Englewood, & how many other places in this area do you frequent? I've lived here nearly half my life, & strongly disagree that you are one of "the most sober & friendliest bartenders around."
1/15/16 addendum 
Really, Sean? If you love your business and gladly spend so much time working so hard, why do you constantly complain on social media that you are, " so bored," "so tired," and otherwise bitching about your long days? 
Grow up, my friend. Life is hard. A business startup requires nonstop dedication for years. You have a great deal of learning to do. At the time of this writing, I also add that you need to learn how to treat your female bartenders with respect. I have heard you yell, speak to them shortly, and be condescending. You never know who are the eyes and ears in your establishment. Stop being an egotistical dick. You have much to learn.

I've been to the State Pub many times and I've always had a great time. Sean and the other bar tenders are super friendly, and it has a good easy-going feel to it.  This place is exactly what Englewood needed. Beer is cheap and the food is yummy!
Best jalapeno poppers ever!!! Fresh pepper not breaded, really stuffed and wraped in bacon. Good price for the size of the serve.

This is the restaurant/food booth attached to Spangalang. Their plates are a little pricey but very well done. We got the meat and cheese plate and everything was quite tasty. It was a good selection of cheeses, a little bit of prosciutto and salami style meats and some fruits, nuts, and olives. Overall pretty well done, and it complimented the beer nicely.
Awesome, the owner is a rock star and Staff is great. The food is a perfect combination with brew in the house.

Very pleased that this place is connected to Spangalang Brewery! The Mac and cheese bites are amazing, and the hummus and tzatziki were yum! You order at the counter and they deliver to your table at the brewery.

Here's a new concept - a snack shack inside a brewery. I discovered Zivix via Instagram and was super excited to try them right then and there! That's when I discovered they were closed Tuesdays. Well, circumstances brought me there last Friday.

Small bites. Tasty eats. You can access Zivix through Spangalang. Zivix has menus throughout the brewery's tables and countertops, so you can browse before ordering. We tried their savory hand pie, mac & cheese bites, and the pizza bagel.

The savory hand pie was packed with meat and very tasty. The mustard that came with it was finger-licking good! Attest. The mac bites were another tasty item, though that hot sauce utterly defeated me. The pizza bagel was ok. The shredded basil was a nice touch, but overall, quite ordinary.

Overall, it was an enjoyable experience and filled us up for the dancing that occurred afterward. Thanks, Zivix!

PS. they have cookies

Hands down the best burger ive ever had. Perfectly cooked, juicy, amazing, and overall just fantastic.
Their beer selection is also amazing, just make sure you get it in a pint glass otherwise you might get too much in a chalice. 
The only thing i didnt like was that the burger was gone way too fast. 
Overall 10/10 would eat again.

Had dinner with a friend Sunday evening and sat at the bar. Our bartender/ server "Tyler"was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. We stared our order with a craft beer and glass of red wine. The wine was $8 which is a pretty good price for downtown Denver. 

For dinner, we shared a Caesar salad and fries, both were delicious. The chipotle ketchup made the fries very tasty. I had the El Diablo burger and my friend the Prime burger. Both were cooked perfectly and juicy. The El Diablo had a very nice heat with fresh jalapeño slices. Overall, the meal was filling and we topped it off with a Butter Pecan shake.

Everything that comes from the kitchen and out of the taps at this place is superb... my two favorite burgers:
1. The Primetime - Brie, truffle aioli, caramelized onions,  steak sauce tomato on a burger - lord have mercy

2. Goodnight - cheddar, caramelized onions , jalapeño, BBQ sauce...  should be named "silly if you don't order this one burger"

**** order the truffle fries ****
For those who aren't crazy about red meat - yes, the ahi tuna burger IS good!

Great food, great service. One of the best burgers I've had. I do wish they had a couple of healthy options... 

Caesar salad was great, but the turkey burger was phenomenal. Fries were ridiculously good.

A great place to grab a burger before a Rockies game. Hopdoddy is walking distance from the Coors stadium, so my wife and I have a burger here before heading to the game. I ordered the bloody mary, and my wife got the moscow mule. I didn't really like the beet juice in my bloody mary, but my wife did, so we switched drinks. 

Our burgers arrived just after ordering, so the service was really quick. I got the El Diable burger, and my wife got the blackbean burger. Both were pretty good. My El Diablo was seriously spicy! It had jalapeños, serranos, and habaneros. I opened the burger, and I could see all the peppers piled up. Needless to say, the burger was hot! It was just the way I like it, so I was very pleased. My wifes burger was very good as well, but the flavors together were a little weird. The goat cheese with the black bean burger was a little strange, but still tasty. 

We also ordered the green chile fries with the burgers The fries were shoestring, and were seasoned as well. The dipping sauce was very good, and was enough fries for both of us.

This is my favorite burger joint in town! I was never impressed with Cherry Cricket, Park Burger, Lark burger, Five Guys, Highland Tap, or Smash Burger. But this place...! Husband and I came here for two consecutive days after trying it for the first time. I've tried the Pablano, Primetime, & Magic Shroom. All were delicious. I generally prefer a more classic taste in a burger so my favorite is probably the Pablano. The Shroom is good if you like pesto but I couldn't really finish more than half because of the dominance  of the pesto flavor. Primetime is really good. Something about the patty that was really good.. The quality was definitely different (better) . I would probably opt out of the truffle aioli next time though. Their buns are good because they make it from scratch!

My aunt and uncle introduced me to Hopdaddy a couple of weeks ago, when we were looking for a nice patio beer spot.  It has a good open corner spot in Union Square with a decent amount of room.  I dove straight into the menu and was sold when I saw El Diablo, because I presumed that meant spicy.  My family already had their choices made before sitting down.  The Diablo was good, cooked right and of a decent size.  The fries were good too, but that didn't matter, because my experienced aunt went ahead and ordered a bowl of green chili queso to dip them in, and after tasting that I'm not sure anything else on the table mattered.  Yowza that's some damn fine eatin'!

They have a good beer list and it's stocked with local brews, which I always appreciate.  We were seated immediately, service was prompt, and the patio was comfortable.

Overall this is a pretty good burger spot, I left full and happy and will most likely return.

This place is so dank!! I don't know about you but I think the Thunderbird Burger is off the hook! It's so tender and flavors flow so well together. There's chicken, bacon, guac etc. I recommend trying with their Oreo shake with a little bit of Bailey's in there and a side of chili queso fries.

Pablano burger,  truffle fries and a Nutella and pretzel shake = absolute bliss. A great Sunday afternoon spot for people watching, enjoying the fall sun and recovering from the weekend. We rode the light rail in from South Denver to spend the day downtown and the stop at Hopdoddy was definitely a treat.

Hopdoddy is the perfect intersection of mouth watering burgers and great people watching. The tables outside offer the touristy view of Union Station along with all of the different types of people walking by (people taking pics, people traveling on the trains, runners, dog walkers, etc). Pair that with a juicy burger, a huge pile of fries, and you got yourself the perfect outdoor spot! 

I came on a Sunday evening with the hubs after Oktoberfest and the burger hit all the right spots. It was meaty but juicy, saucy but not messy, and the bun was toasty but not crumbly. The order of fries we got to share looked gigantic but somehow we easily ate them all (don't judge). My only "complaint" is that the milkshakes were very runny. My red velvet milkshake was more red velvet flavored milk than anything resembling a shake. 

Take home message: Get a burger and some fries, sit outside, and enjoy!

Dropped in here yesterday after the Rockies game because I was craving a burger! I opted for the Shroom Burger (mushrooms, pesto, goat cheese, tomato...what's not to love?) and then promptly realized my Yelp Check In gave me $1 off said burger. Even better! Hubs ordered a regular cheese burger (yawn) and then we ordered a large fry. Everything was good. I loved all the toppings on my burger. I wanted the actual burger to be a bit juicier but it still hit the spot for my protein fix. We sat at the bar and the service was great - very friendly. We enjoyed sampling the array of flavored ketchups for our fries. Honey mustard turned out to be the favorite and then the Chipotle. We weren't so crazy about the BBQ. I love fancy ketchups. 
We polished those off and rolled ourselves out of there. It's a good choice to satisfy your need for a burger and fries!

Was deciding on a last meal in Denver, and somehow ended up in Hopdoddy, which turned out to be an awesome choice. The servers are amiable and quick to help you out, especially with recommendations. Not to mention, the happy hour (I think it's 2-6:30) is a great deal. $2 off any burger and $5 craft beers? Don't mind if I do. 

Food itself was solid. Ordered the El Diablo and a friend had the magic shroom burger. Both were very juicy, but the burger itself was a little lacking in texture and flavor. Toppings made up for it, however. The habanero and serrano chilis lit up my mouth for a good 15 minutes. 

Overall, a nice place with great service and good food.

Do not order the Black Bean Burger, it's like baby food. The concept of the build sounded great, but the texture was bad, even for vegetarian standards. The hit of this restaurant really is their fries. We got the truffle fries and the chile con queso fries, they really were the stand out part of the entire meal. Three different burgers that members of the party tried to order had ingredients that had run out, like the bison. So ask before setting your heart to the Buffalo Bill. Great variety of protein options, tuna, bison, chicken, beef, lamb, and turkey. I like that the staff is alternative, it fits their vibe.

Date of Visit: 7/1/16

Hopdoddy is a cool little burger joint + bar cranking out a wide variety of signature burgers, sides, and funky drinks. The Magic Shroom (goat cheese, field mushrooms, mayo, basil pesto, red leaf lettuce, white onion, beefsteak tomato) is my go-to burger, but I would not hesitate to try anything on the menu. These are not your cookie cutter burgers; they are consistently flavorful, well-executed, and offer some really fun combos. For your boozy fix, go with the Black Cherry Hard Limeade (gin/vodka, lime, black cherry fizz); an excellent summertime drink!

Hopdoddy, keep doing what you're doing.

Hopdoddy being my first burger place to eat here in downtown Denver was amazing and the food was soo tasty, i would recommend this restaurant for any new people to Colorado and old as well to having some bomb shell waiters and management great for night out. 
The server Austin Rice did a super job!

I dont if it was because i was kinda hung over or what but that turkey burger was the best thing i have tasted in a long time. I got my burger to go and it wasn't long for the wait. Standing there watching the game i was approached twice and asked if i needed anything. I will definitely go back to and tell my friends. I got a yelp account just so i could write this review. Good job! A++

Hopdoddy Burger Bar is a gourmet pub-style burger restaurant near Union Station in downtown Denver specializing in locally sourced ingredients and beers. Their large restaurant has a decent amount of outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

I was able to use the new A Line from DIA to escape the foodservice of the airport and find a cheaper and better option in downtown. I settled in with a spicy buffalo burger and a few local beers. The buffalo was great, although the added spice did not really compliment the natural flavor of the buffalo well. Meats with actual flavor do require special treatment. The fries were thin and crispy and disappeared quickly.

This place is popular for good reason. Their commitment to local and natural ingredients is really nice to see and support.

A former coworker in town tried Hopdoddy this past Thursday. Neither of us had been to the restaurant before but both wanted a burger and were close to Union Station, so after ages of passing by decided to give it a try. We were both very pleased. The restaurant's atmosphere was stylish, modern and pleasant. The service was excellent. Best of all the food was not only our fast, but was delicious. We shared fries and both enjoyed our burgers. They were cooked perfectly and the toppings were fresh. Add in delicious cocktails and we had a great experience. Highly recommend.

Damn these burgers were good. The fries were good. On top of that the ahi tuna burger was good too. Love the huge selection of meats, the location right next to Union Station and Rockies stadium aka Coors Field, outdoor seating on a huge patio, cavernous indoor space with TVs, I mean what more could you ask for. Oh, how about speedy, friendly service. Yep, got that too. 

Great, great craft beer selection and I got some sort of lemonade that I can't quite recall but it was so refreshing and much needed since it felt like 100 degrees. Anyway, next time I'm in Denver, gonna make sure I hit up Hopdoddy.

Buyer beware: behold their medium rare. Completely raw 
Don't forget the room temp fries!

Came here for lunch with a friend. The fries were perfectly cooked. My Thunderbird chicken burger which I got as a lettuce wrap was super tasty. Everything was very flavorful and cooked just right. I also got a margarita that was really good but could have used just a bit more lime. Overall, service was fast, and the food was decent. It's definitely a good place for a weekday business lunch!

Tasty burgers here and within a short walk to Coors field.  It took our server a while to come to our table but once he was there he was probably one of the best servers I have encountered in a while.  We sat outside under the shade.  

Try the truffle fries and the ginger lemonade, both excellent.  The burgers aren't cheap but worth the price.

We came to Hopdoddy on the final weekend of the Denver Passport program. My husband ordered a frozen margarita. I had just finished a fairly intense hike up in Boulder (thankful for a casual spot in Union Station that wouldn't mind my activewear); as I tried my husband's marg, I downed over half in a few gulps. Oops! Guess it was that good (and I was that thirsty) 

Which leads me to my first pointer- drinks are on point. I got the alcoholic black cherry limeade- superb for a summer night! Margs are awesome too.

As for food, our table ordered the truffle fries. Pretty good, but I would say the serving size is a bit small for what you pay. The aioli it comes with is yummy. For dinner, I got a the Caesar salad- which had onion straws and crunchy chick peas to keep things interesting. 

Overall- one of the better restaurants in the Union Station area.

Oh man I've missed this place! So glad it's finally in Denver! For some reason, I remember the ones in Texas tasting a little better.

I got the adult shake, Kahlua with Sea Salt Caramel. SOOO GOOD! Then I got the El Diablo with the peppers on the side so I don't get a huge bite of habanero peppers right in the middle. The burger was as good as I remember but the truffle fries I remember tasting better in Texas. They were still good just not as good as I remember.

We will definitely be back here when we are missing that bit of Texas!

Yummy Shakes!!  Yes yummy shakes at a burger joint...No really I went in for the burger but was most impressed with the salted caramel shake. 

 It was the weekend before St. Patrick's day so there was a parade and lot's going on but by 7:00pm food was the most important thing on our minds, and we knew that Union Station had some great restaurants.  We decided on Hopdoddy and were told multiple times by our friend that it was not HOPDADDY,    Located on the Wazee street side of Union Station it was easy to get to and there were no lines but definitely a wait list for those that had large groups.  We opted for a high top and pulled in an extra chair for our party of 5.   

The waitstaff is very friendly and pretty quick to get your order, though we did wait a bit for it to get to us and that did include the drinks.   We weren't in any hurry so we chalk that up to everything being made to order and fresh.  Amongst the many restaurants that have popped up in the area, this one burger bar can hold its own on fresh, from the meat to the potatoes.    Having ground their own meat to peeling and cutting of the fries to the fresh ingredients in the shake nothing appeared on our table that you would question what was in it.   

I had ordered the Continental Club thinking it would be a club with layered  thin meat more sandwich which it was not, it was a good sized full turkey burger with all the fixings.  I was only able to eat half (and all the bacon off it).  My friends opted for the Classic burgers and all of us were devouring the food within seconds of its delivery.    we did have to wait on some fries as my one friend didn't realize that they don't come with the meal and had to order but those came out quickly and all tummies were satisfied!

Now back to my shake, I had not thought I would be getting a shake since it was getting cold out and I had originally been wanting a hot chocolate but just seeing Caramel and Sea Salt Shake on the menu make me smile, it's kind of my new favorite ice cream.  I don't drink alcohol so it's always nice to be somewhere with friends that has alternatives to just colas on the menu.   I will say that the $6 buck seemed steep for a shake but when I got it and after passing it around for everyone to taste I knew that it's worth the price tag.   It reminded me of growing up and visiting my grandparents in Southern Colorado, they lived in a small town called LaVeta where there was a small Creamery.  My grandpa would treat me to a shake made with fresh creamery ice cream mixed in a shake mixer.  It was a nice memory.   

Good food should help to bring back memories or create new, and should always make you happy.   I can't wait to go back and try the Special: Strawberry Buttermilk Shake and I might just have the Ahi burger too, yum.

Hopdoddy Burger. Damn. 

Honestly, guys. Honestly. This was one of the best burgers I've ever had. I live and breathe In N Out. (Which is the best burger ever, duh.) BUT HopDobby was what alllll my dreams were made of. 

It was a Friday evening and we were seated right away. Our waitress, Stephanie was quick and prompt and so helpful with the drink and food menu. Had enough suggestions to make the table happy and even recommended what would be best and cheapest for us without ever trying to upsell... that is a quality waitress! 

All 3 of us had ordered drinks and burgers and were fully satisfied with what we received. The ground beef they use must have some sort of magic in it because it tasted won.der.ful. 

Long live Hopdoddy Burger Bar.

After reading a review of the Primetime burger, I just had to have it.  Some sort of wyagu beef cooked to perfect medium rare with brie, truffle garlic aioli, steak sauce and arugula.  It was so good. The burger was $12 and the most expensive one on the menu.  Plenty of great options for a good bit cheaper too.
The ber list was small, but well appointed.  Traveling alone, this was a nice spot to dine alone.  plenty of seating at the bar.  The service was great too. I think the bartender's name was Sarah.

The experience could have been better. 

Host today gets no star. I just don't like the type of hosts or hostesses that make you feel like they want you to go away. I asked if the bar was open seating and he quickly responded it's full. So I got on the list anyway and walked in to find two open seats on the bar right in front of the entrance. Lol

Luckily the bartender was great. 

Burgers were fantastic. I'd give it 4 out of 5. The buns could have been a little less greasy. Although the overall taste of the burger and especially the meat was definitely great. You can tell the beef is fresh. Very delicious. 

Ambience I'd give 2 out of 5. The restaurant just has a chain feel to it, which it is.

Overall, I'd give it 3 out of 5.

I'm glad I held off on my review until they revamped their service system. When Hop Doddy first opened it was kind of a mess. An inconsistent and ill-employed combination of fast casual and restaurant service. It didn't work. They heard their customers, they revamped, and now it's a regular resto service model that's 10x better. THANK YOU FOR LISTENING!

Great burgers, if slightly underwhelming on occasion -- but still pretty great. Good cocktails, limited beer selection, and milkshakes that are so good you'll swear it wasn't possible to feel so much guilt while sweating pure ice cream.

It's really an awesome part of Union Station, and a great burger bar to have downtown. They aren't over the top burgers, though some come close. And they also aren't the most amazing burgers you've ever had, but they are absolutely worth it, even if they come at downtown prices.

Now, can we talk about the name? Because that's something I still don't understand....

Great Flavors

I'm usually not a fan of overworked burgers as they usually have a meatloaf type of taste and lose a certain amount of the 'flavor' of the meat.  I'm more a fan less handled, natural burgers.  That said, Hopdoddy is definitely an exception.  It was definitely one of the most flavorful burgers I've had in quite a while, but you miss that burger bite with nooks and crannies in the meat.

Had the El-Diablo burger that has habanero and serrano peppers, pepper jack, caramelized onions, salsa, chipotle mayo, lettuce and tomato.  Even with all those flavors and heat, the meat was still the star of the show.  I was really impressed.  The bun/meat ration was perfect though a little small overall.

We had the fries, and a lot of them. A regular order of fries is pretty large.  We got the fries with the green chili queso.  As many people have said in other reviews this would taste awesome on a burger.  Again, the flavors are great and fresh.  I did have this wish that this contained some protein such as chorizo - if it did I would order this as a meal of by itself. yum!

Also tried the Primetime burger with Brie, caramelized onions, arugula, truffle aioli and a steak sauce.  Again, good mix of flavors and the meat is allowed to stand out.  Good, but not as good as the El-Diablo.  I made the better pick ;)

The burgers could be a little bigger for the cost as a burger, fries and drink could run you $12-15.  Appreciate their attention to detail though with respect to the fresh, natural, sustainable ingredients. The flavors definitely come through in their dishes.  

Only issue I have - and this is a nit is that everything about the decor, atmosphere and environment is perfect - almost a little too perfect.  You want it to feel like a local place, but unfortunately it's on its way to being a bigger chain.

Unfortunately, I don't frequent the downtown scene much anymore but I am glad I was downtown this day because I found one of the better burgers that I have had in a while. 

I was down for St. Patty's day and was starving. On recommendation from my friend, he suggested that we eat here. I can't remember the exact name of my burger but we all had different burgers and yes, I tried all three. They were so good that I can't wait to try some of the others. 

I also ordered some Parmesan truffle fries which were some of the best fries I have ever eaten. 

When you're hungry for a burger, I definitely think this is worth your money.
Loved eating here with a friend that came into town! Burgers were seasoned deliciously and the buns were warm and delectable! Fun atmosphere and great service!

Happy hour runs from 3pm - 6:30pm M-F which gave me just enough time to get here after work! Like I mentioned in my tip, all burgers are $2 off, all beers on draft are $5 (they carry a ton of great local ones), and 4-5 signature drinks for $5 as well. 

I had at seat at the bar and the bartender was immediately friendly and welcoming. I wasn't sure how it worked, but apparently they switched back to a traditional ordering style rather than their previous confusing method of ordering at the counter and then getting a waiter afterwards. 

My first dilemma was choosing which beer I wanted to go with my burger and the bartender was very informative. He asked me what kind of burger I was thinking of, told me what paired well, even let me sample 5 different ones (generous pours) because I'm terribly indecisive. He was super friendly and very knowledgable about the breweries, profiles of the beers, etc. and helped me make the right decision. 

Food: 

Went for the parmesan truffle fries, which were not the best truffle fries I've ever had, but the magic is in the sauce. They give you a mushroom truffle dipping sauce that really makes the fries great, and it was also on the HH menu! 

For my main, I decided on the Magic Shroom Burger because of the Yelp check-in deal. Great news- it stacks with the HH deal so you get a great gourmet burger for just 5 dollars and some change. Flavor-wise, I feel like they focus more on the fixings rather than the meat here. The patty was cooked perfectly per my request, but the flavors more so came from the plentiful mushrooms and goat cheese. You can add some peppers for a kick for no extra cost, however, the habenero and serrano peppers come mixed, so make sure you can handle the heat. Otherwise just go for the jalepenos! 

I heard that they have some great "adult" milkshakes here so I will definitely be back and try them, as well as their other offerings. Just a few steps away from Union Station and service is relatively quick, so if you want to make a quick detour for some good food, I would definitely suggest this place.

Watching the nighttime fireworks coming from Coors Field through the window over fries and a shake made for a super cute date night! The first time I came here and had just the fries, queso and a shake I was blown away. The next time, when I actually had their burger (the bandito, which is their one vegetarian option for a burger) I was a little disappointed by the lack of flavor and the crumbly texture. 

This next thing, i'll admit, is nitpicky, but we had a group of about 10 people and there was plenty of room to sit us at one table, but we were placed at separate tables which made conversation an issue.

Hamburger Heavan!!!!! I literally enjoyed every bite of my burger! I had the Magic Shroom and my Hubby El Diablo. We had the Green chile con queso fries too. The bread on the burger was soft and buttery yet perfectly crispy on the edges. The meat on the burger was cooked to perfection. The burgers melt in your mouth. The fries were good as well the chile had a good little kick. And the sangrita was a decent cocktail and had unique flavor. The service was on point and made our experience even more wonderful!
Damn good burgers and beer.  Great spot on your train ride to or from the airport.  They let me test drive the beer before getting one.  Burger is amazing.  Get the Buffalo Bill. Bison burger.

The waiter seriously messed up everything about my drink and food order. I ordered a margarita with no salt on happy hour - both times he brought it with salt and I had to return it.

As far as my burger, I asked for mustard on it and it didn't come with mustard so I had to wait a while to get that and he didn't seem apologetic. I don't remember our waiters name but he didn't seem apologetic at all whenever he messed up. Maybe everyone else will have better service than me. Good luck!
Great burger spot, lots of variations to choose from when it comes to burgers. Great environment and customer service. It was the first place my fiancé and I stopped to eat when we got to Denver
Cool atmosphere,  great location.  I had the shroom burger...REALLY tasty.  The truffle fries are to die for.

I love burgers and living in Los Angeles, we have a lot of burger joints spread across southern california. So coming in Hopdoddy we didnt know what to expect. My gf and I were doing tourist stuff in Denver so we decided to try this place out. We were greeted nicely and sat down right away. 

I got the El Diablo burger and boy was that an adventure! Normally I can tolerate spicy food without a sweat but this burger was definitely on fire! The waiter said the chilies were in season. Although it was hot, the flavor was still there. Definitely one of the best burgers I've had.

A friend raved to me about this fast and fresh burger concept out of Austin, and I loved it, too! 
First off, I love how they bring the fries before the burger. Definitely get the queso with them. Sounds weird, but is SO good!!! Loved this the best.
The burger was so fresh and delicious. Perfect bun/meat ratio along with toppings. They have a wide variety of specialty burgers to choose from. I kinda wish we had gone with the Primetime as the bartender recommended, but ours was still delicious. They grind their meat daily and bake the buns daily, as well. The buns were awesome. No skimping in ingredients here. Wish we had room for one of their decadent shakes, but the local Colorado beer filled us up. Come to Nashville guys!! Great chain!!

It was fantastic and great. Hit the spot and was exactly what I was looking for. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone. The only thing I would change is the long survey they give you to fill out, but it's not required.

One of the best burgers I have had in some time.
Cool hip environment. Good service. Loved the drink selection all sodas made with cane sugar. Fresh ground burgers on site. You could tell. Would go out of my way to go back

Hopdaddy may now be a good reason for me to go into downtown more often. I tried the burger for the first time the other day, and absolutely loved it! I had the Shroom burger and can't wait to go back and try other ones!! 
Fries however was only ok though

We had an amazing experience tonight and we didn't even have any food or drinks. Let me explain. 

We stopped by after the Rockies game to have a shake, it's the Purple Rain shake (the shake formerly known as purple haze) that they're featuring right now. They have re-named it to the Purple Rain in honor of Prince. When we got to the host's stand and told them we were only stopping by to have shakes he told us there were a few that they were out of and the Purple Rain was one of them. We were bummed but oh well right? But we were so pleasantly surprised when he presented us with a gift card so that our next shakes were on the house! 

Talk about over and above... I was blown away! We will absolutely be coming back! 

Sometimes it's the littlest gesture that can really make an impact and Hopdoddy obviously gets that! 

(I should add that we never got upset or threw a fit. Take note, it pays to be nice to people who you are talking to, and sometimes you even get free shakes out of it!)

I walked past Union Station and this place a million times yet only saw a simple burger joint.  Stopped in today in a bit of a rush.  Au contraire, it is a collection of very original and tasty menu choices.  Even the drinks are interesting and tasty.  The fries are a bit wimpy and of small portion but I shouldn't carb load anyway.  I had the chili and Fritos burger, oh my, very good.  We went on a weekday lunch time and Hopdoddy was very busy but handling the volume with great and friendly staff who also had a good pace for food timing.  Will go again, especially since we have an office across the street...duh!

Really creative burgers. Super juicy, really good food over all . Had Oscar as a server, he was hands down one of the better servers we've had in Denver. So many servers these days are like robots that only car about flipping their sections. We will definitely return here when we get the craving .

I kept hearing about this place from co-workers and friends so when I got to pick the lunch spot yesterday I hopped on Hopdoddy (I think I'm funny sometimes)

If you have never been here, you order and pay near the kitchen and they bring food to your table where you also get assigned a waiter. This is a little weird to me because if you end up getting more food/drink at your table you will have to pay an entirely new bill. Why not pay one time, at the end? Oh well what do I know. Moving on...

To start, I got a side of the Parm Truffle Fries for the table to share. Those were the best damn fries I've ever had and I would go back just for those. I think they were only like $6 and you got enough for 3 people. I enjoyed the fries so much I barely could finish half my burger (the Llano Poblano) but NO REGRATS

Check this place out if you want a good bite near Union Station. It's more pricey than your fast food burger, but the high quality of ingredients is apparent. Highly recommended!

Although the waitress forgot (but eventually brought) my companion's beer, this was a great restaurant.  The burgers are inventive and tasty.  I had the magic mushroom burger ($1 off with Yelp check in) and my friend and I shared the fries and green chili queso.  They need to have a burger or nachos smothered in the green chili queso because it is legit.

How crazy is it that I have to come all the way to Denver to try Hopdoddy when there is one right in my neighborhood but oh well, I tried it and loved it.  The wait staff was exceptional. Very friendly, helpful in all ways, since we were visiting etc. I ordered a plain cheese burger just because and I have to say it was exceptionally delicious. The meat comes from non hormone, grass feed animals and tastes very fresh. We had a small order of French fries that easily feed two that were hand cut delicious. Perfectly cooked. Because it was my brothers birthday, we got the Apple pie milkshake which he loved complimentary.  What a great experience and food. Thanks Hopdoddy Denver.

Way cool. exceptional food. cool location. most memorable was the shake. Blueberry with toasted hazlenuts. I think it was just a special for the week. But truly memorable. 

I'd like to return and get a more pared down burger. Just to experience the beef in surroundings it doesn't get intimidated or washed out by. Just a personal exploration this place has compelled summoned from me at the moment. I'll be back multiple times i'm sure though.

One of the best burgers in town. And milkshake. Great atmosphere near union station. I had slow service but it was worth the wait. 

Truffle fries are a bit too rich but I have been pleased with pretty much everything here. Magic shroom burger and stout shake are my favorites. My fiancé tried Caesar and said it was unique and very tasty (if you want a salad...)

Service: great 

Pricing: absolutely ridiculous. Be careful. I ordered a Magic Shroom burger for $8.75. Very basic- onions, cheese, and mushrooms. Instead of a beef burger I asked for a chicken breast instead. The brought out my burger, with a ground chicken patty the size of the bottom of a coke can. I rate it a 4/10. 

I received the bill, which stated "Sub ADD CHICKEN PATTY" $4.00

$12.75 for the burger, no fries. 

The chicken burger on the menu with cheese bacon and avocado- $10

Place is a joke. If you want a good, honest burger in the area go to Thirsty Lion.
Had the magic shroom burger and its taste like make. Juicy and very delicious. Must try when in town. Hope they put one in Los Angeles.
So much goodness in this next generation Burger Bar... (Service is Impeccable as well) Thanks Guys !!!

Came in for happy hour and the food is amazing. I was able to substitute a black bean patty for any of the burgers on the menu. You have to try green chile quest fries! Be sure to share it with a friend though! It's a huge portion size. I had the Oreo shake and it was alright. Nothing amazing and wish it came in a bigger portion size.
Hopdoddy's is a good burger joint with decent prices. I had the Llano Poblano. Quite a tasty burger with good quality meat. Easy 4 stars.
Visiting from LA, dropped in to grab a bite.  Our server Nick was very friendly and hospitable.  Great beers, tasty burgers! Great start to our weekend gateway!  Thanks Nick :)

You get a discount on the magic shroom burger (Angus Beef, Texas Goat Cheese, Field Mushrooms, Mayo, Basil Pesto, Red Leaf Lettuce, White Onion, Beefsteak Tomato) if you check in on Yelp. The burgers all cost a little under $9 each. They were a lot smaller than I thought they would be so I would recommend getting a side dish (Ex fries). I tried both the magic shroom and the goodnight/good cause burger (Angus Beef, Tillamook Cheddar, Hickory BBQ Sauce, Caramelized Onions, Sliced Jalapeno, Hickory BBQ, Sassy Sauce, Red Leaf Lettuce, Beefsteak Tomato). It's called good cause because a $1 of the price goes toward Lone Star Paralysis (great idea!- now you can feel less guilty about indulging in a burger). I got a small kennebec fries for $2.75. I thought the fries were ok but on the greasy side. They offer tons of beer and cocktail options and they have a happy hour that starts @ 3PM. There is indoor and outdoor seating. the interior is very modern and they have a few TVs inside that feature sports.

We have been here multiple times. .. great service, great  location..yep we just walk on over and have a beer with one of their amazing burgers. K town belly, el Diablo and prime time are my favorites! !!all beef is grinded daily no frozen patties here!  AND of course you gotta have the  Truffle fries.. yes amazing !!! Bartenders friendly. .Tyler and Toni. 
And if ya like bloody Mary's. ..delicious.
Food (classic bison burger with baby kale salad and green chili queso fries) was awesome, and Devone was a great waitress! Will absolutely come back here.

This is my favorite place for a burger and fries in Denver! It's close to everything awesome downtown and the train station! I had never been before but my friends and I were roller skating downtown and decided to check it out! We had an amazing server! Her name was amber and she had an adorable southern accent! The food, beer, and service was superb!

Three and a half stars. I've seen this chain in Dallas, where they're hugely popular. It's hard to get a table, so that's a good sign. I am pescetarian, so I didn't try a meat burger. I had what they call a hemp seed patty, which is a vegetarian patty with various nuts and seeds in it. It doesn't really taste like a burger and is a bit dense for me, so I didn't care for it. Next time, I'll try the ahi tuna burger. However, they have AWESOME green chile queso fries (the queso is served on the side in a cup). I could just eat a big bowl of the queso, like a bowl of broccoli cheese soup, but better! Seriously, like crack. I've been thinking about it ever since. They have a cute condiment bar and they also offer water and hot tea for free on the bar. Cute place. I'd try them again, just wouldn't recommend the hemp seed patty.

I have been here twice now, and each time I am impressed. These are upscale burgers, at in a fun causal atmosphere with reasonable prices. You can get a cheese burger, but you can also get a goat cheese mushroom pesto burger (serious the best burger ever). Burgers come on a homemade potato bun - light and fluffy to balance the thick meat patty! Get an order of the shoe string fries - you wont be disappointed. Good Happy Hour (M-F 3:30 -6:30) - great deal being downtown Denver. Service has always been friendly. For a good burger, look no further - these this place is spot on.
Such good food. Cool little spot to chill! Go during happy hour, tons of great deals and try to the Truffle Fries and Sassy Sauce!

I'm a big fan of burger places that have gluten free buns, so a friend recommended I stop here while in town, and I'm glad I did! First off, Amber was our server and was amazing! She was super helpful and sweet when I asked her about the gluten free items on the menu. Most places dont know what I can and cant eat, so that was really great. I went with the Thunderbird on a GF bun. I was also craving a cocktail, so she recommended getting the "hey neighbor", (their version of a bloody mary). Well, I have to say, that might have been both the best drink and best burger I've ever had! Ill definitely be back, and asking for Amber!
Amber was the best! Was so on top of everything, we came in close to closing time and she had no problem giving us an hand. Great burgers and fry but honestly it's the best service! Thank you Amber

The first time I ate at Hopdoddy was a few years ago in Austin, TX before the Denver location opened. The burgers are alright. Nothing spectacular. The truffle fries aren't my favorite either. I mainly come here for the shakes.

The last time I came here, my friend ordered shake special called the Purple Haze (blueberry compote, gray sea salt, and spiced vanilla ice cream topped with whipped cream and toasted hazelnuts) which was delicious but I stuck with my usual Nutella Chocolate Pretzel. The custard they use has a hint of cinnamon, and while I'm not a fan of cinnamon at all, the shakes are all great! Highly recommend them, even with the $6 price tag.

This will have been my fourth time here. The first time was amazing, this time not so much. Debated two stars simply because the mess ups shouldn't have happened.
I asked for extra onions and didn't get any. I asked for well done and it was pink in center. Ate it anyway.

Service was great, cost not bad. I have a feeling that with this happening they won't last too long. Standards are high in the area.

Will be back but probably only one more time to see if they can get it right.

Oh and we came at the end of the night so it wasn't like they were busy. At all.

Coco was awesome! She was very welcoming, hospitable, and had wonderful energy. The food was excellent as usual. The queso was to die for and the truffle fries are an absolute revelation. 
Food, service, and atmosphere was awesome! I'm visiting from California and had been to the one in Texas before so I took the Denver local who I am visiting here for her first Hopdoddy experience. Needless to say it was a success!

While living in Austin for 3 months for work, I fell in love with this local joint.  There was always (ALWAYS) a line out the door and around the corner.  I love that a little piece of Austin is a few miles away from me.  

The ahi tuna burger is incredible.  The milkshakes are a thing of the past for me, as I found out recently about a cow and goat milk allergy, but they are AMAZING!!  They will mix flavors for you! 

What I got this time: the bison burger as a lettuce wrap without cheese or any sauce & I added avocado.  I apologized for my complicated order but they were super gracious.  It was full of flavor with just the right amount of crisp on the outside to compliment the juiciness on the inside.  

What I didn't like: it's at Union Station - which means parking is a beast!

Honestly the best burger I've ever had. I'm praying they open up some of these in Ohio. I would visit often. The adult beverages are good but possibly are shy of a full oz of alcohol so don't go there to get your tipsy on. Check out the staff shirts- they all say something comical. My only wish was perhaps some plug-ins at the tables so people could work while eating. I feel like if they had that people would totally make it the upgraded Starbucks. Lol. Customer service was excellent and prices were fair.

Great food beer and service.  Super nice young people are doing a great job of running this show.  Friendly bartenders!

We love you guys:)

I dine at the HopDoddy whenever I'm in town for a concert or hiking, the weekend I visited in particular I got down with the magic mushroom and pecan porters, great experience everytime, also cheers to the sweet server Devon. Highly recommend if you're into burgers and be

Nice burger place. Stopped here before leaving for the airport. Wait staff was accommodating for my furniture and allowed me to use their outlet at the bar to charge my phone. 

Hamburgers tasted good and their small margarita was surprisingly strong.
Awesome food and drinks. Bartender Tyler will definitely take care of you. Check out the ahi tuna burger and the little Larry drinks... BOMB! Definitely a go to spot in LoDo

One of the best burgers I've had, hands down! The parmeasan truffle fries are great as well. I would definitely recommend this if you are in the Denver area. Make sure to ask for Amber, she's  the best!

Amber was our server and asked her what she recommended.  After a few seconds we decided the Diablo was the way to go!  #LEGITNESS.  Killer service(Amber was absolutely rockstar!!!), great beer selection, and ordered another Diablo to go home with.  This is one of my new favorite fatkid places!

Love me some Hopdoddy! I have eaten here several times and the food is always on point and the service is amazing. The fries and green chili queso are out of this world!

I've never had a bad experience here and can't wait to go back.

This place reminds me of the Counter but the quality of the burgers is higher. They have some great tasting food and the drinks are actually pretty good too. The Margaritas are $4 on HH which is a pretty good deal considering that they are strong. I would recommend the mushroom burger, it is quite tasty. 
Overall, great experience. Would highly recommend for everyone in Denver. 
Keep up the good work!

Wonderful! Had the El Diablo and my wife had the Llano Poblano with the Parmesan Truffle fries. Cooked perfectly to med-well and delicious. 
:-)
Food was alright. Service was absolutely terrible. Completely unorganized and took about 1hr on a dead night (there was no wait all just missed timing with waiter and kitchen).

I just cannot get enough of this place!  Great place to watch a game or just meet up with friends.  My friends and I are obsessed with this place, so we often come for birthdays because they're great about accommodating large groups and will even let you bring your own cake.

Without a doubt you MUST order the truffle fries!  They come in a large basket meant to share (although I admit I've finished one off by myself a time or two) and are something you'll be dreaming about for nights to come!  The Magic Shroom burger is my absolute favorite, although I've had the chance to sample most of the burgers and they're all delicious.
