A solid draft beer selection and great house cocktails (order a round of Little Larry's for yourself and be prepared to call an Uber home).
Superior service. Great concept, tasty food, neither of our meals were correct as ordered so they gave us more truffles fries. The food tasted great, but not OMG great.

This place is outta this world!  From the unique burgers (the shroom lover is my fav) to the homemade shakes (peach cobbler) this place can't go wrong!  

The location is prime, right next to union station!  I have been a few times and I love this place!  You will too!

I came in here with a coupon to try their burgers. The food was worth 4 or more stars but the experience wasn't great. It was confusing that we were assigned a table and then had to order at a register and get our own water. I also have a hard time with places where you tip before you're served. We were promised "table side service" but we never once had an employee talk to us. We got our own water and refills. Seemed odd. I'm sure they do the order ahead to help ease wait time when there's a large crowd but it just seemed like they needed to work some kinks out.

The food was great though! I recommend the prime time. The fries were great too. Everything was a little pricey but ingredients were above average so I suppose it was worth it. I wasn't as wowed as everyone else. I don't know if I'll be back

I had high expectations for Hopdoddy since it has such a high overall rating but I was pretty underwhelmed by the whole experience.  I live right by Sunnyside Burger Bar, which tried the same ordering system and failed hard so I was curious if Hopdoddy did it better and though a friendly employee was right at the door to explain everything, I'm still  not a fan.  I'd so rather sit at my table and look the menu over, than stand in line doing it.  Also, the beer selection and pricing is such a disappointment.  $7 for a pretty standard Colorado beer that I could find in any restaurant?  No thanks.

As for the food, it was just okay.  I got the Magic Shroom burger and it was SO rich.  It really needed something to contrast with the beef, mushrooms, goat cheese and basil aioli (that was oozing out of the burger).  We got an order of regular fries and I thought it was so weird that they bring them out right away before your burger gets there.  I did really like the dipping sauce options though and the chipotle ketchup was our favorite.  Overall, this place just isn't worth the price.  There are way better burgers to be had in Denver.

So here's my take. The burgers are decent. I wouldn't say amazing but they are good. It's too bad no one out here makes char-burgers. That would change everything.

So the burger is good and the fries are decent. The prices though.... it should have three $$$.
It's definitely pricey and the fries don't come with the burger, which is kinda cheap. The truffle fries are super pricey too. Especially if you are one person getting food for lunch.

So I'd say go ahead and eat there. It's decent, but be ready to spend at least $10-15, probably $20 on one burger and fries.

I will eat Ahi Tuna fixed about any way. Tonight it was as a burger at Hopdoddy! Incredible flavor with the Teriyaki, Honey Wasabi, Mayo and Pickled Ginger. My dinner companion had the El Diablo and he was in some pain LOL from the chili's so don't order this unless you are die hard!! The only reason I didn't give Hopdoddy a 5 is because I wasn't a huge fan of the Parmeasan Truffle Fries. They weren't hot and didn't really have much flavor. Beer was great and service was excellent! I also love the decor!

**They have selfie sticks by the door if you need to borrow one to take a group photo to put on Yelp while you are there** How cool is that?? :-)

Forgive me. This establishment's Yelp ratings require correction.

This establishment suffers from a confusing mix of fast-food and restaurant service paradigms.  Table numbers. Waiting in line. Pseudo-waitstaff. Who do I tip and when?  Where do I get water?  Did I do something wrong?  Is this Qdoba or Denny's? I wonder if the employees tire of seeing confused patrons standing anxiously at the front of the restaurant looking about for help. 

The burger, promised to be medium-well, was rebelliously medium. Volumes of grease soaked the bottom bun, my hands, and my face.  The price of the burger with side was unwarranted for any establishment that requires a queue.

The atmosphere is the opposite of comfortable and authentic. It's a cookie cutter corporate masquerade, a cuckoo among its established neighbours.  This is an urban Panda Express for trend followers who don't understand service or cuisine. 

The one positive is that the staff are kind, helpful, and downright attractive urbanites (hipsters). I appreciated their hand holding as I stumbled through this social experiment.  

My recommendation?  Cross the street and experience the real Denver.

Awesome burger joint! I had the French fries with queso and the classic cheese burger. The seasoning on the fries was perfect with parsley and the queso tasted like an abuelitas (Mexican grandmother) queso. Burger was perfectly cooked-- medium and was super juicy. My husband had the mushroom burger and a rootbeer. Definitely order the rootbeer if you are a fan of classic creamy rootbeer.

BEST BURGERS I'VE EVER HAD! This place is amazing service was fast and great, but the food takes the spot light. These burgers are juicy, tender, and delicious. This was my first time and when I'm back to Denver I'll definitely be back. Josh our server was amazing btw!
We are from California and the burgers here were mouth watering. Absolutely delicious!!! If they still have the peanut butter jelly shake special it's a must. Also their sangria is very tasty

Whoa.

This place is delicious. 

We walked by and the letters on the window drew us in: full bar, local beer, burgers, fries, shakes.

Seriously, what more could you want. 

My fam and I had a couple drinks and shared an order of fries. Just a quick snack before the Rockies game. 

Couldn't have asked for a better place. 

Not only did we devour the fries, but we couldn't stop complimenting them. 

The service here is fabulous... Attentive and friendly.

Check it out and enjoy!

I was here for an yelp tasting event and was back a few times after scoring a $25 gift card. I got to try a few different burgers, salads, and shakes while I was here. I've tasted the classic, magic shroom, greek, thunderbird, ahi tuna burger. The burgers have a lot of flavors and is a good sized portion. I personally liked the ahi tuna and classic burgers. I thought the ahi tuna burger was unique and creative and tasted pretty good. Their truffle fries are also really good - either as a side or as a starter.

Of course, you have to try their shake if you have room for dessert. I've had the Lemon Olive Oil Biscotti, Caramel & Sea Salt, and Nutella & Chocolate Pretzel. All of these flavors have been really good (although very very sweet). I really enjoy the lemon olive oil biscotti shake because it is refreshing and not as sweet as the other ones I've tried. People here are very friendly and service is pretty fast. The only downside with any places in downtown is the parking!

I had the privilege of dining here, on Friday, November 11, with a dear friend. I've known Mehdi, for a little over a year, and was anxious to try Persian food, I've already become VERY passionate about, as it's what we are served at the Senior Day Care I attend. I enjoyed Koobideh Kebab, sprinkling Sumak on the beef, after savoring a lovely mushroom soup. Marcel, my friend, tried the Joojeh Kebab and truly enjoyed it. We treated ourselves to the Persian Pistachio Rose Ice Cream w/chopped Pistachio pieces sprinkled, on top. It was cool, creamy, and wonderfully refreshing. The perfect end to our perfect lunch. I'd recommend Surena to anyone who appreciates authentic Persian food, or would like to experience this exotic, healthy, and delectable food. You won't be disappointed. 

The restaurant is beautifully designed and decorated, elegantly. Everything is pristine and I imagine it would fit in, perfectly in an upscale New York or Los Angeles restaurant area. The staff are impeccably dressed and beautifully attendant to their customers. This is truly a restaurant I'm going to see about crossing town, again, to experience their fine cuisine.

I'm from center of Persian restaurant in US (Los Angeles)
In Colorado I can bot belive how they make this kind of delicious food.
Ashley (Afagh) is a good server and she is very polite.

Thanks guys

Well, what a great dinner! It's like the hidden secret of Greenwood Village. Saturday night and it wasn't even a full restaurant. 

We had 2 apps to share between 5 of us. One was an eggplant dip served with flatbread and the other was like fried rice cooked into a slab, crunchy on the bottom and topped with some tasty toppings. 

I had the lamb kabob and there around the table had other types of kabobs. Everything we tried was fantastic. We also had dessert, I had a delicious rose water ice cream and one person had a pastry thing drenched in honey which was apparently a bit too much honey. The complimentary tea that comes with dessert was great too, can't buy it here but they import it.

I am definitely a fan of Surena. This is located where the old Samurai sushi restaurant was. They've redone some of the décor and it looks clean and fresh with all the white they've added to the place. It wasn't too busy when we arrived to this restaurant around 11:30?

They have lunch specials for $10 and it includes this absolutely delicious mushroom soup. If you like mushrooms and if you like soup, you're going to really enjoy their soup...just a fair warning. I ended up ordering the Koobideh Kabob lunch menu. The normal portion includes 2 skewers which is way more than I could eat in one sitting. After we ordered, it did take a little bit of time for our food to arrive, but I was not disappointed by my first bite. The Koobideh was very well seasoned and had great flavors every bite I took. It wasn't over cooked at all and the meat was very tender. The rice was well cooked also (you'd be surprised at some restaurants under cooking their rice). They included some butter on our plate so I added it to the rice and it was extra tasty. I don't care what anyone says! Butter makes everything better. 

Overall the service was a bit slow, so I would definitely carve out extra time if you plan on coming for lunch. I thought the meal was a great value and exceeded my expectations.

Was fun meeting folks here for a UYE DTC lunch. First time here and first time at a UYE DTC lunch event. Enjoued the conversation and meeting new yelpers. 

We all ordered off the lunch menu. They have 3 or 4 options for $10. It comes with soup and roasted tomato half and pepper pieces. Some came with basmati rice with a sprinkle of saffron on top. I ordered the kabob wrap and that came with lettuce and special bread instead of the rice. The ground sirloin kabob had lots of flavor. The peppers were pretty hot for a wimp like me. My favorite was the soup. It was so creamy and I love mushrooms! The only other mushroom soup I have had is Campbell's cream of mushroom and obviously this soup beat Campbell's hands down.

Ambiance was nice. Fancy wares and plates. Nice waitress! Probably not the best for a quick lunch if you only have an hour lunch.

They have absolutely transformed the interior of this place! The food is more than up to par to match the beautiful atmosphere. And the service was wonderful.

I first went here for lunch with one of my more adventurous friends. I've never really eaten this type of food, but I can find something I like anywhere I go and am always up for something new and different. You definitely need to try their Tah-Dig appetizer. It's some sort of stew served over this crispy rice "cake"- so delicious and borderline craveable!! Their lunch portions are HUGE and a great deal at $10. We each tried a different meat and I really, really liked their rice that came alongside mine (koobideh kabob). Her salad was pretty meh alongside her kabob wrap. But the soup that comes with their lunch specials was super flavorful and delicious. I like the charred tomatoes and peppers they serve with the meals as well. My friend also tried the Doogh drink, and it was really different- a little too off-putting sour/bubbly for us but definitely glad to have tried it.

After eating here for lunch, I observed this would make for great takeout just due to the nature of the food. So a couple weeks after my first meal here, I dropped back in for a takeout dinner for me and hubby. Since I knew how huge their lunch portions were, I ordered one dinner entree for us to share (which is seriously double the lunch portion) plus the tah-dig appetizer and it was the perfect amount of food. He really enjoyed it and I was happy to see the flavors and quality was just as good as takeout. 

Both times, the staff here was incredibly friendly. They were happy to share suggestions and explain the food to us which I really appreciate, and need, when I'm out trying something totally new.

I will definitely be back, in fact as I'm typing this I'm craving it again!

I have ate here number of times, average twice a month since their opening. In the beginning the place was a 5 stars restaurant no ifs and buts about it. My mom is a 70+ Persian living in LA & she is very critical of Persian restaurant's food/service. She was visiting late April early May and we came here twice. She had nothing but nice things to say about the food, service and the place.

Food quality has changed since then. I noticed the Kobideh was slightly weaker/off starting in June. My last visit was Wednesday July 27, and the Kobideh was the worst I ever ate here, it was border line. The Barg was average. I asked my server (she is Persian & worked there since opening) if they have changed cooks or maybe the butcher... she told me no everything/everyone is the same and no changes. This confused me a bit. If everything is the same why is the food quality going downhill...

When they first opened they had nice table cloth on their tables. Now they have glass on their table tops. The glass makes it easier to clean and setup but is not as nice as table cloth. On one occasion the salt & pepper shakers on the table were not clean & were greasy. Persian or not five star restaurant have good quality food consistently... not just on the Friday/Saturday nights. Also, pay attention to little things, how hard is it to wipe clean the salt shaker while setting up the table...

The place is not inexpensive to say the least. Soltani is $22 & it does not come with a salad or anything. Most starters are $6, so with a salad or yogurt plus a soft drink you are looking at $30 before tax and tip. I'm not stingy, I don't mind paying whatever just as long as I'm happy/satisfied with what I am receiving.

Main thing I want is good quality food consistently and they have not been consistent, this is very disappointing. The photos I'm posting where taken back in May and all was good then.
Many vegetarian appetizer options and vegan/pescatarian options for dinner with big portions. My husband loved the shish kabob, a perfect medium rare. Amazing ambiance and a full bar!

Had the most disappointing experience. Ordered take out for dinner. Vegetarians have no choice in main course but to order vegetarian kabob. The vegetarian kabob lacks any flavor. It's like eating grilled veggies seasoned with only salt. Couldn't taste any spice in it. When the veggies are bland it would still be okay if the rice it is served with has some flavor. Not the case here. It's just rice seasoned with salt. 14$ for a bowl of rice and some grilled veggies?? Seriously?? 
Had zoolbia and bamieh for dessert which again failed to impress. Had great expectations from this place. So vegetarians think twice!

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch, right as we walked in the waitress was very kind and seated us right away. The hospitality we got was 10/10. We got the chicken soup that was on the house,  koobideh plate ($10), and tea. It was a generous amount for a well price lunch! It was all delicious and well put together. 

The entire restaurant was very clean, and gorgeous inside. This will become one of my go to restaurants.
Excellent food and great atmosphere. The kebabs and basmati rice are so yummy. The eggplant stew and rice is my favorite. Outstanding experience recommended highly.

Having never had "authentic" Persian food, it might be jumping the gun to give five stars. But the food was incredible and made me happy so five stars it is. 

The hubs and I came here with our international food group. We started with the crispy basmati rice app with half and half on the stew selection. The rice was fabulous and the stews were reminiscent of Indian dal and paneer. 

I moved on to the chicken thigh skewer with the bayberry rice. The chicken was very flavorful but still juicy. The hubs went with the lamb shank with the dill/Lima bean rice. I wasn't as much of a fan of the flavors but the lamb fell off the bone. 

Dessert was baklava. I love baklava but this one was over powered by rose water. I just don't like roses or hints of in any dessert I eat. I did try a bite of the ice cream and it was the same rose flavor. I'll come back for the savory!

The place is pretty neat and decorated. The staff were friendly though not Persian, except they might know couple words, is all. They don't serve hookah but they do have a little outside patio sitting. The food wasn't really served in Persian manners though it is more of a authentic joint so don't expect lots of cultural observation in there. 
For appetizer, Tahdig smothered with Gheimeh stew draw out our attention, the stew wasn't good to our tastes. Kabab Kobodeh was normal, something you can get everywhere, nothing so fancy-pants about it, nor special. Rice was good, glad they dropped two barbecued tomatoes on our plates. To be honest worth visiting once at least, but don't get your hopes high.

Taking its name from a very influential Persian military commander, the Englewood eatery called Surena offers you magnificent morsels in a captivatingly classy space (just around the corner from its prior incarnation, Shiraz).

To me, the most appropriate beverage to begin a Persian meal has always been the very effervescent yogurt soda called Doogh Mashky, and Surena's rendition will have your palate primed in no time for the dishes that are about to come next. Speaking of which - you can never go wrong with their daily soup selection, whether it turns out to be barley-based [Aash-e-Jow], or more noodle-rific [Aash-e-Reshteh]. But maybe an elegantly arranged herb plate with walnuts and white cheese speaks to you instead (presumably in Farsi)? And for you eggplant fans out there, it's time to turn that frown upside down, because Surena has a knockout appetizer [Kashk-e-Bademjan] that slow-roasts it before mixing it with whey and just a hint of mint! I know everything's already sounding wonderful but trust me, this is just the beginning... hope you have room!

A lunch entree that's always appealed to me at Surena is the tongue [Zaban] sandwich, with hunks of juicy meat in mushroom-tarragon sauce, sided with cool veggies. The sandwich is served open-faced on top of chewy lavash bread so that diners can arrange everything to their liking before rolling it all up. But their rotation of beef stews is certainly worthy of mention too, whether the co-star is potato [Gheimeh Cibzamini], braised celery [Khoresht-e-Karafs]... well, you get the idea. If poultry sounds more pleasing, you might also enjoy a moist, marinated Cornish hen [Joojeh Kabab]. But don't forget to save a little space for dessert, whether it's a bit of baklava, the chewy-creamy Bastani (saffron/rosewater ice-cream) or a pastry selection (yes, the Bamieh are the little round ones and the Zoolbia are the squiggly ones). Salamati, and enjoy your meal!

I was surprised to walk in this new restaurant it was absolutely beautiful I have to say they did a great job of remodeling the place however wasn't too impressed with the food the price was great the food was amazing I don't know so much about the flavoring of the right it wasn't feeling that too much I got the chicken kabob plate it was just ok don't know if I'll be back

Don't be fooled by the complex it's located in. The interiors are real nice. The appetizers are filled with vegetarian dishes but I can't say the same for entrees. Two appetizers and a kabob entree must suffice for 2 ppl.

Just got back from Surena. Before writing this review, I will preface it by stating that my wife (who is Persian) and I just moved from the Bay Area, and we are used to amazing Persian food. We ordered Mast-o-moosir (yoghurt), joojeh chicken and salmon.  The salmon was terrible--it was extremely dry such that my wife only ate half of it.  The bread for the yoghurt was awful; we are used to fresh bread (from the stone oven) in Persian restaurants but this one had bread that looked like it came straight out of a bag from CostCo. The salad was iceberg lettuce and it too was not appetizing. The best part of the meal was my diet Coke!  

As I sit here writing this, I feel gross; I will definitely NOT return!

First, I am really happy to have a Persian restaurant in our neighborhood. Denver area is really short on such food. The ambiance is good, clean, owners and help are friendly. Could use some music. My soltani was pretty good. Joojeh kabab was very nice. The ghormeh sabzi was with beef. That is just wrong. It must be lamb shank. I hope they change that part.
Also, need some more spices in appetizers: feta cheese with lavash and radish, more saffron in rice, etc.
I am not complaining, just hoping

Wonderful food. Of course it's higher prices but your at a fancier restaurant which is very hard to make its time consuming and the spices are very expensive with Persian food. The chicken bath is my fave and yogurt. Have to end it with a cup
Of chai. Only thing is service is slow but they get five stars cause the taste of food makes up for it
Amazing! I had the Gheimeh Cibzamini - just incredible. Wonderful service, excellent music, and a very clean establishment throughout.

Service was horrible. The server a young man was not very accommodating nor concerned with me or my friend. She is a vegetarian so she got an appetizer which has flat bread, cheese, walnuts, and a salad mix, I cant remember the name but we did not enjoy the plate at all and did not eat it. The salad was just too strong for our taste. When we told the server he asked if he could try the salad which we said ok to and then he just said sorry you didn't like it. I got the koobideh (spelling) and ground chicken kabob plate and it was amazing and pricing was also right at only $14 for a huge plate. Our experience was saved thanks to the owner whom came over and checked up on us and told the waiter to remove the appetizer from our bill. The restaurant itself is very pretty and clean and if I am ever back in the area I would return
We had a terrific time, food was great.  Saeide is a terrific waiter, we will be back.  Thank you

Whoa! This place is legit! I'm a bit of a koobideh fanatic and Surena didn't disappoint! I got the  koobideh kabob lunch special. I would have posted a picture but I dove right in! The meal started with a spinach soup that was uh-mazing. It was creamy and rich and an incredibly beautiful emerald green. The koobideh arrived on a huge bed of basmati rice with a pat of optional butter. (I'm kind of a rice addict as well.) and grilled  peppers and tomatoes. Perfectly seasoned (IMHO) and juicy. Its one of those dishes I'll be thinking about for weeks.

The meal ended with a delightful, aromatic tea. Already thinking about my next visit!

Beautiful dining room that is clean, modern and bright. I've been eating Middle Eastern food for 20+ years, but don't know all the subtleties of Persian food. However, the preparation and spices seemed on point to me. Lunch prices were very reasonable and portions are quite large. Looking forward to a return for dinner.
The setup is very elegant and classy, food is good, served fairly quickly, not too many options to choose from. The portion is as big as compared to the price.

The food is really good! It took awhile to get it but it was definitely worth the wait. They a wide variety of Persian dishes. I was surprised that they don't have Fasanjoon, I asked them and they said they will probably add it to the menu.  

The people who work there were really friendly and welcoming. I'm definitely going back there again!

Perfection! Everything tastes great. I had ghormeh-sabzi with tahdig which was amazing. My husband had the Surena kabob, the meat was so tender and yummy. And best of all, the prices are so reasonable. I would say Surena is a hidden gem. You should try it!

Great food, great service! Definitely the best Persian food in Denver. If you have never tried Persian food, this is the place to start. We usually eat here once a month. The staff always makes you feel like family. The Beef Barg and Cornish Hen kabob are two staples.

Brought my half-Persian wife here on a date night and it made her heart so happy. I think she shoulder-danced through the entire meal. 
Authentic and truly a treat for the palate .

Thank you Mehron for the wonderful experience.

Atmosphere:  When you walk into the restaurant it is beautifully appointed.  They did a great job remodeling it into a Modern Sanctuary.  It was a very serene and soothing feeling decor.  I wish that things had continued with that first impression.

Friendliness:  So, we got off to a bit of a bumpy start at Surena.  When we walked in the Hostess was going to seat us in the middle.  I have a problem having my back exposed, something that I feel Zoroastrians originally from Iran might have an understanding of, but hey, whatever. We asked if we could sit in a booth.  Everywhere else the request is graciously accommodated, NOT at Surena.  She informed us that none were available and that it would be a while.  We asked to wait and she tried to push us to a table in the middle again.  She had a bit of an attitude problem and that doesn't mix well with first impressions. She then offered us seats on the Patio or in a Private Room.  I was fine with Patio seating.  She then told us there wasn't any Patio seating available. Then WHY Offer it?  By this time I was really irritated and ready to leave, but my husband assured me that the food was good. Then one of the Half Circle booths opened up and we asked to sit there.  She then told us that was seating for five even though we could clearly see that the other two Half Circle booths were occupied with a family of FOUR and a group of FOUR men respectively. It was really disappointing, because I was so excited to try this place.  It just looked Legit and Authentic.  When my husband and I lived in the DC and San Diego areas, we got the BEST Persian food and to date we haven't found a place that even remotely compares in the Denver area.  Finally she begrudgingly prepared the Half Circle booth and we were seated.  

After we were seated her attitude seemed changed a little, but I observed her complaining to another wait person about us-well to be fair, probably just me as she was eyeballing and gesturing in my general direction.  Again, I was just ready to leave.  

Overall NOT a good first impression of the 'Persian Friendliness' that they tout themselves with on their website.   When the subject of Surena comes up again with my husband, I will most likely steer him across the street to Sahara where the food is superiorly delicious and the service is friendly and welcoming.  It's not the same, it's not Persian Cuisine, It's Moroccan, but they have fabulous Lamb Shanks and Eggplant Dishes.  And their Pita and Hummus is Very Very good. Or maybe I will steer him back to Ariana Kabob, an Afghani Restaurant that we enjoy.  Good Food.  Very nice people.  

The Food:

Appetizers:  

Mast O Moosir: This is a Thick Yogurt with Shallots. We enjoy it and this was an average good, but could have been a bit more flavorful.  We also had the Kashk Bademjan, a Roasted Eggplant Dish.  This was my favorite of the two appetizers.  The Eggplant has a very smoky flavor and paired very nicely with the mint sauce and I am assuming Feta cheese and yogurt sauce.  The Lavash bread they were served with both is an un-levened flat bread, very thin, and fairly good when served warm.  We ordered more and the second round came out cold and it was clear that it is probably not made in house.

Main Courses:  

Vegetable Kabob:  Served with Basmati rice.  This is a nice mixture of Grilled Zucchini, Bell Peppers, Eggplant and Roasted Roma Tomatoes on the Side.  There was a nice Smokey Flavor to the Kabob Veggies and overall it was spiced very well, but had a little more char than normal.

Koobideh Combination:  Both the Beef and Chicken Koobideh were well seasoned, but a tad bit on the dry side. The rice was just rice and nothing special.  Served with Roasted Tomatoes.  I have to say Persian Style Roasted Tomatoes are one of my very favorite things.  

Mahicheh (Lamb Shanks):  These were supposed to be served with Potatoes and Carrots, but there were no Potatoes or Carrots.  That being said, the Lamb just fell off the bone and was very very tender, well seasoned and delicious served with Baghali Polo-Saffron Dill Rice and Fava Beans. The rice was a little on the dry side, but tasted good.

Dessert:  

Persian Ice Cream:  Very Good.  A llight, not overly sweet Pistachio Ice Cream with Rosewater and Saffron.  I love the Eastern and Middle Eastern ways of combining Saffron and Rose Water!  YUMM!  TRY IT!!!  Very Reminiscent of the Kulfi we got at Ghokul Chat in Hyderabad, Telengana, India, but not nearly as heavy.

Zoolbia and Bamieh:  This was very nice especially paired with the Persian Ice Cream, the Fried Dough pieces were kind of like a short Churro sat on top of a Jalebi like deep fried sweet that was drenched in Honey.  

Get the Complimentary tea, It's a very nice smooth Black Tea with well rounded Tanins and is a nice complement to the Dessert. And I really liked their version of Doogh.  This was Dill based not Cumin Based.  I am accustomed to the Cumin Variety.  The Dill was a nice surprise.

This is by far the best Persian restaurant we have had in Denver. It is a beautifully decorated restaurant which serves fine Persian cuisine including tasty kabobs (both beef and chicken), signature stews such as Ghormeh Sabzi and Gheimeh, and a very nice vegetarian/vegan entree.

Portions are generous as there has yet to be a time that we didn't end up taking half of our food home. 

The wait staff is outstanding! They are attentive, kind and responsive.  Like any other restaurant, there are times that they get very busy and the food may take a little longer, but what sit-down restaurant doesn't?

I strongly recommend Surena to those who seek to try delectable, exotic and flavorful Persian cuisine.

Nice ambiance, very good food, affordable prices. The eggplant appetizer is to die for.
Kebab is tasty and it comes with delicious rice. Will be back!

Wow!!!!  Awesome food.  The servers were also just wonderful.  The bartender overheard me describing doogh  (sp) to my son and brought him a complimentary sample without us asking.  Our server, Shadi, was so sweet.  We had the crispy rice with two different stews on it as an appetizer and several kabobs, all wonderful.  My favorite was the marinated Cornish Hen.  I have not eaten in a Persian restaurant in 20 years.  I will be back soon!  Highly recommended.  Atmosphere is nice as well.

Delicious. Great ambience, good food, good selection of wine. What else do you want!
Check out the soultani!

All-around excellent! Per the suggestions of the helpful owner, my mom and I were able to share several delicious dishes! I highly recommend their eggplant dip appetizers, the Cornish game hen kabob, and whatever stew they may be offering. The most important thing to know is to get the Persian ice cream for dessert! It is sublime. 

The interior of the restaurant is beautiful and the service is extraordinarily attentive and friendly. I look forward to coming back!

Made the drive down from Fort Collins, CO & had a great experience! Beautiful restaurant, serving staff was delightful. I arrived during Norouz and the haft seen set up was awesome. My husband & I really enjoyed the food. We will be back again!

It's been a long time since Denver has had a Persian restaurant of this high caliber!! Beautiful, classy, and authentic. Could go here for a formal dinner or dressed casually if you desire. They have wonderful kebabs of all kinds, i had the jujeh kabab and my husband had soltani. Delicious and well presented! My kids live the kobideh and the lamb shank is out of this world! Look no further for a great persian evening! Only criticism is they need to have a better system of keeping track of "who ordered what" so when the party is over 6 people they can serve efficiently! For goodness sake make a seating chart or something!!!  i love you Surena!!

Don't be fooled by the outside of this building, things aren't always as they seem. The restaurant is located by a liquor store in a tiny strip mall but inside the restaurant has an elegant and chic ambiance to it. Great for our date night.

Service was very knowledgable and friendly. Not as familiar with Persian food, our server helped explain and recommended a few dishes. Everything we tried was delicious, flavorful and aromatic. Would highly mind recommend the lamb shank and the stew! And don't forget to try their baklava. 

Will definitely be back again soon!
Excellent kebabs, excellent appetizers. I highly recommend this place! Wonderful food, great service, nice ambiance.

Great service at lunch time boarding on a little too attentive. I got the beef tongue sandwich with the barley soup. Soup was phenomenal but the sandwich was okay. The beef tongue was good with subtle flavors that went well with the flat bread as an open-faced sandwich. However the salad that came with it was as basic as basic could be: iceberg lettuce with thousand island dressing poured over it. With a more interesting salad, the meal would have been prefect. Persian ice cream was a great end to the meal though.

Overall the food was DELICIOUS. But unfortunately we arrived at 8:55 (35min until closing) and we were forced to order to go. Due to a private party that was coming after hours. Instead of allowing us to wait inside for our food to be ready, we were told to wait outside of the restaurant on the patio.

Amazing!! I am so glad that there is a fine dinning Persian restaurant in Denver! I am a chef and I grew up with Iranian food! I love this place, decor, food and service!  Great job, keep it up and people let's sport local family businesses!
Hands down, top notch everything! I went there 3 times in one week. Not your ordinary Persian Restaurant!

I grew up eating authentic Persian food and this place did not disappoint. We started off with the Tah-Dig (crispy Rice with stew on top), which was absolutely delicious! Then I ordered the chicken kabob, which came with saffron basmati rice, excellent.  Our server was really nice and attentive.  Will definitely be back!!
A very good Persian restaurant. The kabab is great. Lunch special and daily stew is my favorite

Every dish we chose here was one of the best ( tah dig, gheymeh, kobideh and barg) we have ever had. Although all dishes were really delicious, The best one was Barg kabob! The place is really clean, modern and beautiful. The service was excellent.

Great Persian food, the server wasn't Persian but had an understanding of the food. She even spoke a bit of Persian. The Kabob was tender and the Khoresh was delicious. The tadig was a bit soft but delicious enough that we ate everything. The atmosphere is really nice but not stuffy. Americans and Persians there, but when Persians go to a Persian restaurant it is usually good. We are from St. Louis, but when in the area will eat there again.

The best place to enjoy Iranian foods! I have tried several Iranian restaurants in LA, Tennessee, Chicago, but non of them is as good as this one!
Big and beautiful place with lovely foods! Try it

This place is so good! I got kabobs and their Friday Chef Stew for my wife and I and the food was filled with lemony,  umami goodness.  The kabob was ground beef and steak served with fresh onions, tomatoes and jalapeños. I recommended the saffron rice. Don't be put off by the sparse decor as they make up for it in great customer service and delicious entrees. Portions are large enough for two meals and who doesn't love leftovers?
Nice atmosphere, awesome food at affordable prices.

I've heard about this place when I was shopping at Arash, the best Middle East supermarket in Denver. The owners of Arash own this place too.

I've eaten there times now and the food is excellent. The restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere and the service is very good.  I like the kabobs the best.

Amazing food! Never had Persian food before so I sent my Persian friends there to verify since I told them it's amazing! They agreed some amazing food here, very welcoming staff and great ambience. Please check them out you won't regret it.

Great Persian place.  I lived in Los Angeles for 6 years in a Persian neighborhood so I am happy to get this.  This place is great and they are very friendly.  Everything I tried (been there 3 times now) has been really good.

I am a transplant to Denver.  In LA and Orange County we have so many places that serve Persian food.  It is really great to see a nice Persian restaurant in the area.  This place is clean and sophisticated.  The food is exactly what it should be.  Seasoned well and cooked to perfection.  I am happy we found this place.  Can't wait to come back.
Excellent food and great, knowledgable staff. Loved it! Finally Denver opens a good Persian restaurant!

Amazing food and service. Best Authentic Persian cuisine in a very nice atmosphere . The service was five star as was the food. I highly recommend this restaurant. Ask for Maryam she is the best server .
Excellent Persian food. Wish there was a location further up north. Love the atmosphere. A big improvement over Shiraz, which was great as well.

Finally, an awesome Persian restaurant in Denver. Been here twice since it opened a few weeks ago, and both experiences were great. 

Had the beef soltani the first time. Kubideh was great but the barg/fillet was exceptional. Had joojeh kabob the second time and it was also incredible. 

Also recommend the Persian ice cream here. 

The atmosphere is classy and elegant, the service without faults. 

I look forward to returning and trying the various khoresht/stews they have as well.

We are Persian and familiar with the food. We loved the Soltani and Koobideh kabobs and they were delicious. The kashke-bademjoon appetizer was not that great. But the kabob made up for it. The yogurt and the stews are great too.

Yummy yummy in my tummy! Our Iraqi friends brought us to this place for dinner and sure enough this was another win for Denver. The beef kabob was tender and spicy and all our appetizers and salads were might tasty. The owners and staff were incredibly accommodating and friendly. Would absolutely recommend this place. Top spot for Persian in Denver.

Surena is one of the best Persian restaurant we ever had in Colorado. It's beautiful positive place with lots of good people and great food. Their kabob is very fresh and delicious. I definitely recommend it to every one. I been there so many times and I will go again. Thanks for awesome Persian restaurant.

My fiance and I were going to Shiraz once a month before they closed for remodeling. We've been waiting for them to reopen for like six months so we finally drove by to see if they had made any progress. Amazed to find a sign saying to try their new restaurant three doors down. We were amazed to see how gorgeous the new place looks. The food is great but we mid the saffron chicken. I'm sure we'll be able to find something just as good. Everybody should go at least once. I can guarantee will be going back several times in the next few weeks.
Stopped for lunch  while on vacation in Denver. The food was very good and we really enjoyed the complimentary hot tea.
I tried Surena with a group of Persian friends.  It was a true authentic Persian restaurant. Kebabs were cooked really good. The meet was really tender and juicy

Wonderful Persian food! We've been kinda disappointed with the Persian options since moving to Denver, but this place has made up for that. Wish they offered more than one stew option per day, but the gormeh sabzi was delicious and the beef kabobs were perfectly cooked. We'll be back for sure!
One of the best places to eat. The service is great and the food was perfect. I will come back when ever I can.
Love that there are so many great ethnic places opening up in Denver. Loved this restaurand and cant wait to go back. .

Oh, yes. This is what I love about Yelp, amazing little gems like Surena. The restaurant is clean and elegant,  the staff are gracious and helpful. And the food, the food is so flavorful, without being heavy. It's an experience and I can't wait to bring my sisters here.

I am of Persian descent and this food is very authentic. The hot tea is served with sugar cubes on the side, something I have not seen another restaurant every do.  The kabob was amazing, served with grilled tomatoes and great rice.  The waitress Shadi was one of the best servers I have had in Colorado.  If you want authentic Persian food, this is by far the best place.

There are few times when you taste a new cuisine and you are forever spoiled. Yes, Surena is that good!  As you walk in it becomes apparent that the owners know the meaning of hospitality. You feel welcomed even embraced. It is beautifully decorated, offers great service and has a staff who genuinely thank you for coming back to their restaurant. Now let's talk about the food. Delicious and yummy can not adequately describe their food. I finish eating there and I can't wait until I'm back again. The food makes you want to sing. Yes, it's that good. I ate the beef tongue which was so tender that it cuts easily with your fork. The tarragon sauce is light yet full of flavor. We ordered the zesty vegetables as a side and the yogurt with cucumbers. I don't know how their yogurt is so creamy but you just want more. We've also tasted the marinated Cornish Hens, Braised Beef as well as their Lamb all outstanding! Each dish full of flavor and spot on with their spicing. You cannot miss this gem. If you live in the metro Denver area drive south you won't regret it. If you live in Castlerock or even Colorado Springs drive north you'll thank me.
Delicious jooje and soltani...I haven't had this good of kabob since I lived on the east coast.

The only authentic Persian food in Colorado
Soltani was perfect! Moosir and esfenaj just like we always had in Iran

Definitely the best Persian food you will find in Denver, if not far beyond. It is clear they are using top quality ingredients and have a great chef(s) in the kitchen. My mother's Persian cooking has always been the very high bar that is my standard for comparison when having dinner at other Persians' homes and restaurants. Usually they don't stand a chance but this place is absolutely on par the couple times I've eaten there. And the staff/management are very gracious and nice. Another bonus is the classy, modern decor. It nods to the culture through a few well chosen pieces while the white linens and neutral palette keep it elegant like any high star restaurant. Great place! Being new to Denver I'm super happy to have found it.

We stopped by in this persian restaurant on our way to Vail and it was a sweet surprise. Kabobs were excellent! and every one in our 20 people group were satisfied with the taste of the food, cleanness and looks of of the place . Our waitress Afagh was fabulous. She was knowledgeable, very polite and friendly.  We loved this place so much that we stopped by the 2nd time back to airport at the end of our vacation!

Authentic wonderful Persian food. Beautiful atmosphere. Great attentive and gracious staff. If you are not familiar with Persian food ask the staff for suggestions and enjoy. The appetizers are delicious get several and share. We have both of the yogurts and eggplant as well as sabzi all wonderful. Table ordered a wide variety of entrees including lamb, beef and chicken all perfect. We have been here twice since they have opened two weeks ago. Both times excellent. 

Update 3/25/16:  Been back several times every time service and food is excellent. Manager and staff are some of the most gracious and attentive I have seen. They truly care that your experience is optimal and that you love your food. Planning my husband's family birthday party here in a few weeks can't wait. Restaurant is just simply wonderful.

First time I went there, the food was decent enough for me to frequent there and the older couple at the bar were very nice. 

Second time I went, was a mess. First of all, they were out of Ghormeh Sabzi on a Friday at 6:30pm. So I was forced to choose something else. I chose the Soltani Kabob. Our food took forever to come and when it did, my barg was some cheap sirloin looking thing or some lamb. This is 2016. If the type of meat isn't specified, Soltani is suppose to be a skewer of filet mignon and a skewer of koobideh when you charge $8 more than your Koobideh Kabob and $5 more than your Barg Kabob and $7 more than your Chicken Barg (well at least at high end Persian restaurants I've been to in other states and in Iran). 

It wasn't a big deal till what seemed like the owner came and insulted me in farsi. I speak and understand farsi, I guess he didn't know that. 

And how deceiving is it to describe what type of meat you use in every dish in detail except for the Barg Kabob and Soltani Kabob. If your soltani isn't filet mignon and koobideh, then how do you justify a $5 more price increase then your Barg Kabob and $8 more than your Koobideh Kabob? If it's one Koobideh Kabob and one Barg Kabob from your menu, then pice averages out to $15.5, not $22. And I'm pretty sure the 'King's favorite' would be filet mignon. Barg can be chicken, lamb, or beef. But when you charge $5 more than your other barg entree, it must be filet mignon unless you're tying to scam people. Maybe you should specify on your menu what type of fillet it is. You specify everywhere else in great detail what type of meat is used. And don't charge $17 for 2 skewers of barg, and $14 for 2 skewers of koobideh and then $22 for 1 skewer of barg (which is not filet mignon) and 1 skewer of koobideh. If you don't want to make it filet mignon, drop the price to $15.5 ($7 for a koobideh and $8.50 for a barg, according to your menu). Don't try to scam people and then insult them when you give them sub-par meat. I really don't care about the price at all. But it's obvious when you aren't transparent on the meat you use in the barg and soltani, but you are extremely transparent in the meat you use in every single other dish (you even state chicken thigh, cornish hen, chicken breast, ground boneless chicken breast... sirloin beef, ground sirloin beef, chunks of beef) that you are apparently being deceitful. Sorry I know quality meat and quality food. 

Thanks for insulting me and for average Persian food instead of 'Persian hospitality' being your 'promises to' me and 'quality food and a great atmosphere'.

We entered into a nice clean modern decor with high expectations but then it started.  I don't enjoy writing reviews like this but it is all true.  I can't remember ever hearing the phrase "I'm sorry" so many times during one restaurant meal.  When we arrived at 4:00 the lone waitress was with one of the 2 occupied tables and said from across the room "I'm sorry I will be right with you".  After a few minutes we were seated at a table with plate glass covering the tablecloth (cheesy) and asked if we would like something to drink.  Yes please, 2 arak with water and ice.  "I'm sorry we are out of arak".  Can we see the wine list?  Sure, we have pinot grigio, chardonnay, pinot noir and cabernet sauvignon. OK, we'll have a bottle of pinot noir and some mirza ghasemi and panir sabzi.  "i'm sorry we are out of fresh herbs for the panir.  OK, We'll have the lamb kabobs medium rare.  "I'm sorry, we are out of lamb kabobs but we have some lamb chops".  OK, we'll have the lamb chops medium rare with zereshk polo.   The wine delivered was Barefoot pinot noir ($6 retail), the bland mirza ghasemi came with a nice paper thin lavash.  After a while our waitress came to the table and said (you guessed it) "i'm sorry the lamb is taking so long but that is because the chops are bone in".  That makes me chuckle just thinking about it.  Just then another couple came in and she said "I'm sorry I will be right with you we are having a rush right now".  All 4 tables.  When the lamb arrived it was a generous portion of medium well chops and a huge mound of bland rice with a skimpy addition of zereshk.  The charred tomato and peppers were delicious.  When she came back to check on us I mentioned that it was an interesting version of medium rare but we would take the leftovers with us.  After cooking professionally for over 20 years and seeing the movie Waiting  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SmzGaSQYznA   
I am reluctant to send food back for a replacement especially when the kitchen is in the middle of a big rush.  The manager came over and agreed they were overdone and brought us a take out container of maast-o khiyar as a consolation prize.  On to desert.  We ordered Persian ice cream, zoolbia barmieh and some Arabic coffee.  "I'm sorry we don't make Arabic coffee".  The ice cream was the best thing we ate there however if you plan to have it order it with your entree because it was so hard it must have been dipped in liquid nitrogen bowl and all.  The fried pastries were room temperature and the syrup had little flavoring.  When the bill came I noticed the wine was billed as chardonnay for $25.  I thought that was a bit steep for such a cheap wine.  "I'm sorry, the pinot noir is not in our system yet". The price was reduced to $20 (still a rip off).  This place has a lot of potential but you can't do business from an empty cart.

Sorry we went.

Great service! Waitress was very kind and gave great descriptions of the various items and recommendations. The ambiance is very nice and they even have a few spots on their patio. Lastly, the best part was the amazing food! Tried three different items lamb shank, Cornish hen, and an appetizer and all tasted fabulous. Strongly recommend.
Excellent service!  Decor is very classy and warm.  Main course was amazing, didn't care for the crispy rice appetizer with Stew.  Our server was very attentive.  We will be back!!!

We have been In Surena four times altogether since they have opened. We love the atmosphere, ambiance, service and of course the food. The restaurant is very clean and is kept very clean. Food is delicious and their attentiveness to customers are first class. I have been waiting for a restaurant like this to open in Denver for a long time. We were recently invited to a reception/graduation party at Surena. There were over a hundred guests and they planned for the whole event really gracefully. Food, service, their open bar and music were all great.

How refreshing it is to have a Persian restaurant in this part of town. The decor is nice and inviting and the service was warm and friendly. We had the eggplant and yogurt dishes as appetizers and they were both delicious. You could tell that everything was very fresh just by looking at it. I also had the veggie kebbob with saffron rice. It was very good. My only comment is that I hope that the owner will include vegetarian and seafood dishes on the lunch special. Currently only meat dishes are discounted.

column4: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
column13: Went to Surena for the first time last week, and left with a huge smile on my face and a happy tummy! The decor is elegant and tasteful, the service was prompt and friendly, and the food was AMAZING. I recommend the kabobs- yummy and huge portions.I will be returning here as soon as possible!

This is the best Persian restaurant in Denver, impeccable food and service. In such a pleasant atmosphere, the Soltani presented in voluminous trays with plenty of rice and tomato, and the Ghormeh Sabsi are my favorite fares. There are generous portions served, and I cannot finish the meal; I have to take a substantial amount home. Rima S.

FINALY!! A delicious authentic Persian restaurant in the Denver Metro that you look forward to taking your friends to. Beautiful setting, great ambiance and excellent service enhance the DELICIOUS food!!   The Sultani was juicy and tender!
Finally a good Persian restaurant in Colorado. This place has great food & great service.

Amazing food,amazing staff, classy atmosphere. All around great time I had a beef soltani and the kubideh that was great and the barg even better.  Good work! We will be back to try the chicken and the stews.

Finally, us Iranians in Colorado have a restaurant we can be proud to take our co-workers and friends to. It is authentic Persian cuisine just minutes away from DTC. The atmosphere is gorgeous, and the staff is friendly and helpful. It is the best Persian cuisine that Colorado has ever seen. Impeccably delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to absolutely anybody. 5 stars are not enough to show how good this place really is. Kabobs were cooked perfectly, and came out in a timely fashion.

Finally a place to try authentic Persian food that are prepared with love and passion. Cozy yet chic environment just adds to the perfection of the food and makes the experience just unforgettable. We went there twice and every time we left happy , pleased with a hope of going back there soon. Tried the soltani and it was divine! ! The ground beef kabob was prepared to perfection , juicy and yummy . The barg which is tender pieces of filet minions cut and grilled to melt in your mouth with basmati rice just heaven. Cannot wait to go back. You feel that you are at your friendly eighborhood restaurant with excellent services !! All smile and just amazing food. You will feel welcomed and at home.

Yelpers thanks for turning me onto this place!! I was down in Denver for an appointment that got delayed and needed to kill an hour (and eat lunch). Found this place via Yelp and it made my week! The ambiance is unassuming and if you blink you'll drive right past it. However, the food is INCREDIBLE. I ordered the Pablo with jalapeños. Bread was perfection...toasty and light. The combo of flavors was a nice balance of salty and sweet. Can't wait to actually come back here on purpose. Oh and don't miss the cucumber lemonade!

Ps- free parking in the back!

Thank you, again, Yelpers!  If you hadn't raved about Torta Grill, I would never know about this gem. My first visit was in November, 2015 for lunch.  Even though I live 45 minutes away, I returned with my husband that night for dinner and ordered the exact same thing.  It's the only thing I've ever ordered and I don't expect that to change.  When you've had THE YUMMIEST SANDWICH EVER, who needs to experiment?

The Carlito is cooked when you order it.  Served on a fresh torta roll with tender and perfectly-seasoned carnitas.  My husband and I always split one large sandwich.  Half is just right for me when I'm famished.  

I've visited 5-10 times and Omar (Omer?) is always at the register, friendly and smiling.  He lets me practice my Spanish with endless patience.

This is also the best Yelp check-in perk I've ever had...their cucumber lemonade defines the word "refreshing".

Stopped here for lunch, based solely off Yelp reviews - didn't disappoint! The place is tiny inside (might not even be a bathroom for customer?). Sandwiches are so delicious and insanely filling! My husband had chicken, cheese, chorizo and egg (Hector?); I had the pork loin, ham, pineapple, cheese (Pablo?). Both of us had the avocado Serrano sauce. Yum! The bread is both crisp and soft; almost made it hard to eat but totally worth the mess. Stuffed to capacity with cheesy goodness. All sandwiches also include tomato, avocado, refried beans and onion (unless you request otherwise). Cucumber lemonade was super refreshing (and huge!).

Added the extra star in - my husband is still raving about this place a day later!

Oh. My. Goodness. Let me start this review by letting you know I'm from Tucson, AZ where there are plenty and plenty of tortas. We stopped by after seeing the great reviews on Yelp. We weren't staying too far so we decided to give it a try. If you've read any of my reviews, you'd know any place that offers half-sized or "mini" entrees is a winner in my book! Well the tortas are HUGE so of course I went with the mini (half of the regular size for almost half of the price). I had the "Pedro" and my bf had the "Raul". Both came with the "breaded steak" aka milanesa. They were amazing, and perfectly prepared! The tortas were filled with so much meat, they sure don't skimp ya here, and topped with avocado and your choice of sauce. We're already planning another trip back to Denver and Torta Grill will be one of our first stops.

This was my first time to Torta Grill. I went there on a Friday evening and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the Miguel which was steak and eggs, it came with re fried beans, avacado, cheese, tomato and onions. It was absolutely marvelous. It was cheesy steak goodness that made me full with the first bite! The sand which was definitely huge! I couldn't eat the entire thing! Also there was so much meat in it, I could not believe it! If you've never tried torta, try this place! It's the bomb!!

I am gluten sensitive so I don't know about their tortas. I love their tamales though. Especially the green chile and cheese...I don't like spicy food and I love their tamales. I usually get 10 at a time and eat them for the rest of the week. Highly recommend.
Yea this place is legit!  I grew up in the boarder and this place is very authentic. Will definitely be coming back when I'm in town.

Delicious! The Pablo and Carlito are the way to go!

When you walk into the store, a quaint and charming ambiance feels the air. It feels real and authentic as they have described in their name! Definitely one of the better torta serving latin restaurants in Denver! The chefs are hospitable and friendly! 

Parking is available in the back if you can't find a meter.

PS: The Pablo is especially good for Hawaiian Pizza lovers!

The Carlito Torta was amazing. The spice that is cooked with the meat is delicious. 

This is a perfect Torta and I recommend everyone to try this place. First time here and plan to come back.

Parking is a pain on Colfax but they do have free parking in the back via the ally. Not the best Tortas in Denver. The place is a small hole in the wall but clean. Food is not expensive and you get a big bang for the buck. I had a steak torta, the meat was really tough and over all I was disappointed with the quality. Maybe they were having an off day on Monday when I was there. Will give them another shot.
This is my 2nd time is and it's the same- super great service-fast service- torta is huge and packed full! Tamale is also great if you like tamales!

First visit - home run. So tasty! Tiny little joint off Colfax, totally worth coming by for a delish Mexican sandwich.  A much better choice than the "usual" fast-casual. I had the Pablo mini. I'm too gringo for the chipotle sauce, so next time I'd choose a different one, but if you can take the heat, it's great. My son ordered the Ivan. Both were fantastic and gone in minutes. :-)

Staff was friendly and welcoming! Reasonably priced too! Highly recommend!

For the torta fan (so sane human beings), Torta Grill is awesome. Straight-up tortas with some fairly creative insides, not just the classics. I am a huge fan of the "Enrique," made with nopales, panela cheese, and crushed red peppers. Mmm... Everything is right on at this dive.

Mexican Sandwiches found here at Torta Grill. There is a small little lot (free parking) right behind this tiny eatery in the back in case you do not find parking (metered) on the street (free after 6 pm). 

My husband and I came by here last Thursday (9-17) for a late dinner. Around 8:15 pm, we saw a few patrons eating at the little counter and employees cooking up some meat and vegetables on their stove top griddle. After browsing the menu, we decided upon:

By the way, I just want to mention that each torta comes spread with mayonnaise, beans, avocado slices, tomato slices and grilled onions. You can also choose between your choice of the following to add to your sandwich: jalapeno pepper, chipotle sauce, avocado serrano sauce and jalapeno jelly. 

Miguel Torta, $7.75 prior to tax- My husband decided to order this torta which comes with steak, egg and cheese. This torta came already cut in half and was more than enough for one person to eat and feel satisfied. The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The creaminess of the mayo and avocado really went well with everything that is stuffed in this large sandwich, making each bite better than the last. 

Enrique Torta, $7.75 prior to tax- I opted for a vegetarian torta (I know that isn't traditional, but I am fan of vegetarian food options and believe me, I did not feel like I was missing meat) that comes with egg, cactus, queso panela cheese, crushed red peppers and another type of cheese. This sandwich was really good. Just like the Miguel, this sandwich was also cut in half. I only had half of my sandwich and saved the other half to be consumed 2 days later (which still tasted really good). I liked the red peppers and cactus, as it gave it a really nice added flavor and texture. The avocado, mayo and smashed beans really complemented all of the ingredients. 

------------------------
(Total= $16.74 including tax, prior to tip)

With Yelp Check In, you get a free cucumber lemonade. I thought it was okay, but felt it needed to be sweeter. But my husband liked it and found it to be refreshing. 

Wait time for our sandwiches was not that long. Seating is quite limited here, probably can fit about 10 people. But just be aware that there is no public restrooms. 

So if you are looking for something really filling to eat for lunch or dinner, then Torta Grill should fit the bill. Food is pretty affordable and is really good (messy, but good).

Would definitely order food from here again if I was ever in Denver again.

So tasty!!! I am gonna dream about this place forever!! I can't remember the name but I moaned all the way thru eating it... uhm :) I loved the hotsauce and avacado, the bread was perfect and tasty meat. I can't wait to visit Denver again!

The Chorizo torta, made how the staff recommended (w/everything which is typically not how I do it), was wonderful!  Each ingredient, from the scooped out avocado to the juicy meat, to the bread, was soooo flavorful.  I can't wait to return!  Do I try something else or stick with perfection?  -and if you've been to Zacatecas, take it and discuss it with them.
Man, what a torta. Delicious ingredients and high quality meat as well. It's actually quite hard IMHO to find a good torta in Colorado. I will for sure be back! ;)

Who knew you could find great Mexico City style tortas in the mile high city! Whats a torta? Its an amazing Mexican sandwich prepared on an oversize "dream" roll, stuffed with your choice of meat (pork carnitas, carne asada, chorizo, etc), and finished off with refried beans, avocados, tomatoes, and jalapenos. For those "doubters" out there, put down the grocery store prepackaged deli sandwich and drive over to Torta Grill. Your taste buds will thank you for it. This is hands down the best torta in town, and so close to downtown!

My favorite torta: The Juan or the Carlito.

Unique sandwiches well worth the price.  I'm a huge fan of their vegetarian Torta as the cactus is a different flavor than anything I'm usually used to.  A great hole in the wall find that anyone can enjoy.  Get two mini sandwiches if you want to try more things!
Great authentic Mexican tortas, you really can't go wrong with any sandwich. You can get any sandwich in a burrito for those days when the bread is too much!

Just found this place although it's only been a few blocks from my office for 3 years now. 

And WOW. I've been missing out. I want to live here. Inside a torta. Because they're that amazing. 

It's the type of place that you know will learn your name and know your order by heart. I want that.

I am so torn by my review of Torta Grill. A friend (a GI doc, actually, which will be funny later) recommended it to me. So while hubs and I were waiting for a show at the Ogden, we ran up here to try it out. 

He had the Carlito, and it was as good as promised. I'm not a vegetarian, but also not a huge meat eater, so I went with the Enrique with chipotle sauce, which had such interesting toppings as catcus and and egg. It was DELICIOUS! Seriously the best meal I'd had all month (and that's even comparing it to some $$$ restaurants). A little greasier than I would have wanted, but a delicious, and interesting blend of flavors. And thanks to the little gift from the Yelp! check-in coupon, we were able to try the Cucumber Lemonade for free. It was refreshing, but sweet, and really good. 

Why the three stars? Fast forward to me getting home at midnight after the show (dinner was at 8). My stomach started cramping up. I tried a pepto bismol (probably outdated, because I almost never have to take stuff like that). Didn't work. By 1AM, I was puking my guts out. I slept on my bathroom floor until 5AM. It was bad news bears from both ends. Hubs fared better than me, but his stomach was still upset as evidenced by the smells escaping from him. (Have you completely lost your appetite now?). I was the DD and didn't have anything to drink at the concert, so perhaps some beer helped partially disabled the germs in his stomach. 

But you guys...it was SO good! Just because someone didn't wash their hands after going to the bathroom, I paid for it all night. Even so, I'm going to trust these good reviews, and give them another shot some day. I'll be looking for their sanitation score the next time I come in though. Good hand hygiene is imperative!!
This is my regular neighborhood go to. They are quick and the food is always delicious. I've only had one torta that I didn't like and that was the one with the pineapples.
Best food and super awesome people to help you.  The fresh fruit juices are fantastic.  We love this place.
The torta was fine, but not great. I wouldn't come back here considering the number of better competitors in the Denver area.

I really wanted to like this place more than I did.  A place called torta grill, I expected to have at least a couple traditional tortas on the menu. Unfortunately,  they are all over the top combinations of tortas. I am sure for some people this is a fantastic menu with a twist on a torta, for me it was too much.

The staff is friendly and the tiny place has a cool atmosphere. I thought it was a tad pricey for a torta place but they do have more options of things to put on your torta and a cool selection of speciality tortas and combinations. Expect to wait a while. They make everything fresh (so it's pretty good once you get it) but it can take 15 minutes or so.

Skip it if you're looking for a basic torta but definitely hit this place up if you are up for being a little more adventurous with your torta and trying something new!

Tortalicious! I got a regular chicken torta with beans, mayo, avocado, onion, cheese & tomato. It was delicious & not too filling! My husband got the one with EVERYTHING on it & that sucker was a beast of a torta! He loved it & the horchata. I had sweet delicious pineapple juice =D
Another great experience. Brought my son in for a bite. He had a burrito and I had a torta with steak, egg and cheese. Made to order, fresh and delicious. Must give this place a try!

I love this little place.  Seating is very limited - but the tortas are excellent.  Great bread is one the keys.  I always get the Pedro and it never disappoints.  Friendly staff.  I have not yet tried the smoothies.  Maybe someday.

Mmmmm their food is SO good! I came on a hot Saturday around 2p and was the only customer in there.

They are a two-person show. One mans the cash register, the other cooks. Everything they made was fresh, greasy, and hot! I had a chicken sandwich with pineapple, BBQ sauce, and more. It was great!

The only negative to this place is the space itself. It's really small - there are high-top counter seats for 5-6 people and that's it. Because they cook right in front of you it is HOT in there. It's nothing fancy, but their food is great!
Awesome tamales! Try the cucumber lemonade. Great service, quick and easy. Definitely reccommend taking to-go.

Torta grill was great. Me and my cousin just came to Denver driving from Los Angeles to New Jersey. We look up torta on Yelp and decide to go. The sandwich was awesome. I had the hector and it was so filling but so good I couldn't not finish the thing. We were helped by who I assume is the manager or owner. He said his name but my memory isn't so fresh. Asked about our trip and asked for any specific things we wanted in our sandwiches. Totally accommodated for us and made us feel welcomed to the city. You should come here it's a great place

This place is amazing! I live in Texas and I make it a point visit the Torta Grill on each visit. 

The Ivan Torta is my go to. The bread is perfectly soft yet substantial. All of the toppings are top notch. 

The fruit drinks are excellent as well. They are super fresh and made upon being ordered. I've tried the watermelon and cucumber/lemonade. The watermelon drink is perfectly smooth and very refreshing. I can't wait to try others particularly pineapple and cantaloupe. 

Overall this place easily earns 5 stars. Highly recommend stopping in for lunch at the Torta Grill. Best Torta I've ever had.
So freakin' DELICIOUS! I'm back for "The Dembicki": steak, breaded steak, pork loin, and Serrano avocado spread PLUS an earth juice. A veritable taste bud orgy! I'm going down....

Pretty darn good place.  They have some great tortas, full of flavor, and pretty unique.

Less complex, more traditional tortas would be great, as Ashley H. mentioned.

Wow. I think these are the best carnitas I've ever had. I had the Carlito with the avocado Serrano sauce. Carnitas are super flavorful and crispy and bread is light and fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside. Can't wait to come back! I'm bet everything on the menu is great, but I'm not sure I'll ever be able to order anything other than the Carlito because this torta is divine!!!

what I love about this place is that there is a concentrated effort to introduce gueros like me to some of the awesome Mexican traditions that are missing from far too many Mexican places. Milanesa, Al Pastor, Horchata, Fruta con Chile are all things that more gringos ought to be exposed to. An why is it when I go to most mexican places all they have is coke, and maybe jarritos? the juice and lemonade here freshly made washes down the thick carnes very well.

the ingredients are great too, but special mention to the way they lightly fry the bread to perfection. really makes the sandwich. 

6 stars amigos! este gringo salio un poco mas gordo que antes

Stopped by while I was in town for work and wow o wow they had some bomb ass tortas! I had the Juan which has steak, pork loin, cheese and I topped it off with some avocado sereno sauce. It came hot off the grill and looked amazing! I waited for it to cool down as much as I could before I demolished that torta! Highly recommend!!

Took my daughter to grab a bite to eat after her softball game at East High School and found this gem on Yelp. It is the definition of "hole in the wall" and well worth the visit. We were greeted warmly and helped to understand what a torta actually was. The ingredients are fresh and delicious. The bread is something from out of this world! I guess they have it made for them from a panaderia in town. Well worth the visit, just be prepared to dine in a small hole in the wall.

I had a few minutes for lunch and was driving on Colfax so naturally Torta Grill came to mind as it's been on my want to try list for a while now. 

It is a little hard to find initially as it is tucked away in the corner. The store is small and exactly what I would want to find for authentic tortas. 

My choice for the day was the Enrique which is their veggie option. Cactus, cheese, re fried beans and avocado sandwiched between soft bread? Sign me up for more. I inhaled it. The flavors went so well together and I would definitely go back for more. 

I washed the whole thing down with a cucumber lemonade which even the small size was too big for me to finish. The only complaint was the drink was served in styrofoam which is an environmental nightmare.

Since moving to Colorado I have felt like Denver is a Mecca of sub par Mexican restaurants. All of them are cooking the same exact thing. So I was really excited to read all the wonderful reviews of Torta Grill. Hubs and I decided to have a very low key birthday dinner for him Saturday night. Turned out to be a little full still from our afternoon festivities that we skipped Torta and made plans to go Sunday during the Broncos game. Turns out they are closed on Sunday. Bummer. Okay let's get delivery for dinner on Monday after work! 

It's Monday, yeah we're excited for Torta! We both choose the hector, different sauces so we could split them. I go to place delivery online but I am wary because when I came back to look at the menu I noticed a review suggesting that they say they deliver but they really don't. So I was a little skeptical. I did some digging and realize they don't deliver past 5PM, but their website does allow you to order delivery after 5. So that's a poor customer experience. And it was hard to find the right times. We decided to just pick up the food, which was a painless easy experience. 

Fast forward, 20 hours later and my husband was sick all night and is still ill. I'm fine and we ate exactly the same thing. And btw the food was totally delicious. It was so good. I think so solid clean up and maybe proper temperature checking might be just what they need! I am always the one to get sick too so if my husband is sick, you know something is wrong. 

The sickness and confusion about time open and delivery on their website is why I'm giving them 3 stars. I will definitely try again though to see if anything changes.

This place is on point. If you're hungry and in the area, stop by here. If you're hungry and not in the area, stop by here. They open at 11:00 AM and you'll want to stop by as close to when they open as possible. There is limited seating. There's a counter that seats maybe 6-8 people and a few small tables. I was there with a group of six and we covered the entire counter.

They aren't a fast food joint so don't expect blazing speed but it is worth the wait. I tried the hector torta and it was pretty legit. Who doesn't like breakfast in a sandwich? Everything was cooked well. The sandwiches innards are plentiful so when you eat it, prepared for it to be a mess. Grab a fork and enjoy.

Yum!  We were hungry after spending the morning wandering around the Botanic Garden.  Very tasty carnitas with avocado sauce. My husband loved his Pedro Torta as well.   Prepared fresh and fast. Cucumber lemonade refreshing too!

Nice modern authentic Mexican restaurant. Little hole in the wall kind of place. The guys back there will whip you up a niceeeee meal! Great spices. I had the Enrique, first time trying cactus. Won't be my last! Going back there without a doubt!

I love a good Mexican torta and being back in Denver I decided to visit Torta Grill based on all the positive reviews.
I ordered the Juan Torta which is steak, pork and cheese. They had other sandwiches which had all kinds of stuff in it but I felt like something more simple. I also asked for the pickled jalapenos and chipotle sauce on the side which went extremely well. The sandwich came with lots of fixings such as guac, refried beans, tomatoes, onions and mayo which made for a very satisfying albeit messy sandwich. I wished the bread was toasted more so that it could hold up to all the sauce and condiments.
It was a bit of a wait for the torta even though I was the only one there, but it was worth it.

I also had the cucumber lemonade which was very tasty and refreshing. The small size was actually pretty big.

The place is really small and only had a handful of stools. Luckily it was a late lunch so it wasn't busy so had a seat right at the window which offers an entertaining view of the all characters on Colfax Street which is sketchy but fascinating -- there was a dumpster fire across the street with some kind of commotion by the transients hanging around by the bus stop. They all dispersed when the police and firemen arrived to put it out.

I would come back again!

Wow - this hole in the wall Mexican is fantastic place to grab a quick lunch.  The Pablo sandwich was sweet and tangy (couldn't figure out the ingredient) but was just right for a satisfying bite to eat.  Also ordered the tamale (nothing out of the ordinary) and a quesadilla (cheese, onion, avacado, chicken) was definitely not typical.  Their homemade red sauce (chipotle?) was amazing!  Definitely will be back to quench that spicy/tangy craving!

So I was in the neighborhood running errands and had some time to kill right at lunch time. It was fortuitous that Torta Grill happened to be right down the block!

Specializing in Mexican sandwiches (Tortas) they also serve tamales, fruit juices, and if you're in the mood, a whole coconut! All their sandwiches are by first names. My husband had the Jose: ham, chorizo, egg, and cheese. I ordered the Miguel: steak, egg, and cheese.  All tortas come with avocado, refried beans, tomatoes, onions, and mayo (unless you request otherwise). 

The tortas are rather large, I was starving and only ate half, my husband was happy to finish it though. They're also delicious, and so stuffed I was worried the bread would fall apart. It courageously held on, but I recommend getting a fork. 

Also, there was a Yelp coupon for a free cucumber lemonade with purchase of a torta. I'm glad I redeemed it, very refreshing!  As if I needed another reason to love Yelp.

The only seating is at a bar at the window or in front of the kitchen. We got there right before a lunch rush, food was out quickly and the staff is super friendly! Check them out when you're in the area!

The torta grill just remodeled and made a lot more room!  The place looks great and there is even a new logo.  
  I love the sandwiches here.  The Pedro is my usual pick with spicy hotdog and milanesa steak done with beans and avocado on a crispy torta roll.  Dang.  Oh and don't forget to try their chipotle salsa to spice up the sandwich.  I get that and some jalapenos just for character.
