The food here is great but the juices will keep you coming in often.  I like the cucumber lemonade, it will be on your favorite list this summer too I bet.  
The spot is privately owned and operated which just adds to my great experience here.

Since my last review apparently got flagged and removed by yelp, here's an abbreviated version:
Over the past 9+ months, every single time I have called to order delivery, they have told me they do not deliver. There is only one other review on yelp that I saw for Torta Grill that mentions this.
This past weekend I placed an order through Eat 24, thinking that if they had a listing with Eat 24, it must mean they started deliveries again. Nope! Eat 24 called me 45 minutes after I placed the order to tell me that Torta Grill wouldn't respond to their emails or phone calls, and they refunded me my money. I've got a refund on my bank statement to prove it.
Torta Grill, your food (in the few amount of times I actually ever received it) was delicious, but if you won't honor your delivery orders, stop telling everyone you offer delivery services.
One bad ass torta! I ordered online, it was ready when I got there. Took a few minutes to get the attention of the workers, but no biggie. As for the torta it was amazing, check it out!

I finally had my 1st real torta! While I don't have the ability to tell if it's authentic, it certainly is better than an (Americanized) Cuban Pressed Sandwich or the (Americanized) Panini! One thing I don't understand is why our favorite neighborhood Mexican restaurants don't usually offer this delicious sandwich. Does it really have to be a dedicated business?

I loved everything about my sandwich "The Hector" (Chicken, Eggs, Chorizo, Cheese), especially the eggs were scrambled just the way I prefer - with visible whites and yolks! I expected the bun to be tougher but it really wasn't, which was better that way. I swear the bread itself has flavors, mmmm!

"The Carlito" (Homemade Carnitas and Green Sauce, Cheese) was my boyfriend's pick and it's very tasty too, but sans the eggs, it felt less "juicy" and fragrant. I was so grateful it's not breaded steak because I'm not ready for that yet, maybe one of these days...

We also tried one of each of the tamales. The green one is definitely better than the red, as the latter was too dry. I've had better tamales elsewhere so I'm going to be skipping these next time around.

We've heard so much about Torta Grill's fruit juices and not surprisingly, the strawberry lives up to its praise (and it comes in a huge cup even for a "regular" size, can't imagine how big "big" is!). But don't expect fresh squeezed or pressed juices, they're pre-made and might've been diluted with water/ice, but still good and taste real.

The dudes that work there were all very nice and they're fast at cooking the food. One kid who speaks fluent English and was obviously in charge that day let us use the Yelp check-in special (one free Cucumber Lemonade) on top of redeeming a voucher. Now I don't have to come in just so I could use up my saved reward, I'll just come in because the food's so amazing!

One drawback is the place does smell like pee (!) but it's because of the back alley and you know what I mean. Don't let that stall you though, at least you get to enjoy free parking because of that back alley! I'm reluctant to even take off half a star for this great grub joint!

Best torta in town with awesome combinations of ingredients, all fresh and incredible.  I'm making my way through the menu and haven't come close to disappointment yet.  Plus the horchata is fresh made on site and worth every penny.

Best damn Torta ever!!!
I had the Pablo which came with ham, pineapple, pork loin, and cheese. The lady suggested I get it with the chipotle sauce which paired perfectly!!!
The gf ordered the Carlitos which came with fresh made carnitas and she got it with the jalapeños we traded 1/2 and 1/2 and both Tortas were spectacular!!!
We ck'd in on yelp and scored a free cucumber lemonade which was very tasty!
I would highly recommend this place!!!!
Love the care they put into making unique tortas! Fresh ingredients and great seasonings make this place our "go to" when hungry. Great staff and clean place!
I ordered the Mini Pedro and it was delish..! Would come back again next time I'm in town.

Finally decided to walk here on a snowy evening when my fridge was completely empty. I ordered the Carlito which is the original carnitas torta. The great thing about this place is that you watch them make your torta right in front of you. From grilling the bread to searing the steak it's all done in front of you. I got a side of the chipotle sauce, which was delicious, but I actually found that my sandwich didn't need it, it had great flavor, especially with the serrano avocados!

I used the check-in for the free cucumber lemonade, sadly...didn't love it. (But I rarely drink soft drinks/sugary drinks so it could just be me)

On the downside....don't be in a hurry here. It took over 15 minutes from the time I walked in until I got my to-go order. It was great to see my food made fresh, just not the speediest of places to go. Overall, a great torta for $8.
So so so good. Haven't had a sandwich I don't like yet. And the guys working in there are sooooo friendly. Will keep coming back! Make sure you grab a fresh squeezed juice too.

Wonderful, reasonably portioned Latin sandwiches at a price point that makes it worth a weekly stop.  I love this place, and I feel that it's hard to go wrong with Hispanic flavors and it's also hard to go wrong with sandwiches. These people nailed my wishes exactly.

The menu is easy to decipher and ordering is a snap. Sandwiches are made to order, so expect to wait 5-10 minutes for it. All sandwiches come with avocado, tomato, light mayo and onion. You also get the option to add spice if you want; I always get Serrano avocado sauce. My sandwich I believe is the Arturo - eggs, cheese, pork loin and ham.

If you want fast casual food that's actually worth the money, swing by Torta Grill. It'll definitely be worth your while.

Focusing on the sandwiches, i'm a big fan. 

Torta Grill is small. It is the kind of place that you are almost expected to take the food to go.  Think about a long counter with some bar stools and a few bar stools against the wall facing Colfax.  That is it.   No tables. . .the place is way to small for tables.

The food though, is awesome. . at least the Tortas. Don't expect a lot of sides (just potato chips). .but the sandwich will do you.  I've tried a few variations and everyone of them hits the spot.  Plus you can ask for some chipotle sauce to add to it on your own. . and that just nails the coffin shut

Both times I've gone they had/honored a yelp coupon for a free Cucumber lemonade (The perfect sweet/not to sweet match to the Tortas). . .and both times I asked for refills "normally not" then I note I want water. . and they just refill it. . .so . . maybe no refills?


If your coming from the Zoo or Denver Science musuem. . .and you don't mind the space constraints . . you can't go wrong here.

along with Camila's food truck, these are the best Tortas in Denver.  the bread is slightly griddled, but mostly soft, and fresh.  The Carlito is so amazing I am reluctant to try different ones.  Service is good.  I've turned friends on to this place as well.  The bread, many times, can make or break the Torta.  Torta Grill has their bread game on lock.

Cute little dive with excellent food and wonderful nonalcoholic drinks.  I had the cucumber lemonade and it was fantastic -- refreshing and not too sweet, full of pureed cucumber.  My companion had the horchata, a cinnamon-flavored rice drink, and it was also delicious.  Our tortas were also very good.
One of the best burritos in town. Staff is helpful for first time patrons. Burritos aren't authentic Mexican food but this place definitely add an authentic flare.
Definitely one of the tastiest tortas I've had! I recommend checking it out and fyi, there's parking behind it!

I'm not sure which came first here, the shop or the food truck associated, but regardless either is quite the treat. After having sampled the food truck at a local brewery we stopped in here for quick bite one evening. We choose to take the food home, but there are a few seats available inside here.

The menu is diverse, and delicious, you have to trust the selections and just dive in for one of the tortas. I loved mine, thought it stayed together really well while eating it which was a nice bonus. On top of the tasty food, the horchata was excellent and the large drink size is quite large. Besides the great food and drink the price was very reasonable, and the food was ready quickly.

I'll surely stop in here again, since it is right on my way home from work and the food was great for a quick bite.

My girlfriend goes in today and gets food for us. She speaks Spanish and most people don't suspect she would, the line cooks were talking shit about her order and the mods she made to her sandwich, and then continued to talk about her body, making her feel very uncomfortable. The manager didn't do anything about it until she spoke to them in Spanish as well and then he apologized. What the hell happened to manners and professionalism. I will never give business to this disrespectful place ever again. Don't go here lord knows what they had to say about every other costumer that walks in. If you can't respect your costumes, you don't deserve to have a business. Not to mention that's harassment to the fullest.

The tortas here are really delicious, the Enrique is my favorite, though the cost is a little high. However, the juice tastes very fresh and you get quite a lot for your money. I suppose it balances out? This is a small establishment and when they get busy, expect a wait. It seems stressful for the employees here to deal with deliveries and working the store front at the same time as there just aren't quite enough of them to deal with both smoothly. One of the difficulties of running a small business, I suppose. 

It's a good place. Have a torta.

I drove through snowmageddon to try this place March 23rd. I had the  "Enrique" vegetarian sandwich and two chicken tamales and the beetroot juice. This was a hearty meal that I divided up for lunch and dinner. I will definitely return the next time l'm in town.
Best tortas in town! The bread is soft and tastes fresh, the meat is well marinated, and the cucumber lemonade is surprisingly delicious. Denver has a real winner here!

Ordered the mini size of their veggie Torta sandwich - it was huge and more than enough to fill me up with a total of $5 spent. Lots of hot sauce options if you like some heat. Got a free cucumber lemonade with the Yelp coupon - it was huge, and delicious/uber refreshing. A friend got the horchata - also delish and plenty enough to share. Will definitely be back when I need a quick, tasty and inexpensive lunch.
One star for not being open at 10:30 on a Friday night when the sign says they  close at 1:30.
Damn son I ate so much torta a portuguist to come out, seriously the best tortas up in my barioooo, don't get it convuloooted dis the best go here

"Senor Pablo, it is my pleasure to introduce you to Senor David. Senor David, Senor Pablo.
. . .
Ay Chihuahua! Dinamita! Senor Pablo, mucho gusto!"

So, Senor Pablo was actually introduced to me by the lovely owner. And "Pablo" is the name of the sandwich I had. Wow! Was it great. Made with ham, pineapple, pork loin and cheese (to which I added serrano avocado), Senor Pablo couldn't have been tastier.

A small Colfax shop with maybe 10 counter chairs and a table or two, the Torta Grill is a very reasonably priced spot a couple of blocks north of Cheeseman Park that serves the best Mexican sammies around. Try em out when you're in the mood for something a little different.

I would like to go back to this restaurant in the future.  The torta's were good but I had taken copious amounts of zicam rapidmelts that literally altered my taste buds! =[

I think this joint is a nice place to grab a quick bite and overall most welcoming owners I have ever met.

First time visiting the torta grill and was impressed.  Their cucumber lemonade was refreshing.  The cheese tamale was very tasty and the torta especial was the epitome of comfort food. Plentiful, delicious and well priced to boot!!! Look forward to becoming a regular.

Unreal food. This is a must go in downtown Denver. The cucumber lemonade is delicious and the tortas are unreal. The house made carnitas on the Carlito torta are amazing. We are definitely making this a regular lunch spot! The workers are fun and excited about their product too. Great place.

I recently, moved here in Denver few days ago. Then, I discovered this place providing great deal of Mexican sandwiches. I like this place for nailing all my wishes about their food. Definitely, love to recommend this place to some of my friends.

Really yummy sandwiches! Quick, street food style - can watch the staff make your food.  Nothing bad to report; have only been once. It was definitely a good experience.  The cucumber drink is awesome.
I ordered the Carlito torta. I thought it was really good. Took advantage of the free cucumber lemonade offered with a yelp coupon.  That was good as well. Over all i really liked it.

There's something interesting about Mexican food in Denver. It's not really authentic, but it's not really unauthentic either. It's just Denver's own interpretation of an idea not unlike Kings Of Leon's take on arena rock. Or Chance The Rapper's take on hip hop. It all belongs to the overarching genre of "rock" and "hip hop" respectively, however it sounds nothing like Bruce Springsteen or Wu Tang Clan. But is that any reason to write them off as hacks or frauds? No way, Jose. 

That said, welcome to Torta Grill. They keep it simple - a handful of different house specials, a couple of tasty sides, and some delicious juice drinks - that's it. One guy takes your order, another grills up your sandwiches, and you've got quite the tasty fast casual Mexican operation.

I went with the Hector (chicken, eggs, chorizo, cheese). All sandwiches also come loaded with refried beans, avocado, tomato, onions, and mayo. As you might imagine, it was a perfectly indulgent calorie bomb in the middle of the day. Greasy, meaty, savory - it's a winning combo.

If this were in New York you could bet your bottom dollar I'd be a regular.

I finally had a doctor's appt that put me within range of Torta Grill.  I'd been trying to get a fellow torta lover to come with me and explore it, and showing her the ratings and the # of reviews averaging it an extremely yummy place to eat; but they always had an excuse and didn't want to go.  So I resolved to explore it myself the first chance I got - which finally arrived yesterday.

Stephen and Ardeni are wonderful owners that are easy to talk to and truly care that you are happy with their tortas.  I was eyeballing the menu posted in their window from the outside, and another person came out and offered me a to-go menu to take with me.  Helpful!  It was a tough call, but I finally narrowed it down to 2 options and headed inside.

The establishment is pretty small -- you could maybe fit 20-30 people around the inverted "L" of space around the counter - if they didn't mind being close to each other.  But the place does have a charming air about it.  There is a definite "Dia De Los Muertos" vibe in the place, in a wonderful mural on the wall, the skeleton marionette hanging near where you'd place your order, and 4 very artistic and beautiful skull masks on the side of the grill/oven hanging over the cashier's head.  It could easily double as a small HQ for OIngo Boingo fan clubs.  They also gave me, gratis, a small cup of their cucumber lemonade.  Tasty and refreshing and just the thing you'd wanna suck down when it's 95 outside.

As regretful as I was not to be able to eat there, I a) just wasn't hungry enough at that point, and b) was rushing all over on a tight timetable yesterday, so I had to take my foil-wrapped torta to go.  It was a tough call but I finally settled on the Arturo (pork loin, ham, eggs and cheese).  I finally made it home about 45 minutes later, unwrapped the torta and put half of it in the microwave for 20 seconds.  *So. Delicious*.  I can see why this place is neck and neck with Las Tortas now.  They do not have any TV up like at Las Tortas, so there are no Mexican music videos playing...which is a nice change of pace if you want to eat someplace quieter or actually converse with someone.

We're truly blessed in this city to have so many amazing dining establishments; Torta Grill is a crown gem among them.  I can't wait to get back here and try some other options. :)

SO disappointed... From the reviews I thought it would be wonderful.
The bread was burnt on both sides so I couldn't taste any favors except burnt bread.
Very bland.
I also got a fruit cup of mangoes and it was all bruised and terrible! 
Ew
Just shocked at how this place has great reviews...
Had the Miguel and Jose. Both were super delicious. Overall this place has awesome and affordable food!

An easy to miss little restaurant with incredible food!  The tortas all come with refried beans, tomatoes, onions, mayo, and avocado, and your choice of additional ingredients.  We tried the Jose (which also comes with ham, chorizo, eggs, and cheese) and the Miguel (which has steak, eggs, and cheese).  You can also add your choice of spicy ingredients, I recommend serrano avocado. 

Both sandwiches were incredible!  The flavor, the texture, the portion size, everything was just right.  It's a little messy, but it tastes so good that you won't care.  This is the perfect place to go for something a little different.  I'll definitely be back!
Delicious, fast, and friendly. Not much else to say besides that. Highly reccomend it if you are looking for something casual.
Delish! Have to try the Carlito. Amazing...and the cucumber lemonade is the perfect addition.

While visiting a friend in Denver, I wanted to help her explore the food around her. So... Yelp. Duh. 

The Torta Grill popped up as a highly-rated option. And I was super excited to get some Mexican food. So we hiked over (since it's Denver) and eventually reached the store. The place was empty which made me kind of weary of trusting Yelp reviews. But we kept going anyway. The Illini game was on TV so that was cool too (actually, I don't really care about sports, but I'm obligated to show loyalty to my alma mater). 

I ordered the Torta Grill Especial and my free drink with check in. We waited a bit and saw them prepping and cooking the meats in front of us which was really cool. They kept adding meat to mine and by the time it was done, it was a monster of a torta that looked like it was dripping deliciousness. 

I honestly didn't think it would fit in my mouth. But it did. And it was delicious. And that's what she said. Honestly, I think I blacked out from how good this torta was. And I kept thinking about how I wanted to come back hungover so that I could just drown my misery in food. 

I'll be back, Denver. Yeah, I'll be visiting my friend. But also... these Tortas.

Good tortas are hard to find in Colorado and these folks are doing a fine job. 

First off, they offer the best tamales I've had in Denver. That's a plus. I tried  the Carnitas Torta and was impressed. A little smaller and neater than what I'm used to but outstanding quality and flavor.

The owner is incredibly friendly and seems genuinely interested in his customers and his product. I would highly recommend a visit if you're in the area. I'll be back!

Food was delicious. Not a traditional style torta that I'm used to but the seasonings and add ons (avocado, beans, jalapeños, cheese, etc.) gave it authentic Mexican flavor.  It's a good sized sandwich for the price. Our kids loved their quesadilla. It was so big that they couldn't finish the one they shared. We got their cucumber lemonade which was very refreshing and flavorful.  This is about a 30 minute drive for us but we will definitely be going back.
So delicious!  Wonderful steak, cactus and cheese tortas.  Delicious juices.  Even a good yelp deal!  I am addicted.

Every time I go to Denver for work, we are sure to order from here. Don't bother with delivery if you can avoid it because that aspect is slower than molasses in the wintertime. However, the menu is chock full of unique and delicious items. All the tortas are customizable and I've tried 4 different ones; each was phenomenal. Try the Jalapeño jelly. And the Torta Grill especial is sure to put you in a food coma. Plus major points for being able to put egg and avocado on everything. Fresh fruit and juice options too! Definitely worth trying especially for the price!

I stopped here after work and picked up a Juan Torta... Just finished eating actually and had to write about it's amazing flavor! It is a soft bread filled with meats and melted cheese. I got the chipotle sauce on it and it was the perfect spicy... And I love spicy! I can't wait to take my boyfriend so he can enjoy it with me! New regulars now!

This place is AMAZING!!! I got the Hector (I think), with chicken, chorizo, eggs, avocados, onions, and a bunch of other deliciousness!!! I also got a tamale with cheese and a green chile, which was excellent as well!! The food was all so tasty, I will definitely be coming back!

The only downfall and reason it got 4 rather than 5 stars is how long it takes and how small the space is. The place was packed and there was only about 8 people in there. They definitely need someplace more spacious!

My boss paid for lunch for everyone who was able to make it into the office today!  Although I hate the snow, I love free lunch! We ordered from Torta Grill. The Ivan Torta & the Super Cocktail Cup were delicious. Glad this place is right around the corner.  Highly recommend the food.  #TortaGrill
Had the Carlito. Was amazing. Would have given all five stars for this place but had to ask them to make me my drink I ordered even with there only being a few people inside.

Tacos Acapulco was a huge surprise! Went with 3 other friends, our 1st night in Denver. When we ordered and ate our foods, we all kept saying "We have to come back"....Needless to say, I went back and the rest of the crew had other plans...

Went back on Labor Day around 6:30pm. You walk in, place your order and wait for the food. The food order goes in # order. Nobody gets any favor, everyone waits. 

Ordered the Beef with Cheese Pupusas, Carnitas Taco, Carne Asada Taco and a large cup of Horchatta. The total bill? $8.60! This place is not only a bargain, absolutely authentic!

Every food items was delicious. Only one picture will tell you the stories as they do speak a 1000 words. If you are a foodie, you'll appreciate the quality of Tacos Acapulco!

One of the best tacos al pastor I've tried! Place is small but has great seating area outside. Service is ok and the food is flavorful and made to order.

We ordered a pupusa, a burrito, and tacos al pastor!

Small
Tasty
Authentic
 seem to be my initial impressions of Tacos Acapulco...but there is so much more once you finally stop by and explore the food options inside!
Denver's best place to try Pupusas.
Does have a very limited inside counter area to sit and enjoy your food on site. Local take away or just plan ahead and eat it there at one of their picnic style tables on the "patio" -- (meaning a small fenced off part of the parking lot)
Don't come to Tacos Acapulco for the view of East colfax traffic and walk-by people sightshow though.
Come for the food. 
Basic
Tasty
Authentic

Decent mexican style tacos for the cheap (tacos were $2). Parking is available but tight. It's a popular place so even late evening (7-8pm) you'll wait 15 minutes for food. Not a lot of seating inside (like 5 stools) so take out if you want to relax. Papusas were delicious, hot, and affordable. You have to pay for all your sides and there was avocado but no guacamole.

After a disappointing taco experience last week (see review) we came here for the real deal!

I realize this place is a little lacking in atmosphere, but that kind of makes me love it more.  It's small, busy, always crowded, most of the seating is outside, orders can take a while, and only if your lucky is there an employee who can speak English.  Don't let any of that keep you away because I haven't even mentioned the food.

The menu is short and to the point; tacos, papusas, tortas, burritos and a couple other random offerings.  There is no fancy salsa bar, but they make several different kinds (all delicious and spicy) and seems everything on the menu is paired with the appropriate salsa, which they include.  Also, homemade horchata.

I have never had anything I didn't like.  But, what I really drive all that way for is the BEST tacos Al Pastor in Denver (IMO) and some really great papusas.  

They no longer have Lengua on the menu, which is kind of sad.

Oh yeah, and two of us left full and happy for under $12

Papusas are delicious. Tacos are great too and everything is very cheap too. I would give 5 stars and more for food but 1 star for service. I called them and placed an order for Papusas and got there after 20 minutes and food was not ready. They made me wait for another 20 mins. Avoid this place if you are in a hurry.

Papusas are large and generously stuffed.  We tried the Revueltas and Chorizo y queso, they were both good, but the Chorizo one was the fav.  Their papusa sauce was more flavorful and zesty than most I've had and their red hot sauce was lightly smoky and very very spicy, a little goes a long way.  Tacos were good but a little bit dry, they def needed a little salsa to go down.  The strip of pineapple included for the pastor was a nice touch.  

They do brisk business and the wait area is tiny.  there are a few stools along the narrow counter but this is def a take out rather than dine in place.
Very authentic, Made to order. When I want papusas, this is where I go.

I just love little hole in the wall taquerias, so I was excited to try this place. This isn't your typical sit down restaurant, as it consists of a walk up window catering to take-away orders. There is a small bar with about 4 stools if you prefer to eat it there.

I couldn't pass on the al pastor which come shaved off the vertical spit Mexican style. We sampled tacos, a torta and pupusas with the al pastor. My favorite was the torta, but the tacos were also very good. The pupusas were hot and fresh served with a slaw and red sauce. They were not my favorite, and the red sauce was very disappointing. However I should note that I've never been a huge fan of these little stuffed pancake-like treats. The horchata was spot-on delicious though.

This place is well worth a try if you enjoy simple little taquerias.
Really good and unassuming joint on Colfax. If you can stand to wait it's worth it!  They have great sauces as well, and the pupusas are sweet!

My boyfriend and I recently moved to the area and we have been on the hunt for a good hole in the wall Mexican restaurant for a few months. Today I think we finally found our go to burrito place. Don't judge this restaurant by its appearance! Although it is a tiny restaurant that can only seat 3-4 people at the bar (there is some outside seating too) the food here is delicious. 

This was our first time here and we got 2 burritos and a papusa. We have never tried a papusa before so we only ordered 1 papusa con pollo (chicken). It was sooooo good!!! I recommend eating it with the coleslaw and salsa, they all go together really well. I will definitely be eating plenty more of these! The burrito was also really good. The meat was flavorful, the burrito was packed full of stuff. The insides were evenly distributed so that you had a little bit of everything in every bite. This place was really affordable, we paid $13.50 for our 3 things and it was totally worth it. We will be going back soon!!
Excellent. Huge variety. The carnitas were succulent. The pupusas were cooked to perfection. More for than you can eat for less than $10

This is the real deal. The atmosphere is non-existent and the line will be long, but it is all worth it as the food is so good. I have to say their Al Pastor taco might be the best that I have ever had in CO. The Papusas are also very yummy. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

I thought the food was pretty standard. In winter there is only a 4 seat counter to eat at. So really take away only. Also the area is, we shall say a little depressed.  We came at night, and you may want to go for lunch instead. Staff do not speak much in the way of English, which is fine.  I had attempted asking if the counter lady, had a favorite meat. She grabbed another lady cooking, and she said the steak or pork. I don't think asada, and pollo sound anything a like, and I never mentioned the bird the whole time we were there, then got made my order of two carne asada pupasa's as chicken, still they were the best thing we ate. We also got 3 burritos, 2 carnitas, and one lingua. The ratio of meat to everything else was meager. The carnitas were in no way crispy. Honestly I was expecting way more, considering the near perfect review. Items came with 2 salsas the red one just tasted like bland tomato, the green one was quite good. It took some time to get our to go, so don't go here expecting to exit fast. The food is probably better than Taco Mex, but that has an eat in area, and a salsa bar.  It was great value, and maybe I will try again in  for a lunch in summer? I would eat the tacos and pupusa's next time, skip the burritos.

This is my goto spot for Papusas. This place is where it's at, it's just got a tiny dining area with 3-4 seats so I always get my food to go. But it's so good and worth the wait. I am a customer for life here.

One fateful day driving down Colfax headed east, my boyfriend and I stopped at this gem. The line was out the door meaning it must be good. We only got 2 papusas, but they took roughly 30 minutes to make and were super, super good and a great deal (maybe $2.50 for one?). Served with slaw and some green and red sauce (all of which were OK).

Next time we went was this past Saturday. No line this time. We each ordered two papusas with carne y queso. We also got the Jarritos drinks. Our whole meal was probably about $12-$13 for two dollars. Awesome deal. The papusas were great, but when I put the slaw on them.. I didn't like the taste so much. Also, this time around they gave us 3 different sauces (2 red, 1 green), which was great because we had more dipping variety. We wanted extra cheese in the papusas, but the lady behind the register said the papusas would explode? They have extra queso for the papusas on the menu, though.....

I like the outside patio because it is right on Colfax and you can see the true E. Colfax neighborhood hanging out. For me, it is a nice culture shock (even though it's only a few miles down from me). It's also very cheap. I want to try the tacos here or something else.

Their tacos de camaron are amazing. Their tostada de ceviche is even better. I can't wait to try their pupusas after all the good things I hear! Also, I'm not a fan of horchata but theirs is pretty damn good. I love this place. It's such a treat

This place is exactly what it looks like. Amazing food for cheap. I've not had a better Taco, Burrito, or torta, or flan since in Denver. And it is very well managed. You order and they tell you how much time to expect and they are always on time. I've never had them mess up an order despite their High customer volume.

Don't be fooled by the exterior of the restaurant. This hole in the wall joint is amazingly good and super affordable.

To start off, this place has got to be the top 3 of the best steak burrito I've ever had. Super fresh ingredients; steak, rice, beans n veggies. The pupusas are also a must try. Super cheesy and meaty with a generous side of cole slaw and red sauce.

My girlfriend and I are on vacation and have visited this place twice in the past two days. Definitely worth the trip to Denver just for the burritos!

my wife and I were on vacation in denver from the east coast and drove out of
our way to eat here and was not disappointed. Whats good? everything! if you like
authentic (not tex mex) this is the place. if want fast food go to taco bell, if you good
food thats well worth the wait then i would definitely recommend this place. thank you.

There is nothing like a steaming hot cheesy papusa. I hadn't planned on eating here today but when a screw in my tire brought me to this side of town, Papusas became a reality for me!

This is a tiny store with a big following. The sounds of Papusas being slapped together, with a sizzling grill and delicious smells wafting throughout create a mouth watering experience. 

I waited a while for my two raja Papusas with beans and rice. When I got them they were cheesy crispy happy on a plate. The cabbage slaw was tangy and perfect with the tomato sauce and papusa. The beans and rice were also perfect and my absolute favorite kind of rice. 

This is an out of the way place for me but I would definitely come back.
Great tacos and so cheap! I like the al pastor the best. The tortas and pupusas were also very tasty. Excellent horchata too!

Right off Colfax with a parking lot in the back. Don't drive too fast or you might miss it, its small in stature but big in value. 

Ordered 5 Tacos with the fixins (cilantro and onion). 3 Pork, pork was basic, cooked right but you might want to add salsa for a bit of kick. Chicken seemed boosted with a little more flavor. Comes with Red and Green Salsa which is also great.

Ya great little spot. First exposure to papusas so I won't speak authoritatively on them. But good prices, good authentic street tacos, what you see is what you get. Menu's in Spanish so deal with it.
Service was friendly and fast. Tacos are quite large and cheap! I tried lengua, carnitas and al pastor. Carnitas was my favorite of the three. I'll be going back to try the pupusas.

The best taco el pastor I have ever had!
These are a must try!!!
Super friendly staff as well
Solid taco and burrito place. Best to order ahead and get it to go as there are only 6 places to sit for people waiting on their order.

Let's just get on with it.  The most amazing al pastor tacos I've ever had.  Off the spit onto the griddle and garnished with pineapple.  The meat was the star and the salsa just made it better.  The four stars comes from the fact that I can't give 4 1/2, because I ate the al pastor tacos first and then tried pupusas.  They were good, but the entire time I kept saying, wish I had three more tacos al pastor.  I've eaten tacos in Mexico, San Diego, L.A, Austin, most of the tacos hot spots, and these were the best al pastor I've had.  Kudos

If you like hole in the wall taco joints this place is for you. I had two asada tacos and a chicken and cheese pupusa. The pupusa was excellent, extremely filling and had an excellent texture. The asada tacos were good and had enough meat on them to make a whole other taco. The meal was like $7-8 and was more than enough food for lunch. Only downside was it took a little while (maybe 8 or 10 minutes) for them to get the food out, but it was worth the wait. I will return!

Discovered this place by chance on my first trip to Denver and knew I had to return.  On my second trip and already plan to eat here multiple times this weekend.  The shrimp tacos are phenomenal and veggie burrito is delicious too.  Looking forward to trying pupusas on my next visit.

If you like authentic Mexican food go here.  Can't say enough good things
Love this place! Finally found some decent Mexican food in Denver. Ordered pupusas, a ceviche tostada, and a chorizo torta. Absolutely no complaints. Excellent food, nice staff.

SO happy this place is close to where I live. Best tacos I've had outside of San Diego... in fact, even better! The authentic pastor tacos should not be missed and I look forward to trying every one of the different pupusas. Less than $6 for two tacos and a pupusa which is more than enough food to fill you up. I will be back often! The parking situation can be tricky if it's crowded but it is well worth circling for a spot.
Was told about this place by several friends. Got the asada and chicharron & queso papusas. They were delicious and the salsas were amazing too. Definately worth the drive.

I loved this place.  I feel like it is such a find.  SUPER cheap and yummy tacos.  

I also got a papusa.  The papusas they make FRESH. Like the dough, putting all the stuff in the dough, and cooking it, and it takes a while.  Like 20-30 minutes.  Tacos take 3-5 minutes.  If I knew that I would not have gotten a papusa.  ''

I got the papusa because I like to say the word.  I can hardly believe there is a food called papusa.  You can say it all sing-songy: Can I have a pap-u-sa?  Mi Quero un Papusa. It was yummy.  All doughy and warm,  tastes just like Mexican love.  Its comfort food, for sure.  

For the other gringos: A papusa (I think) is like a fat pancake of dough with stuff in the dough, like meat or cheese, then they cook it on the grill.  Like a savory fat pancake tortilla with stuff in it.  Like a mexican latke, with no potatoes.  

So while I was waiting for my papusa to be made, I got to gander at all that come here and work here in the back.  It was impressive the range of folks that stop.  Spanish speaking families, dudes from the street, neighborhood tough guys,  an occasional hipster, and even a tiny little asian lady.  Every walk of life likes tacos and papusas.  Every. One. And THIS is the place to get your papusa  and street taco on. 

While I was watching people order, I noticed some things.  You can get cheese and lettuce on the tacos, IN A TAQUERIA!!  The ladies make those papusas one at a time by hand.  They make the flan in house.  there are like 4 ladies back there cooking, and it looked so hot back there,  and they were all SO busy the whole time.  1.75 tacos is a great deal, made from scratch, by several people.   The kitchen is bigger than the waiting galley and the waiting galley is tiny.  Def. take out.  (people knocking down stars for that; DUDE. It's a taqueria.  Get over it. )

I suspect the corn tacos are also made in house, because they are thick and fluffy and so fricken yummy.  I loved this place.  It seems like someone lifted it right out of Mexico and onto East colfax.  Like a magical papusa fairy.  Ding!! PAPUSA MAGIC.
Nothing better on this side of town. Definitely call in your order ahead of time to avoid the wait.
This place is good for tacos and pupusas after a night out! If you are hungry late at night go here!!!

Pupusas and plantains are great, everything else is good. The only tacos worth getting are the Al Pastor - others are disappointing. 

As others have said, the horchata estilo salvadoreño has a very unique flavor profile...  We both tasted a peanut butter thing happening and prefer the Mexican style. 

All-in, this is a place where you can get a truly staggering amount of good food per dollar. Bring your Spanish language skills if you have any questions or want to order anything with additions/deletions from the way it's normally served.

Best al pastor tacos in town. we ordered 5 tacos for here and 5 tacos to go. Place was easy to get to and we got our food quickly, within 5 mins of ordering. Great fast service and delicious pastor tacos, probably the best in denver!

Delicious Pupusas!!! 
I love the asada, al pastor, and chicharrón!
I recommend getting Horchata Salvadoreña. It tastes like Atole. 
Really good.
Love this place so much. DEFINITELY Call ahead, get a few pupusas and some awesome al pastor tacos. Definition of hole in the wall, but so good.

They usually have maybe three women cooking up food in this tiny establishment. Wait time is normal for Mexican food unless you're there during peak hours (as this place can get busy and crowded). Very reasonably priced and tastes delicious. Call ahead during peak times, if you know what you want. Ordering will be much easier for fluent Spanish speakers.

It is hard to find authentic Mexican food in the mile high city. This place is one pure authentic and affordable place. It is best to-go Mexican food as they don't have dining room, and known for their Pupusas.

So you don't know what a pupusa is?  Well, my friends, it's time to find out.  And no better place to do that than here.  Look no further than the "Tacos y Pupusas" sign on colorful and cultural Colfax Blvd.  It's cheap, it's yummy.  And, if you're lucky, you might get offered discounted VHS tapes from a random guy meandering through the waiting area.  Or maybe even some Duracell batteries.  You just never know.  Adventure awaits at Tacos Acapulco.

(PooPOOsahs) - This place is it. Handmade pupusas instead of hotplate foolishness. Always a firm time estimate, staff always checks to see if you want/need more condiments, beverages, or desserts. As good as handmade pupusasit gets!
Authentic but Mezcal makes a slightly better pupusa itself, sauce and cabbage sides are much better here.

Wow... haven't  been here in a year and a half. I forgot just how good their pupusas are! Simply delicious! I went out and bought a half dozen for three of us who were here for some drinks.  They never had the pupusas before. And everyone loved 'em! Two for each is more than enough and if you need more food, order some tacos to go along with. The key here as has been mentioned is TO CALL IN THE ORDER AHEAD OF TIME as they get very busy! Two pupusas with great Cole slaw and two sauces cost under five bucks. Incredible! The two best under five buck meals in the city are the pupusas here and a Banh Mi at New Saigon Deli. Highly recommended!

Although this place is small, their food packs a huge punch in the flavor department! Came here because I didn't know what a pupusa was and had asked a friend to explain it, but still didn't understand. It's hard to explain, but it's sort of a stuffed savory pancake filled with either meat, cheese, or veggies and comes with pickled carrots and white radish, and salsa. The way to really know what a pupusa is is to try one for yourself. Their burritos are great, flavorful, and huge!
Visited during a business trip to Denver.  Great service.  Loved the food.  Only wish I spoke/read better Spanish, as I did not know some of the menu items.  Would definitely go again.

I ate here when I was in town over labor day weekend. (Ate on 9/6/2015)

Since Denver has a very large Hispanic population, every time I visit the area I feel obligated to eat cuisine of that nature. Most times, it's been extremely Americanized, Tex-Mex crap. This place is quite authentic. 

Since I knew I wouldn't be back in the area for a few months, I ordered as much food as I felt I could handle. 4 tacos (2 chicken, 2 carnitas), and an al pastor-stuffed Pupusa. 

Absolutely DELICIOUS!

The tacos were served with a side of freshly cut onions (with a sprinkling of cilantro), and freshly cut limes and radishes. Very delicious. The chicken was a TAD on the dry side, but was still pretty good.

I will admit, this was my first-ever pupusa, but at 2.50 per serving, this could have been its own separate meal. It was served with red salsa (delicious), and some coleslaw. When eating, I attempted to make a taco out of it by putting some of the coleslaw in the middle and curling it up, as one would do when eating NYC-style pizza. It worked, somewhat.

The Al Pastor was delicious - full of flavor. I will definitely be trying some in a taco on my next trip. The carnitas were also quite good. The chicken was a little bit on the dry side, but this could be easily mitigated by combining with salsa. 

My consensus - this place has delicious, cheap (for 4 tacos and a pupusa, it was around 12 dollars) authentic Mexican/Salvadoran food.

My only qualm was that the radishes served were not pickled, and were not sliced thin. If this restaurant pickled their own radishes and sliced them thin (for taco garnish), in addition to having slightly more flavorful chicken, it would have gotten 5 stars. 

I will 100% be back next time I am in town. Try this restaurant, you will NOT be disappointed!

Boom! What is this little beautiful place, and how did I get here? It's tiny when you walk in, I can't speak a lick of Spanish, they don't know my English either. Did that stop us from pointing at pictures and using hand gestures to figure out what I'd like best. No, they nailed it. Papusa? What the hell is that? I'll gladly take two more. Make it four, I might share one with a co-worker.  The shrimp cocktail, cold soup thing. That's a yes, you must get it. Crumble up some crackers, hit is with hot sauce, it has avocado, and it's delish.  This place is awesome.

It's a tiny little shack with outdoor tables, every time we drove by the place was packed, at least 10 people deep. Now we know why. Worth the trip, be adventurous! Pupusas were great, nice size with assorted fillings, well priced. Our favorites were the pastor, chorizo/cheese and chicken/cheese. Salsas were good, red sauce was very mild but I really liked the 2 other (red/green) salsas for more heat. Try with the cabbage slaw.  The burritos and tortas looked good, and I'll come back to try the fried plantains too.

This place should not be called Tacos Acapulco, or even Tacos y Pupusas Acapulco, as the letters on the roof of the Colfax shack read, but rather Pupusas y Tacos Acapulco. The pupusas are the star here: impressive almost more in texture than in flavor. 

Kind of weirdly, you can get a pupusa al pastor. It was pretty good, as was the new rajas pupusa (cheese and strips of chile pepper). 

-Yes, the place has the good and the bad of a place with funk: you wait a long time, there's not a ton of parking, and you don't want to be wolfing down those pupusas at 7 pm on a cold Friday night, cramped into that tiny waiting space with a million other people eating alongside you. On warm nights, I like the weird sad dingy-but-not-really dirty picnic-table space in the parking lot.

MY WORD. How come I never ventured in here sooner. Its definitely a hole-in-the-wall. The girls working in the kitchen know there stuff. After perusing the menu. I went with the AL Pastor Burrito for 5 Bucks. It Was Big and Stuffed and Delicious. If i could eat this every day of my life I would. I ordered it with Everything minus the beans. The Pork was tender but crisp. Good Veggies, packed with sour cream and Guacamole. I put on the salsa verde, and even without it, the burrito had some kick, but not to much of a kick. 

Its a meal in itself. Plus they have flan. Its a little out of my way but well worth the drive. 
And the seating is VERY limited. They do have a TV.

Ok....a few disclaimers.....this establishment is in an extremely seedy part of town AND there is barely enough room to turn around in once you get inside AND they don't have a public restroom.  Now that we have that out of the way, onto discussing the food.

The papusas (A Salvadorian dish, it is a tortilla filled with cheese, beans, or meat. Usually served with a special tomato sauce or cabbage mix) was DELICIOUS!!!! My husband and I both had the cheese and chicken papusas and enjoyed them. The cabbage slaw is what really made it so delicious. Each papusa is $2. Well worth it.

My husband also had a chicken taco and I had a steak taco. $1.75 each. They were okay, but nothing either of us would run back to eat again. Oh.....but those papusas......gracious....we'll surely be back for those!

I had a great experience. I'm partial to Mexican already and they did not disappoint. I had 3 tacos, steak, chicken and pork. The line and pineapples were new to me but a welcome change. I can't wait to go back!
Super yummy and affordable! Best pupusas in town, delicious shrimp tacos, and great tortas! My favorite is the zucchini and cheese pupusa. The patio is nice but a bit noisy since it's on Colfax.

Amazing amazing pupusas con chorizo y queso...con just about anything! 
And the tomato dipping sauce is sooo wonderful as well! 
I love enjoying my meals with their refreshing medio litro cola hecho en Mexico!
My new go-to taco and papusa place! The wait can get long at times but the staff is always nice and welcoming!
The tacos pastor are a treat to behold. We also dipped into some pupusas made with steak and pollo.
These pupusas are amazing!! Yes, the waiting area is small. Yes, the neighborhood isn't great. Yes, it takes a little while for your food to be up. So keep all of that in mind and plan ahead! Yummy!

simply the best east colfax has to offer. period. there are a lot of good spots for any kind of food you want on the east side, but this place is el rey. papusas revueltas con todo might be among the absolute best dishes in all of denver. 

in short: a landmark.

I went based on the reviews here.  Had birth the tacos carne asada and chicken torta. The tires was ok.  Definitely enjoyed the tacos.  I'll try the pupusas next time.  I like the red sauce.  The spice sneaks up on you!

column4: South Jordan, Salt Lake City, UT
column13:
Great little Taco Stand. Big fan of the Carne Asada Tacos which ring up a $1.75 each. The horchata is pretty good as well, and they give you a lot. Haven't tried the papusas yet, but looking forward to that next time.

Gets pretty crowded, so calling ahead with your order can save time.

East Colfax Taco Tour UYE!  Sunday October 30th 2011 

3RD STOP, The FINAL STOP of East Colfax Taco Tour UYE : Tacos Acapulco.

Tiny Tiny establishment.  You order at the counter, and make sure you get a "ticket" and remember your order.  There are like 3 or 4 stools if you dedcide and can have your tacos eating in.  You also can seat outside or either have your order to go coz that was my observation at other patrons that afternoon ordering from this Taco Stand.

Since I was stuffed from the other eateries, I decide to order just one.  I cant recall what I order.  Was it tripa or was it lengua?  All in all 3 stars for this Taco Stand, and I dont mind returning with Hubs and see how or if my review might differ.

Stopped in for the first time last night. We caught them in their last hour before closing so that may have affected our experience.

The good:
Some of the best horchata I've had north of the border.
The pupusas were out of this world delicious. Highly recommended.
Staff was fun and friendly.

The average:
It was late so the al pastor was a little dry and lacked flavor. I will try again and update my review.
Tortillas for the tacos where a little dry as well, but again, it was getting late.
The torta was average. Not the best bolillo I've ever had but worth a try.

All in all,it's a great little place and we'll be visiting again for certain - especially for the pupusas!

This little joint on Colfax and Yosemite is famous!  It is always packed with people.  I love being able to see the cooks make our food in front of us,  you are reassured there is nothing to hide and there is cleanliness and dedication.  The girls that work here work hard, I always see them busy at work.  They do a great job because everything is yummy!

I went here with another taco loving friend and we knew we had hit gold from the moment we got there. The first sign of success was that there was a line out the door and we were the only white people in it. Inside the building where you order the smells that came out were just amazing. This isn't fast food by any means and you can tell just by watching the kitchen. 

We ordered a variety of tacos, papusas (sp?) and a shrimp cocktail. 

The shrimp cocktail came out first and was very very good. It was more like a chilled soup with a tomato base with shrimp, avocado, onion and more inside of it. Came out cold and was amazing on a hot day.

We then went into the tacos which were good, but not mind blowing. Definitely some of the better tacos though I've had in Denver. The chorizo was my personal favorite.

Lastly we had the papusas and these were AMAZING. Definitely the go to meal here based on what other people ordered. A papusa plate comes with three papusa's of your choosing, a nice slaw and an amazing red sauce. Definitely get these when going here.

Very good puposa. Love the meaty cheesy bliss and the slaw is super good. Always get a cpl pastor tacos as well. They stuff the tacos to the brim and the green salsa is very good. Was unimpressed with the torta, only bad thing I can say

Easily the best pupusas in town. I opt for loroco and chicharron while my wife prefers the pinto beans. They're Fluffy, greasy and crunchy with a great flavor. The slaw is cold and crisp which helps complement the gooey starchy pupusa.

Burritos and tacos are good... There are betters along Colfax, but the El Salvadorian speciality can't be beat.

Not for dining in unless you like sitting at a cramped dirty counter though.

So the bf and I finally made it over to try these tacos and so glad we did! 

Honestly, the carnitas and al pastor tacos were my favorite and they came with pineapple, which I've never had with tacos before, but I really liked it! Also love that my cilantro didn't come full of a million onions. This is the first taco place I've found where I can just have cilantro without onions... so happy for that. 

I also tried a beans & cheese pupusa... and wow, soooooo good! That caramelized cheese is delicious. My bf really liked the cole slaw it came with and I liked dipping it in the tomato sauce. 

The only down sides to this place is that there are only 5 bar stools inside to sit on... so it's outside seating or take it home. Also, it's in kind of a creepy area. If the motel across the street is boasting about their "clean rooms" on their sign... you know it's not the nicest part of town. 

Anyways, nothing bad enough to keep me away from yumminess... I will definitely be back for more.

Great pupusas. It would have warranted the 5 stars if it weren't for the fact that the waiting area is the size of a shoe box and they take forever. That aside, the pupusas aren't overly greasy and the price is fairly inexpensive. 

PRO TIP:
Call ahead and order

Do Not miss this place. True Al pastor on the spit. The Adasa and carnitas are delish, too. We split a Papusa- Al pastor (takes a bit longer)and it was divine. Small interior but great outside area to relish your order, including a sink with soap and paper towels to wash the excess deliciousness off your hands. Good horchata as well. Big tacos for cheap price ($1.75) with so much filling you can split them into 2. (Does that mean I ate 6 tacos?) go here. You will not be disappointed. And get at least one Al pastor taco.

Stopped by again last night to try a few more items (Carne y queso papusa, Al Pastor Taco, Pollo y queso papusa and pollo taco).  All were on point and this place better get used to seeing my face as I'll be back often.

These pupusas arent all that great. I dont see what all the hype is about no offense. I have tried way better in california real yummy salvadorian pupusas where the cheese isnt too thick and hard to chew.

Holy pupusa!!!  I love, love, love Tacos Acapulco.  Since moving to the EC (East Colfax), we have become regulars at this joint.  They are open late, cheap, and offer delicious, fresh Mexican.  

I've had my fair share of tacos al pastor and have to say, Tacos Acapulco offers the best.  The meat is very flavorful and delicious.  They also throw some cilantro and fresh pineapple on top and it creates a delightful melody of flavors in your mouth.  I am quite addicted to these tacos.  I am also addicted to their queso pupusas. I am a newcomer to the pupusa world, which is crazy shocking since I am a cheese addict.  Pupusas were made for me, especially these pupusas.  The tortillas give off a subtle, perfect corn flavor which meshes perfectly with the melted, gooey cheese.  The best part is when the cheese leaks out of the tortillas and caramelizes.  I go bonkers for caramelized cheese.  They also have wonderful horchatas!  

We usually call ahead and get it to go since it is a pretty tiny place.  They do accept debit/credit cards now.  Give Tacos Acapulco a try.  You will not be disappointed!
Great tacos, mediocre ceviche. The green salsa that comes with the tacos is way spicy and super flavorful.

tacos are awesome. I always ask for the green sauce with my carnitas. it will light you up.. very spicy and tons of flavor. the overall atmosphere is a no go.. it's very tiny in here so be prepared to possibly order to go.

This place just might have the best tacos al pastor I've eaten in Denver. It is pretty dang good - when you roll up to the ordering window you can see it hanging out on a spit there by the grill. You place your order, they carve some meat off and toss it on the grill for a bit of warming/crisping up. It comes topped with onions, cilantro, and big chunks of pineapple. Yum. Yum.

There is a pretty wide variety of meat options and you can get tacos, pupusas, burritos, and things of that nature. However, the place is super small. There is about 5 stools inside so you might want to consider getting your order to go. But, if it's a nice sunny day you could also sit outside on their patio which boasts about 3 picnic tables.

Show up early for lunch if you don't want a wait. So far I've only tried the pupusas. Walking in and seeing the flat top covered with freshly formed pups and smelling the aromas wafting out of that tiny kitchen... how could I not try those first? The chorizo, carnitas, and chicharon pupusas I ordered were more like two meals than one but I managed and ended up waddling around the rest of the afternoon. From now on I'm gonna have to chop 'em in half as soon as I get 'em and hide the other half from myself! The trials and tribulations of the overweight taco eater.....  sigh.

Pollo y queso pupusa, and  tacos al pastor. Tasty!

 I'd never tried a pupusa before, but it was made to order and down right tasty.  The tacos al pastor were tasty, but their tortillas were straight out of the bag.  Their pupusas are made from scratch with masa, why not make fresh tortillas as well?  That alone would have bumped this up to a five.  

Service could have been quite a bit faster, especially when you can see the entire kitchen working at a leisurely pace from the tiny walk-in area that can't even be called a dining room.  I saw my completed order sitting on the counter while one of the girls in the kitchen went in back to chat with a co-worker.

They did provide an ample selection of salsas with my take out, and a baggie mostly cabbage for a little extra green crunch.


 I'll definitely be going back for more, eventually, but I'll call my order in.  Three point five stars, rounded up.

Stop #3 on the October 2011 East Colfax Taco Tour UYE! 

Okay, I'll be honest.  I was pretty stuffed by the time we rolled into the 3rd taco stop of the day.  This place is TINY inside.  I think there are five stools by the window, period.  The outside area is basically a corral with three picnic tables.  Additional people eat off the top rail of the fence.  I had an okay carnitas taco.  It had a fair amount of meat, but for $1.75, it really should.  It was moist, but did not pack significant porky goodness in the flavor department, B-.  The taco al pastor, on the other hand, was pretty good.  I would give it an A-, it was also a generous and tasty portion.  I had a small taste of a pupusa, which once again reminded me of a hockey puck, but the flavor was good.  However, the tomato dipping sauce accompaniment here seemed straight out of a can, with little seasoning.  I liked it, but this is a "weak 4 stars" in my opinion.

Tried the pupusas here, because that's what all the locals seemed to be getting. Never had pupusas before and I liked them. They came with sauce and a cole slaw like vegetable side. You can also pick different ingredients in the pupusas.

Pretty cheap prices if I remember correctly.

The place is incredibly small and narrow inside, with just enough room for the ordering counter and one bar style counter to sit at. There's maybe enough room for 5-6 people inside, but there is outdoor seating available. Very "hole in the wall" but worth trying.

I had to go back and try them when I wasn't going to explode the last time I was here.  It was the 3rd stop on the Taco Tour and now that I went back I'm very sad that it was - had it been the first I might not have ventured to somewhere else.

I remember when really good things come in Styrofoam containers and this place does it proud.  I know, I know it's not very green of me to like styrofoam but this once - you'll just have to get over it.

Had a repeat of Al pastor taco and pork/cheese papusus.  There was tons of meat and sauces and cucumbers and radishes and a slaw.  For $3.75 you gets tons of food.

If you haven't had a chance to stop in and grab something to eat - you need to go soon.  If it is cold outside you can eat in your car!  There isn't much seating inside.

Whoa, what a little taco stand.  

Al pastor that makes my mouth water even now.  I mean, like, totally soooo good.  They have an awesome Spit of Pork rotating so you know it's good.  They also put pineapple on the Al pastor tacos, so you know it's good.  And they have papusas.  So you know it's good.

That's pretty much it.
Tacos are great, pupusas are great. We order take out as they don't really have any capacity to eat in. You order at a window. Don't expect fancy, expect delicious.
Def get the pupusas, for realla!

I have been on a quest for good hispanic food since I moved to Denver. If you've been to the Bay Area then you know about the awesome food they have and Denver is really lacking, but this place is a hidden treasure.

I've driven past it tons of times going down Colfax and finally decided to give it a try. I went in on a Sunday afternoon and the tiny place was crowded. There are a few bar stools to sit on, but the inside is really small. I waited about 30-40 minutes for my order and was on my way.

The area is sketchy and some of the people who came in were questionable, but the pupusas were SO good. Almost like eating at my favorite spot in San Francisco. I got the cheese and steak & cheese and they were both delicious. I've never had a steak & cheese pupusa before but it was to die for. Cheesy and full of flavorful chunks of carne asada meat.

This is my new go to spot in Denver and I can't wait to try out the burritos and tacos as well. Everything is made fresh to order and is worth the wait!

MMMmmmmm...delicioso!!!! 

The tacos Al Pastor are delectable and the fresh slice of pineapple just puts it over the top. The items are served with a fresh coleslaw and the tacos are generously filled.

Having never tried a pupusa, I insisted my dining companion share a bite (a big bite :-)).  The cheesy goodness was overflowing and the chicken was tender and juicy.  I loved both the homemade green and red sauce.  It had some kick which I adore in my sauces!

This unassuming little gem was the perfect answer to breaking out of my rut.  It was an adventure locating the place and we were rewarded with an inexpensive bite to eat that was literally exploding with flavor and freshness.  That's the good stuff!

Tacos were ok.  Packaged tortillas (ay ay ay) and the al pastor was burnt and dry.  The salsa might as well have been water.

Pupusas were good.  20+ minute wait for our food was ridiculous at 4pm.

You can do a whole lot better in Denver.

My boy friend and I really like this place. We haven't tried any of the taco places down the street so we don't have too much to compare it to. We mainly order the al pastor tacos, the fresh cucumber and pineapple make it so refreshing to eat. It doesn't feel heavy and the meat is crispy and tender. It's not chewy at all. We did try the pupusa and I think it's an acquired taste, we weren't too big fans of it. Their green and red sauces have a bit of a kick to it, but are really good. This place is tiny and can fill up quickly so I suggest calling in your order and picking it up. We will be back for more of that al pastor!

Ok the only reason this place is getting 3 stars, are the pupusas. They are very tasty. The salsa de tomate was on point. The curtido could use more acidity. The ceviche was dry, bland, and had IMITATION CRAB in it, as well as shrimp. Yes, the fuchsia color strips were a dead giveaway. That's just gross. The carne asada taco was pretty good. And I'm a tough judge of tacos. Sooo, I will be back for the pupusas only.

This place is awesome.  I live in Lowry and recently discovered it after a few friends of mine told me to give it a try.  Very good tacos and excellent pupusas.  The waiting/ordering area is tiny, but they have a patio space that's good in warmer weather.  Don't be afraid of the fact that it's a tiny little shack.  It's awesome and the prices are very reasonable.

I think there is no better late night food in Denver than these pupusas. They are open until 2 am, and the food is fresh and filling without giving heartburn. 

I had cheese and chicharron pupusas, and both were outstanding. As another reviewer pointed out, the red sauce is phenomenal, and I also really liked the green salsa. It's a ton of food for the price. 

I really don't know what else to say. It's absolutely worth the schlep if you don't live nearby. Just go. You won't be sorry.

Good little taco joint.  There's actually a lot more seating than one would think--several large picnic tables in a fenced area off to the side.

The tacos themselves were okay.  They had no cheese, which is supposed to be a good sign.  The lady who took our order was pleasant and got the order right (I asked for no cilantro).

A heads-up:

If you've been to Pinche and loved their lengua taco, this one is different.  It's cut in strips instead of chunks and doesn't have the triple fried texture and taste of the ones at Pinche.  It tastes slightly like organ meat, and you can see the tastebuds.

That said, it wasn't bad, but I won't order it again.

The asada was my favorite.  The al pastor was good.  They were all topped with raw onions and came with two sauces.  The green was mild and good.  The red was way too spicy for me.  I guess the problem is that nothing was remarkable.  Everything seemed just average as far as texture and flavor and was rather plain.

I'll go back and try a few different tacos and pupusas.  Hopefully, I just ordered wrong.
$3 Pupusas is definitely 5 stars it's like a fried flatbread with your choice of meat. Taco Al pastor is fresher during lunch time. Limited indoor seating so take out only during winter time.

Always SO happy to go to Bar Dough! 

My Top Recommendations: Meatballs, Chicken Entree, and the Squid Ink Pasta

 Service is always top notch, the happy hour is basic, but delicious (Try the house red!), and the vibe is great. 

I highly reccomend Bar Dough!

This place seemed like a good restaurant. I would have been able to access it better had I gotten the opportunity to eat there. It seemed promising; the place was full, it was a bright open room, and it looked like it had a good atmosphere. 

My friend from Denver made reservations for 5 of us to eat here. When we arrived they said we were late for our reservation and they had a policy. After talking to them they realized that we did make it by our time. (We made reservations at 8:40 which is a little different) At any rate, we waited another 50 minutes before deciding to leave. As we left the group behind us was seated right away. I'm not sure what happened there. 

I'm giving a 1 star for not coming close to their reservation time. I'll give another star because the hostess was very nice and offered drinks while we waited. Too bad we didn't get to try the food.

Terrible experience here. Although we made a reservation and the place was quite empty we were seated at "the chef's table." I've sat at chef's tables before, but this was a poor excuse for one. It was so hot and looked directly into the pizza oven, therefore there were no chefs to be seen. 

While eating a fly landed in my meal, resulting in me not wanting to eat it. When the waiter noticed I had a full plate of food I wasn't eating he asked what was wrong. I pointed to the bug. He proceeded to take my knife, fling the bug away (it landed on the table), and say "that's better, out of sight, out of mind." I have NEVER experienced something like this in a restaurant! This sounds like something my grandmother would've done while eating at the family farm. No offer to replace the food and no apology for grabbing my silverware to flick the bug away. 

Outside of the bug incident, the food took a very long time. We ordered appetizers and a pizza, and we were are Bar Dough for 1 hour and 45 minutes. That seemed like quite a long time to be sitting and waiting for each course. 

Finally, when the waiter came and got our bill, we asked him to split it based on what we ordered (my friend ordered more drinks). He instead split it down the middle, which was pretty careless of him. 

From a food perspective, it was good. I've had much better pizza elsewhere, but their appetizers were interesting.

I heard about Bar Dough cause one of the chefs was in an Uber Pool with us. Like he promised, the seasonal risotto with a red wine reduction, mushrooms, & duck sausage was awesome! The side of ranch meatballs (not like ranch dressing, like cattle ranch, I think) were on the salty side, but good. The spicy clam pizza was unimpressive - the dough is too thin to support the weight of the ingredients & it needs some kind of drizzle to add some flavor to what otherwise tastes like Parmesan & clams. Gordon Ramsay would throw a huge fit if he came in that kitchen & saw these pizzas.

Bar Dough is a beautiful touch for this neighborhood! The restaurant is clean, modern, and cozy. I immediately noticed the white & red interior which looked very sleek and classy. Their bar is gorgeous, it looked like white marble. This place can get pretty busy, so making a reservation is recommended. 

They have an extensive & great beer, cocktail, and wine menu. My friends and I shared a bottle of lambrusco which was so so good! If you've never had lambrusco, it's sparkling red wine and I haven't met one person who didn't like it!

We heard their garlic bread was addicting so we gave it a try but unfortunately, we were not too impressed. I think they went wrong with using focaccia. The slices were very thick so it was hard to take a bite. And the bread was so fluffy. When I think garlic bread, I think buttery, crunchy, slices. Not fluffy, soft, giant focaccia muffins.

However, their pizzas were delicious and perfect for sharing! We shared the Margherita pizza & the Spicy 2.0 pizza. Both tasted fresh, with quality ingredients. The pizza sauce was very tasty and the crust was perfectly light and crunchy. They also gave us a bottle of chili oil to drizzle over our pizza which increased the flavor! Oh, and their Oven Roasted Carrots from the appetizer menu was out of this world! We don't even like carrots that much, but this dish blew us all away. The carrots were roasted perfectly, and the cumin vinaigrette and pine nuts gave the dish a very unique flavor. We were all fighting for the last bite!

The only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 was because the service was slow. We felt like our server disappeared a lot, for long periods of time even though the restaurant was only 60% busy. Their garlic bread was a bit of a let down. And we also tried their 7x ranch meatballs which tasted pretty dry. Other than that, we enjoyed our dinner here!

The hubs and I came here as a last minute decision on a Sunday morning. As such we didn't have reservations so took a seat at the bar. Service was slammed so we did have a little bit of scattered service but it was always friendly. 

We started with drinks; coffee for him and a mimosa for me. I love love that they use prosecco in their mimosas rather than champagne. Totally delicious. 

The tempura avocado BLT sandwich had my name all over it. Fried avocado is a sinful treat that I cannot deny myself when I see it on a menu. I'm sure the salad that came on the side negates the fried component. The hubs went with the eggs Benedict dish. He was satisfied except the spicy jalapeño bread wasn't and he didn't get the heat he wanted from that. We shared the summer polenta and wow, that was some incredible polenta. I would just eat bowl after bowl of that if given the chance. 

Overall this is a dangerous ten minutes from our house so I have no doubt we will be exploring more of the menu.

Bar Dough is outstanding. 

I went early on a Friday night and sat at the bar. We had outstanding service from Sasha, who had great recommendations on food and drink. They have a strong beverage program, which begins with aperitif-style spritzes, continues with a strong wine program and ends with a good variety of digestifs. I heartily recommend the Aperol spritz before dinner and having an Amaro Nonino with dessert.

On to the food!

Their octopus appetizer is currently the best restaurant dish I've had in 2016. The octopus was boiled then grilled, so it's tender and crisp. Paring that with eggplant caponata and crisp fresh celery was quite creative. If you're an octopus fan, you must get this!

We also shared a pasta, the bucatini. There's nothing better than mixing a perfectly poached egg into a great bowl of pasta. The side of meatballs (made with ground chuck, pork belly and pancetta!) were quite good. 

You could go to Bar Dough and skip the pizza because the rest of the menu is so strong, but I wouldn't recommend it. We had the Signore Bianco pizza. I normally don't gravitate towards white pizza too frequently, but this one was too interesting to pass up. It featured creamed leeks as the dominant flavor while olives, pickled fresno chiles and stracciatella cheese were fantastic supporting flavors.

I'll definitely be back to Bar Dough soon, and I look forward to bringing friends and family.

I stopped by for a quick meal while in the area, and it was a bit late in the evening, but I had 
the smoked mushroom without onions for myself since they unfortunately were only making pizzas at that hour. It was a solid pizza, with fresh toppings and made on very good bread, although I wished that there were a few more toppings. If back in the area, I'd definitely try to stop by and try other dishes.

Ever since I came here I've been craving Tiramisu and its been almost 2 week... The entrees are just as amazing! Every bite felt like an orgasm that kept you begging for more. 

The braised lamb shank was some of the most tender meast I have ever had the pleasure of eating, while the Margherita pizza here was by far the best one I have ever tasted. Cooked in a wood fired oven the pizza was cooked to near perfection. I honestly think I could have eaten 3 pizzas by myself. To my favorite part, dessert. There are simply no words to describe it, I've ordered Tiramisu from 5 star restaurants to hole in the wall places and cannot remember having one taste quiet this good. By far the highlight of my night and I will definitely be back for more.

Food aside the service was also second to none. With my friend having nut allergies the waiter went completely out of his way to accommodate for her, regularly checking in and made great conversation. 

This is definitely now one favorite restaurants however I will say this place gets very loud so might not be the best place for a first date.

We visited Bar Dough based on an Open Table recommendation as unfortunately it didn't appear in my first YELP search. I'm glad we discovered this modern restaurant. The pizza oven wasn't working when we visited but the staff was sure to let me know once I made the reservation via Open Table which I appreciated. 

We made it in time for happy hour which was a great way to start our evening. The garlic bread wasn't as hot as I'd like it, room temp bread, but maybe this was because they were having kitchen issues. 

I can't remember the details of what we ordered as I'm writing this a few days later but I will say we all really enjoyed our pasta (they offer half and large sizes) and our server was great- he offered to explain anything on the menu (I'll be honest, I didn't know what "speck" was) and asked whether we had any food allergies which I've NEVER been asked before.

We will visit again to try the pizza.

Of course this place is all about pizza and pasta - hence the name. For a girl who avoids wheat and dairy I was worried when a friend picked this hip spot. Never fear! I had an amazing meal that was so yummy and gluten free. 
Olives, shisito peppers (cheese sauce on the side), sunchokes and the most delicious ribeye (split between two meat hungry ladies). Yum. I will be back if I'm in the area - maybe there's a gluten free way to sample some of those yummy pastas...

I love brunch and this is one of the best brunches I had in awhile! We had a spot on the patio, and I loved the people watching and summer sun. I went before the recent revamp on their brunch menu, so drinks weren't bottomless, but I enjoyed a bloody mary. The brunch menu is small (I think they've added more options when they redid it,) but everyone in my group was happy with their food. I couldn't resist ordering a pizza because obviously pizza at 10 am is necessary. The signore bianco was so good. The combination of onion, olives, and peppers led was the perfect mix of salty and spicy. I completely get what the hype was about, and can't wait to come back and sample more of the menu. Especially now that they have bottomless mimosas!

I LOVE THIS PLACE!  Such an amazing addition to the neighborhood.  Chef Max, Manager Steve and the staff have really put together an amazing spot. The wood fire oven is NO joke and the pizzas are delicious. And so is everything else. They truly have mastered the idea of "elevated Italian". Here's what we had the delight to taste during the meal:
Meatballs (HELLO, IT HAS PANCETTA IN IT!)
Brassicas (perfect light blend antipasto)
Garlic squid - super tasty & the fennel was the perfect accent
Tagliatelle - again with the pancetta.. AND CLAMS
Pappardelle - excellent bolognese
Garlic bread - homemade foccacia - party in the mouth
3 cheese Pizza - so light and delicate - perfect crispy crust
Mountain Man pizza - this is a busy pizza but i LOVED it and the calabrian chile honey drizzle is the best!

I have to review my previous review and send an apology after my last dining experience. Bar Dough made me feel like a complete hypocrite. From the moment we walked in to the end of our meal, I was blown away. Ambiance, food, and the hospitality were tremendous.

Was able to grab two seats at the bar last Friday and was greeted by tremendous service from our bartender and the general manager Juan. These two seemed to go above and beyond to make sure our meal was desirable. Pretty sure that's just the level of service they bring to the table night in and night out. Kudos to them.  

-Caprese:  Tomato escabeche set this dish a part, may have been the freshest tomatoes I've tasted in Colorado. This caprese is unlike any other you've tried. Order this! 

-Carne Crudo: The beautiful presentation was only matched by the taste.
