-Bucatini & 7X Ranch Meatballs: My mom is constantly on the hunt for tremendous bucatini, I've already made reservations for her trip this month because I know she will fall in love with Bar Dough's rendition. House made pasta done to perfection. 

-Pollo al Limone: The most divine dish I've had in Denver. I may request this as my death row last meal. 

Booked a reservation the following morning to bring my entire family when they visit. Not sure I'll be able to make it that long.

Great artisanal pizza! 
And my wife says the tiramisu is the best desert she's ever had, EVER!

Bar Dough is my new favorite restaurant in Denver.  I have gushed about a lot and cannot wait for my fourth visit.  Each visit, the food has been a star.  Even with my vegetarian friend, options were aplenty.  The scratch offerings are well executed and smart.  The pasta is housemade and delicious.  It's hard not to order the bucatini.  Don't forget the roast carrots to start: puffed farro?  Yes please!  The mains are great, and the pizza is scrumptious.  Try the mushroom or leek ones!  The cocktail program is smart and simple.  The gin drink is awesome.  Most times the service is unassuming and on point.  Do yourself a favor and dine here, and do it often.

Visited here during our Vaca and decided to stop in. It  was absolutely amazing. The lamb shank was perfect! Got a side of sunchokes as well which was delicious! Paired along the blanco house wine and it was a dinner to remember. Hospitality and atmosphere were everything you want in a place. Will be back on my next visit.

We went at 12:15 PM on a Sunday. All  week I had been looking forward to choosing from one of their delicious sounding pasta options. Unfortunately, you can only have brunch on Sunday afternoon. It was frustrating because it was well past what I consider "brunch time." The brunch menu offered one pasta option which included a runny egg, which I'm not a fan of. I ordered a pizza that was really good but I still left a bit disappointed. My friend had a tempura fried avocado BLT situation that she said was really good as well. So obviously there wasn't a problem with the food, but I was slightly annoyed that even at 12:15 I couldn't have "lunch" food. First world problems.

I had a chance to sneak in on opening night (as a paying customer, not a guest). We had a group of 7, and it did take a bit to get a table, but we hung out next door at HTB so nobody minded.

At the waiter's suggestion, we dined "family" style. Starting with pizzas, don't miss the clam. Trust me. The spicy meat pizza was also solid, but the clam is what you need to drive across town for. Also the crust is maybe the best in Denver. 

Small plates: meatballs are phenomenal, as was the straccietta (which is burrata. I could live on burrata, and this one is amazing). 

We had a mash-up of entrees: pasta with clams, prawns, tortellini, and meat skewers. I was hesitant to order the skewers (it just didn't sound "italian" enough to me), but it may have been the best dish on the menu. 

The wine list was well-crafted and affordable; the service was very solid. All around great addition to the 'hood.

Items Ordered:
Margherita - tomato, basil, fresh mozzarella
Meatball Sangwich - chuck, pork belly & pancetta, crushed tomato, pecorino, mozzarella open-face on focaccia
Mezzaluna - butternut squash, pickled red kuri squash, pinenut & raisin agrodulce
Polenta - fontina, butter, corn
Budino Tiramisu - mascarpone mousse, espresso soaked lady fingers & chocolate chunks, almonds
Pumpkin Seed Brittle Gelato

Recently opened on West 32nd Avenue with a Modern Italian focus and highly praised Happy Hour beginning at 3pm, Bar Dough from Max MacKissock seemed like  perfect place to kick off Wednesday evening, particularly with  Williams & Graham just down the street and an Avalanche game at Pepsi Center beginning at eight o'clock.

No doubt an anticipated opening, the Chef a known entity with several previous local restaurants seeing varying levels of success across the years, entry to Bar Dough presents patrons with pleasant hostess at a podium lined with Chris Bianco's canned tomatoes, the focus on product immediately evident even before seating or perusing the menu.

Long and narrow up front, seating at the bar divided from banquets by long communal high-tops, a look at Bar Dough's interior speaks of a minimalist approach and with retro music playing overhead the food and beverage takes a look at Italy by regions, the happy hour a veritable bargain with the full menu offered from 5:00pm till close 

Perhaps a bit too hip in terms of service, the young man assigned my table keen on words such as "awesome" and "bro," orders were batched as not to overwhelm the table and starting with an open-face Meatball "Sangwich" the value early arrival was immediately evident, just $7 exchanged for two sizable balls of beef, pork belly and pancetta with almost no binder atop crispy, dense focaccia drenched in crushed tomatoes and a bubbling layer of pecorino plus mozzarella.

Deeply discounting a competent Margherita that saw a bit less rise to the crust than I would prefer, despite a good blister and taste, far more intrigue was offered by the subsequent round of polenta and pasta, the former lent great crunch by dehydrated kernels juxtaposing butter and Fontina while each handmade pocket of Butternut Squash was exceedingly delicate with bright acidity added by pickled red kuri squash and a lightly sweetened sauce of vinegar and raisins.

Oversold by the server on "Pumpkin Seed Brittle" Gelato that tasted like little more than vanilla with unsalted pepitas chopped into the mix, those looking for a sweet ending are encouraged to instead trust rumors of the city's best ladyfingers, each espresso soaked bite enriched by creamy mascarpone in a dish that lives up to hybrid naming by harkening both pudding and Tiramisu.

I enjoyed my meal at bar dough. The appetizers were really prepared with fresh ingredients. Especially the kale salad. My pasta was also really good. The meatballs however lacked flavor and were dry. Overall great meal. However, the one thing I would change is the music being so loud. Having a nice meal does not need to include wu tang clan at full volume.

Speechless, because speaking can't be heard

My husband and I are foodies and we live a block away from this fun little spot. Food- great but service to deliver is SLOW... It took almost an hour to get to our meal. The food was fantastic and the wine prices very reasonable. Bright vibrant atmosphere. The downside- you can't tell your dinner mates anything about your meal until you leave. It is SO NOISY!! The cemet floors and high ceilings make for an awkward screaming match or a creepy staring contest with others. Sign language lessons with the appetizer menu might be a great addition. I won't go back due to the noise level but we might get it to go...

This place is a MUST if you are in the Highlands area. Service was too notch! Couldn't have got any better. My husband had the Grilled Octopus (A+) and I enjoyed a fabulous Caprese (Yes Please!) Followed by a fantastic Chocolate Torts we shared along with perfect, Contratto Aperitif's. 

Overall experience was all we expected and more. We have found a new Highlands Fav!!

Went here to have dinner with a friend the other night and finally tried the food.  I've been here before for a glass of wine, but had never had a meal.  I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was.  We had a hummus and garlic appetizer which was awesome.  Make sure you like garlic before ordering though - it's definitely a garlicky dish.  We shared a mushroom and balsamic pizza that was also great.  I'll definitely be back for food again.
The bar staff here is awesome. Especially Sasha. She was spot on about what to order as far as food and drinks. The food was amazing. The Commendatore pizza was fantastic.

Not really sure what all the hype is about. There was nothing wrong with my experience, it just sort of met my expectations and nothing more. Our server was on the slow roll for most of the evening although he was able to honor my request for a spicy cocktail. It was also really expensive. Again, nothing wrong with my experience just nothing special.

This is by far one of our favorite restaurants in all of Denver. We had been meaning to go since they were open but every time we went it was packed. We were lucky enough that tonight they had an opening at their bar. Everything is brand new, of course and they have 2 tvs. Chase, one of the bartenders, greeted us immediately as we sat down and explained to us the menu. We ended up ordering the lamb with a side of polenta as well as the spicy pizza (which was recommended to us from the manager of highland tap [next door]). The lamb was the best lamb we have had in Denver. It's fall off the bone! The polenta was delicious as well and went perfectly with it. The pizza was amazing- thin and crispy! And of course I had to have desert. The tiramisu was light and crispy- they definitely took a classic and made it modern. We cannot wait to come back for happy hour and dinner again!

Girl's night dinner and dranks took place at Bar Dough this past Friday. Friend and I had an 8:30 reservation, walked in, place was popping off. Crowded to the brim, 3 people deep at the bar, minimum 45 minute wait for the two girls who naively assumed they'd get a table. Highly advise you to call ahead to make a reservation. 

Ordered the octopus for the starter, half plate of pappardelle, and the commendatore (tongue twister) pizza. A+ for our server's octopus reco, charred and not chewy, a slightly sweet mention from the eggplant, pistachios for texture. Is there anything better than a plate of pappardelle in lamb bolognese? Al dente noodles, flavorful and hearty meat sauce to beat back the cold winter chills. Our tummies were regretfully full by the time we got to the pizza but the one slice that we each ate thoroughly satisfied our inner meat (and garlic/bad breath) lover. 

Our server was incredibly attentive and sported one of the most impressive and well groomed beards I've ever seen. Place is a little loud but no matter, business is good. Couples galore sprinkled around the space so I assume it's a popular date spot. Come share a few plates with an SO or a group of friends, Bar Dough guarantees a good night.

Hot and new is an understatement for Bar Dough, the perfect evening meal on a cold Denver winter's eve. 

The interior is sleek and modern, an upscale Italian eatery. No you will not find red, green and white flags anywhere or mosaics on the wall depicting a vineyard or gondola ride. Not that I mind the latter, but Bar Dough is a bit more upscale that a traditional Italian joint.

Getting a table without a reservation was easy on a Friday night. It was also pretty early (before 7 pm) and the week after New Year's, when a lot of folks are still trying to commit to resolutions and the sun sets before 5 pm. 

Happy hour looks appealing, but my +1 and I were in it to win it in terms of ordering. We each tried the $40 tasting menu, which is served family style. Three courses of food served family style to be accurate. This included garlic bread, meatballs, arugula salad, pappardelle pasta, bucatini, scampi and lemon chicken. Granted, the portions were smaller but that was a good thing! There's no way two people could eat that much... we even took home leftovers that were just as good the next day.

Also, try the house red wine or a limoncello spritz since there are several to choose from. The grapefruit/basil sprits is quite refreshing!

Welcome to the neighborhood, Bar Dough!

Despite what many might expect, Denver is KILLING IT in the pizza department. There is so much good pizza to be had.

We were looking for a late-night meal, and I'd heard good things. I went in expecting a pizza shop, but this is so much more. I didn't realize it was a full-on Italian restaurant.

We had some delicious olives, good cocktails, and pizza. Since it was my first visit I tried a classic margherita pizza. Everything about it was great, but I was especially impressed by the dough. Thin but not a cracker. Chewy, a bit sour, but still light. It was delicious. 

I can't wait to go back to try the rest of the menu.

The name says it all "bar".  At 6:00 this place feels like a bar.  The music was turned up and guests got louder because they had to hell over the music. Not the best atmosphere for dropping over $$$ on dinner.  As for the food, it was great.  The service was also great as well even though we sat at the bar.  The main reason for 3 stars is because it got so loud all I could think about was leaving.  Too bad I really liked the food and the Italian sodas.

Went here last night at the suggestion of a friend... Upon entering, the place is adorable. Great lighting, nice subway tiling, wonderful set-up and the staff was incredibly friendly from the start! 

I started with a spritzer... which they make with limoncello and prosecco. I asked the server if the lemon basil would be too sweet, and he explained the taste perfectly in terms that I could make a legit decision. It's such a good drink I had to have 2 (ok fine, 3). Their happy hour menu is stellar, and incredibly well priced. We ordered the pizza margherita and it was huge! Huge in the best way possible, all for 6 dollars! I cannot believe it! We ordered the olives as well. Tasty and well-seasoned. Finally, we chose the meatball sandwich sans bread... absolutely mouth watering. 4 drinks, 5 apps, all for under $50. The place started out a little emptier when I first arrived at 4, but by the time we left it was hoppin and the crowd was diverse... there were couples, young peeps, older peeps, families, etc. 

i cannot wait to go back!

Came here for brunch on a sunny Sunday and sat on the patio.  They have a great drink menu and I couldn't decide which beer to get.  Our server was kind enough to bring me some tasters.  

We ordered the meatball appetizer to start and so began our amazing experience.  

For lunch we had the Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder.  It had lots of flavor and was perfect.  We even saved room for some dessert.  Chocolate cake that was rich and yummy.

We moved to the bar as the sun went down and the bartenders are the nicest I have ever met.  They even gave us a sample of their house made Limóncello.  It was divine. 

Such a wonderful place, I can't wait to come back.

Sat at the bar with a group of friends before an Avs game. The bartender was great and very attentive. Beer list wasn't extensive, but for my friends drinking cocktails/wine it was exceptional. 

I had the Commendatore pizza which was amazing. The fennel sausage and prosciutto worked great together with the garlic oil. The pizza was filling for one person.

Loved the decor but it is really loud.  They could benefit from some sound absorption textiles.  Service was great throughout the meal. It took a long time to get our food.  My favorite app was the carrots and farrow - delicious.  I had the gnocceti which was like French onion soup in a bowl with pasta.  It was good but very rich with the short ribs but I would get it again. We were too full for dessert!  Note: parking is terrible so plan ahead!

Perfect first date night venue! The food is spectacular! Potions are the perfect size for sharing a few apps and an an entree! 

Our food suggestions:
*Appetizer
Verde - arugula, goat Gouda, lemon and olive oil salad
Brassicas - charred broccoli, Brussels sprouts, pecorino and apple! (OUT OF THIS WORLD)
Coppa Di Testa - sliced pork, charred frisée, lemon dressing, and parsley
* Main course
Pappardelle - lamb Bolognese with pecorino
Pollo Al Limone - pan seared farm chicken with an incredible pan sauce! 

Our bartender, Devon.. Incredible service! Spot on with suggestions and very attentive!

This is the best and most creative Italian food that I have had anywhere in a long time.  Love the roasted carrots, all of the pastas are incredible, desserts were great, and loved the house wine on tap.  

I may take that two-hour flight from Austin to Denver more often simply to eat at Bar Dough.  Really hope that this place sticks around.  I did ask my server about the ingredients that went into the dishes.  That way I can try to make them at home.

I spent all week in Aspen, and I was kind of bored of the menus at the restaurants in Aspen - nothing creative.  But Bar Dough on my way out on a plane was the best menu of all.  Forget about Aspen restaurants.
Very expensive and very noisy but the carrot salad was nice. Served warm but should be served hot

Great place for happy hour. We had the grilled peppers, pizza Bianca, and pizza Margherita. All were great. Service was great and attentive as well. The meatball sandwich looked delicious as well. Will definitely come back for dinner to try the pasta options.

We LOVE Bar Dough! After hearing numerous amazing things about this new restaurant in Highlands, my wife and I had to give it a shot. 

The restaurant is both hip and cozy. They have many framed pictures of Brigitte Bardot, which is a clever play on words. 

We started off with an appetizer of their garlic bread, which was melt in your mouth tastey. We then split two pizzas: The Margherita and the 3X Cheese. Both were light and excellent. 

If you're looking for great pizza in a cool setting, check out Bar Dough!

I'd give it five - but my hubby didn't love it.
He picked the wrong dish and he wasn't proud of it.
I picked lamb shank, served for a cave man.
He picked the tagliatelle, just want a fan.
The octopus app was so out of this world.
And I grinned from the Italian wine as I swirled.
A laid back atmosphere in our causal town.
But quite nice enough for a suit or a gown.

So, Bar dough: four stars -almost five- for you...
I promise to come back for another review!

The first time I came here I really enjoyed this place. Second time the menu changed up a bit. I thought it's kinda pricey for pan seared and a lamb shank. Didn't know everything was ala cart, but it definitely was not worth the money.  Their happy hour items and pizzas are good.  I enjoyed the grilled octopus, margarita pizza, and meatballs on the first visit.

I would give Bar Dough a higher rating if not for the fact that it is so... over-rated.  The reviews you read have you ready for a life-changing Italian eating experience.  This was not the case.

1) The earliest reservation I could get was 9:00 pm for a party of four, but when we arrived there were an abundance of empty tables.  I was also told by the hostess that my table wouldn't be ready for about 10 more minutes, despite the fact that half of my party was already seated there.

2) Bar Dough as been praised as one of the best pizza places in Denver, so we focused on that.  However, the pizza menu was very limited and disappointing.  The margarita was a dry and flat pizza with little more than crust and tomato sauce.  The Commendatore had some great flavors, but was so greasy that I did not finish it.  The only pizza that really impressed me was the Smoked Mushroom.

3) While the food is ok (and I would be interested in trying their non-pizza menu offerings) I don't think it's nearly good enough to justify the prices, the hype, or the difficulty in getting a table.  There are plenty of Italian/Pizza places with superior food, better value, and less hassle.  They just aren't as hip.

Came here because a friend recommended it as a place to eat before visiting Williams and Graham down the street. 

Sat promptly even though they were quite busy. Have a cute patio as well. Service was friendly. Had the Margherita pizza and tasted very fresh. 

My only complaint, confusion really, was what these guys are going for atmosphere wise. Everyone is dressed up and the space is classy. But they were playing some crazy rap. Just not sure how I felt about that.

Love love love this place! Amazing food, drinks and staff. And they always play awesome music (Tribe Called Quest, Mos Def, Talib Kwali, etc.) Clean, stylish, and easy atmosphere and draws a very diverse crowd. I always enjoy hanging out here

It doesn't matter who I am. All that matters is this place. This is the only thing that matters in my life. 

My family is in shambles, so when I stepped into the loving arms of this restaurant I was hoping for a miracle. Well, let me tell you first, this place is a miracle embodied in pizza form. Not only pizza form, but meatball form, prawn form, toasted bread form and hospitable owner named 'Juan' form. 

With each bite of their four cheese pizza I forgot about all that troubled me so. My ex wife, GONE from memory after my first slice. My teenage son who huffs paint, a smudge in my imagination after those meatballs. After such a euphoric experience  I had to ask my waiter to pinch me, I was sure it was a dream. But no, it was just a wonderful meal at my new favorite place in the entire world. 

Later that night I walked home and looked at the moon, I've never seen it look so beautiful. Maybe this life isn't so bad after all.

"Wow", were the first words I experienced at Bar Dough. Not because of the amazing food or the amazing service, but because of the extremely long wait for below average food. 

Meatballs - tasty, but overly average with minimal sauce 
Garlic Bread - amazing definitely order!
Margarita Pizza - why do they even include on the menu?! Extreme amount of sauce with very little mozzarella or basil. How do you mess this up?!
Pappardelle - heavy emphasis on meat in the meat sauce, but nothing near a pappardelle bolognese I would expect for the time and money

Ambience - someone needs to help! The immediate vibe is diner plopped into the middle of LoHi. Bright light with awkward red leather benches. Take it down a notch all around!

Not sure how or why this is rated the top spot right now in Denver. For all that read this, please check out Il Posto or Luca D'Italia for true Italian. Same price. And better experience. If you're into the top spots of Denver because Eater or 5280 was paid to say so, keep on keepin on with Bar Dough.

I was so excited to try out Bar Dough as I had heard great things. Unfortunately, it turned out to be way over-hyped.

The food itself was great, but it was difficult to focus on that as the service was absolutely terrible. Our server gave us little to no insight into the menu, with no knowledge (or perhaps willingess to share) about the dishes they offered. Our service was slow, sloppy, and ruined this restaurant for us.

You can't let the food speak for itself when the service is speaking louder...

Just fantastic!  Very lively atmosphere and a varied menu.  Service was tremendous as well.

Had the hand made pasta, meatballs and pollo, which was divine!   It gets very crowded, as its in a trendy new neighborhood so get a reservation!
Tried the family meal for two, great food/portions and attentive service. Pasta was good. House wine blend was great. Gets crowded quick so get there early or make reservations.

Had a fabulous dinner . The atmosphere was comfortable and sophisticated, servers were friendly, helpful and professional.  We shared the yummy caprese salad and the signore Bianca pizza between the 5 of us for starters.  I ordered the pollo al limone, was hesitant because it was a chicken dish and the pastas looked incredible.  It was the best chicken I have ever tasted,  I am craving  it and have been thinking about it ever since.  Cooked to perfection with a delicate lemon sauce. Debating whether to write to Bon Apetit so that they will publish the recipe.  We shared the tiramisu , Zeppoli, and the chocolate torta .  We gobbled them up to.
Lively atmosphere in a hip neighborhood. Good service and outstanding food! Not your typical (American) Italian fare much closer what you find in a trattoria in bella Italia.

We went here on a Saturday for my mom's bday. Our waitress, Ashley was fantastic. They have a great wine selection from which we ordered two bottles. Both were delicious.
We started out with the grilled octopus which was done perfectly and had great accompanying sauces.
I got the half portion of the pappardelle (lamb bolognese). The half portions are perfect for one. The sauce was effing amazing. The pasta sadly felt like it had been overworked and was entirely too thick.
My mom got the tagliatelle. The pasta was more successful though some of it had glued together even with visible flour trying to keep it from doing the opposite. I guess when I see an item involving clams, I kind of want a few whole clams in shells for presentation. The clams were chopped so finely, I felt like they got a bit lost. The dish was a bit blah. I did have to admire the knife cuts though, lol.
My husband got the braised lamb shank which was hands down the winner. It was fall off the bone tender and the flavor was out of this world.
For dessert we got the fried dough and a trio of gelato (olive oil, pistachio, and caribbean chocolate). The fried dough was good. My mom loved it. The olive oil gelato made me sad because I wanted it to be awesome, but unfortunately it tasted like the oil was rancid oil. The pistachio was SO good (my fav) with the chocolate in second (my hubs fav).
This place was nice, crazy busy, and I will definitely go back despite the occasional misses. Its only been open since Oct, so I could see it working through the occasional issue. I'd love to scope out the happy hour.
Also, on a side note, a fellow seated at our community table paid for our entire table and told us to pay it forward. It was overwhelming, but made this experience all the better. We have started our pay it forward journey and maybe just reading this might inspire others to do the same.

This is a fun place with solid food but there are a few things that turned an otherwise  4 star rating to a 3 by the end of the night:

1) lighting was a bit too bright and wasn't dimmed until later in the evening
2) the music seemed to compete with everyone trying to have conversations over dinner and we found ourselves having to talk pretty loudly to be heard over the music
3) the dishes were hit or miss: 
- brassicas was a great veggie app with broccoli, brussels sprouts, pumpkin seeds, pecorino, and a flavorful brown butter vinaigrette
- meatballs were tasty with a mixture of chuck, pork belly and pancetta with a crushed tomato sauce, I would recommend these!
- garlic bread was soooo good and went really well with the meatballs so get both!
- pappardelle with lamb wasn't bad. our friends thought the rosemary was a bit strong in this
- butternut squash ravioli which was pretty disappointing. the sage was really overwhelming and since it wasn't finely minced, you would get a big piece in your mouth which would leave a bitter taste in your mouth. I love herbs in general but sage has a very strong and distinct flavor and it really overpowered the delicate ravioli so it did not feel like an appropriate addition.
- margherita pizza was really fresh, good sauce and a nice crunchy crust
4) the prices for these small plates and the wine really started to add up. overall, we were surprised at the bill and this would deter me from going to bar dough more often. 

We appreciated being able to taste the wine before ordering a glass so we all got what we wanted. We were too full for dessert but I bet the tiramisu is great!

Amazing homemade pasta and great ambiance for a casual Italian dinner night. Loved the open kitchen and imported brick oven. Service was great. There's black and white TVs on the walls which was a little odd but it worked. I would definitely recommend this as a casual weeknight dinner spot for pasta and pizza foodies.

Bar Dough is an amazing food experience.  I say experience because the chefs there are artists.  The bar is wonderful, the staff is noticeably passionate. Dishes with so many great complimenting flavors and incredible pizza and deserts make this restaurant one of the best I have ever had the pleasure of dining at.  

My favorite dishes:
Bucatini Cacio e Pepe
Fava Bean Toast
Smoked mushroom pizza
Chocolate torta

Loved the atmosphere reminds of being home in chicago...lively and yummy..the owner Juan and Brad congrats and thank you for bringing such an amazing place to eat and meet great folks...Maggie are waitress was fricken amazing..very knowledgeable of the food and wine..not to get to wordy..come see for yourself. .I promise you will meet someone new and enjoy a fantastic meal and drinks...hope to see you there one day..

We had lunch today in this beautiful new modern restaurant. One salad each and a pizza shared by two was a perfect amount of food for two big eaters. I eat a lot of salads but the tricalore was an amazing new unique creation of spicy, savory, and just a few punctuations of sweet. The salad had a mixture of red lettuces, shishito peppers, cauliflower, cantaloupe and honey. I loved that salad. The pizza was also amazing: crisp, thin crust topped with sausage and broccoli. D E L I C I O U S!!! Great service and a fairly priced meal.

I came here on a Friday night around 7:45 and the wait was over an hour so we decided to sit at the bar. So I highly recommend making a reservation. My boyfriend had the white wine on tap, which was really good. We ordered the bucatini and margarita pizza to share. The home-made pasta was amazing! Highly recommended. The pizza was also super great, can't go wrong. The only problem we had was the noise as it was difficult to hear (but it was a busy Friday night). The food was a total hit though!

Bar Dough has absolutely delicious pizza. I think it's the Italian pizza oven. Really unique ingredients and superthin perfect dough. They also have excellent appetizers. The fried peppers were amazing. And really delicious cocktails. A great place to go. Excellent dessert.

The bartender Chase is incredibly friendly and pours liberal glasses of wine. The waitress Maggie really knows the food. We had the octopus to start and then the sausage and broccoli pizza and the clam and prosciutto pasta. All of it was amazing. Make sure you get the chili oil sauce and pour it on everything! Very happy with the entire experience and so glad to have this new gem in our neighborhood.

This place just opened last week and I am already obsessed. I'm so thankful that it is just around the corner from my new house and I've been in three times in five days...! 
You'd never know that they are a brand new operation as service is fast and delightful and the food and wine superb. 
Thank you Bar Dough for being such a great new addition to the neighborhood!

This place is seriously amazing. Probably my new favorite restaurant in Denver.  The food was fantastic and original without being one of those places that tries too hard. We got the chicken, asparagus, and the bianca pizza with sausage added. All great. Service was top notch as well. James was charismatic and provided great insight to the menu with suggestions. Definitely make a reservation for this restaurant as they were still busy at 10PM!

Amazinnnnnng! I've never had such delicious garlic bread in my life. Doughey yet crisp and no cheese! I don't know how you make something taste so good without cheese. Mountain man pizza was a tasty and unique surprise, and the tagliatelle was TDF! I'm a tiramisu connoisseur, so when they first brought out all the desserts I thought they'd forgotten it. Nope! Just a fun twist on my favorite dessert, and it did not disappoint! Service was fast and friendly, and with the laid back, clean and open atmosphere I can't wait to return!

Great new spot in the Highlands! I like that they offer half sizes and full sizes. They say half sizes are considered "appetizers" but I think it was enough for a full dinner for 1. I had the lamb Bolognese it was delicious. I also enjoyed their wine on tap!!
Great pizza; drinks, and atmosphere. Very chill but not pretentious .  Classic Italian wine list, Homemade lemon cello. What more could you ask for?
Amazing food and staff!  The pasta and meatballs are to die for.  Get a reservation for the dinner soon!  I have a feeling they will be booked up once word gets out.

Good place for dinner with good food and a good bar. Definitely get the Garlic bread, it's freaking amazing. The clam pizza, while it sounds weird was very delicious. Nice place, very busy on a Tuesday. Crowded and loud music (because it's a bar), so don't stop here for an intimate Italian meal. Great place to grab small plates with friends.

Good food. Service was ok. Started with the Tricolore salad which was too sweet for me. Then had the Tagliarini pasta...amazing!!! The Signore Bianco pizza was also amazing!!! Would give 5 stars but it's so loud that I can't hear shit. Also I don't want to listen to Wu-Tang while I'm eating.

Brick oven pizza was superb, but the highlight of the night was the Tagliatelle!  So delicious.  Oh, the squid and octopus appetizers were amazing as well.  Wine selection is great as well.  Can't wait to come back.

Our first time visiting Bar Dough.  We sat outside, it was quieter.  Inside was Loud, and a basketball game was playing.  The server Ashley was fantastic, we hope to get her next time.  The Margherita pizza was very good.  There were no beer options outside of craft beer.  I loved my Pinot Grigio, but the Chardonay Blend (also house) was not worth $18 for a 9 ounce pour.  This is Highlands, not New York City, to justify that $ for a house wine.  We will go back, and try happy hour another time.

Delicious. We got the verde salad and meatballs to start, and the half garganelli for dinner. Perfect amount of food, and high quality too. We sat at the bar and service was great. No complaints here.

I met Katie and Juan through a mutual friend while enjoying some beers at Highland T&B next door.  

They were both SO friendly. Immediately my group was invited to take the grand tour which included some food and beverages at this sexy new hotspot.  It was immediately obvious that their menu was well above average.  

Before I left I even reserved the evening of my birthday the following week which Katie made sure was over the top.  

The service, food and mixology skills at this place are sure to impress even the harshest critics.  

Thanks Katie and Juan for another great lunch, dinner, and cocktail joint close by.  I'll be a regular.

I hate this place! As I said in my last review I'm on a quest for ethnic food, I'm sick of the foodie scene. I'm writing this review as I sit in the restaurant. Drunk girls are shouting basically in my ear next to me. I can't even think about enjoying a meal at this decimal. And again it's the $150 foodie nonsense. Yea a bunch of pasta and sauce that they throw some Italian or Spanish word into the menu and all of the sudden chef boyardee  is a $24 entree. 
Seriously why would anyone want to eat in a freaking nightclub? 
I compromised on here when the Indian place I picked was a bust. No way I can even try to eat with the noise level. 

Oh and the drunk girl keeps elbowing me in the ribs. As she's shouting at her friend. Wow this is lovely. And I tried a bite of my partners paperdelle, it's too salty and pasta is not very good. 
Omg I'm so sick of the millennial foodie scene. 

And now the bartender is woo hooing with the loud screaming elbow to my ribs girls sitting here. 

Bottom line...this is a club it is NOT a place to try to have a chill dinner. I'm running out as fast as I can.

We went here for a late lunch on Friday. They were just about to start happy hour ($6 margarita pizzas). We had meatballs (3 come in an order for ~$10)  an open faced eggplant sandwich with side salad (~$9), bucatini with vodka sauce (~$9/half order). The food was excellent, really good Italian food with high quality ingredients.The service was amazing. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and passionate. I recommend this place as I certainly will be coming back.

I think the food is great and has a fun atmosphere. We went there for the first time last night and ordered the coppa di testa, mountain man pizza and one of their $30 table wines.  I would have given it an extra star if we didn't have the service experience we had. When we got our bill, we were charged for the antipasto which was twice the price of the coppa di testa. We pointed out the error to our waiter and he said "that's how much it costs, I'll show you". I explained it wasn't the price that was an error, it was that we didn't order it at all. He just said ok and took $10 off our bill (which didn't even make up for the full difference). He never admitted his error, he just shamed us for not wanting to pay for what was apparently the antipasto platter and sent us on our way, which I didn't really appreciate. It will probably be a while before we go back.

The pasta dishes are amazing and I like the pizza as well.  It has a really nice bar.  The only thing I don't like is the communal seating on the restaurant side.  I also think it's strange to have pizza on the happy hour menu, when the prices are the same as the dinner menu.

Very unique pasta dishes. You won't find any standard and boring dishes around here. If you are looking for simple Italian food try some where else. The menu changes so it's a good place to keep coming back to with out getting sick of the food. I didn't try the pizza but it seemed to look amazing as it was coming out to other tables. Great wine selection. Busy atmosphere but very laid back. A few "regulars" we're sitting alone at the bar and the wait staff treated them like family. A good neighborhood restaurant where you can come eat amazing food and relax.

Bar Dough got voted one of Denver's top 15 new restaurants for 2015. So I was excited to spend a soon-to-be holiday dinner w friends at this new LoHi joint. We got seated immediately by a friendly staff (all staff were great!), and looked around at the amazing food! Definitely excited. We ordered a bottle of wine, garlic bread, ordered lamb pappardelle and a red sauce w guanciale pasta. That's when it went down hill. The bread came out 10 minutes before the food. When the food came out, only the pappardelle came out. We weren't going to eat without our friend, so we waited and waited. Eventually I called to our waiter to check on the food. It hadn't even been made. So our food sat and got cold. They brought him a salad and comped his meal, but it was another 10 before he got his food. Our food was pretty mediocre at that point. Re: the pappardelle, it had no distinct flavor, spice, salt, or seasoning. Nothing stood out. Too many noodles that were a bit too al dente. Noodles stuck to each other and created thicker noodle chunks as if the water wasn't salted, too much gluten in the water or something. Positive is that the portions are huge and the prices very reasonable for prime and secondi.

Atmosphere overall was nice, but the music was loud and out of place. It also changed tones halfway though the meal. It's like they aren't sure what they are trying to be.

Last point: my friend got food poisoning and has been sick for the last 5 hours off the pappardelle. He ate nothing else afterward or before.

This place is amazing!!!! The mushroom pizza was delicious as was the chicken liver appetizer. I have eaten in the restaurant as well as gotten takeout. Takeout was fast and the food was hot when I got home. The restaurant has a cozy ambience and is great for a girls night out or date night. The staff is extremely welcoming and friendly. I would eat here every week if I could! The drink list is creative and they have a lot to offer!

Excellent food and value. The lamb was amazing and the pizza is solid. Cocktails are overpriced but stick to beer and the damage won't be too bad. Sitting at the bar the service was excellent. Will definitely be back.
Very noisy.poor selection of wine. Good appetizers and dessert. But the entrees of pasta served lukewarm and not as tasty for the price.
Fantastic spot!  I've been 3 times and had perfect service each time.  (Shout out to Alex behind the bar!)  The pizza is perfection and pasta is insane.  A great Denver gem!

29JAN2016
Excellent service again. From waitress and runner.
It has become "muy popular". We got there are 1723 and it was crowded.

11DEC2015

4.49 stars truncated to 4 as it was my first visit.
You should eat and drink here; it is very good.

++ Our waitress: Ashley. Perfect. Knew the menu top to bottom. Made excellent recommendations. Timely. Efficient. Friendly. Skilled.

+ Happy Hour is 1430-1800 every day. Dinner menu starts at 1700, so I think you know when  to arrive.
+ Thick, large cloth napkins.
+ Hefty, good quality flatware.
+ Wi-Fi.
+ Tabletops are white synthetic quartz. Attractive and easy to keep clean.
+ Atmosphere. Brightly lit for us old farts. Very hip design. Open kitchen.
+ Food.
   A. Meatballs - $7 during HH. The tomato sauce had a very fresh taste. And, when I wanted/needed just 2 tablespoons more, I received them quickly and with a smile.
   B. Garlic bread - $3 for 3 pieces during HH. Powerful and mouth watering. Normally, I am not a fan of foccacia and prefer ciabatta, but this is very good.
   C. Verde salad - $8. Highest quality arugula. Sharp pecorino.
   D. Pappardelle with lamb bolognese - $19 for the large. (We brought some home.) Al dente egg noodles. Well balanced bolognese. Melded flavors.
+ House wine is decent. We had both the red and the white. HH price is OK.
+ Patio. The chairs are super comfortable. Looking forward to warm weather and working on my skin cancer.

0 Noise level. Quiet when the are no customers. Noisy when it is crowded.

- TVs. No reason to be in a food emporium as good as this one. You want to watch sports? Go next door to Highland Tap.
- Wine prices are a bit steep. $30 and up. No $30 bubbly. No rosé at all.
- Verde salad is overpriced by $1-2.

Difficult to believe this the same ownership as Highland Tap. This is delicious Italian-style food and way better service.
We enjoyed a great late-ish dinner here and enjoyed everything we ordered. Noticed a variety of vegetarian friendly menu items including their daily specials!
WOW!  Service,  food, atmosphere, creative, authentic.  Definitely going back and soon!
Service was poor, my boyfriend had to ask for his beer 3 times. Food was sub-par. Pizza was burnt on the edges and raw in the middle. I will never go back.

Excellent service, knowledgable staff, excellent food with an amazing 60's paris style bistro ambience- complete with modern movies played in black and white on their two televisions behind their fully stocked bar.

So glad for this new place in the neighborhood.  I've only been for happy hour and sat at the bar both times, but everything I've had is great.  The meatball "sandwich" was super tasty, and the margherita pizza for only $6 at happy hour is a steal.  Great atmosphere and the pizza oven is beautiful.

My friend and I visited this great lo hi spot as it was recommended a few times to us. We sat at the bar and I had the roasted chicken, delicious. Our bartender (Chase) was fab and service in general was great. And how can you not love a place that even plays great hip hop jams!? Some unknown person even picked up our tab which was totally awesome. I'm sill looking for this special mysterious person!
Meatballs! Let's start at the very beginning. And order garlic bread for the gravy if yous know what I'm saying.Love everything about the place. A great addition to the neighborhood!
Food was excellent. Don't even think about it - just get the Braised Lamb Shank, thing is ridiculous. Pasta and pizza here are my jam. Great service and good cocktails too (recommend No. 2).

A great funky little restaurant with an outstanding menu and carefully prepared food. I had the lamb shank and it was phenomenal. Friends had fresh pasta which they raved about but the pasts portions were modest.

When I heard another wood fired pizza place was opening in the hood, I thought "great the only thing we need less than another pizza place is another burger bar". 

The pizza was better than we expected, not as good as a Marco's but still solid pizza, even if the topping are a little on the scant side. 

While the pizza was good the other dishes did not meet expectations and the prices seemed to very high. At $12.00 the Tricalore salad was over dressed and lacking in freshness. 
We tried one pasta and that was enough. If you have not perfected homemade pasta then don't put it on the menu. What a disappointment. 

Great for a weeknight snack, but stick to the pizza.

I was so excited to try out Bar Dough. I had read all of the great reviews and knew that I needed to try it. Got there around 5:45 so we ordered a few items from the happy hour menu. The happy hour  wine and Margherita pizza were great - pizza was definitely the best thing we ordered all night. We also got the shishito peppers. I love shishito peppers but these came with a "fondue sauce" on top that hardened immediately and had a weird consistency - would not recommend. 

From the main menu we ordered the Brassicas Salad, Octopus appetizer, and Clam Tagliatelle. The Brassicas Salad had some great flavor but was incredibly oily. Biting into the broccoli released nearly a tablespoon of oil, which was overwhelming and unsatisfying. The octopus was okay; the sauce that accompanied the octopus dish was delicious, but the octopus itself was a little tough. However, the  most disappointing dish was the Tagliatelle, which was also the dish we were most excited for. Most of the noodles were stuck together, the sauce was way too salty and the clams had a very fishy flavor. The clams were also cut up in such small pieces that it was hard to discern where they were in the dish. 

I would recommend sticking to the pizzas. The staff was great and I liked sitting at the high-top counter, but unfortunately will not return to this place.

LOVE THIS PLACE! 
Their shrimp tempura roll is the best thing ever. Makes my stomach so happy.

I went for lunch. They have $1 pieces which suited my price point and allowed me to sample sushi I do not always get. The service and decor were great. The food quality was good and i left feeling like I had eaten some healthy chow. I am a sucker for small family owned businesses, and this appeared to be one. Their location is a bit of a business killer and so I hope they make it, as there are many ways they made this strip mall location feel authentic....green tea was great!
Ill be back and you should give it a go go!

This is not our go to place for great sushi. But we were invited to go with another couple and since we love sushi we decided to give it a try. When you walk in the layout is sort of strange, it is almost like it was two separate businesses at one point and they cut through the wall and now there are two dining areas. One area was full so we were sat in the other area and we were the only patrons in that area the entire time we were there.
The waitress let us know that the sushi chefs were pretty backed up and we needed to be patient. We were not in any hurry so that was fine. We ordered drinks: two sapporos and two glasses of wine. They don't have a great wine menu, it is mostly of the sutter home variety (or some similar low quality wine). 

We ordered 6 rolls and some happy hour nigiri which is $1 a piece. We definitely could have ordered more because none of us were full but I'm glad we didn't because when the check came it was $180. We didn't realize we had racked up such a bill. I thought the nigiri was great, it was a nice slice of fish. I liked about half of the rolls but some looked like it was topped with cat food or some other weird minced meat mixture. I don't think our meal was worth the price, we will probably stick to other places that we love.

One of the best sushi places we've been to. LOVE the Firecracker. Just had the Trainereck sooo good. We have tried many of their rolls and most have  been really good. Definitely recommend this place.

Most expensive, over priced sushi I have ever ordered!!!! They charge $50 for a pick up, no itemized receipt and the whole order fitted into 2 boxes?! These guys are an absolute con!!! At least four better sushi restaurants in the area that make this lot look awful, try those...

UPDATE - Just tried each role to see if I could update this bad review and honestly wanted to have my tail firmly between my legs in embarrassment, however as I thought... Really poor, no taste sushi! I really wouldn't recommend this place to anyone wanting to eat good food

Meh, I thought I was going to be really impressed by this place but it left me with a stale taste in my mouth. They have a great sushi selection and $1 nigiri during happy hour and when we went it seemed to be a two person team running the show. The decor is stale and uncomfortable, like Thavry said, very IKEA-esque.....and thats not a compliment.  It wasn't like gas station sushi but it wasn't anything I would recommend and and just wasn't as mind blowing as the reviews had me believe. The sushi didn't have a lot of taste and the fish tasted rubber-y at best. We ordered a couple of rolls and multiple pieces of nigiri but for price to value, I would definitely go elsewhere or pick up a ton at King Soopers since that's about the level it was on.

Now that I live in the Aurora area, I am excited to explore new restaurants that I have never been to or heard of.  Sushi Hana is one of them.  I was looking on Google to find a sushi place in the area and came across this one.  They are open late and offer $1 nigri.  I am in! We walked in and the place was dead. Not a soul in site except the two employees there. Many people complain about the decor being too Ikea ish, but I feel like it looks inviting and comfortable.  We were seated and saw the sign stating 2 for 1 sake on Monday through Thursday. Perfect! We ordered a couple of rolls, and a ton of nigri of yellowtail and salmon. Service was super fast. I know they didn't have anyone else to serve, but still felt like they were faster than normal. The sushi was good, maybe not the best, but still pretty fresh. We will definitely be back to try more rolls!
Very good sushi. Location is not the best, but the food more than makes up for it.

I went for my first time today, and will definitely be back! The location is perfect, close to my house. The prices don't seem bad for lunch either. 
For dinner I  ordered edamame, two specialty rolls-- two dragons & spicy shrimp, and a tall Sapporo, for $28. 
The rolls were wonderful, but I was disappointed in the edamame as I'm pretty sure I could see what was freezer burn on them. 
The staff was very nice and gracious, and the two handled their nice monday night rush with grace and smiles!

I have driven past this place many times but never trusted it would be good due to its location.  My usual go to sushi restaurant was closed for remodeling,  so I thought "what the heck."   I finally stopped in and I should have trusted my gut feeling.
First off, I am a sushi snob.  I love the stuff and eat it often.  Here my nigiri was anemic.  The portion size was laughable, and the rice was dry/old.  The spicy tuna roll was acceptable, but not spicy.  The miso soup was average at best, and the curry bowl was boring and uninspired. All that being said, the food was average to below average.
The service was prompt, and the waitress was friendly and attentive.  Unfortunately, great service does not make up for the food.

I read all the other reviewers comments and see that not everyone agrees on how good their experience was.  Mine was great.   But let me be specific.  I don't like raw anything, so I am all about the rolls.  The spider roll ( soft shell crab) was the best I have ever had.  ( compared to other places in my hood like the Golden Dragon, or Sonodas)   I also enjoyed their Dragon roll (eel) and the California roll.  Their ginger dressing is amazing on their salad, and they have cold Saki which I had never tried.  Delish!  It is also convenient to home and work, so I will definitely be back.

This sushi is pretty average.  Nothing we ordered really wowed us, but the service was great, the prices were reasonable, and the restaurant was clean and well decorated.  Overall we had a pleasant experience but we've had better sushi elsewhere so we probably won't be coming back here any time soon.
Everything I've tried here is just delicious! I also love the eclectic decor. It's a hidden gem which is great because it means not much wait time. Staff is very friendly! YUM!

Good but not great sushi.  The Ikea like furniture hurts my eyes and is definitely not welcoming.  You walk through the entrance to another section of the restaurant that looks like used to be an older section.  That's when you get greeted.  Service was ok at best.  Miso soup was bland and the salad was alright.  Only liked one roll that came to our table so we ordered it twice.  The nigiri was made with a huge cut of fish and a dab of rice.  This place is ok like I said but the ambiance doesn't say "please come back and enjoy the food."  Instead it says "You want to sit in uncomfortable metal/wood chairs and chic see-thru tables?"  Someone needs to bring the feng shui bat and swing it around a couple times.

I used to come here a lot but I don't anymore. It's a shame too because this place is right by my house and I really liked their sushi. The reason I stopped coming is because in my experience the service was not the best or friendliest. I used to come here as often as once a week and the owners and staff here all knew me, and surely knew that I came around a lot. And they were always professional and got me what I wanted. And yet they never greeted me in a friendly way, it was always more of a gruff or formal 'hello'. I would often sit there waiting for my order for 20, 25 minutes and they would never tell me if it was on the way. The last time I came here I waited for a particularly long time, without any acknowledgement from the staff. I left and haven't been back since. There are many other places with good food and better service.

We moved in around the corner about a year ago and have been eating there since. Quality of fish is good and quite consistent. Wait staff is very friendly and prompt. Happy hour is an excellent to time to go with their $1 Nigiri and 2 for 1 Saki. Prices are right in line with the other top sushi places in re area. 

This is a great place if you want good quality sushi that's close by. Definitely one of the top to choose from in the area.

Ambience... Ehhh... Not comfortable at all.. IKEA decor.
Food....how should I put it..old hard sushi rice,
It's was so hard to chew, slimy fish. The yakisoba was beyond terrible... It had to much tonkatsu sauce it was sour, the noodles tasted like overlooked instant ramen noodles... Omg horrible.... Finally we got dessert we got mochi and green tea cheesecake, first of all the mochi was definitely melted then frozen again it had that freezer burned taste and texture...the cheesecake tasted like the fridge. I really had high hopes for this place.....:(

Great food, reasonably priced. Firecracker appetizer was tasty, but be careful! It was definitely a spicy jalapeño in there! Fish was fresh, nice atmosphere - very low key. We will definitely be back!
Rude service. The sushi is sub- par And the owner makes no excuses for being rude when asked about the  bad service. I will never go back.
Really wish this place had better sushi. Its so close to my house but it tasted like pre-made sushi. The ambiance was okay and the service was nice but everything we ordered fell short.

Not sure why the ratings for this restaurant is 4/5 but I personally think it should be 1/5. I am a huge sushi fanatic and have tried many sushi restaurants. The sushi rolls were not fresh and the rice was hard. I ordered the Dragon Roll ($9.95) and the avocado on the outside of the roll was brown and old looking. I also ordered the Manhattan ($10.95), Alaska Roll ($5.25), and Spicy Shrimp ($5.25) and all tasted really bad. The rice on these rolls were hard and fish are very thin. These sushi are worst than the buffet sushi!!!

Pros: They give you Andes mint chocolate

Cons: Pricey, Not fresh, small pieces, not many choices to choose from, bad service.

Sushi nazi!  We patronized this business for years.  Loved it.  Then one time we ordered more than we could eat, both of a special roll along with a couple of pieces of the happy hour sushi.  When we asked for a box we were told that we couldn't take the leftover pieces of "happy hour" sushi.  If I remember correctly we had 2 pieces left worth $2.00.  REALLY?!.   Hello, common sense and courtesy anyone?   We will  NEVER return again.  I recommend  Saigon Tokyo off Buckley and Alameda.  Great customer service, which is priceless.
Best sushi place in town! Bob and his family provide great service and food. They are very consistent and reliable. I would recommend their restaurant to anyone.

Had to stop by this place before heading  back home.  Who says a landlocked state cannot offer fresh great sushi?!  
Got the Philadelphia and dragon rolls.  Of course had to get the spicy mushroom roll & firecracker appetizer again :). 
 
This place is on par with some of the great mom-pop sushi joints back in FL.  Consistently great service, will  miss this place.  Don't take this place for granted :).
Excellent food. The firecracker appetizer is a must have. Friendly staff, fantastic food!

One of my favorite sushi places. My dad and I have been going here for years and there's never been a disappointment in food and service is exceptional. I appreciate all the owners have done to make us feel extra taken care of!

Yuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuum.

Seated promptly, friendly service, and they have Ramune!! Get one, next time. Japanese sodas are not to be missed. 

Ordered shrimp tempura rolls, the Hana roll, Tokyo roll, and spicy tuna. All extremely delicious. The Hana roll was by far my favorite. All tasted very fresh, too. Drinks were refilled consistently, and I have zero complaints. Can't wait to be back and try that Firecracker app!
Love the firecracker at this place- very fast service. A little pricy but food is good and people are nice.

Hana offers happy hour prices all day- just $1 per piece! You can't beat that price. And here's the real kicker- it's very good sushi!! They have unique rolls, fresh everything and consistently good service. My son absolutely loves the green tea cheesecake. It's a must visit if you are in southeast aurora!

This place is decent. My friend and I enjoyed our sushi and seaweed salad. This is definitely not my go to spot for a sushi fix but overall our experience here was good. If you are looking for really tasty creative rolls you may want to look elsewhere. I did love their spicy mushroom roll. The service here was courteous and attentive.

Been going to this place off and on since it opened many years ago.  When it first opened it was consistently good. I'd even make special trips during my lunch hour to go there.  When we had out of town coworkers come in and we'd go to lunch, this was one of the places on our radar.

But lately, the past several years, it seems the quality has diminished.  Sushi isn't always the freshest anymore.  And by that I don't mean that its bad or going bad, but it seems like the raw fish can be "flavorless" and getting old.  I've ordered Maguro there and the fish has an odd texture and color (on multiple occasions).  Again, not that its going bad, but its no longer "fresh" and its obvious.    Nigiri portions have shrunk over the  years as well. And while they do have a Happy Hour Sushi menu, those items are smaller than you'd expect, more like you'd find at one of the "All You Can Eat" sushi bars.

I've also ordered cooked items off the menu.  Again, hit and miss.  No consistency.  Sometimes its really good and has me coming back and other times it lacks flavor and is overloaded with vegetables. As an example I really like Beef Teriyaki. The beef is small, smothered in Teriyaki sauce and loaded with "filler" vegetables. 

The service is good and the people are friendly.  Decor is nice and pretty cool for a strip mall in S/E Aurora... But while those are nice its the food that counts... and thats where this place seems to miss the mark lately.

So, why do I continue to go there after all these years?  Well, its the closest or was the closest sushi bar to my house and I kept hoping I hit it on a good day...
Not much to look at inside. Very small rolls for the price. Two of us dropped $90+ and I left hungry. Nice staff.

My second review here, much better this time round. Rice was on point, fish was very fresh and delicious. The train wreck roll was awesome! Great service excellent local sushi, we will be coming back glad to have a great local sushi joint!
Love love love this place. Fire Cracker & Dragon are ah-mazing! I start with them & end with a second order. Great for business meetings, date night or large parties.
Two stars because the food was okay.  Service was horrible.  If I came here again it would be for take out only.

Before 7 pm, most nigiri (that's when the raw fish is on the little piece of rice) is only $1. Say whattttt?!!!!! That's right only $1!

It's not the highest quality, but it is pretty damn good IMO. Well worth the $1. Rarely do I ever go to a sushi place and mark 10 pieces of salmon nigiri and NOT feel guilty about it. (When I say guilty, that's in reference to the damage I do to my bank account, not my body.)

The service was quick and attentive. What more could you ask for?

In conclusion, if anyone came to Denver and said, "hey girl, I'm craving some sushi, but I only have $5." I would say, "Try Hana Sushi before 7pm." Then I would say, "Also, when you google map it, you may think that the place has disappeared once in the area, but it is really tucked in a corner by Safeway, two doors down from the Thai place."  I got a little lost, so I think that would be important to add in.
Very good happy hour! Sushi is some of the best downtown, and the drinks are very good (try one of the signature drinks... they are yummy!)

Stopped by for sushi on the way home from DIA on a business trip.  It was say 7:30 pm and there were the right amount of people there - ie not tko crowded.  The sushi price was reasonable.  I ordered the sashimi and liked it - flavorful and fresh.  Wednesdays they have buy one get on free sake (sucks if you have to drive and get do that).  Because I had mostly sashimi, miso soup and I think 1 spicy scallop roll I didn't get to try a wide variety of sushi.  Hats of to them for doing it pretty well.  For the money and if it's not to far to go I think I'd rather hit Sushi Katsu because you can get more sushi for the $$.  However, that said this place is still great.  Quick sushi without the wait and very friendly service is great by my book!  I'll be back.

I am very surprised at all the positive reviews on Hana Sushi.  Ordered a few appetizers and 4 rolls tonight and I was extremely disappointed with everything.  The gyoza was not typical and actually came steamed like dumplings.  Tasted okay but not what I was going for.  Don't even order the spring roll/egg roll thing.  For $3.00, there only came two small pieces cut in half.  The seaweed salad was mushy and didn't taste fresh.  The biggest disappointment were the Manhattan and Twin Dragon rolls.  For $11 a piece, you would think they would be substantial but they were actually the same size as the California roll and the artificial crab is the worst I have ever tasted.  Honestly, King Soopers sushi has more flavor, better quality ingredients and a better value for size.  The calamari tempura roll was the highlight of the meal but even the pieces of tempura were small and insignificant in the roll.  I wasn't expecting too much but could not get over the price of each roll vs quality and size.  Their are other better sushi options in the area.  Would not recommend.

This is my favorite Sushi restaurant. If you don't see your favorite on the menu just tell them whats in it and they will make it for you. The prices are good and the sushi is far better than the expensive places I have been. They have a good happy hour and good service as well.
My wife and I have been coming to Hana Sushi for about 4 years and the service and food is always outstanding! Keep up the great work, our favorite Sushi Bar, hands down!
I first tried them cause it was convenient really close to home to my surprise was actually good love there firecracker roll on the appetizer menu will continue to return

Don't let the strip mall ambiance full you, this place is great!! Hands down, the best roll by far is the fire cracker. I could easily be satisfied with just this but then you get into other rolls like the Philly or Tiger roll and wonder why didn't I check this place out sooner! I finally have a place close to the house that doesn't have weird hours! And it's a bonus that this place offers a lot of room so you don't feel like you are in the next tables conversation. And 2 for 1 hot sake during the week for Happy Hour. Not only is the service great, the staff goes out of their way to make sure your service is suburb!

Its no secret I'm a sushi snob. That being said, this spot surprised me.

I scoffed at the idea of eating sushi in a little suburb of Denver, how could they offer up anything even remotely close to what I get in Cali or Hawaii. What I got was a sushi bar that provided good cuts of fish, with some decent roll options for those you are into the cali sushi style. 

Usually, places that serve cali style sushi don't put much into the quality of their fish, as it will be soaked in eel sauce, or avocado, or crunchies for that matter. But having ordered a few hand rolls, and nigiri, I realized I had a gem on my hands. While not in the same ball park as the places I normally frequent, the pricing was right here, and the waitress was kind and funny. 

Don't know if I will ever be out here again, but if I were to be out here and wanted a decent sushi fix, I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.

This little sushi place is right next to the Thai restaurant tucked away in a little strip mall in East Aurora. Some pros & cons to Hana Sushi. Clear pro is the nigiri was exceptional. The downsides outweigh the sushi, though. First, we ordered some eggrolls to start off and it was basically 1 eggroll sliced. For the money, it was too little for the price. The other thing is I just didn't like the ambience. The seats were extremely uncomfortable and overall the little place just feels cold & uninviting. Definitely not the kind of place where you feel like you can settle in and linger over your meal.
Good service and good food. Definitely worth stopping by. Get yourself some good sushi and don't spend an arm and a leg while doing it.

I returned to Hana Sushi for lunch.  I had been out running errands and ended up in the neighborhood and turned into the parking lot in a flash of a last minute decision.

It was about 2 in the afternoon and the place was empty.  I took a seat at the sushi bar and carefully selected my happy hour order.  The sushi chef was very friendly.  Also, on a side note, they changed the chairs at the sushi bar and they are much better than the old ones.

After talking with the sushi chef, I found out that he is the owner of Hana Sushi.  His name is Bob and he was very accommodating.  I really enjoyed my sushi and had a great conversation about Asian cuisine with him and his wife.

The experience was much better than the last. But due to the inconsistency in visits I've had here, I'm sticking with 3 stars.  I will definitely go back if the opportunity arises.  For Aurora sushi bars, it's a decent one!

I've been back to Hana Sushi on a number of occasions since i wrote the first review in 2008. I have NEVER been disappointed! Last night was no exception. A welcoming rest from Holiday preparations. The food, service and ambiance of this little restaurant continue to be excellent. 

P.S. The little desserts are a most welcome surprise from the press stamped fortune cookies that other restaurants serve.

I was hungry because all I had that day was couple of cookies and peanuts on the airplane.

Their hand rolls were good especially the spicy scallop.
It was bit on the sweet side and their ponzu sauce was also good.
It's not too much soy sauce taste and enough tang and sweetness.

We also order pork katsu... it was not that great.
Out side was flaky but the batter was not cooked all the way.

I didn't have any of the rolls so I can't really say but the interior is big and clean and simple.

I also didn't like it as much because there was a lady that keep going in and out with cleaning materials.

I know you have to clean the place but to see it every 5 minutes I was there was not a plus for me. I would recommend that they put a little curtain or pretty Japanese room dividers so that customers don't have to see the employees walk between the kitchen and the other room with mops and other cleaning materials.

New to town and I finally found my sushi joint! Great fresh sushi at a reasonable price! I'm excited to eventually try all these rolls!!

Loving the spider roll and the spicy scallop...Yummy :)

My husband and I stopped here for our first visit recently and overall I am happy with the result. I ordered Futomaki and Vegetable sushi, both were good.

My husband ordered the Yakisoba, which he was not impressed with. My husband lived in Japan for a couple of years and frequently ate the Yakisoba there, which he loved. The noodles are supposed to be crispy, but the noodles here were very soggy. He got chicken with it, which he did say he liked.

Our waiter was polite, but he seemed very disconnected. He almost seemed annoyed by our presence. This ruined the atmosphere for me a little bit.

I was very surprised to see the place nearly empty on a Saturday evening at 6 p.m. There was a party of 4 that had been there for a bit when we came in, but they left shortly thereafter and we never saw another soul come into the place before we left around 6:30.

I would definitely get sushi from here again, though I don't think I will ever eat at the restaurant itself again. It will always be take-out for me from now on.

Good stuff.  Ordered monkey brains and they tasted good.  No, not real brains, two hemisphere of spicy tuna and clam, avocado and rice fried with a panko crust.  It's about the size of a monkey head but I didn't bring a monkey to compare.

Two touches that would improve things..., I wish they had hot towels and I miss the orange they use to deliver with the bill.

Love this Place!  Great for people who love good sushi and aren't wanting to make the trek across town to someplace downtown or to Denver.  Good prices and good selection. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I go there quite often with my husband and son and there's really not anything on the menu that's "kid friendly". Meaning it's all adult portions at adult prices. But other then that it's got great atmosphere and friendly staff, even when my kid made a mess of our table!

Really great sushi. I have been several times. It is very modern interior, with glass tables and metal chairs. There is also a sushi bar you can sit at and watch tv as well.

My favorite sushi roll is the fuji roll, I would definitely recommend getting it. 

Everyone that goes there gets the spicy (deep fried) mushroom rolls, I think it is their number one seller. I don't eat mushrooms but my husband loves that roll. 

The nice thing about their sushi too is that the rice is very sticky. Some restaurants don't use actual sticky rice and so the sushi falls apart, but here it is perfect! 

The waitstaff also is very friendly and made sure our drinks were refilled frequently.

I like this place quite a bit! The service and grandpa making the sushi are all so friendly! My family comes here quite a bit as we love sushi and are sushi snobs, as it is usually our choice of food when we go out to eat. They recognized us as soon as we walked in, and greeted us warmly as if we were family. 

We ordered an assortment of various rolls and cuts of sushi (lots, as we are a family of 5 and can consume quite a bit), and we even got a couple extra as thanks. Not fishy at all and my mother (who has had many a bad experience with sushi) delights in eating here. 

I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced sushi place in Denver. Actually, to anyone who likes sushi.

Try the mochi ice cream for dessert as well! It is quite delicious.

Hana Sushi, with 10 frens and I, we came and pay you a visit for our October month Sushi Feast.  Though some of my frens were "lost" in order to find you, nevertheless all came in ONE piece...  So if you intend to drive here and not familiar with the area, please do have your GPS or directions ready in hand.

Everyone enjoyed their Sushi dinner on Thursday evening October 09th 2008.  

Since I feel like some Miso soup for that evening, I tried their MISO Soup with Clams.  Oishii!!

Next came my main entree that consists the following:

Unagi, Tobiko Flying Fish Eggs, Kaibashira Scallop which I only pay this $1 a piece coz I ordered them before 7pm ~ entitled for HAPPY HOUR.

The rest were Ama Ebi, FUJI Roll, Spicy Shrimp Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll, Spicy Shrimp Handroll and Spicy Scallop Hand Roll.  I was slightly disappointed with their Ama Ebi coz it seems not too fresh for me.

I shared one piece or two with my fren who ordered their Spicy Mushroom.  This I HIGHLY RECOMMEND their Spicy Mushroom Roll!!!  Since both of us do not fancy, salmon in the Spicy Mushroom Roll, we requested for Shrimp instead.  Double Oishii!!! Be warned though, when they served the Spicy Mushroom, make sure you wait for abit before eating them coz, it can be pipping HOT and can burn the top tip of your mouth.  Just be cautious okies...

They have other menu in this Restaurant, perhaps I would return to bring hubby to try them.  Service was prompt, accomodating and fast.  Though I cant deny not everyone get their food at the same time.  There is room for improvement if they would want large groups to dine here.

Come for their Happy Hour for $1 per piece Dine Only sushi during Lunch and 4pm to 7pm everyday.  Another added bonus for me.  I ended my evening with Mochi Ice Cream of Strawberry, Mango and Vanilla flavors.  Triple Oishii!!!

Please Take Note:
(Hana Sushi is closed from 2:30pm to 4pm on Monday thru Friday)

If possible do call in advance.

After having Sushi on the West Coast, nothing compared. This place comes close! They don't have the same fresh fish that they do on the coast though. They are not too pricey, we usually spend anywhere from $10-$25 a person depending on what we get, which isn't too bad for good sushi! The staff is always really kind and quick. I am a huge fan of their Philadelphia Roll. YUM! Also, they always have specials that are so delicious! Try them out, you wont regret it!

I like to get different types of sushi every time I come in. The sushi is good but my real reason for five stars and my guilty pleasure is the Firecrackers. I always get two orders so I can snack on some later when I get home.

Hana Sushi is bar none the best place around to get sushi on the quick...or even on the slow.  If ever I've got a hankerin' for some good sushi, I call to make an order and within 10 minutes its ready to go.  I'm not a serious sushi eater (I pretty much stick to my rainbow roll), but when I'm feeling a bit adventurous and go for something new, Hana always ends up giving me a pleasent surprise.  This place is simply delicious!  The firecrackers are delicious and I can eat an entire order to myself...even if I can feel myself getting fatter in the process :)
This place made me a fan of sushi...so much so that I could probably eat here every day! Consistently delicious, fresh, and presented beautifully. Also, really friendly staff!

I came here for a quick lunch the other day.  First time here.  I didn't realize they had a happy hour every day, with $1 nigiri.  Had several of those an a couple maki rolls and some miso soup.  The octopus nigiri was good.  The tuna wasn't the freshest I've seen (I came here on Labor Day).  The miso soup was good/average.  The maki rolls were small.  On some parts of the roll outside the seaweed, there appeared to be only one layer of rice (one grain thick).  The rolls were very small.  Now, I'm not one to like huge sushi rolls but they seemed to be cutting corners on the rice.    The ingredients seemed OK.  I would return but wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

5 stars for happy hour, 5 stars for the price, 4 stars overall for the sushi.

Very friendly service; the owner is behind the bar when the place gets busy, but still takes time to chat. 
The happy hour quality is surprisingly good; they don't switch the out to inferior sushi for HH, so its very well worth $1/piece.  They didn't have anything too crazy for nigiri, but hey, it is in a strip mall after all.  
I tried just about everything they had for nigiri and I didn't have anything that stood out as off.  Even their saba was tasty, and it's generally one that's the first to taste foul when it's not fresh.  They were out of Uni; that's the ultimate test for me...it's only available on weekends.    

It's well worth checking out; I wouldn't place it in my top sushi joints of all time, but I would put it in the top 2 for quality vs price.
No complaints here.   My husband and I have been in twice over the past few months.   I'm not a huge sushi fan, so I can't comment much on that.   Good service, food and nice portions.
Try the Hana roll.  I grew up near the ocean and don't prefer eating fish in a land lock region but I will eat the sushi here.
This is my favorite sushi bar in Aurora. Plus priced very well! A definite must

Disappointing happy hour and long wait service.  

We came as a group of five with three of us arriving first around 6pm so we quickly submitted our happy hour order.  By the time our last friend showed up around 6:30 our order had still not arrived.  It looked to be an average day with less than half of one side of the restaurant filled so it failed to explain the excessive wait time.

When the sushi arrived it was good but not in the mouth melting yum way.  We managed to quickly get two more orders in before happy hour ended at 7pm and still nothing really stood out for me.

Last but not least our bill averaged $36 per person!  With a few beers and some forgettable rolls that may have increased the bill, it still was not the happy hour deal I was expecting.

I was craving sushi for dinner but was too lazy to go to far or dine in so I looked up places near by that had either delivery or takeout. Hana does not have delivery but since this place is only about 5 minutes from my house I figured I would give it a try for take out.

I ordered the Tetakki Salad and the Tokyo roll. The Tetakki was not good and I won't be ordering it ever again. They mixed a vinegar based sauce with a mayo based sauce and you could imagine the image...not good. However the Tokyo roll was pretty tasty and I think if I went back I would certainly order it again along with some other sushi options. 

Overall it was just OK. I have had much better sushi and just can't bring myself to give 4 stars for anything that is just ok. So there you go. Take it or leave it.

It's my favorite place!  I've sat at the sushi bar, a table and I've picked up sushi, without fail, it's always the best.  The fish is always as fresh as possible in Colorado!
