The chef is funny and friendly.  There's rarely a wait.... this place is hidden between some odd places, but go out of your way to find it.  I think you'll find yourself pleasantly surprised!
Suggestions:
Seaweed salad
Eel roll
Spicy tuna roll
Rainbow roll
Green tea
Yum!!
It's so nice to have a great little place to have really good sushi, we love the modern contemporary vibe of the dine in experience.
Excellent food and service.  Our server was also the owner! Nice man, obviously very knowledgeable and very friendly! Highly recommended!

cheap sushi close to home.. how bad (or good!) could it be?  it's a small place in a little strip mall off the side of a major street... hmm... why not.

stopped in for a to-go order of sushi -- hostess was very nice and offered me some water while i waited. picked up a few rolls for myself and took them home. i'm pretty picky when it comes to what's "good" in terms of sushi -- not that i'm picky about what i'll eat (i'll pretty much eat everything when it comes to sushi!) but more that if you tell me a certain sushi joint is "the best" it better damn well blow my socks off.  however, i was pleasantly surprised at this little place. i wouldn't say it was the best, but it was good. especially for a small little hole in the wall so close to home. 

i would go back again, preferably for happy hour dine in, to try more stuff. this place is A-OK.

We eat at Hana reguarly. I have eaten sushi at nearly every sushi restaurant of note in the Denver metro area, and in my opinion you're not going to find better sushi in Aurora.  On any given night you'll find KC and Nemo behind the sushi bar cranking out sashimi, nigiri, and rolls with speed, accuracy, not to mention an eye for detail, presentation, and most importantly -- flavor!

Bob and Angie, the (Korean) owners, are very friendly and hospitable. They will take the time to get to know you and generally will bend over backwards to take care of you. 

What else can I tell you? Most of the fish is US-sourced and is very fresh and tasty.  The happy hour prices are fantastic. The only time that service slows down is typically during the latter part of happy hour (6-7) when the place gets packed, especially on weekends. I think those who complain simply aren't used to a local restaurant being this popular. My advice is: come early and hungry!

There are a few sushi places in Denver that are better than Hana, and I've been to them, but like another reviewer noted, we simply can't break away from Hana long enough go back to them.

Love it!
We stop here whenever we're in the area.  As others have noted the interior is delightful - the large aquariums make for a unique dining experience.  The sushi is always top notch (for Denver).

I have gone to Hana since it was first open.  First, it is very close to where I live.  All the other sushi restaurants in my neighborhood are not like how Hana Sushi is, original.  I know the owner, Bob, he is very nice and friendly person.  I can't remember his wife's name, and she's nice too.  I also like how all there sushi chefs get to know you.  It's like Cheers, but with sushi.

I love there portions.  I usually get there chirashi and the portion compared to any other place is bigger.  They load it with everything they can.  I love there happy hour, $1 per piece, cannot beat that.

Don't do it.  Sushi is just ok. The service is the main problem with this restaurant. My daughter ordered a ny steak (I know it's a sushi place). And couldn't eat over 80% of it...due to it was all grizzle/fat. The evidence was nicely placed back on to the plate. Then the waitress/owner refused to take it off the bill. Her response, "well, sometimes you get a bad steak". Ok, thanks I won't ever be back. What's crazy...I was a twice a month customer for 2 years.

This was my husband's 4th time having sushi. We had just watched a movie and were on the drive home. A coworker of his had recommended Hana... we called him for the details of where it is. Cute little sushi place near the Safeway on Buckley and Quincy. It's actually rather intimate once you get inside. Tables are somewhat close together. 

We didn't want to spend a fortune (which is easy to do at a sushi place). We each ordered 2 rolls. I tried the Hana Roll and Chicken Tempura. The hana roll had cooked salmon, mayo, tempura crunchies, and green onions. Very tasty! I think I liked it more than tempura rolls. I usually get shrimp tempura, but decided on the chicken here. The tempura rolls are bigger - so harder to eat in one bite. Still very good. The chicken tasted a little dry - but other than that, everything was great. My husband ordered the spicy salmon and spicy tuna rolls. He has a shellfish intolerance, so unfortunately he can't eat shrimp or crab (two of my favorites). 

It's nice to know there is a decent sushi place close to our house. If I'm ever in the sushi mood, I'll go back.
Hana is a great local spot. Great service and yummy sushi. Love the monkey brains and the rainbow roll

Recently moved to the area and saw this as the only Sushi place nearby.  Went in to place a take out order.  Staff ignored us when we first entered.  We saw menus and decided to sit near the door to review.  One of the waiters acknowledged us and then was  rude when he realized we were going to make it a take out order.  He threw 2 paper menus at us and told us to look over these instead of the regular menu.  We had questions about some of the items on the paper menu and the staff member was very condescending to us.  We ended up ordering a mix of appetizers and sushi.  Food was descent, but because of how rude the staff were, I would not return or recommend.
Very friendly and attentive service.  Miso was perfect temp and tasty.  Went with standard rolls (tuna, salmon, etc.)  They were fresh and well made.

I went to Hana Sushi for lunch and got one of their lunch boxes with the pork in it. The pork was delicious and I would recommend it to anyone.

It was also nice to order a few of the $1 pieces of sushi. Its a fair deal to mix and match whatever you want. I choose the maguro.

Good stuff, would definitely recommend it!

Our favorite neighborhood Sushi. We love to come in, sit at the Sushi bar, chat with the chefs, and they're so good natured about my inability to remember which rolls we've tried before and which ones are our favorites. Of course we love all the fresh fish and especially the sushi happy hour EVERY night of the week.
Thanks Hana Sushi!!

This place was average food-wise. The staff was very polite and attentive, they took our order fairly quickly, and our food was brought to us promptly. However, the food itself wasn't amazing or delicious per say. It was "eh." The sushi was bland, not tasty at all. The sushi rolls themselves and the nigiri were tiny compared to other sushi places I've been so because of that, I thought the prices were a bit steep. I'm from the Springs, and there's a sushi place there called Kohnami...now that is the best sushi restaurant I've been to thus far, EVER. Their rolls aren't tiny nor is the nigiri a sliver of fish with a bit a rice attached  like at Hana Sushi. Kohnami's sushi is truly tasty, flavorful, and delicious, hands down. Needless to say, I miss that place and I've had a hard time finding a great sushi restaurant since moving to Aurora and driving the 30 min to Denver to get some good sushi is a bit discouraging. Now that being said, I would continue to go to Hana Sushi if I'm in dire need of a sushi fix and because it's close to my house, otherwise, I'll probably have to settle exploring my options elsewhere.

Wow, I can't believe this place has such great reviews. I came here once and I definitely won't come again. We came during dinner, not during happy hour time. 
Most of our food was pretty alright, except for one of our rolls, which just threw everything off. My husband got a combination of rolls, and the fish in his yellowtail roll was definitely spoiled. It did not look right, the color was very dark and the fish looked partially cooked (probably because it was so old and spoiled). It also smelled horrible! 
The place was pretty full and we did not want to make a huge scene, so we wrapped it up in paper and asked them to take it away. I just could not believe they would serve something like that. Imagine a newcomer didn't know that it was spoiled, ate it, and got sick! 
Maybe we just went there on an "off day", but we are definitely not going back.

For quality sushi in Aurora, try Sushi Katsu on Havana Street.
Mount Fuji in Southlands is a bit costlier, but it is good too. 
And Sushi Den is my all time favorite, a bit more costly, but it is like sushi heaven!
By far the best Sushi in Aurora! Really enjoyed our dinner, and will definatly be going back. Spider roll, Spicy tuna roll yum
Excellent, Excellent, Excellent.  I'm kind of a sushi virgin, but every time I've been here, the food, ambiance, and service has been incredible.
Love this place my wife and I try to get there once a week. Good sushi and even happy hour! Restaurant is even nice and up kept. Bathrooms not so much tho. All together tho great local sushi spot.

This was the first sushi resteraunt I've tried in the Denver metro, and so far it's still the best.  This place is located on the NW corner of Buckley and Quincy, along the Quincy side of the lot.  It can be easy to miss if your coming off of Buckley.

The atmosphere here is excellent.  The dining area is calm and fancy, but still casual.  There's always someone to offer a warm greeting as soon as you step in the door.  The service is attentive and friendly, and the guys behind the sushi bar seem constantly up beat.

The sushi here is wonderful, but being a Japanese Cuisine Resteraunt, the menu is extensive.  So far everything I've tried has been fantastic.  The presentation alone beats out most other places I've tried in town.  Happy Hour consists of one dollar sushi making it a nice spot to stop for a quick, after work meal.

Like Annie B, sushi is my very favorite "feel good" food, and it certainly can be an expensive habit. I do tend to get a little snobbish about my sushi here in Denver, simply because I got rather spoiled from spending a semester in Japan a couple years ago.

Hana Sushi is one of the only places I will go for Sushi in Denver. Their Hana roll is amazing, and I LOVE their masago rolls (flying fish egg) with a quail egg on top. Yum!! :D  Unagi rolls are something I tend to approach with caution, because while they are absolutely delicious when prepared with quality eel, most sushi joints' unagi rolls are chewy at best, and stringy and tough most of the time. Hana is an exception - I always make sure to have at least an order of unagi rolls when we are there! I'd also recommend their rainbow rolls, as they are fantastic as well.

The staff is always fantastic as well. The servers are always there when you need them, and are consistently friendly, and great with kids. When my niece and I decided to try out Hana Sushi, our waitress offered to make "kid chopsticks," basically, she took a couple chopsticks, rolled the packaging into a ball, and rubber-banded in between the chopsticks, which helped Katie learn to eat with chopsticks. The bar guys are the same way - always upbeat and they enjoy chatting and getting to know their patrons.

I think the only thing preventing Hana from getting five stars is the whole cold, urban look. It's just not something you'd expect in South-East Aurora, which is, let's face it, right on the edge of suburbia. The decor would look better in downtown, maybe, where the metallic, edgy look is common, but again, in SE Aurora, it might be better to go with a warmer look.

Aside from that one little detail, Hana gets almost perfect 10's down the list. I even like their tempura rolls, and I have never been a fan of tempura.

Everything was quite tasty! 2 for 1 sake all the time Mon-Thurs.

We got a plethera of rolls and an apetizer call monkey brains which consisted of an avocado cut in half stuffed with crab and cream cheese then fried. Pretty tasty but so unneccesary. We ended up taking 1/2 the rolls home because we filled up on the appetizer :(.

The service was really swell, though it took a little longer than you might think to get the sushi out but there was only one chef crankin everything out but he did so with painstaking detail so it was worth the wait.

Seemed signifigantly more expensive than other places I've been frequenting lately (sushi train, mt fuji) but the quality was really good so I can't compain.

And for the record this place is on the NE corner.

This little sushi place was pretty good.  The rice wasn't the best and I love great sushi rice.  The fish, however,  was really fresh and it made up for the rice.  They also had a great happy hour special where the sashimi was only a dollar a piece!  I had the yellowtail sashimi and it was really good.  I also tried a few spicy rolls and they were spicy.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was good.  I would come back here again to take advantage of the happy hour sashimi.
Every time my friends and I come here we try something new. The Godzilla roll and the tiger roll are especially good. The wait staff is very attentive, and the menu options are not lacking.

I'd just like to add that I've eaten here multiple times since my last 5-star review, and the sushi has been consistently my favorite in the Denver/Aurora area.

If you're feeling adventurous, I recommend the Fuji roll.  Delicious!!!

I spent time in Japan and lived in the northwest for years, where we have some of the best sushi place available, and Hana is for sure up there on my list of fav sushi places. Order anything and enjoy!!!

Went with a friend the other night and would def go back again. Good food and good happy hour specials. Only thing was when we were done eating we ordered a few more but they wouldn't give us the happy hour price cause it was after seven although we got there at 630 thought that was pretty cheesy!

My family and I love sushi and order it at least once a week. We ordered take out from Hana Sushi tonight and were appalled at how rude one staff member was. She said her name was "Andy" although she also claimed to be the owner. My fiance wanted to pay over the phone so that I would not have to pay upon pick up. He gave her the card number and she proceeded to tell him the card was not working and said"you have to pay your bill or the card doesn't work"! He checked his account and had more than enough money. The staff member would not read the number back to him and when he offered to come in and pay she told him she would not make our food because he had no money. When I asked to speak to the manager she said he was not in. Then I asked for her name and she proceeded to tell me that now she was the owner and hung up on me. If you want to be treated like garbage this is the place to go. We will never go back to this place again.

I dislike amateurs reviewing sports bars that are actually cool spots such as this one. This small pub deserves credit for being awesome, and no it did not take a long time for our food to be served. The best part about being able to eat here was the holiday. On Halloween, it was dead and it felt pleasant having this tap tower to ourselves. Though it's higher priced, the platters are worth it. The fried pickles, we pictured to be tiny chopped pickles with dipping of course-- but no! It was definitely full pickles and they were already filling us up. But this was just our appetizer. The beau craved the Fish & Chips, and I had the best spaghetti ever-- it almost looked Italian, Mexican and American literally in 3! That's perhaps why they called it the 3-Way Gary. It was also Monday's special on the menu. They have various specials on their menu that are highlighted and it was awesome to have the chance to come in and try their Monday one. 

All the servers were going above and beyond to impress us. There was this nice gal who greeted us , I thought her tummy looked so cute because i saw she was expecting, and she was telling us she was 5 months, I loved her warmth presence. Then on our receipt we had it say "BR," but no actual name. They we're both nice. I had to call in and ask their names, guys. 

Anyways, though we didn't have dessert, we had a great time. And a wonderful Halloween

So I have updated my review to four stars.

After calling management and talking to them about our experience, they invited us back for a meal on the house. Our return trip was MUCH better. We went during a Bronco game so the place was pretty full. Our server was amazing, knew the menu very well and took the time to talk to us. We did not make him aware of our previous experience until the end as we wanted to ensure the service was unbiased. All in all the buffalo chicken sandwich was amazing and the burgers were great. I, of course, had two glasses of root beer and the root beer float. Definitely order the float. You won us over and we will be back.

We've been wanting to visit the new Rusty Bucket since it opened and finally had the opportunity yesterday at at happy hour.  We arrived and immediately got a street-side table on the patio.  Our waitress was sweet and helpful, and, not being especially hungry, it was the perfect time to visit because all appetizers were half off as were the pizzas.  Also, there was $1 off drinks.  As we enjoyed our food and beverages, the patio filled up, and why not?  The menu has a good variety, and the happy hours deals are the best at the Orchard Town Center.

The sliders were especially good, with yummy grilled onions, so give those a try.  Not sure what this place is like other times of the day, but it always seems busy, and we sure do need some new restaurant selections in this part of town.  Looks like Katie Eile's didn't make it and the Rock Bottom sure could use some competition.  That is all I have to say.
Patience is a good idea. Food and drinks are good. But the place is disorganized. Host stand seems confused.  Takes a while to be greeted at the table. Once past this it's a god roll.

Things are very off at the Rusty Bucket. From my first and only experience - I am feeling like front of house is casting blame on the kitchen and while its true  - stuff was off - but it was across re board. 

We were seated in a full restaurant at 5:55 on a Thursday. Waited for five minutes with no greeting and at least five people walked by, serves food or could have said hi. 

The room was literally freezing. People rubbing their arms and it was probably 65 degrees or less. 

Once our server did come to our table we asked twice for the air to be turned down. We were informed that it takes time for it to happen. It never did. The second time I asked I walked to the host stand to ask the hostess - and there was our server chatting at host stand. 

My 13 year-old noticed on her own "why are all the staff in a pack?" Yep. Non-efficiency. Like a row of ducks.  And they are not looking at anyone in the eye. 

Food was cold. And not how we ordered the burgers. Bucket Bites had onions even though we ordered without and kids burger didn't have cheese. Wedge Salad came out alone without soup and was terrible lettuce - bitter and inedible. 

Waited about 6 minutes for the soup to arrive and it was the best thing - albeit salty as heck. 

Server came over to present check with all of our plates and half or uneaten food. I was like  whoaaaa.... Not paying yet. Need to recap all this.  

Manager came and said you don't owe us anything - I said - thank you - (& I do think this was the right move.) I have worked in the industry and opened many restaurants - sometimes things are just off. 

After waking away-at the end.  The GM wakes over to air controls and turned the three hvac vents down in front of us. Hmmmm.  

And then she said "yes, it always comes in threes" to a server. I am guessing we weren't the only table with concerns. 

My take on things. They have a young staff. Training and feeling in tandem hasn't happened yet. 

It's cold temperature-wise in the space - like grab your arms cold and rub. 

Our server checked the boxes and it felt like she had had enough with kitchen complaints. 

The food is not to par. The salad not edible. The instructions in preparing our two burgers - both wrong. 

Oh and I nearly forgot the food runner literally stood in front of the three of us with plates of food waiting for us to say which plate belonged to who. Not auctioning it, but stood there until we said "oh that's mine."

Glad it was comped, left a tip and went to 3 Margs for a drink and tacos.

We were greeted promptly. Hostess was great , we were seated . And things went down hill from there. We waited for 20 minutes for our drinks. Not a hard order.  4 waters.  2 glasses of wine., One root beer(menu said that they had draft root beer., we got ibc in a bottle.  My granddaughter ordered milk. Took another 10 minutes to get her milk. Waiter said he could not find the kids cups! After another 40 minutes we ask our waiter to check on our food order. Order had obviously been sitting.  Every thing was cold.. I ordered a taco salad., it was terrible. Fried tortilla smeared with beans and fried hamburger meat. Topped with soggy salad. By the time it got to me  . Was a soggy runny mess!
Every time waiter came to the table . He was apologizing for something! We were hopping for a good lunch.. will not be back!! Go somewhere else!!
Anyone who wrote a bad review of this place can go ahead and get fucked. Three words: fried pickle spears.

I've been trying to get in this place for so long and I was always to hungry to wait. I finally made it, on a day when I had a slight hangover. My friend and I had the best server, Meryl. She was so friendly and attentive. I didn't even know what I wanted and she ordered me a buffalo me chicken sandwich and Bloody Mary. I enjoyed then both, but I think we enjoys our sever more.

We frequented this Cameron Mitchell restaurant in Columbus Ohio and really loved it. This place has a lot to do to get up to par. Hostess station is a mess. Unable to manage stress (3 people waiting- seriously). Inside is really small and cramped. Waiters are very slow to the table and not familiar with the menu. The bartender recommended a Bud Light when I told him I like lighter beers- are you kidding me- bud light? I've got a fairly sophisticated pallet. Food appearance is poor. Overall food is okay- basic bar food- NOTHING special. 
#longwaytogo #wontlastlongatthisrate

Everything I've eaten here has been great. My fave is the buffalo chicken sandwich; it's so crispy. I crave it!  The bread pudding is also delicious. Good beer selection and some tasty cocktails. Patio is also nice. Service has greatly improved recently.

Absolutely terrible. I had the BBQ chopped chicken salad, and it was disgusting. The lettuce was mostly iceberg, meaning they made a poor attempt to save money by buying the cheapest crap lettuce in existence. There was some romaine, too, but it wasn't that great. Their BBQ sauce was just ketchup with some extra spices or something. It tasted just like ketchup. The chicken was dry, tough, and tasted like it had been grilled on a grill where they cooked fish, or the cilantro ranch dressing had anchovy paste in it. The whole salad tasted fishy.

Nobody else at the table had any complaints, but nobody raved about the food either.
Took 3 times to get the right beer, then they served my infant daughter raw chicken.  Not too happy!

I know Rusty Bucket is new and may have some growing pains, but I would be shocked if they stay open without some changes. When I walked in, the wait time was 2 hours, and there is not a single thing there worth waiting for. Thankfully, we had reservations, so I got to skip that part.

The food seemed very hit or miss. Friends seemed to like their burgers and quesadillas, and the fish sandwich was alright (too much bread, but it tasted decent). The mac & cheese tasted like absolutely nothing, the coleslaw was dripping in what tasted like Miracle Whip, and the fries were soggy. I ate some of my food because I was starving, but I sort of wish I'd just eaten at home.

The beer list was similarly uninspired. I saw one stout (Guinness) on tap, and the rest was all pale ales, IPAs, and maybe an amber or two? The bottle selection was mostly made up of fairly stereotypical imports (Corona, Fosters, Molson) and a few decent to good domestic choices. Still short on dark beers, and most of the options were 22oz bottles that ran something like $13-$25 each. They were out of the one I ordered, and the manager brought me a different beer without asking, which happened to be one I don't particularly like.

Really, the only decent thing was the service. Our waitress was very nice and the manager was clearly trying hard to make people happy. They ended up comping my entire meal, which they didn't have to do since I still ate some of it. They actually made me willing to go back in a couple of months to see if they've worked out the kinks

Had dinner on Sunday at Rusty Bucket.  Were a little concerned with the past comments, but decided to give it a try.  We were seated promptly in the enclosed patio.  Our server was very attentive and the service was quick. Our meals were pretty good, my hubby liked the salmon, and my fish and chips were great.  My son had the mac and cheese which was a little bland.  Would go back.

Burgers are pretty darn good and the beer selection is pretty good. 

My only complaint is that there are too many kids there. Not that I'm anti-family but just sometimes want a relaxing atmosphere. Its hard to get a table and they go on a wait really early. Plan ahead!

Do not eat here - the food was bad all around. Cold queso which was basically velveta and frozen spinach. They comp'd it when we said it was a cold blob in the middle. 
The Cheeseburger was RAW I ordered it medium rare when I was told it would have "a little pink"! I didn't send it back but didn't eat it either. 
Pizza was cold and the "soy glaze" on the salmon was so sweet it was barely edible. 
Clearly cooking thoroughly and serving hot food is an issue!!!
There was nothing good about our lunch. There was a bunch of flies as well which is gross and annoying! 
Service was ok the waiter was nice but not worth a return trip here.

Generic and gross.  
Environment: 
They seemed like every other tavern/restaurant in business today.  To be honest, the entire atmosphere felt like a total rip off of the Baker Street Pub franchise.

Food: 
The food was not good.  Both my boyfriend and I ended up sick later on in the evening.  I've never seen a restaurant prepare Mahi Mahi fish as badly as this restaurant.  I ate one of the three tacos on my plate, and was repulsed.  It was basically a frozen fish stick in a soft-shell taco.

Service:
Getting sat was a 40-minute wait, while we sat and looked at multiple open tables for over 20-minutes.

Our waiter was nice enough, but we ended up asking for one of my drinks again after 10-minutes.

Drinks:
The only saving grace of the experience.  The drinks were good, and reasonably priced.

If we go back, it will only be for the drinks.  Stay away from their food unless you like overpriced frozen food.

The double bacon cheeseburger was quite good, but the fish tacos were weak. Almost no flavor. Would not recommend them. 

Nothing remarkable about this place. A decent spot to score chain restaurant food in a mixed use shopping mall environment. Good selections for kids, but the adult food left something to be desired. Staff were nice.

I had high expectations for this place, but it was a major letdown. First, the food was not good. At all. Chicken Parm was mostly breading, chicken was tough. Served with a side of fettuccini Alfredo, which is weird.
Mahi mahi tacos were bland, had a weird, watery Cole slaw in it. Beer/ drink selection was just ok. Flagship beers from the biggest craft breweries, but nothing special.
Atmosphere was decent, and service was good. Unfortunately because of the very poor food, I can't recommend this place.
Great food good atmosphere. The wait staff kept drinks full and were very attentive clearing table when we were done with plates. Great place to grab a bite!
Not impressed. Over priced for the service and food quality you receive.  Been there twice with the same results.  Today at lunch there were seams of Flys inside the restaurant while we were eating.

Came to try it out with my family. There were flys all over our food. 6 or 7 flying every where. We were not sitting outside, but inside. I have been to many indoor/outdoor places but never with so many flys. Kind of gross. When we sat down they made a quick comment that it's an outside place and so there can be a few flys. Well... This was nuts. I told the server it was a bit much. Really bad and I think we won't come back till winter. Also my salmon plate had a very small cut of salmon. Think I be usually had a larger portion most other places. I think Cheddars over in 104th is much better food.

I guess we got the first time here shaft. We got put in the corner with the newbie. This person should probably not have been on the floor serving yet!  There were just two of us and got sat at a table for six. Everything that could be bad was bad. Asked for water twice then finally had to ask another server . People were coming in ten and fifteen minutes after us and getting there food before us. Food came out cold! Sweet potato fries were cold. Burger was supposed to be medium and came out super well done. Manager was just walking around not doing much, never seen him talk to any of the customers. Just a horrible experience for coming to a new packed restaurant for the first time. Probably will not return.

Horrible service, food is sub par at best.
Half of the wait staff was standing arround on our last visit. Waitress never came back after our food was dropped off so there wasnt anyone to rectify the fact that the food was not eddible. 
Will not be returning. Typical resturant in the orchards, forgo service because they have a great location

I hate giving a one star review because our waiter was great, they had an amazing Bloody Mary on special but the food was awful. I order the "Signature BBQ chicken" for 14.99. I've honestly had microwaved dinners that tasted better than this. In fact, based on the rubber feel and nearly paper thing cu of the "chicken breast" I am willing to bet that it was indeed microwaved, perhaps out of a boxed dinner purchased at the super target for $5 around the block. I happen to have celiac, so I'm unsure if the dinner was that expensive and that awful in their attempt to make it gluten free- regardless, they lost a customer. Strike that- I might go back for drinks. But I surely will eat dinner elsewhere before hand.

Food and atmosphere was great. The service was hands down amazing by everyone especially by Justin, who made our dinning experience exceptional. We will be returning to the Rusty Bucket and requesting Justin as our server!!!

Fist, understand that I stopped using Yelp in February.  My response to this place is so strong that I came back just to write this review.  

Most importantly, know that I ended up sick from their food.  The food didn't taste horrible, but it certainly wasn't great.  I had the Chicken Parmesan, and it tasted like every single thing on my plate came from the freezer or out of a bag.  The fettuccine Alfredo was dry.  The chicken Parmesan was salty and tasted like a cut of crappy pre-breaded frozen chicken.

With that in mind, the food is overpriced.  The seating wait was almost 35-minutes...with open tables not being quickly cleaned or seated.  The service was "meh".  The environment is a repeat that's been done time and again.  I said to my girlfriend, "If they're striving for mediocrity, mission accomplished."

...and I won't even go into the amount of flies in this establishment.

Regardless, I ended up sick from the food, and that's the most telling review.  I'm writing this review the day after, and my stomach still isn't right.

I will not be returning to this establishment.
For a newly opened restaurant they were fantastic!  Good menu selection, great food and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Nice to have a place like this on the north side.

We've been to this place twice.  The first time is a pre-opening training dinner.  Service was great even though our waiter was obviously new at the job.  They were probably triple-staffed for that event with trainers everywhere.  We had wings (excellent) and bucket bytes (decent) for apps.   For main dish we had the daily special BBQ pork sandwich, tuna wrap, reuben and something else I forgot.  All came quickly and well prepared, the only complaint we had was one batch of fries needed a bit more time in the fryer.  Beer selection is decent and they have some interesting choices in the rotators.  Environment is about what you'd expect for a bar and grill place, clean, efficient with good patio space.  Wifi connection took forever to login.

The first experience was good so we came back a couple of weeks later to see how the regular staff performs.  The place was packed with long wait time for table, kinda expected with locals checking out a new place so we sat at the bar instead.  We had wings, Italian torpedo and hot brown this time, all came out fairly quick and were tasty.  Still had slow wifi login issue but another customer at the bar told us once you're connected, the speed was good.

The staff still wasn't quite settled yet, there were 4 people tripping over each other in a not-that-big of a bar, a little unorganized but we didn't have any service complaint.

Overall, it's a decent place to eat, there are many more items on the menu we haven't tried yet.  Maybe it should be higher than 3 stars but the menu is too generic, nothing creative or really outstanding.

This was the first and is probably the last time we will come here. We were ignored upon arrival for at least 10 minutes. Then we ordered. After other people came and went and more than an hour had passed, they finally admitted to us that they had forgotten us. The food wasn't too bad, but the experience sucked. The manager at least comped our meal, which helped, but this place has issues. Go there at your own risk!

Go elsewhere if you enjoy flavor! My fiance and I were so hopeful about this new restaurant. We came in for happy hour today and found it to be so bland and lackluster. The food had no flavor what so ever. The quesadillas should have been tasty with corn and beans but nothing. In a blind food taste test I'm not sure I could have told you what it was. The sliders were a ringer for a plain Wendy's cheeseburger, but I could have gone there for a fraction of the price. We were underwhelmed to say the least.
We visited for the first time today for lunch and from start to finish the service was outstanding! The food was great!!! We will be back!
Not impressed at all. Food was mediocre and made my whole party sick. Staff was extremely rude and inattentive. The wait for food and drinks was lengthy. We won't be back.

I live 1.5 miles away and I'd love to say this is a great new place to frequent--but unfortunately my first experience left a pretty poor taste.

The "computers went down" which in and of itself is no big deal, but every table around us we heard from the wait staff were being comped.  We were NOT.  How do you explain that?  We were also the only ones with 2 toddlers having to wait way too long for our food.  If anyone should have been comped it would have been us with the impatient kids.

My beer took 30 minutes to arrive.  

Our sweet potato fries smelled and tasted like fried fish.

I asked for no dairy on my sandwich (allergy) but it was toasted with butter.

No thanks.

Brian
My friends and I had the burger and the meat was really juicy. It was almost perfect. I tried their salmon too, tasted great. Some waiters need to be educated more on the menue, though.

I give this place 2 stars because the food is OK. Drinks are OK. But the service was Terrible. And awkward. Will not return to this establishment and I suggest going to one of the many other options in the area with better service and better food.
Not overly impressed.  The staff is slow and appears to be new to the industry.  Food is just average.
Not so good .  First you b walk in and the floors are greasy and it feels likevyour ice skating.  The food was not so good. Therevwas flys all over and we had nats in our drinks

This place is by far my neighborhood favorite! Multiple visits and the food was amazing for entire party! Great atmosphere, friendly staff and gluten free menu. This particular evening, they were slammed, we had a party of 7, two dietary restrictions and two severe food allergic children...Julietta was extremely helpful and patient, the kitchen did an amazing job and we left happy and thankful that we were taken such good care of. Oh, and awesome bar area too!

I really felt inclined to leave a review for this place as it was horrible all the way around. The waitresses are confused and don't know what's going on. my son ordered a cheeseburger and sent it back twice for being bloody - it was more undercooked the second time he sent it back. my chicken was very oily .it reminded me of long John silvers chicken but way more oily. I got home and got sick . the fries were cold , the glasses were dirty ,the waitresses need some training ! This place was a major dissapointment .

We've tried this place several times, to see what all the hype was about.  Have to say, we're not that impressed! There is always a line, because it's small.  It's so small even at lunch time there isn't enough to room to walk to the restroom without bumping into something or someone. Single wide isles makes it difficult for the servers too. At the dinner rush, we waited 45 minutes to be seated.  While we were told 30. Then was rushed by the server to order- eat-and pay.  Most of the menu is fried bar food items and the taste was average.  Cost wasn't anything too pricey or spectacularly cheep. Very limited choice of beers and the bar drinks are on the pricey side. I'll pass on going back. Mostly due to the fact I don't like feeling rushed to eat nor the feeling like I'm in a mosh pit while sitting / ordering at the bar.

Great new bar/restaurant. I sat at the bar and had a couple beers and a buffalo chicken sandwich. My friend and I also shared a quesadilla app. The quesadilla was solid. The beer batter breading on the buffalo chicken sandwich was especially delicious. I'd definitely order that again. The bar had a good atmosphere and pretty good beer selection. The staff was clearly still learning the ropes in a newly opened restaurant but they were friendly and courteous.

Very delish!!! I LOVED the grapefruit margarita. It was do refreshing and great. Decor and atmosphere was great. For lunch I had the turkey club and French onion soup- both very good! My partner had the Asian Wrap and loved it. My only hope was for a more unique menu, it was very similar to Rock Bottom and other surrounding places. Our server Vy was great, so kind and attentive. The bar service was slow but they just opened so I'm sure the service is a learning curve. One more time though on that Grapefruit Marg- it was soooo good.
Just awesome. The service....the food...the value...Meryl was our server and she was the bomb. The food was SUPER fresh and cooked perfectly. We'll be back. A LOT.

Very impressed with this new place (opened 6/30/16). Drinks were good and the food was awesome! I had the blackened salmon salad, and would got back again just so I could eat the same amazing thing. We sat out on the patio which had a nice vibe to it. Will absolutely be going back. Only negative was a pretty long wait time to get a table, but that's to be expected for a brand new place.

Our friends suggested this restaurant and my gut feeling was to say "no" due to three things:  1.  Bad reviews  2. Chain restaurants often skimp on quality and 3. It's only been open for a short time....not much time to work out the kinks. I travel extensively for my job and make it a point to seek out restaurants in other cities with the best reviews. I only mention that because due to the fact that I frequent quality restaurants often, I feel I have a pretty good perspective on what makes for good food and good service. 

So I went because I really wanted some nice quality time with our friends. I should have listened to my gut....it's never wrong.  Our friends were already there when we arrived and we were seated on the patio, which I always think is a good thing.  There was an extensive menu so we decided to partake in drinks first.  I ordered a Kentucky Mule (like a Moscow Mule only with bourbon).  It came in a copper mug, which got my hopes up that it would be good.  Wrong.  It was mainly ginger beer....could not taste any bourbon at all so I sent it back.  We had to ask for waters and when I requested lemon for my water, the waitress (who had some difficulty with linguistics due to her tongue piercing) said "No!"   I guess she thought she was being funny but it was just a really odd response.  For one thing, this is not an Ed Debevic's or a Dick's Last Resort type of place.   I'm pretty sure the Rusty Bucket is not going for the "rude to the customer" schtick.  I was taken aback.  My friends politely laughed but we all thought it was kind of weird.  I was brought one lemon slice on a heated plate.  So odd. 

I'm quite the "When Harry Met Sally" kind of orderer (changing things up on the menu to suit my taste) so I ordered the salmon with sticky rice but instead of stir fried vegetables, I wanted fresh fruit instead.  I am not a fan of vegetables.   I also ordered a side order of sweet potato fries.  When everyone's food was brought out, I was handed a plate with a huge stack of vegetables with the salmon on top.  No sticky rice.  I let them know that was not what I ordered.  I was given the sweet potato fries and small bowl of fruit, which I munched on while everyone else ate their dinner.  The waitress came back several times to let me know that SHE had not messed up putting the order in, rather it was the KITCHEN who had screwed up.  Since I still had no main entree, I didn't really feel it was very professional to be letting me know that she was not taking any of the blame.  I don't care WHO'S fault it is.  When everyone is eating while I have no entree, there should be no playing of the "blame game" by the waitress.  It took forever for my fish to come out.  By then, everyone else was done.  To add insult to injury, the waitress questioned why I couldn't just eat the salmon that was brought out.  I explained as calmly as I could that since I didn't like vegetables, I sure didn't want fish that had been lying on top of the vegetables soaking up the flavor.  I finally said that I didn't really want to discuss it further but she insisted, going on to say "Well, if it was an allergy or something..."  WTH.  I'm a paying customer so if I don't want one food to touch another food, then that's really all that needs to be said.  

When I finally received my entree, it was obvious that the salmon had been cooked as quickly as possible with very little seasoning.  I'm thinking the kitchen was just trying to get it out the door.  It was dried out and the sticky rice was pretty basic.  I asked if they had any soy.  That seemed to really stump them.  Our waitress finally brought some sort of teriyaki sauce that was actually quite good.  I told her that the kitchen should use that sauce on the fish from now on and she questioned me, indicating that the salmon was just perfect the way it was.  She did finally acquiesce by saying "Thank you for the feedback".  

We did not ask for any adjustments to our bill but did notice that they did not charge us for the salmon so I'll give them that.  At least they realized I shouldn't pay for a meal that I had to eat alone and one that was also sub par.. 

My advice is to find another restaurant and tavern combo in town.  There are plenty that are MUCH better than this place.  I hope they're just suffering from new restaurant syndrome and with any luck, will get their act together.  Regardless, I won't be back.  There are way too many good restaurants out there.

10/19/2016 decided to try this for a first time, 5:40p.m. Weds. evening.  The hostess/greeter was friendly.  We sat at the bar.  It took quite a while for any acknowledgement by 2 bartenders and then we waited another several minutes for 2 beers (one of our beers was forgotten and the bartender had left to head to kitchen).  At least 3 of the beers from the rotator list were no longer available but that was not communicated except if we asked one by one.  Since we had time to sit there and wait, looking around indicated a huge lack of care and attention to detail.  For a fairly new restaurant/bar, it was super dirty, especially our glassware for our beers, shelving behind the bar, tap handles, floors, bartop, seats, etc.  I would be afraid to see the kitchen!  We had no desire to eat after that observation.   Unfortunately we will not be back ~   very disappointing.
Sitting here for 30 min and daughter just received the ice tea she ordered when we sat down. Veeeeerrryyy slow service.
Absolutely love this new place. Great food, fantastic hand crafted drinks and a pretty great staff.

Everyone working there seemed a bit confused. I realize they just opened up but there was almost no structure to their job. We had a 50 minute wait after reserving a table and there were empty tables all over the restaurant. The food was okay but it came in waves with the people at our table. This restaurant is clearly lacking good management. I definitely will not go back.

I'm a sucker for service and this place is top notch. Daniel, our waiter was amazing and warm, providing us with everything we wanted. Food was delicious with loads of selection for beer. Called and said there was a 30 minute wait. We walked in 10 minutes after calling and were promptly seated. No wait time at 6:30 on a Sunday. Already recommended it and will be back for sure!

Horrible experience!!! I ordered a turkey burger. Not only did it take forever, but it was overcooked and burnt! The waitress never came back, so I could not send back the burger. I picked it apart and finally a different server cleared our table. We then sat there  for ten minutes waiting for the waitress to bring our check. When she did I told her the burger was uneatable, she then became super rude saying you should have told me. I explained that she never checked on us. She continued being super rude, said she would take care of the check and stormed off. We waited ten more minutes thinking someone would come talk to us or at least let us pay for the second meal before we finally left.

We've been watching this place being built for a while and were anxious to try it. We had spent the day in the mountains and thought we'd stop in on our drive home. We had a party of 9 so we did call ahead seating. They quoted us 105 minutes - but we were driving from the mountains so that was fine with us. On the drive down we "yelped it" to see what the reviews were saying..... Needless to say it wasn't good. We decided to go anyways and see for ourselves We got there in about 70 minutes and our table was sat almost immediately. Our server was quick to greet us- I ordered food for my son when drink orders were taken. It came out in a reasonable amount of time. We had a little mix up with a beer, but other than that, drinks came out as expected. Food was actually delicious. The reviews I've read raved on the burgers. I decided to have the beer burger and it was incredible. It was my cheat meal for the week, and it was completely worth every calorie! When we left at about 8 pm, there were probably 30 people outside waiting for tables. I have a feeling they'll be quite busy for a while. New restaurants + busy = slow ticket times and long waits. So if you know that going in, I don't think you'll be upset. But our experience was lovely. Server was quick and attentive, drinks were good, food was delicious and came out timely. We will definitely be back.

The waiter with the tats on his arms and knuckles needs to go back to waiter school, or maybe he should just go... Very poor service. We'll be back maybe in 6 months. Broke my own rule coming to a new place. Crappy wait service. Abby the hostess was delightful, however. Management: figure out your service or the place won't last long.

Haven't had the food yet.  Sitting at the bar annoyed with the crazy high beer prices.  Reminds me why I don't go to corporate establishments.  Just here meeting friends and they picked the spot.  Sorry Busty Rucket.  We won't be back.

This is very busy place in evening time. However they are able to service customers quite well. We only waited a short time period before seating at table. The waitress gave us recommendations and answered our multiple questions patiently. Food quality are good, many choices. The services were fast and politely. I like this place, hope I can got back here again.

I dislike complaining but I dislike getting ripped off a lot more. At Rusty Bucket you don't get what you pay for. I ordered a mule and it cost me $11. I've never paid that much for a mule but that's not the problem. The problem is that it was the WORST drink I've ever had. They filled the cup with ice. That is not an exaggeration they literally filled the cup with ice. I placed my palm over the cup and it didn't even get wet because of how much ice it had. I pressed pressure downward and nothing came out. The mule was literally 90% ice and 10% drink. I promise you that I'm not exaggerating. I told the server and she said that's how we serve our drinks. It took me 3-4 seconds to finish my mule. That is such a rip off. The food is average if that, very greasy. I sincerely recommend you skip this place. Take your hard earned money and get your money's worth elsewhere. I am not the person that goes complaining a lot, but this place required an exception.

Food was better than we expected. Ordered house salad, nickel salad, chicken parmigan and beef stroganoff (Wed special). Loved everything! Only room for improvement would be on how the beer was poured (Guinness had a lot of foam). Seemed like all staff members were still working out the kinks. Covered patio was awesome. We'll definitely be back!

A huge fan!  Strip-mall Thai food at it's best!  There is outdoor seating!  There is parking!  There is a spice scale!  This was a great lunch. 

I ordered the Pad Ped- a stir-fry of Jalepanos, carrots, onions, and bell peppers with chicken.  I ordered it hot, reassuring the server that yes, I understood hot was going to be really hot. "Hot" here is one notch down from Thai hot, which I avoid after losing my eyebrow a few years back.  

Hot was hot, jalepenos included, and it was PERFECT!  The rice came in the shape of a heart, which is about all of the romance Ia m getting these days, so it was appreciated!  Soup appeared in front of me, with a glass of water immediately after sitting down and I was fiddling with my Yelp app to check in.  Free Soup!  At lunch!  NICE!

I think this set me back $15 with a tip.  I left, belly full and lips burning....and that's the way I like it!

Im love every thing here !! 
And im can said really thai test in Danver 
You should to try Everything here 

I do order SUKI soup and that out side on manu
But,i really can said that fantastic Soup in USA
U will nave fine from anywhere ,els ..I fo ptomise by test do great...!!!

I haven't gone to a Thai restaurant in a few years, and I recently had the opportunity to get some Thai food. The reviews here made me feel good about trying Mali Thai.

I went with a friend on a Friday around 7:00, and I was surprised at how empty the place was. The restaurant next door was jumping, but I think there were only two other tables with people at them when I came to Mali Thai. Weird.

Anyway, the service was prompt, and I was happy to learn that they could make gluten-free Pad Se Ew (my personal favorite dish). The food was yummy and served in a timely manner. Nothing outstanding, but it was good.

I was bummed that they were out of mango sticky rice for dessert, but it's not like I needed the extra calories. Maybe it was for the best.

So, while I'm not crazy excited about Mali Thai, I did like the place and I'll probably go back the next time I want Thai food.

The welcoming atmosphere & food presentations are just the beginning of a pleasant truly Thai dinimg experience.  Must say ALL of our selections were properly prepared, especially the "spice level" & delicious!  Will warrant a return when in Denver for sure.

Been living in DTC for 1.5 years now. At first, Mali Thai was my go-to spot (I'm talking at least once a week, if not more)... but as of late, it's gone downhill. 

More specifically, the food quality and portion size has gone down, but the prices have gone up. 

I recently switched up and ordered from another local thai place, then went back to Mali Thai the same week. Both places I ordered the panang curry, both were tasty but the Mali size was half that of the other, and a few bucks more. 

Sorry, I'll be heading elsewhere now.

Stumbled upon this place after just arriving in the area. Food was delicious and service was fast and easy. Portions were nice enough to have awesome leftovers. Would definitely go again. Recommend the pad Thai.

We were convinced to go here because of the other Yelp reviews. At 7pm on a Sarurday night we were the only table in the restaurant. Two adolescent boys were the only workers we saw during our visit. We ordered vegetable egg rolls, chicken pad thai, and mango sticky rice. The egg rolls were 4/5 stars. The dirty plate we got with our egg rolls was 0/5 stars. Then we were told they were out of mango sticky rice. Our chicken pad thai was a few pieces of chicken- the appearance of meat expanded with tofu chunks. It looked fancy from the purple cabbage shaved on top but that's where it ended. At this point we felt our experience and meal was worth three stars, despite our young server and the other employee retreating to a table in the dining room glued to their phones each time they weren't serving us. We sat with our empty plates and payment sitting out for a fair 5 minutes. Then we realized our server was the figure head down on the table in the center of the restaurant. My partner roused him up to ask if we could pay. We did and left.

My new favorite Thai restaurant. Green curry was amazing and the Thai tea is so delicious! The staff is super nice and accommodating; last time I was here we had about 15 people in our party and they were wonderful.

The following is all true. Slightly embarrassing.. But true.

I ordered from Mali Thai tonight due to a serious craving for some Thai food. I used to love a place in Lakewood called Star Thai, but have since moved near DTC area.

I ordered for pick up, and once I got there I went to pay and realized, that for only the second time in my life, I forgot my wallet at home. I told the gentleman I would go grab it and come back. He said I could take the food with me, and just call when I got home. I promised I would call him in 10 minutes.

I wanted to tell my boyfriend about the trust the gentleman extended me so I called him up. I then started to feel the pressure of showing the man that he did the right thing to trust me, and got nervous and ended up getting turned around in the tech center. Like I said I'm new(er) to this part of town and rarely go into DTC. My boyfriend was able to tell me how to get home, and joked that the staff was probably betting on whether or not I'd call, since now 20 minutes had passed.  Well I did, and I was very grateful for the customer service.

By the way, the Pad Thai and Tom Kha soup were absolutely delicious. I would have rated it a 5 even if I would had to drive back home for my wallet.

I'll definitely order here again, and encourage others to do the same.

Excellent mom and pop Thai restaurant in the Denver Tech Center. It has a modern look and feel with a run by the family mood. The family is very friendly and makes it a point to tell you that this is the exact same food they cook for themselves at home. The spiciness level seems to be spot on based on the description, I hate it when places think mild means no spice at all and hot means burn your mouth out, this place is different and is open to you customizing your meal to your taste. This is now my go to Thai restaurant in the area.

Solid Thai food here. I've brought a few very critical Thai aficionados here, and everyone has enjoyed their meals. Although I've never ventured past the usual Thai staples here, ie Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Fried Rice, etc, what I have had has been consistently good. They've got some pretty reasonably priced lunch specials which feature good portions for under $10. Service is consistently good and atmosphere is nice and clean.

We came here during lunch, and may I see, I was very disappointed. Their prices are steep for what you are getting. We ordered their chicken pad thai, and it was alright. We then added the fried rice, and it was so bad, it was almost inedible. Their service was awful as well. Since we looked young, the server prejudged us and would not come to the table at all, I had to seek him every time I needed something, even water. For the price, I have had MUCH better food and service else where. I will not be returning to this restaurant.

Tried this place for lunch and it will be my last visit. Overpriced. Small portions. Barely any chicken in my sweet and sour plate. Should have been called sweet and sour veggies cause that's all I had on my small portion of food. Also make sure the waiter tells you the brown rice is an extra $1.50 or they'll sneak it in there like they did to me. Nothing too exciting about coming back for.

We had a delicious lunch here and were pleasantly surprised to find such good Thai food in suburbia. We had a seafood soup with pork and noodles that was quite good, although the crab claw was not great . Fried tofu was really crisp. I had house special noodle and my wife had the Larb chicken salad. We did not see much of our waitress, who gave us one glass of water each, not to be refilled. But the food was good enough that we will likely come back another day to explore more of the menu.

Been here twice now for lunch! Staff is extremely friendly, and the food is great! I had the drunken noodles the first time, and mild red curry today. I'd be careful if you're not a spicy eater- even though the red curry was mild, I was still sweating, but it was worth it! Can't wait to come back:)

We ordered delivery and the person who took our order was fairly rude. The pad thai was dry and the red curry was not flavorful at all. 

We definitely won't be ordering from them again.

Best food in the Tech Center hands down. Staff clearly takes pride in the food. Pad see ew chicken is a staple of my diet. The curries are outstanding and the salads are delicious. Try the Mango salad.

Parking can be hard to come by if you're there during lunch or dinner.

The restaurant is very green with interesting decor (still had Christmas decorations up in February) but it's very clean and modern.

Service is very quick and friendly, they know they get busy.

Larb chicken was good but had no spice whatsoever. I know we ordered it mild but didn't think it'd be as bland as it was. I had the daily special garlic chicken which was DELICIOUS. Just the right portion too. Friend has pad Thai which was also really really good. They didn't have mango sticky rice available even though it was on the menu. We went with coconut ice cream and some other sticky rice. The ice cream had a different texture, wasn't exactly ice cream, but was still really good. The sticky rice and Thai custard were yum.

I can never decide between the yellow curry with chicken or chicken pad thai

They are both always so tasty. Have not found any other thai place in Denver that has quality and taste in comparison

I eat here about once a week

I wanted to check this place out b/c of the good reviews on yelp. When my friend and I arrived around 6pm, it was SO empty inside, I was afraid I had made a wrong decision to come here..

The summer rolls we ordered as appetizers were filled with bean sprouts that I couldn't taste anything else. So we both did not like them... 

BUT, I had their panang curry, and it was delicious! So good it makes up for the nasty summer rolls. :) It was creamy and spicy and savory, just as I like it. It was the perfect portion, and I loved that they offer both white and brown rice. 

There seems to be just one waitress (probably b/c it was so empty...) and she was very nice and attentive. I would come back and try some of the other dishes. Or do take out! I could see this joint being super busy around lunch time.. but for dinner, it was seriously completely EMPTY. But don't be fooled, the food was delicious. Just do NOT order the summer rolls. yuck.

I love Thai food and have wanted to try this place for a while. Though scores of reviews mentioned the heat level, I found it not hot at all. I ordered Red Curry with Vegetables Hot and it was maybe a notch above mild. My friend ordered medium and we both asked for hot sauce to ladle onto our dishes. So it sounds like they've been gringo-fied. You've been warned. Tell them adamently what kind of heat you want! The flavor of the curry was good but I don't know if I'd order the dish again.
I loved the soup they brought out upon arrival! It was just a simple broth with carrots and celery- but there was a distinct delicious flavor that set it apart from just a "normal" soup. Props there. 
We also ordered the summer rolls as an appetizer. I did not care for these at all. They were dry, barely any shrimp, and the peanut sauce was clumpy. I don't see a big need to return here.

The overall experience was great!!  Dining outside is definitely a must, but the interior is nicely decorated with pleasant themes.  Large televisions are great for filling in any awkward silences :)

The food itself is excellently priced; we had the pad see ew, masamun curry, and thai iced tea all for just under $20.  The portions were a little smaller than I'm used to, but still a great value!  I would definitely visit for a quick lunch or an early dinner.

So I called and ordered and they said 15-20 mins. 45 mins later I call and no one answers. No phone call from them either and they charged my card. What the heck kind of morals is that?!???

So the food finally got here. Pad Thai not bad. But the coconut ice cream and friend banana... It was vanilla ice cream not coconut. Disappointed
The food tasted pretty good, but very overpriced for what you get. The portions are tiny.

I don't what it is...whenever I choose a restaurant to host lunch for friends I end up making the wrong decision.  I have ordered delivery from Mali Thai before and it's been great so I was confident inviting friends here for lunch.  Service was okay and atmosphere was pleasant and clean - would be great on a warm summer's day.  

We ordered Duck Curry, Eggplant Stir Fry and Pas Se Ew.  Duck Curry was great, full of flavor.  It was begging for more duck and vegetables though and not enough rice was served with the dish to be able to eat all of the curry.  The eggplant stir fry was good and the best value of the three dishes.  

The Pad Se Ew was AWFUL.  I didn't want to say anything in front of my guests or return the dish, but I was nearly inedible, tasting burnt and rotten (smelled of feet or dirty socks, honestly).  Very off flavor and I couldn't eat more than a few bites to be polite to the guests I was hosting. It also didn't have more than a few very small pieces of chicken for the add on price of $2.  Oh and the curry came out 10 minutes after the rest of the dishes.

I will not be ordering from here again.

I have been going to this place for about a year.  I have no issue of visiting this spot by myself, and taking advantage of their beer special of buy two get one free.  I'm from Colorado for god sake!  I feel like I made a relationship with the female owner enough over this year.  She appreciates that my husband and I can take the heat, and quite frankly never order Pad Thai.  

I haven't been in to the restaurant in a few months.  I have ordered to go quite a few times in the last few weeks.  

So I ordered tonight, and it was a mess.  I was a bit shocked at the food.  So I called and made my plea.. Beef salad had no flavor, coconut soup, tasted oily.  I call immediately.

The young lady says they are going to come pick the order up???  Ok, and then what...

Long story short.  The young lady apologized over the phone.  But I didn't get any kind of apology from the husband/owner when he came to get my food.  It was like, we'll see if you have the right to have me deliver new food to you, which by the why was "fire" hot.  Like trying to teach me a lesson, BEFORE they received my first order back into the kitchen.

Well I'm sure they realized I had every right to complain for the first time, even though they have given me reason before.

Not sure if I will continue being a patron to this place again.  One reason is, I haven't ordered anything but beef, chicken, or tofu for awhile because I was concerned with what kind of meat I was actually being served.  

If someone orders/visits your establishment for a year and complains once.  You should have a bit more empathy.  Not happy.

Food was good, but these guys pushed the limit on up selling.  Brown rice, extra $1.50, add chicken to Pad Thai, extra $1.50.  Who on earth charges and extra $1.50 for that with Pad Thai ??  I won't be coming back just for this reason.

I have yet to find many good restaurants within walking distance of my house, so I really wanted to like this place. They have a really cute patio and the food was good pretty good (spicy with an abundance of vegetarian options), but there were some aspects of the service/quality that are too hard to look past. My friend's entree did not come for about 10-15 minutes after the rest of us were served and it was brought out with no apology/explanation, I found a hair embedded in my food (at which point I stopped eating, but I hate complaining about that type of thing because it's really no one's fault...It turned me off, but I won't hold it against them), and the wine served to our friends was hot. The wine was literally as warm as the sake!

After reading all the reviews, and looking for a good new place for Pad Thai, I decided to give this place a try.

The place is pretty easy to find, just off Ulster next to Darcy's Pub. Plenty of parking. The place was pretty empty when I went in, with only 2 or 3 other customers. It was pretty early on a Saturday, so this was to be somewhat expected.

Service was very good, quick and friendly. The Chang beer special (3 beers for the price of 2) was a great start!

The food came, pretty quickly, and was decent. I ordered the Pad Tai with chicken, and had it 'medium' spicy. I'm not sure what 'medium' spicy is to most people, but what came was very mild and tame. I should have gone for the 'very' spicy I suppose. The flavor was good, a bit on the sweet side, which would probably have been masked if I ordered it at the top of the spicy scale. Portion was good, but over all, just kind of average in the experience.

I will probably try again sometime, when I am in the area.  They are only minutes away from the Landmark movie theater, and Comedy Works Landmark, so it is pretty convenient for a night out.

The food was really really good. But the service was horrible. They only had one guy working the front. He was super busy and we felt really bad for him. Originally we were not going to tip him, but since he was by himself we understood that he was over worked. You guys need to hire more people up front !

Simple clean environment. Lunch style rather than dinner. Pretty casual. Grandma folding napkins at a corner table while grandchild playing on iPad. 
Food very delicious. Complimentary soup upon seating was awesome and welcome on a rainy day. Highly recommended.
AMAZZING! Best Thai food ever! Healthy and delicious great service. Ask for Satita best Thai in DTC! Get the papaya salad it's healthy and cures infections!
Delicious!  We had ordered a couple of different menu items and have been extremely pleased with all of them.  The food is wonderfully flavorful and fresh.

This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant in Colorado, Wyoming, South Dakota, North Dakota, Minnesota, and Utah.
Their service and recommendations are always exceptional.
The know exactly how to gauge proper spice levels.
Their flavors are so fulfilling.
I always come here when in Denver.
The are so caring and always remember my family and I.
The atmosphere is so relaxing and inviting.
First time and return guests should take solace in knowing that they care very much about the food they make, the impression they leave, and the friends they make.
This is ideal gathering and lunch or dinner place for anyone living in or traveling to Denver.
I got the Tom Kha soup w/ chicken and the pad se ew. Noodle dish was good, different than other thai restaruants. The tom kha, I've definitley had better.

I ordered the fresh rolls, only to be told about five minutes later that they were out, so I ordered the tod mun pla (fish cakes) instead and they were pretty good, and probably the highlight of the meal.  For my entrée, I had the drunken noodles which were just OK - the chunks of broccoli were an odd and seemed out of place, and it was lacking sauce.  I asked for hot sauce and was hoping for the typical selection of hot sauces offered in most Thai restaurants and all I got was some crushed red pepper.

I had the homemade coconut ice cream for a dessert and it was nice enough, but not creamy enough for my liking.

Overall, not horrible, but not great either.

Great food, delicious deserts and friendly service!  A must try! 

Mango and sweet rice was delish.  Noodle dishes were solid too!

The food here is excellent!  Be careful her version of medium heat is hot. The servers need some training but the chef makes up for it on many levels as she's adorable!  Pad Thai, pod pak and sticky mango rice were all awesome!  Enjoy! Worth the trip!

I have no idea why this place isn't more crowded. I live right across the street and I go at least once a week. The service is attentive, the atmosphere is nice, and the food is wonderful. I particularly enjoy the Massamon Curry and the Tom Kha. The chefs do a great job of fine tuning the spice to your taste (you'll notice the difference between a 5 and a 7). They're rarely busy, so carry-out is typically finished super fast. Please patronize this restaurant! I would hate to see them close as there is nothing else as good anywhere nearby.

I took a friend here for lunch. When she found out where we were going, she was chagrined because she said "they took forever to get the food to you" and she only had a set time for her lunch.

True to form, by the time our food came we had to ask for it in a to-go container, because it took more than half an hour. The waitress wasn't attentive at all or responsive to our situation. When the food FINALLY came, guess what? Both had MEAT in them and we had specifically ordered vegetarian items!!

They said they'd redo the items, but that took a long time too, and we had to leave with to-go bags when I'd planned a nice birthday luncheon for her. ARGH!

When we left, I assumed they'd take at least one of the meals off the bill for ruining our lunch. Nope. Not even a discount! 

Needless to say, I won't be choosing this place again anytime soon.

Holy moly--this place is the real deal! We came here on a whim and it was a most excellent experience (I feel very Bill and Ted saying that). As always, I ordered my standard chicken pad thai spicy and when I said spicy she told me "No, we will do medium spice". I'm not one who likes being told how to order something but there was something friendly about her remark so I took her advice and got medium spice.

Um, homegirl was right. I took one bite of the medium spice chicken pad thai and my mouth was on fire! And I liked it   The pad thai sauce was right on point with a great balance of sweet and spicy along with a hearty portion of both chicken and noodles. The chicken, the peanut, the bean sprouts, the spice--this dish had it all! I was so conflicted--I wanted to keep eating bite after bite because it was delicious but at the same time I wanted to stop since I never wanted the meal to end. I stopped at a good point, just enough where I was satisfied and could take enough home. Afterwards we ordered the fried banana and coconut ice cream (homemade) and it was mouthwatering. This is definitely my new go to spot for Thai food in Denver!

I've ordered delivery a couple times now. The first order I was able to slide under the $20 minimum with an order of pad Thai and pad se-ew. Both were super tasty dishes. 

Needing lunch delivered in another day (nothing like bring tied to your desk - bleh), I ordered Mali Thai again. This time I was held to the minimum order so threw in an order of veggie egg rolls. They were perfectly crispy and nicely flavored. 

It gets a bit pricey for lunch to order two dishes (the hubs gets one of the meals for dinner) but it's a delicious option when I can't break away for lunch.
Average and staff insular. A family set up with more interest in driving profits than repeat customers...better options in the DTC

Overpriced and small portions sums it up. I ordered lunch take-out recently and they asked if I wanted white or brown rice without disclosing the price difference. I chose brown rice which, in central Denver, is usually 50 cents more. When I arrived to pick up the food, it was about $13 after tax. I asked why, and they said the brown rice was $1.50! And the lunch portion is tiny. The container is divided in two with "entree" in one half and rice in the other. There was very little entree and for the entree price of $9.99, it was a littel ridiculous. I ate it all and was still hungry after a $13 dollar meal.
Fresh, delicious food and friendly prompt staff. Calm atmosphere. I had lunch and you could tell everything was made from scratch.

Tried Mali for the first time tonight. Had hoped that the food was going to be great, but both my dish and my wife's dish were bland. If I had never before had great green curry, I may have enjoyed it more. Same with the pad see ew (sp). The pork egg rolls were very good.

Came here for lunch recently with a group of Yelpers and was impressed.  The space is bright and cheerful.  Service was efficient and helpful.  Our server even helped me choose between the different kinds of curry and her recommendation was delicious.  I opted for the panang curry with beef and selected between mild and medium.  Next time I'll definitely stick with mild as it had quite a bit of heat to it!  The flavors were very good and I had enough for lunch plus leftovers for a small snack.  It would have been two meals if there had just been a bit more beef in my curry.  And, it was still less than $10 even with gratuity included.

As others have noted, parking can be difficult in this strip mall at lunch.  So, I'd recommend getting here on the early side or taking a late lunch.  The food is definitely worth it.  I'm not an expert when it comes to Thai food, but this is among my favorites of the Thai places I've tried.

I went with my husband. He ordered Pad Se Ew which was really good but my Pad Thai was disgusting. It was sweet, like the sauce was the same sauce you'd find on orange chicken..yes THAT sweet. I ate one bite and couldn't eat anymore of it. Awful. They also brought my husband's food out a good 5 minutes before mine so his food sat there getting cold while he waited for my food to come out. Definitely will not go back. You can't have a Thai place ruin Pad Thai.

In my limited experience with Thai food this place is the top of the pyramid for me. 

The prices are reasonable, and the food usually comes out pretty quickly. Most importantly it is delicious. If you are a lover of all things spicy like me, I suggest the Pad Ped. It is a stir fry dish with jalapenos, yellow onion, carrots, bell pepper, rice, and your choice of meat. 

The only downside about this place is on the few occasions I have gone there with parties of 6 or more there has been confusion about who ordered what from the wait staff each time. And one or two people usually end up waiting up to 5-10 minutes longer than the first person who receives there food. So if you are with a large party you might want to consider another restaurant.

We happened to be in the area after a work meeting and decided to check it out. I found the interior refreshing and lively unlike some of the hole-in-the-wall places you might find. I ordered the larb chicken salad, which is one of my favorite Thai dishes. It's light yet has good taste and they spiced it up to my liking. I think the scale was more along the lines of American than Thai spicy, as an FYI. I'd be interested to try something else here sometime.

Surprisingly pleasant flavor of the beef salad. In particular since the "free" half cup of soup upon arrival was rather bland and too peppery. 
What makes me write a one star review is the fact there was roughly a table spoon, or the equivalent of less than two ounces of beef hidden in my salad.  For $10. 
Shame on you.

Great Tom kha coconut soup and added in shrimp. I have a high spice tolerance and ordered the soup hot. Very delicious.

For main course, I had pine able fried rice w chicken hot. Do no get hot ! Super spicy..., my mistake. 

Overall 4/5 stars for takeout. They take credit cards over the phone and you can tip on it. Great service.

I love spicy food and most restaurants wont make the food as spicy as I like it, but the Thai Hot here is the real deal.  I was not able to finish my meal because it was too hot.  Not a complaint at all, but rather a compliment.  

The delivery service time was superb as well.

After reading the reviews, I decided to pick up some Thai food from here for the sick family. The location is in the upscale DTC area, but the price was very reasonable. 

As you enter int this strip mall, there is outside seating, but you can tell a lot of smokers hang out there. I got a whiff of it before I walked in. The interior was prety nice with contemporary green lighting, etc.

I ordered an appetizer, 2 entrees and a papaya salad and it was under $36.

I wasn't thrilled with the papaya salad, but my cousin loved it. I had the chicken flat noodles, medium heat, which was just right for me. It was quite tasty. 

The chicken satay were pretty good as well.

We were the first ones there for dinner tonight using a Groupon.  By the time we left, there were about 5 other parties having dinner.  This was our third visit.  The owners were the only ones working the front of the house tonight and service was actually good.  Our water glasses were refilled several times without asking.

We ordered the Summer Rolls, Mango Salad, Chicken Pad Thai, and Garlic Shrimp.  We have ordered all of these dishes before and we know what we like.  Everything was excellent.

They get the 4th star back.  We will be back.
