Pad kee moa hot was very good.  Service was slow and place was empty but food was good. I would recommend!

I love their food although they do lean more towards thai spicy than american spicy so be wary if you're ordering something hot. The mango salad is best mild in my opinion but it's delicious. All the employees are polite and professional but I prefer to pick up rather than dine in. There's a work area almost like a home office set up at one of the tables in the corner which was distracting. Best thai food I've found in DTC so far though. They did deliver once to my apt but I'm not sure if that's a regular thing.

The food was good, but the service was crap when I went to the bathroom the "soap" was just colored water, I mean seriously soap cost two dollars. I got the Thai basil and it was watery and the chicken was really rubbery. When we told her she just had a fit with us and yelled at us, we tried to tell her that it was bad but she just cut us of. Definitely not coming back again.
Their Pad Thai is perfect!! My friends and I ate here a couple of days ago, all we had was praise after we were done with the food. definitely a must try to all foodies out there.
Fantastic food, good and friendly service, and very decent price.

It's hard to give one start reviews, but is hard to better than "Eek! Methinks not".  Looking for an exciting place to eat while on the road, Mali popped up as a 4.5 start Thai restaurant.  How could I go wrong i asked?  I grabbed my colleagues and made the 20 minute drive to Mali.  We came early and there was only one server, which gradually grew to two.  The server was in a rush since she was alone but got our orders in right before we were ready to walk out.  Drinks came out two at a time, and then the wait for the food began.  I will give up a lot if the food is great

And therein lies the disappointment.  My dish arrived first and I mean 15 minutes before the other's dishes!!!  I got the house special noodle which was bland, and for $12 was too small.  Other got the house special, and one got the noodles.  Not a single person had anything good to say about their food.  The food was bland, and the veggies undercooked.  As a matter of fact we all kind of didnt want to say anything because we were expecting so much based on the reviews and were just really let down.

Maybe there isn't much Thai food in Denver but somehow I doubt it.  This place was lacking in every regard.  A big AVOID!

Food here is great and inexpensive. The pad   Kee Mao is a go to. I also had the homemade coconut ice cream which was delicious. The ambiance and decor are also pleasant, a modernish look. The service was alright - definitely not the best. The place was pretty much empty except 3 tables and they still managed to have moments where other tables were looking for servers. 

Overall good experience and great Thai food. Will be back when the craving comes.

What a refreshing little place.

I recommend the curry and a Thai iced tea. Specifically, I had the yellow curry with beef. But everybody at the table enjoyed something different. It's definitely a good place to bring friends.

The service was quite good as well.

They have a great Tom Kha Soup. One of the top Tom Kha Soups I've ever had. The portions could be better for the price, I've ordered this soup with almost twice the amount for a dollar more on their price at other places. Make sure when you order it if you are vegan to have them make it with out fish sauce. I'll be coming back for the soup.

Came here courtesy of the DTC Lunch Club (Denver's longest and award-winning lunch club according to Carly B). It was a nice place with very quick service and turnover.

I ordered from the lunch menu and ordered the panang curry lunch special. The soup was tasty and my curry dish was good. I enjoyed my meal, but it felt a little rushed and the lunch portion is tiny. I know I am used to American-sized huge portions, but the portions here are just enough to eat and  no leftovers.

I would probably go back, but I wasn't overly impressed either.

Thought the food was bland. Had pineapple fried rice. Pineapple is not sweet or fresh. Hoping I don't get sick from him. Step it up. I had pineapple  fried rice served in a whole pineapple once. They should try that. It was amazing. The food in front of me is not.
Very simple but just amazing flavors. Sauces for the stir fry extraordinary.  Duck Noodle Soup fabulous- the broth to die for.  Decor simple but pleasing and well thought out.  We'll be back soon.

My husband and I ate there today for lunch.  I mistakenly chose this Thai place over another one close by.  Bad idea.  The parking is horrible, even with the underground parking.  We were greeted with "Two?" and that's all, not even a smile.  The dining room was nearly full with about 50 people and the noise level was horrible.  I could barely hear my husband across the table.  There is an open ceiling and no sound proofing.  The server just said "Are you ready?" and I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken lunch special.  My husband wanted Garlic Beef but was told they were out of beef.  At Noon?  So he ordered pork.  Then the server walked away without offering us beverages.  My hubby flagged her down and he ordered a Sprite and I ordered a Thai Iced Tea.  The Sprite was fine...until he needed a refill.  It was very long in coming and when it did arrive, in a 20 oz glass, the top level was 1.5 inches below the top.  Since it was full of ice, it was about three sips.  My Thai Iced Tea was served in a very skinny, very tall glass, also packed with ice.  For $3.00 I barely got any liquid at all.  Plus, I had to drink it by holding it near my hip.

The soup that was served to us when taking our order was very bland.  It had frozen mixed vegetables in it.  Yuk.  It had no seasoning and the broth tasted like brown water.  There were no condiments on the tables - no salt, pepper, soy sauce, teriayki, sriracha, or pepper sauce/paste - so we couldn't add any flavor to it.

It took nearly 40 minutes for our food to arrive and, my husband said his smelled odd.  I could smell something "off" and he said his pork (which he had to order due to no beef) smelled like the pet food processing plant he has worked in as an engineer.  Plus, his Garlic Pork was presented poorly and was very bland, even though he ordered it with a lot of spice.  There was no color and it just wasn't appetizing.  It was also cold.  Not room temperature, but cold.  The white rice was a bit warm.

My Pad Thai was very blah.  I can make it better at home.  There was one, one-inch square of chicken that I could find, and NO peanuts.  I think it was a peanut sauce but it was not very tasty.  The bean sprouts were at least fresh.

One quarter of the way through my entree I found a long, black hair.  My husband's hair is short and gray and mine is medium-length, dark blonde.  I was getting ready to ask to pack it up to go but I completely lost my appetite.

Our server had only been to our table once to check (very late) on the Sprite refill and never once asked us how things were.  After it was obvious we were done (napkins on the table), she finally came by and simply picked up my husband's empty plate.  She did not offer me a box or anything.  I finally had to flag down a different server and tell her "Well, I wanted to take this home for later, but I found this hair." and showed it to her.  She said she'd be right back.  She came back with our bill and said, "They said I could give you a discount" and walked away.  I looked and it was a LOUSY 10% OFF!  For a hair in my food!?!?  Not to mention that I only got to eat about one-fourth of it???  I was hungry two hours later, but still put off by the thought of that hair in my food.  By the way, no one in the front or back of the house was wearing hair restraints.

We will NOT go back.  Poor parking, very poor service, not a good value, even with a lunch special, food that was worse than I can make myself, a very loud atmosphere, and uncaring managers/owners who don't want to make hair in food an issue they handle themselves or do anything about - free entree, free meal on return, etc.

This could have been a favorite lunch spot for hubby and I since it's close to his office.  We'll stick with our favorite Thai place (Dancing Noodle) and Asian place (Cherry Village Asian Grill) in Parker.

Visiting from Nashville and staying at the Hampton Inn nearby... Decided to skip the chains and go with the local joint. 
The restaurant was clean and the service was fantastic. We sampled 3 
 Appetizers crab cheese wontons, egg rolls and spring rolls. All of which where fresh and delicious! 
The complimentary soup was simple yet fantastic. 

Garlic Shrimp stir fry was worth going back for. Pad Thai was done classically. Green Curry was hot and delicious. Fried rice was well seasoned.

It was a delightful experience!

I just recently gave someone my speech about how I only give places on Yelp 5 stars if it's truly one of my favorites, and damn. This is definitely a favorite. 

I don't get down to the tech center often, but when I do absolutely have to have Mali Thai. I usually get the same thing (Pad Ped), but I've never had anything that wasn't awesome. I always order hot, and it's always hot and flavorful (it's not just the heat!). 

They have a little outdoor seating area if you're so inclined, but if not the inside is still very bright and sunny. The service has always been pleasant and speedy (I'm usually there on my lunch break).

Great food for a great price.

The chicken satay is quite average.  Thier peanut sauce is little more than peanut butter.  

Shrimp rolls are yummy.

However, the panang curry is outstanding.  I also appreciate the presentation

Bright, clean, nice people, and perfect portions of tasty food make Mali Thai a lunchtime win.  The fact that it's a three minute walk from work is not too shabby either.

This location used to swallow up greasy pizza joints, so I hope Mali Thai does well.  When we were in last month for DTC lunch club (the longest running Yelp lunch club in the Denver Metro area, I might add) it seemed to be hopping.  This place has the lunch hour in and out down to a science.  The time from ordering to scraping every last delicious morsel of food off of my plate was not long at all and they were good at accommodating separate checks.

I ordered the pad see ew with tofu (my usual go to, medium spice).  This version had lots of crispy fried egg bits and long pieces of Chinese broccoli to soak up the sweet soy sauce.  My favorite kind.  Call me a wimp, but I thought medium was perfect heat...detectable but not distracting.

My other dining friends had some great looking entrees.  Some even had sides of what appeared to be wild rice in the shape of a Christmas tree!  That's pretty cool.  They also start everyone with the prettiest bowl of tofu soup (clear broth with the vegetables cut into star shapes).

Glad to have stopped in.  Now I know I have a good lunch option within spitting distance of the office for the days I don't feel like driving.

Thank you YELP! I ordered Mali Thai for delivery today and wow!.
I ordered medium heat Shrimp Pad Thai, Chicken Satay, and Thai iced tea. The delivery was quick, I received my food in under 30 minutes. First, the Chicken Satay was delicious. it clearly came with freshly made peanut sauce, which was delicious. The Pad thai was perfect. They achieved the perfect balance of flavor and spiciness. I will definitely be returning.

Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing.  I had the pad garlic sauce with shrimp and it was flavorless and a tiny portion.

It's in a crazy-busy strip mall in the DTC area and I had to park quite a ways away in a hotel parking lot and then dodge cars to get there.

I dine here every time that I come to Denver on business. At this point, I am making up reasons to travel just so that I can dine at Mali Thai Cuisine. My favorite order is the Chicken Satay, Crab and Cheese Wontons, and the Chicken Pad Thai. This place is AMAZING.

Tom yum soup was delicious. the duck curry was also delicious but not enough duck. In one order, there were probably 5 pieces of duck in it. We ordered medium hot but it was more like mild hot- not spicy enough for me. We also ordered the pad se ew. It was not good at all! Like other reviews have said, it tasted burnt. No flavoring, just burnt all over. I'll have to try the pad Thai instead next time. Friendly service is definitely great to have with good food!
My wife and I had a bad experience here.  My wife is from Thailand and she was hoping to get a taste of her culture here.  Instead got bad service and bad food.

Spacious seating and clean colors inside. Tables are spaced far enough that you don't hear people sitting at tables around you. 

Good Thai food I have to say. And emphasis on presentation- I like that. The last thing I ate was masaman curry with brown rice. It was heavenly! I've also tried the drunken noodles and pad thai. Both were awesome. Food is greener, fresher and and less greasy compared to what is served at Thai restaurants in the neighborhood. They are usually very good with accommodating requests if you want your food made a certain way. Best part? They're like half mile from where I live! Woohoo!!!
The papaya salad is decent, the pad thai and thai tea are fantastic! Nice atmosphere and great service!

I am giving 5 stars for the food and the people who work . I am a vegetarian and ordered basil fried rice . -was AMAZING .. I'm not a fan of Thai food and this is my first time . This places makes me wana go there again .. Don't expect this ambience to be sophisticated.. Just ok ..must try !

Good lunch place for quick lunch special at lunch special price.  Ordering from menu is hit or miss and too expensive.  Food taste is too Americanized.  If you ask for spicy taste then they just add a lot of crushed red pepper, which is annoying. Meh.
Was super clean and the guy is very nice.  One thing to note, I ordered a 3 star dish, it was so good and flavorful but definitely spicy!
Good Thai restaurant near DTC area. Highly recommend their masaman curry. Lot of options on their lunch menu. The place gets packed during the lunch rush hour. The service is pretty fast

Don't let the unassuming exterior of this restaurant fool you.

The food is outstanding. I lived in South East Asia for eight years and Thai food was a daily staple. The food we had at Mali Thai was the most authentic Thai food I have had in this country. 

The Soup was to die for, the green papaya salad was outstanding, and the main dishes were equally so  

I give Mali Thai 5+ stars. If you like authentic Thai food you will not be disappointed.

Hello authentic Thai food! We tried the Raad Nah Gai (Chicken), Panang curry, and Tom Kha Gung (Shrimp) and we loved all of it. The noodle dish tasted like the ones I had in Thailand as a kid (my family is from Bangkok) and the soup was perfectly seasoned and you could taste all the fresh herbs in it. Plus, they actually only put ingredients in the soup that are supposed to be in there instead of other places that also add bell peppers or onions. They also have duck curry and Kao Pat Boo on the menu which I will try out again because these are hard to find dishes in Denver. 

One of the ways I test a Thai restaurant is whether I get chop sticks or not. I didn't and instead I got a spoon and a fork as it should be (google Big Bang Theory Sheldon on Thai food for an explanation). 

We definitely will be back and I will even take my highly food critical Thai mother there when she comes to town that's how impressed I was with the food! 

Almost forget, the homemade coconut ice cream is heavenly.

Was here for dinner few weeks back on a saturday night. 75% of the tables were full and there was only one server attending all the tables. They could do a little better on service.

Now coming to the food...we order chicken wings, Pad thai woonsen and Pad Khing. I felt the chicken wings were very dry and over fried. I loved their Pad Khing(medium spicy)...it had a great flavor and tasted delicious. The Pad thai woonsen was also good and the portion size is pretty decent. 

I gave them four stars ...as they can improve on their service....but will be back to try other dishes.

This place was Thaitastic! For me, Thai is that type of food that my wife is always trying to get me to eat instead of Mexican, but I honestly can't wait to blow her mind and suggest this place on our next outing. The vegetable soup starter was awesome, and my curry was delicious. It was decently priced at $10, but it did include the soup so i'd say the value is there. Our server was really nice and spoke broken English (which added to the credibility of the food), but the service could have been a little better as I had to wave a guy down to ask if he could refill my water, it could have been slower because I was outside though. All in all this place has begun to shift the priority of Thai in my life for the better!

This place look very relaxing. The food tasted 3/5 and for the service, unfortunately I would only give a 2/5 stars rating. I ordered pad thai and Thai ice tea. The pad Thai tasted okay compare to most of the pad thai I've eaten. The Thai tea has a unique taste to it. Overall for a first time visit, I'll give it 4/5. I will come back again and we'll see if my rating improve then.
I got the chicken pad thai and spring rolls. Saldy, I will not be ordering from them again as their was a lack of flavor.

Stands above the crowd in presentation, cleanliness, and quality of food.  Would recommend to anyone.

Tom Kha (coconut lemongrass soup) was enjoyable.  It had a decent amount of herbs to compliment the tofu I chose. 

Panang curry was rich in flavor and the sauce had a perfect consistency.  Don't expect many veggies; I had to order a side of them steamed for $3, which helped.  For $1 more, I ordered the dinner size, which isn't all that much. I'd hate to see how small the lunch portion is.

It's almost on par with Wild Ginger in Littleton.

Modern atmosphere that catches the eye.

Gosh do I miss this place. My fiancé and I probably ordered Mali once a week. I even asked the owner for the recipe and he abided. I'm excited to try and replicate what Mali is throwing down. The Pad Thai Woon Sen is top notch. It's by far the best Thai dish I've ever consumed. I've had other Thai places in Atlanta but nothing comes close to this place. I'll be searching for something comparable all my life. When I'm back in Denver, I'll be sure to pick up some Pad Thai Woon Sen from Mali.

The food at Mali Thai deserves 5 stars. Not only that but it is THE BEST THAI FOOD in CO or maybe even most of America. It is always very, very consistent. I have been here too many times to count for years, the spicy level you ask for, you always get (I always get medium, it's perfect.) It is always SO fresh and flavorful. They are not afraid to make your food actually spicy. Very, very good dining experience always, I have eaten in and ordered to go. Friendly, quick, GREAT service. The food is just really, really great here. Their fresh spring rolls and crab cheese wontons are amazing and I always really enjoy their soups. I would recommend their pad Thai, red curry and the pad kra pao.  Although all of their food is great. Also, the food presentation is amazing, they use carrot garnishes that are delicate and beautiful and the white rice is always in a heart shape. Also, definitely get a bottle of Chang beer, it is now one of my top 3 favorite beers and it goes great with the food! (They have a special now for buy 2 get 1 free.) The owner here is such a great person, you definitely want to eat here often and get to know the amazing people that run this place.

I get pickup for lunch while at work from here and I have been impressed with their individual service thus far. Unlike many Thai restaurants in the Denver area-at-large, Mali Thai knows how to liberally use spice! I get my food 'medium' and end up needing a drink and a tissue for my runny nose (that's a good thing for people who like spicy stuff.) Their fried bananas are Awesome as well! I've had swift customer service every time. 

Unfortunately, I can't recommend them as a large group ordering location. Our office ordered from there for roughly a dozen people and there were some definite let downs. 1 girl found 2 hairs in her food, and another coworker did as well. The quality definitely suffered for the quantity I think. They were prompt, so it might have just been an 'off' day.

My husband and I ate here on Valentine's Day this year. We got the Tom yum soup and papaya salad to start. Both were excellent! We had Penang curry and the drunken noodles for entrees. Again both were excellent! Tons of flavor! We ordered both dishes medium and they definitely were spicy. It cleared our sinuses right out! We were disappointed that they were out of the mango and sticky rice for dessert but we got the fried banana and coconut ice cream instead. The ice cream was great but I don't think I'd order it with the bananas again. The bananas had a batter that was similar to tempura and tasted greasy. Just not for me. We would definitely return though! I'd love to try more dishes!

Denver, Colorado- I'm impressed! Our party had nothing but raving compliments of the food here. I loved the Tom Kha- it was incredible and one of my new favorites. The creamy coconut milk was perfectly accompanied by a hint of lime and slight spice. I also had a pad Thai that was flavorful and filling. The Tom yum and curry had nice reviews from those dining with us. Thanks for the recommendation and for going us Shane, Andrew, and baby Lexi! I'll look forward to returning to this fun and bright (the walls are lime green) spot.

When your name is Gumbo's, you have to deliver an outstanding gumbo.  And live up to the name they did.  I wandered in here for a late lunch the other day and had an outstanding experience.  I took a seat at the window so that I could people watch in fabulous Uptown.

There are so many classic dishes to choose from including gumbo, red beans and rice and shrimp etouffee.  I couldn't decide so I asked the waitress to choose any of the three for me along with a side of cheddar grit cakes and a classic iced tea.

She went with the gumbo which arrived lightening fast and had the fabulous deep flavor of a well cooked roux, providing a launching point for all the other ingredients to shine.  My only complaint is that I wanted a bigger bowl and they offer only an appetizer size, it was that good.  The cheddar grit cakes arrived at the table a little after the gumbo and had a nice crisp crust; I'm sure they are deep fried which is even better.  The flavor had a nice smoky cheesy quality paired with the rich corn flavor and slight crunch on the outside.  Delicious.

Service was quick, fun and well done.  In short, this is an Uptown restaurant that I will be back to many more times.

Tried this spot for the first time last night. My server was very nice an attentive from the get-go. 

I ordered the gumbo and the red beans and rice, as these were two things that I grew up with and I wanted to see how they compared to my mama's. After I placed my order I waited for about 20-25 minutes. About the time I was going to flag down my server, she came up to me and apologized, saying that the kitchen guys thought my order had already gone out and that they were making it right then. Ok, no big deal. I told her that it was my first time there and she apologized again and told me that one of their servers had quit that night by simply not showing up. The place wasn't super packed so I thought there must be something going on. 

I got my food shortly after that and it was delicious. I decided that I was still hungry so I ordered the Tilapia Ponchartrain. This dish came out much quicker than my earlier order and was also very tasty. Though, as my grandfather used to say my eyes were bigger than my stomach and I asked for a to-go box. My server asked if it would be a silly question to talk about dessert and I said yes, but of course asked to see what they had as I could take it home for later. 

You guys. Pecan cheesecake with bourbon caramel sauce. OMG. Anyway, I ordered that to-go and was getting ready to pay my bill when the server tells me that the cheesecake is on the house because I had to wait so long for my original order. 

This is what made me give Gumbo's four stars. Not only was my server sincere in her apologies and great with her attentiveness, but she also wanted to make things right on the part of the restaurant. I can appreciate any establishment that recognizes a mistake and makes up for it. It shows that they care about their customers.

I will be going back to Gumbo's for sure.

When you date someone that was born & raised in New Orleans, you tend to be spoiled on your Cajun/creole cuisine. My boyfriend and I went here to celebrate our anniversary. It's a little pricier than we would normally spend going-out, so we saved it for a special occasion. 

The service was a slow and inattentive. But the cuisine is the closest thing to home - good New Orleans style comfort food. It is better than any corporate creole/Cajun restaurant that we've tried. It's not too greasy and not over blown with spices. Gumbo, dirty rice, and crawfish Etouffe are among my favorite dishes. The ones that stand-out and that I would highly recommend are the Tilapia Pontchartrain (Pon-choo-train) and the BBQ Shrimp & grits. The BBQ is not your usual BBQ pulled pork/beef brisket style. It is an entirely new creole style. You'll love and be surprised by the flavor.

Really great food but a bit dear (expensive). We're from the Springs so maybe that's normal. All the food was delicious and the service was good. Nice ambiance and location. I'd definitely go back but likely avoid the beignets as they were very dear and very meager.

I've been to Gumbo's about half a dozen times or so for both lunch and dinner - consistently excellent.   My preference is to sit at the bar - the spot where you can see into the kitchen... pretty cool to watch the chefs do their work - atmosphere is great, always candles, light music and pretty intimate.. great for a date, business or relaxing evening - like the artwork and pictures on the walls too.  My favorite dish is the tilapia pontchartrain with shrimp and crawfish... the sauce is incredible!  I also love the gumbo, etoufee and catfish... there's nothing that they don't do exceptionally well here.  Place is on the small side so call ahead or again eat at the bar... you'll have a great experience regardless.

Came here and enjoyed lunch on their patio with a friend. We both got the shrimp po'boy, mine fried, and his grilled. Both were decent but we agreed that there wasn't much seasoning or spice present. You don't bite into it and think cajun cooking. 

I got an appetizer of the seafood dirty rice and I thought it was really good. I'd definitely get it again. Especially if you put some of the green hot sauce on it to give it some kick. Plenty of shrimp mixed within.

My buddy said that the red beans and rice were just ok, and that Popeye's (yes the fried chicken chain) has better red beans and rice. Ouch... or maybe Popeye's just has really good red beans and rice?

Not a bad place to grab a bite in the neighborhood. I'd come back.

Gumbos has a great atmosphere and excellent service the music is awesome, I've read several reviews which were great and it just proves that Denver folks haven't tasted the same flavors that I have.. I had the shrimp and grits and the shrimp slider, the shrimp slider was amazing ... hats off to the chef, the shrimp and grit wasn't the best I've tasted, however it was flavorful.. I tasted the gumbo, and again I say to Denver folks it's probably good, I know the chef prides himself in his dishes however once again not the best I've tasted, but that's cause I'm from Louisiana and he's from New Jersey. Good for a night out ... seems like all the stars on yelp has gone to someone's head

Well, my first encounter with Gumbo's didn't get off to a great start. My friends and I headed over rather early on a Friday night. There were a few empty tables on the patio and several open tables inside. We hovered around at the hostess stand until a somewhat frazzled server told us the wait would be about 40 minutes. Hmmm...but what about all of these open tables? They are reserved, we were told. About 15 minutes later, as the empty tables remained empty, the server finally capitulated and let us have a table on the patio. I think overwhelmingly the 3 of us agreed that if you want to survive, if you want to stay in the green as a business, you've got to be welcoming and get people in your door. Making us stand awkwardly around the front entrance to the restaurant while tables stand empty is just not a feasible approach.

Finally seated, I ordered a bowl of gumbo and a simple salad. The salad was barely dressed. I had to ask for extra dressing. The salad was, as the name suggests, "simple." Nothing to write home about. I did not care that much for the gumbo, however, it was dark and chock-full of sausage which is probably how it's supposed to be! The fried green tomatoes were delicious and they are something I would recommend if you are dining here. My friend's order of fried catfish was huge! We ended with an order of beignets, which were freshly made. 

All in all, it was a nice evening after we got settled in.

After an arguably bumpy start, our experience ended on a high note. We dined for dinner on a snowy evening and opted for bar seats. Was disappointed in the beer offerings and in the fact that the two of us were handed a single menu and had to ask for a second so we could both decide what to eat. I inquired about the best way to order as the menu is separated into small plates, salads/po'boys, and large plates and was told "um, it's really up to you"-not exceptionally helpful. So, with limited input from the bartender/waiter the two of us decided to order the bbq shrimp & grits, gumbo, and crab cakes (all small plates). Additionally, I ordered the warm kale salad. The kale salad was exquisite served perfectly warm, with crispy Brussels (more like crispy chips), and tahini dressing. The crab cakes also came with warm kale salad and were great to share. The gumbo was spicy and rich with plenty of sausage. The shrimp and grits were tasty with the grits served in three triangular patties. 

The restaurant itself is a nice space located just near the intersection of 17th & Downing.  It appeared that there was a single large table that accommodated  a larger group. 

I would definitely recommend sharing the small plates and eating tapas style. My only qualm is the beer selection and the seemingly scattered service. But neither are enough to keep me away. I will be back again!
Gumbo, collards and grit cakes......I'm in heaven!!!!  Noah, best server in Denver!!  This place is amazing!!
Can't beat the prices to be honest. Twelve dollars got me a huge portion and another seven got me a great Moscow mule.
We had another great time at Gumbo's! Love this place! We make an effort to come here every chance we are in the area.

Great service, tasty food. Everything I had was delicious: gumbo (nice kick to it), collard greens, grit cakes, bbq shrimp. No complaints and I'll certainly return being I'm a transplant from south Louisiana and even though I like to cook it sure is nice to have someone else do it. Also, getting my Abita fix is necessary. The Abita Amber was nice and tasty as well.
Wow!!!! I am surprised it took me so long to get here. Everything was excellent from start to finish! The atmosphere,  the food,  the customer service were all great!!! I can't wait to get back here.

Great food and killer portions. I usually go to Lucielle's when I'm in Denbah but tried this place instead bc it's close to the venue. I'll come back. 

Fried catfish with a side of dirty rice loaded with shrimp and crawfish  for $11? And it's delicious? Say no more fam.

Came here for lunch last Friday with my Dad, a huge southern and NOLA style food lover. We were sat a nice table outside. 

My dad had said he wasn't starving and ordered the red beans and rice. I will pretty much always order a Shrimp Po'Boy if its on the menu. That is what I did. The waiter was not impressed that we didn't order drinks and a lot of food. Sad to not be treated well because we have a smaller appetite. 

My Po'Boy was pretty good except two of the shrimp had not been deveined. I did it myself at the table and continued to eat it. I am not a NOLA-style food expert, so I could be wrong but I was surprised they severed their Po'Boys with mustard, not just a mayo type sauce. The mustard took away from the other great flavors. None of the (many) Po'Boys I have eaten in Louisiana had mustard. The flavors were still good though. I'd like another option for my side besides sweet potato fries.

Sadly my dad's red beans and rice left much to be desired. Out of the entire soup bowl, there were only two slivers of sausage. Good thing he wasn't that hungry. 

I gave this place the benefit of the doubt because its in my neighborhood and I know they are capable of providing good food. Their (now closed) downtown location surely did. I will try again in the hopes that this was a fluke.

Arrived early for an 8:30 pm reservation on Fat Tuesday and was chastised by the hostess for having the audacity to come before our appointed time. We didn't ask to be seated early. We just thought we'd find a seat at the bar if one was available. But no. Little attitude chic had to get all up in my grill with a 'we'll see you at 8:30.' 

In your dreams, Beyotch!

Bummed to write this review but I think the management team and owners at Gumbo's should be aware and make some major changes. 

I used to love Gumbo's and I can say the food is still good, lacking in presentation and pricey for what you get, but the flavor is definitely good. Unfortunately the service is horrible. And unfortunately that is not an exaggeration. The last two times I have been it has been beyond negligent. I last dined there early October 2016 and the girl "serving" us could not have ignored us more - it took 50 minutes to get a bowl of soup and our waters were never once refilled. Sorry we didn't buy alcohol, but that seemed to be the kiss of death for service from her as we were now seen as "cheap" customers, or so it seemed hard not to believe. There was one large group there of about 12 people but other than that, we were among 3 other tables of two people, so it wasn't busy and there's no reason for a bowl of gumbo to take 50 minutes to get to the table. Our meals took another 35 minutes from there for two entrees. The waitress could have at least apologized for the long wait but she didn't acknowledge us at all after taking our orders. Simple efforts like, hey, how about a free dessert since that was an excessively long wait, or being at least on the ball with drink refills and apologizing for the wait would have gone a long way. I never want to not tip, and I did leave a small tip, but I don't think she deserved it at all and I'm sure she wasn't happy about the $4. We had the Denver Passbook, thankfully, since $50 would have been too much to pay for bad service, but she made a point to heavily circle the full total rather than the discounted one. That wasn't necessary, but rather, very tacky. We know how much to tip on and if she would have been better, I would have tipped the 20% on $50. 

With so many new and exciting restaurants popping up in Denver, Gumbo's would be smart to update the decor ( it's really cold and stark right now) and better train their staff to be friendlier, more professional and prompt. That's part of what you pay for when you go out to a nice meal.

Sorry Gumbo's, like I said, I have really liked you all for a long time and good creole food is hard to find in Denver,  but the last two times have been so disappointing and I won't be back for a while. :(

Terrible... Just walked in.. And the kitchen is out of food?.. Not surprised that this white establishment (culture vulture) can't really serve authentic southern cuisine and anticipate patron in a Friday night... So while me and my Girlfriend couldn't be seated... Because the kitchen ran out of food... I see fresh plates coming out.. People eating... And the wait staff setting up tables for more people to come in....?.. Trying to not make this racial... But from my perspective.. A black man from New Orleans... Can see... This place is a  phase restaurant with cheap flare.

Next time if you're gonna call your restaurant "Gumbos" be sure to travel down south and get a real perspective on how southern hospitality is done... This would never happen at Emerls.. Or Ernest's in Louisiana..

Not making a stop here again.

My husband and I FINALLY made it into this place to eat. We have passed by so many times and so glad we tried it! We had the gumbo and shrimp po boy with collard greens and it was all so amazing! Even the service is on point! I can't wait to come back!

Went here for lunch...which is a great time to go (no crowds, staff was relaxed and they were able to converse about the food, the restaurant, etc.).

The place was super clean and full of cheer with bright sunflower colored walls showcasing some tasteful art (see my panoramic).

Staff was uber friendly and very professional.

The food was fantastic. I had the gumbo with a side order of blacked shrimp (don't skimp out on these-they are delicious!!!). My friend had the chicken salad and had commented that it was just right, in taste and size.

This place will be visited again and again and I'm already looking forward to the next time.

Why aren't you here? May be best happy hour in Denver.  $4 small plates of gumbo, catfish, shrimp and grits and brussel sprouts.  Bread pudding was delicious and they have the best beignets this side of Cafe du Monde.  I'm a big N'awlins foodie and this was great.

We had the Gumbo and the dirty rice and they are both delicious! Perfect amount of heat to make it Cajun and the seafood and chicken was literally cooked to perfection!!! Best crawfish I have ever had. Nice and quiet restaurant but with funky bluesy music perfect to escape the Denver chill for a little while.

Gumbo's made me happy.  The service was great and the food was wonderful. There was a good amount of flavor and texture. I also had a cool and refreshing margarita. It was perfect on a hot summers day. 

I can't wait to to this again.

Hmmm....  Gumbo's....

  Went to this establishment, after having a Dinner somewhere else since the Birthday Girl, choose this establishment for her Birthday Dinner Party.  That evening was on Saturday November 8th 2014.  The Party starts at 19:00hrs.  I came in at a later time slot coz I have a prior engagement before this event.

  Anyways, we were seated at the Right Wing of this establishment, near the entrance.  Since I came in late, I sat all the way back near to where the Bar Section.  Once seated, I have to wait a bit, from our Main Server.  Man at that hour, this place is indeed super busy.  I was there way before 20:00hrs ish.  My friends already ate the Appetizer orders from what I could recall was the Mussels, Fried Green Tomatoes and Crawfish Etouffee to name a few.

  As for the Menu, it looks good and appetizing, but in terms of flavors some fall short for my personal taste buds.  I opt to order the Jumbo Lumb Crab Cakes which was ($15) as an appetizer.  WOWZA!  $15 for an appetizer can be a little too steep for some!

  TAKE NOTE, the ONLINE Menu and The Restaurant Menu DOES NOT TALLY, hence there are differences in some pricing of certain dishes.

  Anyways, about 20:25hrs my order arrived at the table.  It comes with the Crab Cakes which is a little too tiny for my liking, Pan seared, with Garlic Butter, served with Kale Salad and some pieces of Fried Kale with a Charred Lemon.  My Appetizer order was just MEH (2.5 stars), to Slight OK..  It does NOT WOW me as much.  *SIGH*  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing..

  I had the chance to sample the Crawfish Etouffee ($10), Grilled Flat Iron Steak, Chicken dish and Alamosa Striped Bass of what my friends ordered.  The Grilled Flat Iron Steak comes with Wild Gulf shrimp, Cremini mushrooms, Red Wine Pepper Sauce, Duck Fat Fingerling Potatoes and Brussels Sprout.  The Alamosa Striped Bass comes with Crispy Skin Bass Fillet, Gulf Shrimp Etouffee and Seasonal Vegetable.  To end the evening we also ordered the Beignet.  THANK GOD those are OK.  Fluffy, though small and the powdered sugar dusting was minimal at best.

  All in all, EVERYTHING was just OK.  Maybe I would return but NOT In A Hurry coz there are other options to eat from the Menu.  From there, perhaps my review might differ.

@209/2014

I heard this place was great so I checked it out. I appreciated their reservation system that my friend suggested I use.  Despite how busy it was, I was quickly seated by Kayla when I got there and she was super friendly and very knowledgeable. 

Kayla recommended the striped bass and it was delicious!!!  I had a glass of Sauvignon with it and complimented each other well.  The meat of the fish was tender while the skin contrasted with a crunchy texture with a scrumptious sauce that had just the right amount of kick but didn't overpower the bass. I also ordered a slice of key lime pie and it was the best key lime pie I've ever had. It's sweet flavor was a nice way to end the meal that left my taste buds happy!

Kayla's service was unlike any other.  She consistently wanted to make sure my meal was satisfactory, and my drinks were full.  I enjoyed getting to know a bit about her and she was genuine in her interactions. She wasn't a typical waitress and made my experience more personable with her style of individualized attention that waiting staff don't do anymore these days.  She helped make the ambiance of the place feel more intimate and really delivered a memorable dining experience that eating out should be.  Kayla was awesome!!!

The older male manager or owner was very rude. We came in during a busy time hoping to get a table. At first the hostess was going to try to seat us, until he told her not to and said no to us in a very rude way, making it clear he didn't want our business. I've eaten at hundreds of restaurants over the years and have never been treated like that.

A Creole classic!!! Great atmosphere with a beautiful dining room. The food is fantastic and the flavors hopped off my pallet. I started off with the BBQ shrimp with fried grit cakes then followed it up with some fried catfish!! You must come here!!!

Gum is was amazing! We stumbled upon it after the restaurant we planned to go had a violation and couldn't serve alcohol. So glad we did! We got there at 6pm on Saturday night and had 30 mins of happy hour!!! Great drink, I had a cool and spicy Marg and hubs had a hurricane. We both had to order one more because they were fab. Since it was happy hour, we got 6 small plates and shared-all were AMAZING!!! Gumbo, red beans, shrimp & grits, Brussels and sausage, green tomatoes and garlic butter (with ciabatta). Spicy to the eight degree, spiced just right and cooked to perfection! Every single bite was great! Service great, patio great! So pleased with our stumbled upon date night find. Can't wait to return!

We stopped by on a Wednesday night to celebrate our house got sold. To my surprise, the place was fairly empty. We sat down in a table on the patio and shortly after, our waiter greeted us. 

We ordered the steak and the scallop for entree, adding onto a crawfish etouffee and a shrimp etouffee. Both the entree and the sides were perfectly cooked. The etouffee were spicy but not so hot that you can't taste anything. Not the best I've had but definitely the best I've had in Denver. I don't think it's fair to compare it with the ones I have had in NOLA. 

Server was friendly and attentive through the whole meal. Ambiance is nice and it's a nice size patio to sit on. Definitely check the place out if you haven't already!

Consistently great food and the crawfish etouffee is awesome! We were in a big group and tried everything and there was nothing that wasn't delicious. I lived in the south near New Orleans and enjoy getting a taste of it out here.

This food was delicious. I had the blackened catfish and would have licked my plate clean if that wasnt weird to do in public. The jambalaya rice that came with it was also amazing. Definitely going back. Lost 1 star because it was a little pricey

We met some friends for a late dinner here the other day and had a great time with some amazing food.  I split the blackened catfish with my boyfriend which comes with chicken gumbo and dirty seafood rice, and then we got a side order of ettoufe.  The ettoufe was pretty good, but probably our least favorite, although it came without rice so that may have been the strange part (they did warn us the side orders don't come with rice, but it was still a little weird).   The catfish was probably the best I've ever had, and everything on that plate was amazing.  My friends got the blackened chicken and vegetables, and regular gumbo, and also said theirs was very good.  The gumbo didn't have quite as much of a kick as gumbo I've had in the past (in New Orleans, which is hard to beat), but was good, and I must say the kick to our catfish is probably what made the meal so good.  The drinks were very affordable, the wait staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was good, although not very busy as we went late on a weeknight.  Overall, we will plan to be back!

I ordered the blackened chicken jambalaya and steamed vegetables. Coming from the south and visiting New Orleans many times, I have been looking for something in Denver to satisfy my cajun fix. This place definitely did just that. From the bbq shrimp appetizer to the beignets for dessert everything was on point. We will absolutely be visiting here again.
Great Gumbo, one of the best  I've ever tried. Highly recommended  if you like Louisiana cooking.

The food here is good. Some of it is dead on New Orleans style some not so much but even the menu items that aren't "authentic" still taste great. The atmosphere could use some work. I like the New Orleans artist portraits on the wall but it seems like they could try a little harder to make the place look like it's going to stay open for longer than a month. 

Service is okay, which on the Denver scale is an 8 anywhere else it's a 5. I'll definitely be back because the food was good and, hell, it's the only Cajun place I know of in Denver.

Have been craving NOLA food and haven't been to Gumbo's for a few years so off we went for lunch today.  Place was still pretty busy at 1:15pm but we snagged a table outside.  I have to say I was pretty impressed.   I had a huge portion of fried catfish on étouffée with crawfish dirty rice and a side of collards with bacon and andouille and she had a really ample bowl of mussels with grilled bread for lunch today. $20 plus tip It was delish - not low cal but really good.  Considering the outrageous prices the restaurants are charging on 17th Ave. these days I thought this was the best deal I've seen in a long time.  Next time I feel like a calorie splurge we'll be back for sure.

My husband and I decided to try Gumbo's last night. Got there about 6:45pm and there was only 1 table occupied. Our waitress greeted us with menus and asked if we wanted drinks. She seemed annoyed because I was not drinking and my husband ordered a beer. The only IPA on the menu. They were out of it!  So he ordered something else. When she returned we told her that it was a first time visit and asked what she recommended. Her comment was "people seem to like the gumbo". Really? That's it?  Hello, first time visit!! She was quite unenthusiastic...
I asked about the pan roasted vegetables. What kind?  The answer was "it varies, I will have to check"...shouldn't a server know whats on the menu daily?  We ordered the popcorn shrimp for a starter. My husband ordered the red beans and rice and the andouille sausage with onions and peppers. I ordered the red beans and rice and the gumbo. All small plates.  She came back a few minutes later and said they were out of the sausage!  Strike 2! So my husband then decided on the shrimp po boy.

The popcorn shrimp was overcooked and very brown.  The gumbo however was tasty. My husband never got his red beans and rice and my order had about 18 rice grains in it and was extremely bland tasting, and when I asked for a side oder of rice, I was told they were out of rice and it would take 15-20 minutes to cook! Strike 3!  How are you out of the main ingredients on your menu?? On a Wednesday night?  With only 5 tables occupied? 

At this point we were completely over it and couldn't leave fast enough. Very disappointing..won't return..

Everything was delicious! The BBQ shrimp came out way better than I expected. The way the grits are prepared are amazing!! Plus there is a full bar - let me not forget that. The service was great even though it was near closing time.

Enjoyed a delicious lunch on Wednesday,Gumbo's is my FAVORITE restaurant for the BEST authentic Creole and Cajun cuisine from New Orleans, right in the heart of Denver on 17th Ave and Ogden. I sat outside on front patio and enjoyed the glorious weather, "people watching" and excellent service from my favorite waitress Hannah! Cheers Gumbo's, you ROCK our CREOLE CAJUN World! xoxox

Had the scallops and my wife had the crab cakes.  They were delicious, and I must say that their Brussels sprouts were the BEST I have ever had and I hate them.  But these were good.  No booths, but nice place.

Everytime I come into this restaurant I am blown away with the creativity and quality of the dishes. Noteable menu items: crabcakes, seafood dirty rice, shrimp poboy, blackened catfish, gumbo. Although, everything I have tried at this restaurant has been incredible so don't be afraid to try new things. Their bread is fresh and upon request, so make sure to order that first thing when you sit down! Love their outdoor seating area. Food is expensive so be prepared to empty out your wallet when you get in.

Found this place on Open Table and thought I'd give it a shot based on great Yelp reviews. I must say, Gumbo's lives up to the hype! 

Don was our server. He was fantastic. Very personable, friendly, and had great recommendations. 

We started with the Popcorn Shrimp and Gumbo. I was going to give this place 4 stars solely based on that... And then came the entrees: Blackened Catfish and Pork Tenderloin. Holy moly! Both dishes were melt-in-your mouth good. Seriously. 

We will be back, maybe next time for lunch to try one of their Po'Boys.

We are in Colorado for the Christmas holidays I decided to stop by this Cajun restaurant. It was so good the only reason why I'm giving them 4 stars is because I thought the rice could've been a little bit more brown as it was more orange and looked like Mexican rice but it still taste good... But the gumbo soup is off the chain and the fried catfish is so tender and juicy. I definitely will come back when I'm visiting Denver

I was in town and visited this place with my mom on Easter Sunday.  The restaurant is very cool, clean, and has a great 'feel' to it.  My bad as we had a great waiter/host, but I can't remember his name...he is from Louisiana and a really great person. 

All I need to say is that the food is fantastic!  I have eaten some amazing food in New Orleans and Gumbo's is just as good.  We enjoyed a lot of items from the menu.  The gumbo rocked, the étouffée was killer, and the beans/rice were first rate.  The only knock is that the kale is prepared in what I would call 'california style' as with garlic and brown sugar so it's too sweet.  Would prefer 'southern style' where it was cooked for hours with a ham-hock or bacon.  Otherwise, there is NOTHING wrong with this place.

Seriously delicious! Stopped in for lunch with my boyfriend who had the fried catfish. I ordered the tilapia with a cream sauce that was to die for!!! Oh and a side of collard greens-YUM. I don't think I can stress enough how good the food was. The guys in the kitchen really know what they're doing! It's also VERY reasonably priced. We live a block away so this will definitely be a weekly lunch spot. Just sad we didn't try it sooner.

This place is absolutely fantastic! We came for a friends birthday, I had the park tenderloin, and my husband had the steak. The food was the best we have had in a long time! Our waiter was Drew and it was literally the best service we have had in years!! Thank you!
Really good food. Service was excellent. Thanks Kayla! Date night for two old parents. Recommend the scallops

I had high expectations for the food after reading the reviews.  The gumbo (chicken and andouille sausage was fantastic - great spices, a little bit of kick - I felt as if I were back in NOLA.  We order something that looked like polenta friters, another excellent choice and great for dipping in your gumbo.  

My hurricane definitely packed a punch.  The Mosow Mule was delivered in a tin cup - what happened to the traditional copper cup?  

Here's the other side of my review - it was bone chilling in the restaurant.  We asked twice to get the temperature raised.  Some people made a comment in regards to the temperature and waited until some tables were opened outside.  Lastly, if you have ever visited NOLA, you will know that their service is not the greatest and the servers are not very attentive or have good attitudes - this was exactly what we encountered at this establishment.  

Lastly, there is a huge ABITA beer sign above the door.  Yet, they only offer one of the beers - Turbo.  What about Purple Haze? The Amber?  A bigger selection of Louisiana beer would had helped my experience.  

The food was great; the service does not match.
Great happy hour and service. Went here before a concert...easy walk after a filling meal.

This place is beyond ridiculous. I literally thought I had died and gone to heaven while eating here. OMG SO GOOD!!!! 
I went here for lunch today and got the blackened chicken dish with chicken gumbo, carrots, cauliflower and brussel sprouts, and I added blackened shrimp. I also got from the happy hour menu; bbq shrimp and cheddar grits, chicken gumbo, brussel sprouts, hummus and the red beans and rice with andouille sausages. All of these dishes were very flavorful and soo so so so good. I also got the hurricane cocktail and the cool and spicy margarita they were both very good and strong but tasted just right. I can not wait to come back here and try more of their food. This is one of the best restaurant finds I've ever had. The service was also good and everyone was very friendly. Don't miss out on this place!!! SO GOOOOOOD. I've come here about 20 times and it's always amazing!!

Loved that they do Togo orders since the resultant space is kind of small. If it was warmer when we went, the patio would have been a lovely option. This food is so delicious! It is hard to find Cajun food in Colorado (I think).  We got the BBQ shrimp, crispy shrimp, fried green tomatoes, and crawfish etouffè. Everything was delicious and the spice was mild (just how I like it, all the flavor with out overpowering spice). The only complaint is that I was hungry for shrimp and grits and they said the BBQ shrimp were their version of it. While the BBQ shrimp do come with grit cakes, it's a far cry from creamy grits topped with gravy and shrimp (how I think shrimp and grits should be). Overall delicious meal. The crawfish etouffè I think was $10 and it was by far the most delicious etouffè I have ever had!

I really need to come here more often. The food is always really good and it's a great value. I especially love the gumbo, the Brussels sprouts with mint syrup and any of the po boys. Happy hour is an extra budget friendly deal with strong cocktails and numerous food choices. Gumbos is a bright open space with friendly, casual servers.

Slowest service I have ever experienced! It was happy hour. We each ordered 3 appetizers. The server informed us everything was made fresh. It took over 45 minutes to be served a bowl of red beans and rice and gumbo. We know that was already prepared. The appetizers did not come out together. I ordered the shrimp slider and ask for additional sauce and was charged $.50.  This should have been mentioned in advance. I didn't enjoy the dessert - bread pudding. Overall, the food was good but not worth the wait.

AMAZING!  I've been here twice and am anxious to visit again soon!

Here are some amazing recommendations:
- craw fish étouffée (mind blowing)
- andouille sausage gumbo (I mean, you kind of have to get gumbo)
- warm kale salad (seriously delicious...so so so good)
- brussels sprouts (if I could make brussels sprouts taste as good as Gumbo's, I would eat them with every meal!)

Enjoy!  I hope you love this place as much as I do! :)

My friends and I tried to get a table and a middle aged male that worked there rudely turned us away. An hour later, when it wasn't busy, we tried to make a reservation for brunch for the following day. A female hostess found us a reservation. Just then, the same rude male rudely told us that there was no way that he could take any more tables. If that was the case the reservation shouldn't have popped up in the system. Even when you are busy you need to treat your customers with respect and he was so rude. After this experience, I'd never give this place a third try.

Coming from the heart of Cajun country, Lafayette, LA...we can truly attest this feels like home!  Legit!!
The menu us on point, the place looks great & we loved everything we had.  Will most definitely be back!!

Ate here the other night with my husband, first off we should have left since the place smelled so bad sewer gas?  Service was horrible, we were the only seated table and the waitress didn't bring my drink for ten minutes and then only because I flagged her down to ask for it.  Her response, I thought the bartender brought it to you.  Zatarains makes better ettoufe or jambalaya or whatever the rice concoction was that was under my scallops.  everything was super salty and truly mediocre.  Skip this restaurant it is awful

Tried Gumbos for the first time last week and I will definitely be back!  Not a miss in the whole experience - great food, excellent service, good ambiance and valet parking.

The kale salad was wonderful - crisp, fresh and not overpowered with dressing.  The chicken and crab was superb - I wish I had their recipe for the chicken.  If all collard greens are as good as theirs I should have tried them much sooner!  Had a side of crawfish etoufee (I am sure I spelled that wrong!) which had a bit of kick but not overpowering.  Dessert was the caramel bread pudding.  

I wish it were not rude to lick dishes in public - I was quite tempted here to do just that!  Cannot wait for my next visit.
A classic menu with creative twists puts Gumbo on map for me. With reasonable prices and still maintaining high quality ingredients this is the place you go to feel loved by food.
I had the pork tenderloin, which was juicy and herby. The sweet potatoes that came with it were sweet and delicious. Everyone else I was with enjoyed their meals very much.

Great food and service! Nothing was overly spicy. The scallops were cooked just right, and the tilapia had a wonderful flavor. Went pretty early on a Saturday night, about 6pm. Was quiet at first but filled up around 7. Generally a pretty quiet atmosphere though. The customer service was excellent too - kept checking on us, were very observant and proactively offered solutions when there was an issue.
Most authentic New Orleans food in the metro area. Favorites include fried catfish, seafood dirty rice, gumbo and red beans. Delicious food and fun atmosphere...highly recommend.

Great food. I had the catfish and gumbo. Gumbo was a bit spicy which I'm not into to but it was still good. I did order the Hurricane and OH BOY this is by far the strongest drink I've had at any restaurant. If you are looking to get a nice buzz off of one drink the hurricane is the drink to have.

Food was delicious, fresh and reasonable for what you get.  We had the seared scallops and the steak and shrimp.  Both were very good.  We had the mussels for an appetizer and they were the bomb and I eat mussels frequently.  Everything had a perfect amount of spice and the Vodka sodas were only 3 bucks a piece... lol
Check this place out, its a gem on 17th.. much better setting than their LODO restaurant was.  I will be back and their happy hr looks good too!

I love going to Gumbo's!  I recently ate there for my seven-year anniversary with my boyfriend and we loved everything.  The scallops melted in my mouth and the gumbo itself was divine.  It is just like anything you would find in the deep south -- rich, flavorful and authentic.  Definitely recommend this place for special occasions or just dinner any night of the week!

Best restaurant in Denver. In fact, when I eat here, I forget I'm even In Denver. As a Southerner I'm happy to say this place does bayou seafood right. My only regret is that I didn't start coming here sooner. It's hard to find a place like this in CO: Amazing food, great value, and tunes that set the perfect blues (or soulful) mood. Come here, sit in Don's section, order every course--you won't regret it.

Wow! The service, food, and environment are all on point. The bartender Kierstin made incredible cocktails and helps to navigate the menu perfectly. Bread pudding, étufee, and brussel sprouts are must haves.
Gumbos! We're have you been? Étouffée! Fried shrimp! And of course gumbo.. Incredible. Oh how I've missed you, I used to frequent your happy when you were located downtown. Good to see your face!

Love this restaurant, the food is delicious. Great flavors and a really nice menu. It's also fairly priced for the portions given. On a side note, I am from Hawaii and I am accustomed to all types of seafood. I must say I was impressed with the freshness of the fish and shrimp at this restaurant. Definitely a great place to try. The ambiance is nice as well.

This place has amazing food, but the services is absolutely horrible! 

They treat everyone that comes in for happy hour like we are 2nd class citizens, each of the waiters are SO rude and I have been to this place on more than one occasion in hopes that maybe the last person just hated there job.... 

But no I was wrong they all seem to hate working there or at the least serving customers who want to enjoy there happy hour... 

To the owner, you really need to clean house or have your people start treating customers with respect before you are forced to close your doors for good...

I was pleased with the flavor of the gumbo. It could afford to be a bit hotter. So a splash of hot sauce kicked it up where it needed to be. Plenty of okra, sausage, and rice. Perfect!  And the fried, green tomatoes were the perfect compliment since I wasn't starving and needed a little taste of Southern comfort food. Wait staff was very attentive and didn't rush me as I dined alone.
Happy hour great ,food great. But the waitress Victoria needs to wake up at the very least smile. But just the same I won't let that stop me I will be back.
Love their happy hour specials! Their shrimp sliders are the best!

Come at happy hour! Very inexpensive small dishes. I had hummus plate and chicken and sausage gumbo, both nicely spiced and tasty. 

The atmosphere is great--wish my sweetie was with me rather than being alone on a business trip. Lights low, jazz playing, oil candles on tables. A little loud for conversation maybe but good. Bar has one TV overhead.

Beignets and coffee! Unbelievably light and tasty (8 per order--of course I finished them!)

The Catfish large plate was out of this world. The beignets were so good I could be arrested for the things I wanted to do to them. 

We will be back to eat everything on this menu. The Dirty Rice too was incredible.

My friends and I wanted to have a fun Fat Tuesday meal. I will preference it with this... I get going there on Fat Tuesday would be busy but this place isn't that big so you'd think they'd be happy they were busy.  Well you'd be wrong.  Our waitress clearly wasn't amused to have the opportunity to make fat cash on Fat Tuesday.  

We had reservations at 6:30 at the exact time the specials ended.  When our server showed up she was clearly unamused and nearly mumbling.  Like I said she seemed mad to be there in general.  We order a round of drinks and ask if it's to late to get the small plate deals.  We got a very unamused answer that they are over and she walked away.
We ordered our dinner and I ordered an appetizer  of the hummus to start with.  Well the appetizer turned into the duringtizer.  Our meals arrived and asked to just cancel the hummus seeing that our food is now here.  I was told that since it was already rang in and being made I couldn't cancel this order.  The server blamed the busyness for the mistake.  However it's not my problem that the busy restaurant is to blame but why should I now have to pay $6 bucks for an appetizer I now have to mix in with my meal.  

My friends Scallops were burnt, which were the most expensive item on the menu.  Now our server is clearing our dishes before we're even done eating. Meanwhile all of our drinks sat empty.  At this point I refused to spend any more money on drinks and got a water.  

Well needless to say I can see why they downsized from their downtown location, and I won't be returning any time soon.   The servers attitude cost her a few rounds of drinks to run up a bigger bill and let's say a group that normally tips 20%+ tipped significantly less.  I shouldn't have had to buy an app because it was rang it and being made.  It should have came before the meal. It's generally how it works.   Lousy experience!
The food was delicious. Shrimp étouffée had a lot of shrimps, just enough spicy kick to the dish. The beignets were hot and so soft that it melt in my mouth.

We found this place out of no where. The food is so amazing. Gumbo is quite spicy for my taste but I wanted to keep eating it because it was so good. I had the tilapia and it was amazing. It was a special for the night.

I liked this place better when they were located in downtown Denver. Crawfish pasta was quite scrumptious. Blackened catfish is always good. What's the best though, what they're known for is probably their crawfish étouffée. Don't forget to save room for some bread pudding with a scoop of ice cream.
best fried oyster po boy this side of NOLA...at least in denver. love this place.

Went for happy hour with my husband and a friend. Loved the atmosphere and staff was super helpful in making decisions. I had the fried green tomatoes and BBQ shrimp with grits. Tomatoes were perfectly cooked, crunchy breading not at all greasy. Shrimp were smoky and spicy but the grits balanced well. Hubby had the crab & chicken which he loved. The stars honestly were the tomato jam and the greens. Wonderful night. Can't wait to go back!

You had me at Gumbo's .... I drove by this place a few times and have wanted to check it out for a few reasons.  One because I like Cajun food and two because the location is awesome.  A nice patio section on 17th street, will draw me in almost every time.

The restaurant itself is very nice.  It has a New Orleans theme but is not over the top or cheesy in anyway.  The staff was very attentive and was able to answer any questions we had about the menu or food.  It's an upscale~ish feel without being snooty, nice mix.

The food ... oh the food.  I had the blackened catfish.  It's severed over dirty rice with shrimp and a Cajun slaw.  The catfish was above average but was really stuck out to me was the shrimp dirty rice (I'm not sure if that's the official name but that's what I'm calling it).  It was phenomenal, a little creamy not too rich.  My date had the salmon, which was very tasty as well.  There were hints of Cajun but not overpowering.  

The booze ... They serve a few New Orleans beers on tap and a few CO beers in a bottles.  They have a good wine and mixed drink selection.  A few of the mixed drinks are New Orleans themed, like a hurricane.  

Gumbo's is a place I'll return to ... the food and atmosphere were great!

This restaurant is deserving of it's Diner's Choice Awards.  I have had several menu items and each have been excellent.  From the Crispy Catfish to the Scottish Salmon always perfectly prepared.  Upscale New Orleans Cuisine served by attentive and pleasant wait staff.  This is some of the finest food in Denver and we'll worth the short trip out of downtown.

I've lived in this 'hood about 4 years and have watched this location change just as many times. First Tastes then Wild Catch then Roam and now Gumbo's, and man alive, I hope this last one sticks around for a while. 

I had never been to the old Gumbo's, so I can't compare, but here's what I can say...the location, for me, is perfect. They have a nice happy hour. The first thing the waitress told us what that in downsizing the space & menu, they were able to focus on the food. All good things, if you ask me! 

We started with the gumbo, which was good, not great and they had "run out" of rice. I found that odd and frankly, it would have made the dish better, but I overlooked that because I was half way through my Hurricane (which, as a side note, I had 2 at Zydeco's prior to dinner and I preferred that one - less sweet and more boozy). For my entree, I had the delicious blackened catfish. Delicious, I say. It was served over "dirty" rice (so I got my rice fix, although, like David M said, it is more like a risotto) and a yummy slaw. The hubs got the Colorado bass and while good, was remorseful that he didn't order the catfish too...

I want to, and will, support this business, hence why I'm rounding up a 3.5 star experience to a 4 star one. Don't be scared if it looks empty - people tend to sit inside, and while it is a lovely interior, grab a seat outside.

I just recently discovered Gumbo's, and it has quickly become one of my favorite restaurants. Literally everything I have tried so far has been excellent.  They serve the best gumbo I've ever had, and if you like desserts their sweet potato cheesecake is delicious. 

Their happy hour deals can't be beat, they have great food and drink prices.  Everyone working there is so friendly too!
Gumbo's seriously has the BEST happy hour. The food and the drinks are so delicious. I find myself returning whenever possible.
I'm from South Mississippi and this is the closest i've gotten to food like home.  The gumbo is REAL.

One of the best restaurants in town hands down! If you like Cajun food this is the place to go. The menus may be on the smaller side in terms of the choices you have but everything is absolutely incredible!

You wouldn't imagine being able to find Cajun food in Denver, but here ya go! The menu is small, but the food is fresh and delicious. The gumbo is made new, every day, and it shows.
It's a little pricey, but if you show up for happy hour, you can get a delicious small bite and a beer for about $6-$10, and if you're stag, the bartenders are friendly and conversational.
Small portions means that Gumbo's is good for an after-work snack, late lunch, or light supper. Try the Turbodog Ale!

Love coming to Happy Hour here. Never been disappointed. The shrimp slider - I was skeptical at first - BUT - the moment I bit into it - I knew it was Louisiana gulf shrimp! It's like 3 jumbo shrimp dipped in a batter and fried to perfection, not at all greasy. The catfish is also delicious, big pieces too. The gumbo has a nice dark roux going on and the dirty rice is pretty darn good. And the hurricanes are awesome and strong! Gumbo's is probably my favorite place to eat in Denver.

My boyfriend and I recently discovered this little gem. I think Gumbo's has the best happy hour in Denver. They make their hurricanes strong! The food is amazing! If your hungry for dessert get the bread pudding.

I lived in New Orleans for a year, and this is hands-down the best Cajun food I have had outside of Louisiana. The crawfish etoufee is fantastic, and it's a perfect small portion for a side or appetizer.

While the food is pretty spot-on, the so-so ambiance and service doesn't justify the premium price that you're paying. The walls were plain yellow with a couple of scattered pieces of art, and our waiter, while nice, had obviously never been given the opportunity to try everything on the menu to even remotely describe any of the dishes we inquired about.

On to the food: Although I expected to shell a good amount of money for a couple entrees and dessert, I didn't expect to end up feeling hungry about an hour after our meal at Gumbo's.

High quality food can scream smaller than usual portions at a premium price, but sometimes that recipe gets old when you're just trying to enjoy good food without having to order the entire menu just to get full.

This place was a huge disappointment. Inadequately named, "Gumbo" fails at just that- gumbo. The flavors were bland and bared no semblance to true Louisiana cuisine. 

Part of the let down were:
--Gumbo made of mild sausage, chicken, okra, in a thick brown gravy. We had to douse ours with Tabasco in order for it be consumable. 
--Collard greens which tasted like sweet boiled greens
--Forgettable BBQ Shrimp
--Crispy shrimp slider, which I thought was quite tasty, but contained no traces of creole influence
--Crispy Catfish that was about 90% batter


On the plus side, we arrived during happy hour which offered a great value, but the food is nowhere near authentic nor satisfying. 

The food would be considered decent if had not claim to be "Louisiana Style" and failed to deliver.
Great service everytime we go. The shoestring fries are my favorite, they even gave my daughter a free ice cream cone!

Terrible service and attitude.  Waited over 20+ minutes in the drive through and then they didn't fill the whole order.  Had to wait additional minutes for the rest of the food, after we had to back up and ask for the rest of the items.  No apology, nothing.  Very unprofessional and staff either not trained or just rude.

Will never go there again.

Chaotic. Went in on a weekend with families swamping the place galore. Dining room wasn't the cleanest and honestly I have had better burgers elsewhere - Culver's comes to mind. It's a solidly OK concept but I never got into the super thin burger concept. 

I'd go back again but probably not in my top 10. Plenty of parking in Cornerstar center.
Meh.  The frozen custard is good.  The restaurant is filthy.  Sweep.  Mop.  Wipe the freakin tables.
The really good part about this place is there dipping sauce. Everything else is ok. The time you wait for food is a bit much.

Only went through the drive thru so can't comment on the inside, but the young staff working were extremely friendly and polite.  The burgers are what you would expect and the ice cream concretes are delicious.   Will go back when craving a burger definitely.

I love Freddy's!! The burgers & skinny fries are so good! I have been to this location quite a few times. I have never had a bad experience here. But, I never knew just how far the staff will go to make sure that you have a good experience, until yesterday.

I went to Freddy's to pick up lunch for myself and a co-worker. Service was good, food was ready pretty quickly and the soda fountain was the perfect combination of soda and syrup. Brought the food to my car and proceeded to lock my keys, cell phone, purse, food, everything in my car. I went back into the restaurant, explained what had just happened and asked to use the phone to call someone for help... With AAA on their way, the manager offered to remake my food when AAA got there so that I would have fresh lunch. It's so rare for someone to do something nice for a stranger now a days, especially when I am the one at fault. I am grateful to all of the staff and my co-worker was happy to (eventually) have a fresh, hot lunch!

First time coming to this place...I was really hungry and decided to stop by...I ordered the chicken sandwich and it looked nothing like the picture. They had a breaded chicken patty and the one that was given to me was grilled. They didn't even ask how I wanted it. I took a bite and it was ok, not the greatest. Won't really be going there again.

Disgusting went to lunch with my family today at freddy's 
A customer who came into the restaurant with a "pet dog"  (pekingese) NOT A SERVICE DOG it was in it kennel they sat right across from us.
My son suffers from dog allergies I told the manager she spoke to them these idiots ....they just just moved to another spot in the restaurant wow!  I dont know if we will be visiting this Freddy's again I left in disbelief ( it was a beautiful day these idiots could have sat out side with their dog!
but, I guess if management doesn't push that THIS DOG WAS NOT A SERVICE DOG what could I do leave? yes that is what we did my son left scratching

Good food, too many flies, got order wrong a few times...

The burgers are good. They got my order wrong, was pretty busy, the fries are the best part. The only thing, other than my order being wrong three times, was the amount of flies in this place...So gross, can't imagine if they got on the food or I'd not be able to eat...

If they got my order wrong again and the flies are swarming as they were the day my friend and I ate here, I'd write it off completely and never come back...So we'll see.

This location gets my order wrong every time. I'm always missing items.  The food usually tastes like it's been sitting around too. Doesn't seem very fresh. This place was good when it opened but has definitely gone down hill since.

What a friendly fast food restaurant. The staff is great and the French fries are like treasures in your mouth. If all they served were French fries and custard they would deserve 10 stars. Unfortunately for all the wonderful things the burgers leave a lot to be desired. Very thin and definitely not worth the cost. Go for chicken fingers, or a chili dog instead. (The chili is incredible) That being said the friendly staff and the French fries (so good) make up for the poor burgers.

I would have rather eaten a $10 bill than spend my money here. Customer service sucked - no one smiled, said "thank you" or "you're welcome"... which threw me off. Then I look at their hamburger, and the display was terrible. It looked like a squashed McDonald's hamburger, but worse. I will never go back to this place, any location, even if someone paid me to. It was nauseating!!!!
I have to say their French fries are to die for!!!!! Ice cream Sundays are amazing! !! So if you've never tried you need to

I love skinny fries. Burgers here are good too. Burger combos come with fries, enough to share. You can also get chili cheese fries as part of your combo meal (up charge) which then gives you a LOT of fries to share as you end up with a whole basket full! Definitely the way to go for two people.

Shakes here are thick and delicious. Haven't tried the other desserts. 

Did I mention how much I love skinny fries???
