Went in today and waited 25 minutes in the drive-thru. No big deal. Food was okay.  But when I finished my iced tea, I discovered a big chunk of onion in the bottom of my cup. Gross. I won't be returning.

I wanted, hoped, this place would make me smile.
I wanted, hoped, that a "steakburger" would be better than a fast-food burger.
I wanted, hoped, that this custard would be thick and exciting.
I wanted, hoped, that a "concrete" would be thicker than a blizzard.
But No.
But No.
But No.
But No.
The burgers are just plain old fast food...nothing special.
The custard is runny...do not tip it upside down...it will spill in one second.
I am happy I only ordered a mini concrete...still $3.99.
The whipped cream was good with the peppermint chips, but the chocolate was runny and plain.
My son's "oreo" tasted just the same as store brand ice cream...stop.
I won't return.

Love this place. Can't believe I've been in Denver for over three years and have not tried his place until today. The burgers are seasoned to perfection and the patties are so thin that it actually taste a bit crispy! The fries are super thin if you like them that way. And the fry sauce is the best! Highly recommend this place for an all-American burger.

Ok, so is it bad that the majority of my visits here are simply for dessert?!  Well don't judge me but that is the case.  I have been here a few times over the past month and it is just too darn good.  I recommend the Signature Turtle Concrete with Vanilla custard.  It is to die for!  Seriously.  My girl gets the Vanilla custard with cookie dough and sliced almonds.  Sounds weird but trust me, it is divine!  They do have great food as well.  I love the double cheese with fries and the fry sauce is where it's at.  Go here and thank me later!

While visiting Denver to see my sister, and after a hefty brunch, we decided to stop by for some frozen custard on our way back. I have never been to a Freddy's before and I was impressed with how many custard options they had.

There was a group of us and we tried the turtle sundae and the peanut butter and banana sundae. I thought it was awesome that they had a dirt and worms sundae as I haven't had that since I was a kid! The custard can be ordered in a milkshake or sundae form as well. We ordered the sundaes and asked for a side of gummy worms as well which they didn't question which leads me to believe that they have gotten his request before.

The custard was great and was not overly topped with the chocolate and peanut butter goodness so the ice cream to topping ratio was great. This was a nice quick option for some sweets while visiting Denver.
Fantastic burgers and the skinny crispy French fried are amazing! I can't get enough!

I can only review Freddy's based on its frozen custard.  I've stopped there a few times to get custard for my kids.  The custard itself tastes good, but no better than any other ice cream place.  On my most recently trip I got a small custard and a small sundae.  The only difference in the price (about .60) was one topping that my son got to pick for the sundae.  The sundae didn't even come with whipped cream and a cherry (or even a sauce of his choice).  You had to pay an extra .50/topping for an extras.  So, why pay for a sundae?   Also, the prices for the custard were a little on the high side.  I won't be back.

I'm thrilled to have a Freddy's in my local fast food option list. It's a wonderful alternative to the humdrum McD's, BK, Wendy's greaseball burgers.

Freddy's burgers are different. They are thin and smashed - almost flakey - but oh-so good. The fries are my favorite kind; thin and crispy. The custartd is a nice little (or big!) after-dinner treat. On multiple visits I have yet to find a food I didn't like.

My only (minor) complaint is that the tables are dirty more often than not. There is an army of people working at Freddy's and yet it's usually hard to find anybody cleaning tables. This is a common problem in the fast food world.

Always like Freddy's, especially the fries! However, sitting in the drive thru for 15 minutes seems extreme! Food is fresh, but maybe get rid of the drive through? Drive through means express to me and there is nothing fast about it!

I'd been reluctant to try this place until a friend recommended it.  If I'm on Arapahoe and wanting a burger I usually head for Smashburger and if I'm further east I head for Five Guys.  My experience here didn't change my mind on the other two.

The patties are so thin at 2.6 oz each they don't have the usual texture you experience from hamburgers.  Now the edges are nice and crispy and such, but the meat just didn't have the "right feel" for me.  I enjoyed the thin cut fries and the fries sauce, it's a nice unique touch and my favorite thing I took away from this experience.

I had read a few reviews and felt like I had to try the turtle sunday for dessert.  It was awful!  I felt the custard lacked any flavor and the hot fudge and caramel left me wanting a visit to Dairy Queen for a blizzard to get the bad taste out of my mouth.  They put just a tiny little dot of whipped cream on top.  Huge disappointment.

Alas Freddy, you probably won't see me again.

The food here is pretty good but it took forever for them to make it. I came at about two in the afternoon and there wasn't a single person in the store. I ordered but it took almost 20 min to make it. I was hungry as well as irritated by the time they gave me my food. Good food,  poor customer service.

Chicago dog was flavorless and they didn't even open the bun, which was messy for my guest. A bunch of teenagers work here, and while we came here on a slow night, our wait was very long for how short our order was. The teenagers were giggling and joking with each other and not getting anything done. Not very efficient. My burger was okay. Not enough seasoning on it.

Not bad! Burger was messy, but tasty. It was maybe a little too smashed, but very good. Fries were good, but get cold fast. Admittedly, I'm not often that into matchstick French fries. I would definitely visit again, but might skip the fries and try the custard.
Yuck. Period. The staff was great, though. Just a bunch of high school kids led by a good manager.

Yummy burgers for sure!  Not a fan of skinny fries.  Their custard just tastes like a regular milkshake.  They were so busy today that we went through drive thru and was served much faster.  I wouldn't drive the distance but if it was the only place for hundreds of miles, I would probably consider it.
I love Freddy's. Since there is no in n out the California style burger is the closest thing I have found. Fries are also really good!

If you're in the mood for some greasy fries and a burger, this is your place! The burgers are smashed down super super super thin and they have shoestring fries. Everything is fried in butter/oil and greasy, did I mention that?  The service is fairly quick, the bathroom usually has a wet floor sign up, not sure if there's a leak somewhere or if they're constantly mopping? The condiment station is well-stocked and the soda machine is clean and the ice tea was good. The custard is pricey and runny, but tastes like a good ice cream. Freddy's fits the need for a greasy burger joint in town, it's just not MY favorite burger.  What is my favorite burger, you may ask? I don't know, I haven't had a really great burger and onion rings in Colorado yet.

First time ever ordering from here, and they got my order wrong. It's pretty easy, no tomato add bacon. Easy enough, right? Apparently not. BUT!! I called to let them know of the mistake and talked to Mike and he had the BEST customer service. He offered for me to come back and he would have it remade right and refund my money immediately or he would put my name down for a free combo meal next time. I don't care about free stuff, I just want them to double check their orders. I politely decline because I don't need free stuff. He was awesome though. He said, "I can't fix it if I don't know there's a problem!" Excellent customer service. Just for that I'll return. :) Thanks Mike!!

Food has very good, service was excellent for it being a Friday night during the rush. I got the double steak burger with onion rings.

It is probably the best burger for the value .

Free self serve soda machine with Pepsi products.

Place was clean and manager stopped by to check and see if everything was good for us.

Food is pretty good, but they constantly get our order wrong. It's very frustrating to get home and realize the food you have is nothing close to what you ordered, and this has happened on multiple occasions. Guess I should have learned the first time, or from reading other reviews as it doesn't seem like I'm the only one with this issue.

The is a good place to grab a burger. It's a larger place and usually enough room for everyone. Service is good and the food is always fresh and cooked well. My only recommendation is, with so many employees standing around, they should have someone always cleaning the tables and floors.

It's a fun upbeat diner straight from the 50s.  The music makes you feel like a teenager from that era.

The cashier and cook were friendly and attentive.  The woman who took our order noticed we ordered only one burger and two frozen custards.  She asked if we were sharing the burger and offered to cut it in half.  While we waited for our food, the cook asked if we were being helped.  

The burger reminded my husband of the best burgers he ever had from Kansas when he was a child.  Their burgers are made of steak.  Not greasy at all.  I rarely eat burgers and craved it an hour later.  The pickles were delicious too.  

We were just looking for a frozen yogurt or ice cream shop and found a new burger joint.  We are unsure if the service is consistent between diners but we will be back to this one.

Love the food and strawberry milkshake.  My only complaint is after telling the guy in the drive-thru three times that I wanted both sandwiches with meals including fries.  He still did not put them in my order.  I was bummed when I got home and only had the sandwiches.
I love love love Freddy's. I get to have my burger in lettuce wraps and my daughter gets her ice cream. Their fries and fries sauce is delicious! If you love in n out you'll love Freddy's too.
Had problems with service a few times as ive been a lot. Great food and fantastic ice cream, need to fix service for a 5 star

The patty melt was so greasy it was inedible.  I was so excited to try the fries after reading all the reviews and the fries I got were cold and old not good at all. Totally bummed.  Even the bag was covered in grease when they handed it to me. Not ok.

Freddie, you dirty bitch! Where have you been hidin'? This burger joint is off the hook. Tasty burgers; really nice sear on the patties, right size/slice on the LTO. The amount of fries you get with the combo is endless, I usually have to ration to have enough fries to finish with my burger, but not at this place, you can shoves fries in your face by the handful (if no one is watching) and there will still be fries for the last scrumptious bite of burger. Wanted a frozen custard, but didn't wanna puke. maybe next time. sorry smashburger and in-n'out, there's a new sherrif in town and his name is Freddie.

Food here is amazing (albeit wayyyy overpriced for burgers and fries), however the staff is pretty bad. The past couple of times I was there, either the cashier was super rude (not sure what her name was, but the girl with claws for nails has a really horrible attitude) or they got my order wrong.

The management is really nice, though, and quickly corrected the mistake and even gave us a free meal (we went through the drive through and didn't notice the order was wrong until we were already home).

Good burgers, very mediocre fries.

I don't have any Freddy's near me, so I finally tried it after wanting to when I was in this area around lunch time.

I went for drive thru and it wasn't as fast as, say, McDonalds-which I take as a good thing, because I'm assuming it means they really do make it to order, so that longer wait time is worth it for increased quality. 

I got their double cheeseburger meal. I burger was delicious-I really enjoyed the steak style. It was nice and juicy. The fries, however, left a lot to be desired. They were shoe string style fries, and didn't taste like much at all-I might as well have been eating air. Very bland.

I might be back, but only for a burger. No fries with that, thank you.
Prompt. Friendly. Accurate. Great fast food. Love the fries and the burgers, of course.
The food is great, burgers are perfect, fries are great and the malts are done perfectly. The place was not busy but every table but maybe two were filthy, this was the only issue on our trip.

I will slap somebody as a natural reflex to biting into a Freddy's burger or their perfectly browned and crispy shoe string fries.

Oh MY Universe!!!

A friend took me here and I instantly fell in love with this place from the freshness to the tastiness of their food (each item was delicious including the meat, the buns, the pickles, oniions, lettuce, tomato, jalapeno-so crispy and refreshing) to the many tidbits about the creators of Freddy's along the walls of the establishment and within the booths. 

My coworker likes it better than Five Guys but one of her sons disagrees. What I do know is that they are slightly cheaper than Five Guys.

I haven't tried their custard but it's next on my list.
Freaking amazing hot dogs!! The fries are sharp and a little small for my preference, but the hot dogs make it worth it!

Ok first I must say the food is fabulous I mean truly fabulous. However it was quiet pricy. That reflects in my stars. And the drive through too crazy long. The custard is amazing. I got the turtle sundae I highly recommend this. The burger was amazing. The patty melt dou b le a serious yes.

I am not much of a burger fan but this place has become a favorite.  One of the reasons i like it is opposite of why some people on here dislike it.  I like thin patties one because i like to taste other things on my burger not just fill my stomach in one bite!

The only other thing ive tried is the onion rings which i get in place of the frys which are ok.

Burger:  Very good.  Bacon was crisp and the veggies were fresh.
Fries:  Crispy skinny shoestring fries.  Loved them.  5-Star fries.
Soda:  Meh.  I had to drink Diet Pepsi (there were two DP fountains) or Diet Dr. Pepper.  Why not replace one of the DPs with Diet Mountain Dew?  Not everyone likes cola.
Custard:  Creamy and good flavor.  I would get this again.
Service:  Prompt and courteous.
I will come back.

if you are hungry for some burgers, hot dogs or even some frozen custards, this is the place.  i really liked the thin cut fries... they are so scrumptious.

can't complain too much here.  its fast, its clean and price is very competitive.
The closest thing to Culver's in Colorado that I have found. (For all you Midwest transplants missing Culver's). Great food. Friendly staff, reasonable prices.
4 starts for the custard alone. I loved it! Will probably just go there for that though. The burgers are a super thin patty, I literary folded my in half to make it seem like a patty.

May be the best burger in town- but the establishment is the worst! Overflowing trash cans on the floor and in the kitchen- grease smears on the tables and counters where you place the order and pick up your food! Smashed fries and crumbs everywhere- Freddy himself would shut this place down if he saw the way this franchise owner was representing...disgusting!

I ate there a bit ago and I'm just now getting around to review.

I think my best description is that it is similar to Steak-N-Shake but just not as good.  I found the bugers left me feeling a little flat s they are very thin patties.

They were just okay.

In truth, the burgers are just OK--3 star.  But, the custard jumps the review to 5 stars.  I think of it more as a desert joint more than a burger joint.

The meals are a dime-a-dozen, but the custards are worth the trip.
Good food but service everything was cooked fresh
Went in for a quick shake and the restaurant was trashed. Looked like it hadn't been cleaned all day and the restrooms were disgusting! Not a place I'd visit again for food.

Stopped in today for lunch as we have been wanting to try it for some time. Walked in to a very clean restaurant that was very busy.  Seeing the prices there are comparable or even cheaper than other burger places. Got a double bacon cheeseburger combo and food was actually very good except fries were WAY too salty. But their fries, they are less than shoestring fry size, and delicious; a nice change from the standard fry. 
Only downside was how loud it gets. Was probably 80% full and busy and is extremely loud. Maybe its the building style or fabrication materials but it was louder than your usual place. Gf wants to try it and I'm definitely game to go back and try other things.

This location is always busy. I go here because I love there frozen custard concretes and I make it cookie dough and almonds. My abosolutely favorite. The service is always just a-ok. This time tho I waited in the drive-thru line entirely way to long. I had already ordered so I was three cars deep and I waited probably at least 15 mins. Unacceptable! Also I feel sorry for the 5 cars that I could see anyway... that were behind me. You know when you wish that you were not locked into the drive thru line because it is taking entirely way to long. I sure did love the taste of my amazing concrete tho.
Good burgers! Has that smashed burger theme going on. Only negative I have is drive through at this location is always slows.

As Homer would say, "This gets my worst review ever.  7 Thumbs Up."

What you will get for $8:
The thinnest wafer of a patty you've ever seen, over salted and cooked in about 90 seconds.  Fries that are just not good eats.  Something about the oil, maybe too old, I  don't know.  And a soda.  

The meat they use is highly suspect.  The taste is so foreign, it's as if there are more fillers than actual beef.  The bun and condiments were unremarkable and the burger did not hold together very well.  

You want a burger that will make you go gaga for $8?  Try Crave Burgers.

A decent option for lunch. The patties are very thin but full of flavor. The fries are also unusually thin, but tasty. A little pricey compared to their counterpart Good Times and the menu is very simplistic and unimpressive. However, this just opened recently so I expect they will grow and improve as time goes on. 

Minus 1 star for location... Cornerstar is a pain to get in and out of during rush hour, and with all the competition in the same shopping center (Five Guys, Chipotle, Which Wich, Garbanzos, Panera, Cheddars....) it seems like they could have been a little more strategic in location planning. 

Minus another star because their custard doesn't even begin to match up against Good Times
Steak burgers are yummy. I like this place better than Steak n Shake. Good service and yummy food. Though it is a chain, they aren't popping up all over the place. Love the California style burger.

I tried Freddy's yesterday for the first time.  I tried the double - good tasting burger, Super thin patties, though.  The fries will be skipped if I go back there.  These things are literally the skinniest fries I've ever had.  Sure they'll cook fast, but they'll also cool down fast too.  Three point five stars.
Note: I did have this brought back to me, so there was a bit of cool down time on the food.

The service here is so uniformly terrible that even though it's less than 3 minutes away, I won't go back again. This time, we waited in the drive thru for almost 5 minutes before someone would even take the order. There were no cars ahead of us. I had to repeat my order 4 times and stil had to clarify when I got to the window. I'm not talking spit-in-your-food special order - I just wanted 3 pints of custard, already packed. Had I known, I would have walked in, grabbed it from the case and been done in a third of the time. We waited at the window another several minutes while the employees were busy with their phones. Literally, they were on their personal phones while we waited. And waited. I get that they hire teenagers with not much work ethic, but isn't there a manager over the age of 17 anywhere? This is not a business that deserves to make money.

We came here to try the custard. We we're suggested to try the turtle sunday, so we ordered this and another regular custard with PB cups chopped up. Both had whipped cream and a cherry. The turtle sunday came with hot fudge, carmel sauce and pecans. The custard is good but maybe not the best, but for the price I'll take it. $4 for the regular sized turtle sunday and $3 for the regular with PB cups added. Service was prompt, helpful and welcoming.

I have eaten at Freddy's several times since they opened at CornerStar.  Their burgers are tasty and reasonably inexpensive.  Freddy's has cut into my Five Guys trips.  One reason is the convenience of their drive-through.  Another reason is that their custard is phenomenal.  I keep getting the turtle concrete and it continues to blow my mind.

The burgers are pretty thin patties and sort of a smashed on the griddle appearance.  They remind me of Culvers.  The french fries are thin and have a stronger potato taste than most french fries.  

Definitely try the custard.  I usually forgo the french fries and eat a burger and some ice cream.  The drive-through staff is unusually polite and it only takes a few minutes to get your food.

As close to In-N-Out Burger as I have found in Colorado!  The California-style burger is delicious and the skinny fries are not to be missed.  

I agree with the other Yelpers who suggest ordering the double - the patties are really thin, so if you are hungry you definitely want two.

The only disappointment was that they carry Pepsi products - I thought with the red and white awning and decor, it would be Coca-Cola and I could get my Diet Coke fix!

So we finally got around to trying the new Freddy's in the Cornerstar shopping center on Arapahoe and Parker. We have been to Freddy's many times, at the old Buckingham location, but now we have one right in our back yard!

This time around we were looking for a hot dog. You cannot find a decent hot dog in the Aurora/Centennial area. I am a traditionalist when it comes to hot dogs, usually just mustard and onios is all I put on them. Ketchup on a hot dog should be punishable by deah in my opinion. LOL Anyway, I got the plain hot dog just like I like it and I saw a Patty Melt on the menu, I had never seen it at the other location. So I got that as well. The hot dog was delicious. I love the grilled flat side buns and the hot dog itself was cooked pefectly. The only downfall was that it was so tiny! I chowed through it what seemed like a minute. Good thing I got the Patty Melt. The melt was delicious too, the carmelized onions and cheesey goodness complemented the thin burgers. And the rye bread was lightly grilled to perfection.

We were running errands so we opted out for the custard, a poor decision on our part thats for sure. I am still wishing today that we would have gotten the custard. Next time I will not make that mistake again!

I dont understand the camparison between Freddy's and In-N-Out. IMO In-N-Out pails in comparison. I just dont get the facination with thier food. Freddy's is much better and will be a regular stop for us!

5 Guys probably hates the fact that Freddy's is right in the same parking lot. Now they can sit and watch all the people going to Freddy's!

-MK

I was hoping for something close to In-N-Out Burger.  Sadly, this was not it.  The onion rings were decent, but the burger was a trainwreck.  I opted for the double with several toppings.  It was sloppy and fell apart quickly.  I was not tasting a lot of beef, so I pulled off part of a patty and ate that by itself.  Very weird.  There was almost no "meaty" flavor.  The texture was also oddly soft.  It was as if the patty had been poached.  The only enjoyable flavor on the burger was from the grilled onions.  Prices were reasonable, too bad the food was largely unacceptable.

I love Freddy's!  First ran into this franchise in it's home-town, Wichita.  Then started stopping at the Freddy's in Hays, KS (instead of the obligatory McD's stop) driving across Kansas.  Now there are 3 (I think) in the Denver Metro area.

This is a great "steakburger" (Winstead's in Kansas City has the only one better).  It's different, but really tasty.  Their frozen custard is great also.  The fries are good, and one order is enough for 2 people easily.

Service is "mid-west polite" and a welcome change from the typical fast food lackluster service you see frequently in this area.

The food is always good but the restaurant smells like mildew and the rags they use to wipe down the tables look and smell filthy. And the intercom system is really not necessary or good for the old fashion soda shop / diner ambience

I could see through the burger!!!

Check it out and then ask yourself if you prefer meat. 

Oh, and can we create another red and white themed burger joint please... 

How many can you count?

In and Out
Five Guys
Smash Burger
Big Boy
Freddy's

Add a splash of yellow and it grows

McDonalds
Juicy Burger
Red Robbin
Fat Burger

This place is so good. If you are looking for a steakburger that is packed with flavor this is the place for you. Yes it is fast food but they make everything to order. No it is not healthy but it is pretty darn tasty and I don't mind indulging every once in a while. The french fries are super thin and crispy, just the way I like them! The ice cream (custard) is also supper amazing yummylishous.  I am especially a fan of the cherry vanilla mini shakes. They are the perfect size and so tasty!
Yummy. Finally onion rings done right.  I like the burgers. But this is not in n out. I am from LA. If  you want in n out try. 5 guys.

This is certainly a nice burger.  They're very thin patties, so you get some crazy caramelized patty along with some great crunchy texture.  The toppings are nice and fresh, and although the California style has a Thousand-Island-like sauce, In-N-Out still is the king of the burger.  The fries are seriously thin and tasty.  Service is fast, place is clean even at the rush of the lunch hour.
Great place! Good food, fast friendly service always nice inside! Shakes are super and the fries omg so very good! Love this place you gotta try it!
Love this place. Courtesy and service were perfect. Burgers and hotdogs..especially the fries were great.
Delicious! Always great service. Drive through is always slow because of all the people that go there. I'm not a vegetarian but the veggie burger is so good! Fries are so thin and Delish!

I didn't try a burger. There are so many places in Colorado trying to do burgers it's kind of lost its appeal for me. Instead we stopped in for dessert. I had a turtle sundae which was more or less not worth the calories and fairly disappointing. After which, my stomach burned. You know that feeling you get in your gut when you've eaten way too much of something that was too sweet? That was it. Both my husband and I got same feeling after eating here. I might be inclined to try a burger sometime, but given that Five Guys is so close (BTW not a fan of 5 Guys, the husband is) I think I'd have hard time convincing my husband to get a burger at this place.

Oh, the frozen custard.  I had never tried frozen custard until I came to Freddy's, and I much prefer it to soft serve ice cream.  Every time I go I get a peanut butter and banana concrete (similar to an ice cream sundae IMHO) and a California-style burger with grilled onions.  I love it, it's replaced Five Guys as my burger place of choice in Cornerstar.
A really good cheeseburger and really good chili.

I'm not a burger lover, but this is a pretty good burger...not In-n-Out, but no other can replicate the Double Double. California style is a good way to go at Freddy's. If you like burgers definitely give this one a try.

As I have stated in many other reviews on wing places..I am a wing snob. Being from Buffalo NY, its hard to impress me outside of NYS with "good wings". Woody's was recommended to me by a coworker, who is a native of CO and never had true Buffalo NY wings. I thought I better give it a try...

I took the bestie with me, both of us being from NYS. We both agreed, they were pretty good. Not the best, nothing ever will be to us anywhere outside of our home-state, but these were worth going to Woodys. The size of the wings were as close as you come to Buffalos wings. I try many other establishments and you pay quite a bit for these small wings and that gets frustrating. I got 6 wings for about $6, and a side of curly fries and drink. My son got the kids meal of grilled cheese and fries and some milk. In the end we shared a bowl of ice cream and our total only came to $18. That's pretty good for a wing place. I ordered the bone-in wings, Medium and crispy. Most of the time I'll order crispy and it wont even be close. This was the perfect amount of crispy! No need to ask for them extra saucy (or as we say "wet"), theyre pretty covered in the sauce you order. The curly fries were okay...they tasted like Arby's fries. My son's grilled cheese(which he loved and was the cheesiest grilled cheese ever) came with straight fries and they were real tasty. They have a lot of flavors to choose from with their wing sauces too. Everyone really enjoyed their meals and I think we'll be back.

HOLY COW THOSE WINGS WERE DELICIOUS!!! So as my first time here in Colorado my cousin chimes she wild LOVE to grab wings it's her favorite after all. When asked where is her favorite, she immediately says "woody's". So this shop has two sides- one with bar the other more opened waiter to table service for groups of all sorts. Super casual and it has multiple TVs around. It's not so loud that you can't hear your own conversation. On to food!
Today I ordered a 6 piece - Bones In- with mild extra wet extra crisp... OMG mouthwatering juicy delicious wings! As a side curly fries . I have no regrets except that maybe next time I'll splurge for 10 wings and go for a long stroll :) also to note this location is closed on Tuesdays. Great service from the staff - very friendly and approached us frequently to check on us. LOVED IT HERE!!!

This used to be our favorite wing place. We have been eating here for about 5 years now. The wings are usually delicious so we have put up with long wait times, frequently incorrect orders (they forget something almost every time) and rude customer service. But in the last year things have gotten worse. The quality of the wings have plummeted (think trying to eat a piece of old jerky), the wait times have been as long as an hour and half, and the prices have gone up to boot (almost double what they were a year ago)! When we have had issues I have spoken to a manager who could care less about a long time customer having to wait an hour and a half because they couldn't get the order right the first 3 times. We love supporting small business, but it has to be good business. I don't recommend this establishment at all unless you have the patience of a saint.
Excellent lemon pepper wings.  Crispy and very flavorful.  Small fries is more than enough for one person. Lots of tv's to watch a variety of sports. Friendly service. Clean restaurant. Will be back.

Came here with the family and you can clearly see that we GRUBBED. Way too much food and we had to take some home. You have a full bar, a bunch of TV's, its has a separated restaurant portion, just in case you don't want to be around the bar, great for the kids. Woody's continues to be a staple in the Aurora area, its great to see their business grow and I would much rather spend my money here versus the chain restaurants. Service was on point, quality food, the only thing I can say, Woody's is a little more expensive than some of your neighboring wings spots... but it damn sure isn't as much as garbage they sell at Wing Stop. 

Looking forward to coming back to Woody's! Don't forget... if its a Broncos game, make sure you order as far in advance as you can, just to make sure you can get your order prior to the game... they get orders non stop on Sundays!

Perfect case of when a friends suggestion goes way wrong. I thought I was in the clear with Woody's Wings. Like, how can you mess up chicken wings right? Oh boy was I wrong. 

These wings were tough. Felt like I was snapping into some leather. Definitely not the texture I was looking for. Overcooked most def. Taste wasn't much to write home about either. Their mild flavor apparently meant just vinegar and not much else. 

Their sides weren't much better either. Garlic bread was so salty. Had me grasping at my water immediately. Their curly fries tasted good but they gave us just one tiny cup of ranch for a large order. Wasn't enough to go around at all. Fried pickles were pretty tasty though so they got my seal of approval. 

Service was friendly but kinda slow. Took us a bit to even get menus after we got seated, and the food took 30+ minutes to come out. Dang. Like daaaaang. So anyways, I won't be coming back. Not my dealio.

We're always on the lookout for wings.  Woody's is in our neighborhood and we stopped by after a brewery to refuel. I didn't realize at the time that we had already been to the second store on Havana. Now I've been here once before on my own and had the nuclear.  These folks ain't messin around there, so be warned.  I loved it but it did melt my face a little bit.  This time around Jess M. and I tried a honey sriracha they were offering and the garlic Parmesan.  The latter was very good initially but after a couple it became very salty.  The former was an excellent balance of sweet and heat. The wings themselves were big and meaty.  And unlike their other spot the sauces weren't overly watery.

Inside the decor is extremely basic, just a simple spot to sit and eat or pick up.  There isn't a huge amount of room.  There's a sports bar on the other half of the restaurant as well.  

The main downside is that carrots and celery is an extra add-on, not included.  I've not seen this anywhere before and I must say I felt slightly nickle n' dimed.  And I'm fairly certain that the blue cheese dressing was not made in-house, which I always find to be a nice touch.

Still the wings are good and close by and I'd come back for some hot love in my face!  (Don't make that weird.)

Hubs and I love it, especially him and he's very picky when it comes to his wings. Service was lovely, and we were recommended the spicy ranch. Tried it and love it, and I usually stay away from anything spicy. Great change from the subpar service we get from BWW in Havana, Aurora. Wish we had found this place sooner.

Garlic parmesan wings were crispy with shredded parmesan which is different and I liked those a lot. The spicyaki wings had a nice flavor but not as spicy as we would have liked. Both wings were good but didn't like that they were both drenched in sauce... a LOT of sauce and oil. Got an order of curly fries which were so yummy, crispy crispy crispy. Ordered a side of cheese with them but that never came (even though they charged us for it). Complimentary veggies for the table. Service was ok, pretty friendly, but kinda slow.

I love this place! These are by far my favorite wings. Always made fresh, they come to your table hot and crispy. The Fried zucchini is also delicious. The wait staff is super nice and always on top of things. I have been going here (and their old location) and their other location on Havana for many years and have yet to have a bad experience at any of them. Dang, now I'm hungry for wings!

The food is just OK. The service is sub par at best. I had to endure a 10 minute conversation about how the cashiers ex walked in some girl she didn't like. I wasn't put on hold, the phone connected and she was mid gossip. She did finally take my order, but with much attitude. The fountain drinks aren't self serve anymore. Wing are salty. But I'm not... Wing Stop is around the corner, I bet you would have a better experience there.

Not the best wings I have had in the area but they are pretty dang good. Some of the better ones in Aurora, that's for sure. I've never come here and left disappointed. I literally have enjoyed every flavor of their wings that I have tried. Their traditional wings are always a good size and fairly meaty and the boneless are pretty dang good as well. Update, I tried the fried pickles and thought they were pretty good. Also, good fries with your order. I am a huge fan of the fact that they have a restaurant side of you want to bring the family and then a bar side if you want some adult beverages as with your food and while there is a door way in between the two sides don't bother each other. Either side you sit on your service will be great and your food will come quickly.

I usually come here for lunch every few months with coworkers and at that time, its relatively slow so service is pretty good. They have a good selection of wing sauce, not a whole lot but a good well rounded selection, not too many of those extra flavors that most people don't order. 

The lunch specials here are a good deal in my opinion, definitely try this place out. the furnishing is outdated but the wings here are good and not completely drenched in sauce (the way I like it, might be different for others).
Best wings ever!  Fast, friendly service. Great prices.  Been coming to them for years.  Followed them from last location.  Will be back for sure!

I can't figure out what the fuss is all about.  There are obviously satisfied customers as the place is always packed.   But, I find the over-priced small portions of ordinary wings in flimsy paper table-ware to be a real downer.  

To top it off, both times I have come to Woody's the table service was horrific.  Young ladies with horrible attitudes who treat you like you are much more a bother than business.  It was so rude it was comical.  We spent a third of our lunch time making guesses at what we must have done to offend her before she even came to the table.  

On the other hand - the gentleman at the bar was cordial, generous, and kind.  Oh, yeah, that's where your tip went, Miss.

It's good. But the prices went up, I love everything but my family doesn't wanna go there anymore because the prices went up and it's really expensive! I also say the food sometimes they screw up your order and they will give you like Dr Pepper instead of root beer or buffalo wings instead of mild wings. But woody's wings is still good but I would say it has bad service.

Woodys wings are the best wings I've had in my life. Seriously. Their mild sauce is VERY mild, so we all got medium instead which was a little spicy for me but I loved it, it had lots of vinegar which makes it a good sauce. We ordered the family pack of 24 wings, potato salad and coleslaw (they were both excellent) and went through those wings really quickly so ordered some more and those went quick too. I wish we lived in the area, I would eat Woodys a lot!

Had lunch at Woodys today, first off the waitstaff is awesome. Very attentive to your service. Second the wings are fantabulious! Just eat there, but avoid football Sunday's unless you do a phone order. The fried pickle spears are awesome.

Not impressed with this trip. We tried to order at the counter like we had in the past. We were told that they are full service now and since we were dining in to grab a seat. After that it took more than five minutes to get acknowledged.  Then when we were asked if someone had helped us yet we said no and then waited another few minutes until another girl came by and finally got us our drinks. 

When we ordered the girl didn't write down our order then came back and asked what sauces we wanted. She also asked if we wanted ranch with our meal, which I requested, I like ranch with my wings. Our food took more than 20 minutes to come out, which seems a bit long for 20 wings and a corn dog. 

When our food finally came out my wife said everything looked good and I immediately noticed no ranch. No big deal, she told the waitress everything looked good, I'll just get up and ask for some. Ten minutes later, I'm still waiting for ranch.  She finally notices I'm still waiting for ranch and apologizes and gives me two. 

To be fair, I don't know how many tables she had other than the 4 in the dining area. If you are going to be a full service restaurant, there should be a bit more organization. We will be back in the future and I hope the service issues get addressed. Watching the waitress spill beer and talk on the phone, while she forgets about us is a unprofessional. 

I tipped  15% on a $41 bill which was generous. Had my wife not been there I would have forgotten her tip like she did my ranch.
Very good eats..never a problem with food always on time great atmosphere go A town...tge wings are at.Woodys wings

Wings were great and delivered in a timely matter. I think we've found our new favorite wing spot. It's a trek from our place and we will pass numerous wing spots on the way, however, I think they're worth it. 

The staff was very helpful in helping us decide which flavors to get for our family. The suggestions were great. All 5 kids and my husband left very satisfied with each having their own favorite. 

The place seemed clean and was very busy on a Sunday night. They have a full bar and a self service "soda" dispenser so perfect for refills. 

The wings were great, perfectly cooked, and I totally recommend this place.

column4: Francis E. Warren Air Force Base, WY
column13:
Wings are pretty decent.  I am still convinced that compared to a couple years ago, they changed the recipe for the Buffalo wing sauce.  Once upon a time, they tasted exactly like real Buffalo, NY wings.  Not any more. Sauce has a decent flavor, but it is missing what it once had.  (The last time we asked about whether the sauce had changed, the owners swore that it hadn't). 

The small order of curly fries was pretty meager and in a bunch of pieces as if they came from the bottom of the bag.

What bugs most is that a server and what appeared to be a manager had flip flops on--open toe and heal shoes.  Aside from a blatant health code violation, it looks pretty gross when staff who are going in and out of the kitchen are running around in almost bare feet. 

Every time we visit, we are less and less inspired to return.
Good wings and fries at a good price. I like the sports atmosphere. Great customer service.

Some of the best wings in the Denver/ Aurora area. I've tried alot of places and this place is definitely in the top 5. Only 4 stars because they charge for ranch, which is ridiculous, they don't deliver and sometimes the service isn't great. Other than that it's great. I recommend asking for light sauce if you're doing takeout!
Wings are pretty decent good flavor and extra crispy comes out extra crispy but they really need to clean the restaurant.  Last time in it was filthy

Woody's is DELICIOUS. My family and I come here every Saturday. I always order the chicken tenders ($8.15) and fries. The food is not too expensive, and this is one of the few places where you get a good serving of food, sometimes extra. The chicken comes with 4 tenders, but you usually get anywhere from 6-8 tenders, and lots of fries on the bottom of your tray. One time a girl even brought us free brownies.

The bathrooms deserve about a 1. They are dirty, but as long as you don't eat your dinner in there, you will be fine. 

The staff is usually very friendly, and the new people are actually very well educated about the job. 

One thing, Woody's Wings has great food and good servings/prices, but can be loud if your not seated in the bar. Screaming kids and toddlers exist in this place, but you can always ask for a better seat.

I have been to Woody's Wings 3 times in the past month, and I haven't been disappointed yet! The ladies in the front are always friendly and courteous and the food is always amazing! The dine I. Experience is good. They have a dining area as well as a separate area to sit at the bar with a very large TV that is playing sporting events or highlights.

These wings are the best I have had in a long time! Goodbye Buffalo Wild Wings or Wing Stop. The flavor is amazing and the appetizers are fun and plentiful. 

When I called and placed a pick up order, I was easily able to order the same meal I had ordered previously which was also extremely convenient and it was ready to be picked up in 15 minutes.

If you are looking for great wings and sides, look no further!
Love this place. . Haven't been here in years but it is so good. .. very crispy wings! !!  Loved the deep fried mushrooms

I have been coming to woody's since they were at their original location in the early 90's.  I love the crisp wings and the fried mushrooms aren't bad either.  

The service at its new location can be spotty.  I've been there an received quick friendly service, I have also been there and waited 10 minutes before gwtting a drink...While sutting at the small bar.

I have been a loyal customer for years, and I hope this is just growing pains from moving locations.  I will settle for good, but they were great at one time.
Wings are good but the service was horribly slow!! So slow it was a turnoff and it wasn't busy at all!! If it was better the easily a four to five start then...........

PERFECTION!! My dad turned 67 this week and it has been a hard year for him to say the least. For his bday all he wanted was woodys. We tried to take him to fancier places but he insisted. And I'm so glad he did. We had an amazing lunch there. Our server Andre was the best server any of us have had in years (anywhere) he didn't miss a beat and took great care of our large group. The wings were fabulous, the entire restaurant joined in as we sang happy birthday to our father (both staff and customers) and most importantly we all left smiling. This place has been a favorites of my dads for years (old and new location) and now I know why! I am so glad I didn't listen to the other negative reviews and that we came here. We made memories that will never be forgotten! Thank u!!

Some of the best wings we have ever had! Our favorite sauce is honey hot, but we also like the garlic parmesan, medium, spicy ranch, & lemon pepper. We love them extra crispy as well. Woody's is our go-to wing spot!
I love Woody's Wings!!!! Seriously the best wings I've found in Colorado!!! The food is always consistent and delicious! Thanks Woody's for always being amazing!

I didn't like their lemon pepper. The honey bbq were okay. But even though I took my order to go and didn't really like the food, they still provided really good customer service. The only reason I'm giving them 3 stars .
Excellent wings! Got great flavor and are extra saucy! Could be a lil cheaper but awesome wings.

Glad to see them move into a location that matched their solid food. Moving a little north on Buckley Road to the new location was a great idea as the place is much more inviting. The wings and sides were solid as usual, but I like the clean atmosphere here.  Kudos for leaving the old place a mile south....will be coming again and a lot more seating!
Love the wings here. This place is one of my favorite place to get wing from. The food is always up fast. Never really  had any problems with any of the workers. Good place to go

I would not say these are the best wings in Colorado. My husband ordered the spicy garlic and spicy ranch, boneless wings. The spicy garlic were swimming in sauce. He did not take his leftovers home. I ordered the fish sandwich. It was served on Texas Toast. I would prefer a roll. It was not bad, but nothing spectacular. The sweet corn nuggets were awesome!!! I'm happy I found a place that serves corn nuggets! I'll be back for the corn nuggets!!

Wings were big, sauce was great. Only issue was the sauce didn't stick to the wings, I had to roll them around in the tray to get any sauce. Not really a big deal, the quality of the wings more than made up for that little thing. 

Prices were great too!

Hands down the best wings I've had. Nice you can call ahead and pick up your order so you don't have to wait in the restaraunt. Recently remodled and decorated like a colorado teams only sports  bar! Always friendly staff when I'm there. I personally really like the honey hot wing sauce.
Good wings.  I actually really liked the fries here also.  No one mentions them. They may appear ordinary, but I for some reason couldn't stop eating them.    Lighter, maybe?  Hmm.

This place is great. I'm tired of wingstop and Buffalo Wild Wings. This place has some different flavors like spicy ranch which is awesome. The Mac and cheese wedges are really great as well. I recommend going. Military will fill the place at lunch so come a little earlier or later to miss the rush. If I was you I would call in your order so when you get there you just sit and enjoy tasty wings.

I've lived in aurora since I was a kid.  And have been frequenting Woody's off and on as I have moved away and eventually back to Aurora.  They have been serving wings since well before what I would call the "wing craze" and well through it.  Back in the day I would have given them three thumbs up if I had that many thumbs to give.  That being said as the years have rolled on and my pallet has expanded and expectations for quality food have risen, I have to say the Woody's falls depressingly short in the quality of food area.  While it is a family owned and mostly family ran (as far as I know) business I cannot give the food anything better than a barely passable grade.  The wings and most other fare is late night bar quality at best and all of which appears to be straight off the local frozen food distributer truck.  Nothing notable and mostly quite the opposite.  Service can be heart warming at times when the owner is behind the bar and down right rude at other times when certain other employees are working it.  Many occasions when coming home from a trip and stopping by for a quick to go order i would drive home only to find my order totally wrong.  Long story long, I grew up with this place and would love nothing more to give them a "three thumbs up" review.  But sadly too many of my recent experiences have led me to set them aside as my local go to for wings and a beer as aurora has many many other options that more than meet the expectations of quality food and warm service...
Best wings I have ever had!!! Oh,wow!!! They are cooked just right. Crispy and tasty! Great food!!!!

Great service and good wings but a bit too expensive. 

The people that work at the restaurant are an absolute pleasure. They are very helpful for requests and are extremely nice and polite.

The bar is great and they also offer food like chicken strips and others for people not into wings.

The main thing I do not like is the wings are expensive. Compared to wings from Wingstop they are much less of a value. The prices are comparable to Buffalo Wild Wings. 

Worth going if you want to support a local business and like wings!

Excellent wings!  The right size, the right crispiness, and really good sauce!  We went with the traditional "hot" that was great and had a super slight sweet finish. Really good.  The ranch side was a little watery and the celery could have been a tiny bit more fresh but the wings more than made up for it. Enjoy!
Love this place!!  I've been a regular for about 10 years and their new location is sweet!  Can't go wrong with these wings!

The location has moved (only a couple of city blocks) but the owner and food is the same--AMAZING. This is the best hot wing in the state. I have gone here since I was a child. Even in my travels, I am hard pressed to find a comparable wing. Not only are the buffalo sauces amazing but the wings are gigantic and loaded with meat. 

The last decade has seen the wing chain restaurant descend on the Denver Metro Area with accompanying grossness (yes, you Buffalo Wild Wings, just nasty--especially in comparison). Save your money and your appetite for a family business that knows the business. It doesn't get better than Woody's.

Note to self:  If you haven't been to a restaurant in a few years, its best to ask what's changed about their menu.  Several years ago, a friend brought fried fish fillets from Woody's wings to a gathering.  They were great!!!!  Reminded me of home.  I try to keep my fried foods to a minimum which is why I hadn't been back since before they moved to their new location.  I ordered the large fish (pieces) dinner.  That was the first clue.  Their fish used to be full fillets fried in cornmeal, very traditionally southern, which is why I loved it.  Now these pieces have replaced those fillets and are prepared with what must be regular flour.  Not only did it not taste good, it has the taste of old, muddy catfish.  Further, the fish is cooked until its so dark, it looks and tastes burned.  NEVER going back.

We went to Woodys cause a friend worked there, but never again. The drinks were ok, but the wings taste like they've been cooked in week-old oil. The variety of sauces is good, but that doesn't matter when your wings taste like crap.

Most of the time, this place is great.  Quick, delicious and not too hard on the ol' wallet.  Today however I was left on hold for over 15 minutes....so I hung up and called BWW, ordered there instead.

That being said, This place is still really great.

Wings are great but service is not the best. Get take out but check your order before you leave. More then once received wrong sides. Last time sat in the bar area to have wings and a beer with some friends but the girl behind the bar was so interested in hanging out with her friends that unless I left my table and went to the bar never saw a server for a new drink. If they could pull together their staff they could easily be the wing place to go.
Love the wings but slightly on the over greasy side. Fires are also super delicious and try the garlic bread it's cheap and good!

I used to love their old location so much more.... Yes wings are decent and their corn nuggets are amazing but ever since they moved we just have to order to go... It is so loud with the new bar and so extremely ghetto!!!!! seriously the people that hang out in the bar are very questionable.... Definitely not family oriented place like it used to be...

This place is right around the corner from our house so I continue to go to it out of pure convenience. When they first moved to their new location I was thrilled! There wings were always good (love the sauce) and they had added a nice new bar. After going there about 5-6 times it seemed like the service took a drastic turn for the worse. Every time we go in there lately there are 2 tables including us, the tables are filthy, and it seems like I'm inconveniencing someone to get served.

I'm not a fan of the customer service but if you can get over dealing with the "bored" employees for a few minutes, it's totally worth it. Corn fritters are out of this world and the wings are the best I've ever had.
The new location is more improved from the old one. There is actually a bar with new TVs. The wings are still good.

I ordered Woody's Wings for takeout last night and was SO incredibly impressed!!!  Though it was a 30 minute wait until the wings were done, it was understandably a very busy night (Mayweather vs Canelo was on and they were SLAMMED). The service was good considering how busy they were. Most importantly, the wings were DELICIOUS! Huge, perfectly cooked on the inside, crispy on the outside, with a perfect amount of delicious sauce! Though it is a little far from my house, I hope to be back soon to get more delicious wings!

I just got off of the phone with "ostensibly" a "manager" at Woody's Wings secondary to a customer service issue that was not handled well by one of the servers.  The wings ARE good - but there are much better wings other places.  For example, Piper Inn ( 2251 S Parker Rd  Denver, CO 80231) is a motorcycle bar - but the wings are STELLAR - and the service is always wonderful... However, I digress - the manager did not offer compensation at all for the very poor experience... I will NOT be back... This place just hasn't had the level of service since they moved down the street from their last location...
New location, same great wings! Eat in for the best experience. The fries suffer from the car trip home.

Woody's is great! The wings are huge and not super fatty, it is mostly meat! The sauces are delicious as well and the apps are good as well. A good place to go to enjoy some amazing wings. Also, friendly service.

So as long as your expectations aren't crazy high, this place really isn't too bad. We popped in here a time or two during the 2013 Broncos season and it's not really busy or loud. You can see the large wall TV screen fairly easily near the bar. Service was good too. The bar is a separate room from the wing joint. So your food orders come from the Woody Wing joint vs their bar. Their take out is decent too. Ordering isn't professional. Everyone sounds bored or like they don't want to be there and they can't seem to figure out their own computer system half the time. But the food is ready for in 20 minutes. The atmosphere in the restaurant side of building is less then desirable. Feels like you're waiting at a public transportation location, even with the scattered TVs. That's why 9 times out of 10 we do carry out. Prices are decent. There wings and sauce is sooooooo yummy to me. Somethings they are dry if the order is ready before the designated pick up time but roll them in some sauce and you're back in business. Hubby loves loves loves their ranch. I order it in pints from this location just to get him to eat a salad at home. So I'd recommend them, but taper your high expectations.

We ordered an order of mild and medium, and got two mild orders, which really were super plain. We added our own hot sauce to it for some kind of flavor. Pretty disappointing since the other reviews were so good.
We ordered wings the other night and they were great. my son liked the chicken tenders and the curly fries  my wife and I got honey hot and teriyaki. Both were fantastic   We will be back

Best wings in Colorado I love it best wings on town great services all the time The wings are really tasty and the curly fries are really good they have so many flavors to choose from this place is awesome

LOVE LOVE LOVE WOODY'S!  The wings have a lot of meat of them and there are so many sauces to choose from.  The new location is so much nicer than the old one but then again, it's not the building that makes food good, it's good food!

Good wings. Some of the best I have had since leaving western NY (not far from Buffalo) in 1981. However, it's really chincy to charge 35 cents and more for bleu cheese or ranch dressing after you've paid $6 for 6 wings. There isn't a "genuine" Buffalo wing restaurant in NY that would dare do this. Dressing is always part of the serving. And $4.15 for fried mushrooms or zucchini is ridiculous. Too pricey to make it a regular thing but again, the wings were good (honey hot buffalo sauce was good, too).

Denver has lots of food spots with Ale House at Amato's being one with quite a view. Now for the review:

Do Well:
1. Atmosphere- lots energy, modern feel and makes you want to order another round

2. Rooftop Bar - one of my favorite things in the world is rooftop dining or drinking and this place has a great view of the Denver skyline

3. Food - just ordered wings and fries but they were very good  

4. Extensive drink list - I did not partake (so sad) but they had a great Tap list and mixed drinks arsenal. 

5. Great happy hour - price point was low and selection decent

Things to work on:
1. Lower price point for non-happy hour - a little high but taste is pretty great. 

2. Wait staff was good but not very attentive. Needed more water and other things but good recommendations. 

If in Denver go for a pint, wings and soak in the view!

Loved the rooftop patio - awesome view. Beautiful on a sunny day.

Ordered the chicken flatbread - it was just OK - nothing special.

Strong Bloody Mary. Friendly service.

Great location, cool environment and fantastic beer.  But for a slow Saturday afternoon our service was terrible.  We sat at the bar with maybe four other people and had no attention for the first ten minutes we were there. The food was tasteless. Had eggshell in my Reuben Benedict. Fish and Chips was plain. Bonefish Grill is much better. 

Sept 2016 Update:
The management team was nice enough to reach out to me a couple times and asked us to come back.  We went for lunch and had a much better experience. Our server, Kaylie, was great. The food was a lot better too!

2nd trip through, had another really good experience. Tons of food and beer selections and just about every game was playing on one of the tvs. This place had a good vibe and even though it was packed, the servers were right on que, didn't miss a beat. The portions were large so I got to try just about everything, all good. I would highly recommend the smoked salmon tater tots, outstanding.

Came to Ale House for brunch on a Saturday. We were able to get a spot on the rooftop patio (open seating) before it got too busy. 

We started with bloody Mary's, and also shared the salmon tots- which were all decisions. Our waitress also brought us extra pickles and olives as requested.

For my entree I ordered the breakfast croissant (plus bacon) with a side of cheese grits. The grits were delicious, but sadly my croissant was awful. I did not send it back (though I really wish I had) only because the food had taken so long I did not want my guests to wait. The sandwich indicates that it comes with hollandaise and avocado. What I received was a literal jar of yellowish mayo on top of my sandwich plus a scoop of mushy guacamole. Mixed together, my sandwich was a goopy, slimy, mayo-like mess. I tried my best to wipe the excessive "hollandaise" and guac off my sandwich, but by that point I'd lost my appetite. 

True, I could have sent it back- but I could not believe the kitchen would make, let alone serve a sandwich that covered in room temperature mayo trying to pass for hollandaise. Without the sauce and "avocado" I think this sandwich would've been bomb- so I would recommend it and would try it again (sans any sauce).

Otherwise brunch was very pleasant, aside from slow-ish service.

Interesting selection of good foods. Beer list is hearty and actually had a beer I like from CT, Two Roads Lil Heaven. Nice view of Denver. We ordered calamari and artichoke dip for appetizers. Had the fried green tomato BLT. We ordered fish and chips, risotto, fish tacos and PBJ burger made with bison. All very good.

What do I love about the Ale House?

1: Kept Amato in their name.  I believe there use to be Amato Statutory business at the same location while back.
2: many and many more seating options.  Wow..  we sat at the rooftop patio overlooking downtown.  It was nice sunny day (as usual), but kept us cool throughout the Sat lunch.
3: lots and lots of drink options.  I settled for $4 bloody Mary and it was pretty good. Will definitely try their super extensive craft beers on tap.
4: my breakfast burger with chorizo pattie and eggs was delicious.
5: easy stroll over from downtown area.  

Definitely worth coming back again!

A favorite patio in town. Amazing beer selection and amazing views of downtown denver. I love taking out of town guests here for the view and rooftop patio. Even in winter I sit up top where they have heat lamps and a fire pit. You can overlook the pedestrian bridge and a few times I even walk across and mosey over to denver beer company or the 16th st mall. It's a nice walk and you see the beauty of downtown denver.

The food here is decent, nothing too exciting, but I've never been upset with food. Come for the beer and the view- snacks always good too!

Great joint to stop at before a Rockies game or just to hang out for sure. Inside, it's a standard DEN place with two floors & a large bar on each! The second level offers great views of the city on a clear night. They have like 40 drafts on the line and this joint is super busy! I watched the bartender Megan pour like 100 beers and make 100 drinks in like an hour...crazy. Definitely be prepared to wait for a seat and a drink especially on the weekends!

Yes, Denver has its Freshcrafts and Falling Rocks. But just across downtown with a great view of the same is Ale House at Amato's in the LoHi area.

The 5 starts are for their incredible and rare selection of beers and the knowledge of beer bartenders, especially Kevin. I came here first during GABF 14 and was blown away by the Russian rivers and other barrel aged specialties they had on tap. It was best part of my beergrimage to Denver. I came back on Oct 15 , Kevin was still there, he recognized me and again, a wonderful selection with even a Crooked Stave offering that wasn't available at the brewery.

Can't review the food much, I've had the southwest burger, which was quite good and had a some kick to it. Also, they have late night bites. They also have open seating upstairs and a patio

But for me it is all about the beer , so I always sit at the bar. Can't wait to be back.

The beer selection is great, and the view from the rooftop is amazing, but the food is lackluster.  I ordered the skyline burger & the cheese soup. 

The soup had popcorn in it, which you think would be a creative idea, but just doesn't tasted good. I ended up pulling the popcorn out of the soup.

I was skeptic about the burger from the start, because the waitress never asked me how I wanted my burger cooked... red flag! Anyway, the skyline burger was very underwhelming.

I would come back here again for drinks on the rooftop... and quite possibly a different meal. My fiancé did mention that she enjoyed her chicken wrap, so I will have to try that next time & update my review.

Great ambiance and service, but the food was nothing to write home about. We had the salmon bacon tater tots for an app, as we were told was liked by everyone from the server. I'm an adventurous eater. They came out as circle blobs of hash browns with ground salmon inside with bacon bits and chipotle sauce drizzled on the plate. Not what I was expecting and didn't taste good. I had their version of a French dip. The meat was tasteless and the aju didn't help that much. They did have good fresh gluten free buns and spring 44 gin which are big pluses in my book. I'd go back if friends wanted to go, but I probably wouldn't recommend it.

Went to the Ale House last night as the other place we were going to go was super crowded. I have honestly wanted to try the Ale House for years after seeing it's awesome patio and view of Denver! 

We walked in and seated ourselves on the upstairs outdoor patio, where we had a stunning view of Denver (front and center). We were quickly brought waters and menus, but after that, our server was MIA for awhile (at least 10 minutes). Finally she showed up and took our drink and food orders. The drinks took a seemingly long time to make. We were brought our drinks and our food came out maybe 5 minutes after. I had a mixed cocktail, which was good but quite small compared to my boyfriend's (he got a different vodka drink, but mine was much smaller). 

For food, I had the blackened chicken sandwich, which was great. It had breaded avocados, pineapple, and cheese on it.. YUM! Instead of fries, I opted for the ale and cheese soup. It was alright.. The popcorn was pretty weird and not a good addition. I don't think I would get the soup again. 

Also tried the raspberry sour beer which was lovely! 

Ale House gets 3 stars for the awesome views, good blackened chicken sandwich, and tasty drinks. The service was pretty bad, though. I don't like seeing a server ignore you and do other things (like running dish racks full of glasses to the kitchen when you still haven't taken your table's drink order yet, for example). I would go back to the Ale house again to give it a second shot because the view is hard to beat.

The view upstairs is pretty perfect but the wait staff messed up half of our table's orders. They forgot about our appetizer altogether and I'm allergic to tomatoes and after I told the waiter twice that I couldn't have them on my breakfast sandwich, they were still on there and when I told them about it, it was clear that they just took the tomatoes off of the sandwich rather than making my order again.

I'm not that impressed so hopefully no one else has an experience like mine.

The location is great, and there was not a wait for brunch (which is how we picked it out).

I ordered the classic breakfast. I asked for scrambled eggs with cheese. The whole meal was cold, the eggs were still raw, and there was no cheese. I asked to waitress if I could have cooked eggs with cheese. They came out when everyone was done eating, still no cheese. Eventually got some on the side. Not only did they not comp my meal after serving me raw egg- the menu says the meal is $9 and I was charged $11. 

If you want a place that stands by their food and respects customers...and knows how to cook eggs...maybe try something different.
They have a great happy hour. We always come back for the fish tacos which are very delicious.

I have been here a few times the food is pretty good, the beer is pretty well-priced and they have a wide variety, but I was really surprised tonight when I ordered wine there by the glass. I ordered a low end sauvignon blanc (nobile) and was charge to $12 ...that's more than the price of a bottle. I checked checked on the way out , and that was no mistake. The average price is $12 a glass. I am disappointed.

This is a good place to grab a drink. Been here a few times and the service was Always fine so no issues there. The issue lies within the food - this is our second time back where we had to send our food back to the kitchen for the meat being undercooked. Having to do this twice is very disappointing. The cooks seem to have no idea how to prepare a meal - on top of the meat being under cooked the food was simply awful. In fact my girlfriend ordered a steak salad and when the salad came out the steak was literally raw (not pink/red) in the center and had looked like it had been sitting out for 2 hours. That went back to the kitchen and when the second came out, same thing. At this point we had given up and asked for the bill. In the end, we spent 90 bucks for some Brussels sprouts, calamari and 5-6 drinks. 

Again, the service wasn't an issue. The server was more than happy to send the food back - the issue here is the food that they are serving which certainly warrants two stars.

great experience.  went with a group to celebrate a birthday and had a nice time.  our table was in a separate room away from the bar which was perfect since there were kids and loud adult with us.  prestin was our server and he was very attentive.  i ordered the pumpkin beer, bison burger w half fries and half sweet potato fries.  i also tried the beer and cheese soup and that was also yummy.  the decor is appealing.  we found a parking spot on the street right out front.  will be back!

For years I've admired their patio but given you can't throw a rock without hitting a great spot in the Highlands it's taken me this long to get there.  If you can find parking midweek this is a great spot to kick back for drinks which is exactly what I did the other night with a friend.   It was fairly busy without being packed.  Service was attentive and the ambiance was just as good as I expected.

Nice outdoor pub with a spectacular view of the city. The fried green tomato BLT is excellent. The food is quite good and also complements a full tap beer selection.   Nothing fancy, just simple and good.

The menu was very selective/not enough options...menu needs some serious improvement. Our food wasn't "restaurant" material...more like airport/pub food. The beer selection wasn't what I was expecting, it very misleading...seeing as how The Ale House calls it self a "brewery". Service was below subpar, we had 3 different servers...I'm pretty sure the first 2 servers forgot about our table. We had to wait 15 minutes+ for our beers each time we ordered a fresh one. Don't think i'll be returning...

I went to Ale House at Amato's one weekend a while back.  It was extremely busy, but we were able to get a table without much of a wait.  The host was a bit brusque, but by no means rude.  Our server was adequately attentive, but not overly congenial.  

I ordered the deconstructed chicken pot pie.  While it was good comfort food, there was nothing uniquely different about it.  I'd like to go back and try a burger or something they are more known for.

View from rooftop seating is great and beer selection is immense. Burgers were slightly above average. Happy hour buffalo wings consisted of 4 wings. What is a table supposed to do with 4 wings? Beer selection is too eclectic for my tastes. Have been here 1 other time and I see very few patrons inside restaurant. Not sure they'd make it if it weren't for the rooftop seating and view.

The location is perfect with amazing views of the city. The upstairs deck is first come, first serve so don't waste your time trying to make reservations. If you're able to wait, please do! It's mid July and hot and we weren't hot at all. The food was ok. I had the seafood risottoV which was pretty good. It came with some shrimp and salmon I believe. The shrink was great but the salmon was a bit overlooked and dry. We all shared the nachos which were good as well but they are a little skimpy on the sauces that are on top. I would recommend adding the pork as it was delicious. Amazing selection of beers as well!! This is a great place to try for sure. Make sure you arrive a little early as parking is very difficult to find in this area.

Well, if I didn't already fall in love with Denver...

Ale House was just delightful. My dinner date and I sat on the rooftop with a lovely few of downtown. It was a little chilly, but they had standing heaters to provide some warmth. If you're looking for rooftop seating, be aware, it's first come first serve here.

I ordered the PB & J burger and it was just the perfect combination of sweet and savory. I partnered my burger with sweet potato fries which were fried to perfection. 

Loved the rooftop bar scene in Denver and can't wait to explore more during my next visit. Ale House is a five star's for sure. Next time you're in the area, definitely check this place out!

I was only here for beer at Happy hour. All the Breckinridge beer was $3. Each item you buy from the happy hour menu gets you one raffle ticket. At the end of the month if they pull your ticket they will donate $1 for each raffle ticket they've sold for the month to a charity of your choice. There are a lot of seats at the bar and high top or regular table seating options. When the weather is nice they open the patio off the bar so the space is wide open. The decor was cool, there were lots of tvs around if you'd watch to watch sports, and the service was pretty good.

Today was my first visit to the Ale House and I was blown away!! Jess gave me amazing service upstairs! I recommend the Southwest Steak Salad, and the deep fried brownie for dessert. Lovely patio overlooking downtown. I will definitely be back again!!

I would recommend Ale House at Amato's as a place to grab a beer or two, perhaps before packing it up for dinner elsewhere.  I've eaten here twice now, and neither time has been that great.  On my last visit, we tried the artichoke appetizer (pretty good, not too hard to mess up artichoke dip, though), and I had a burger with blue cheese.  The burger bun was soggy, as if it had been sitting out for quite some time, meat flavor was off-tasting.  I had mac & cheese as my side, but really didn't like the flavor at all - I ended up passing it to my boyfriend, who ate a few bites, but also wasn't a fan.

The service was really great and the manager even stopped by our table to apologize for the long wait for our food.  Apparently our order had been lost in the shuffle.  They also comped us for some of the food, which was awesome and a very nice gesture.  This almost helped me bump my review to 4 stars, but the food quality is holding me back. 

Try this place for a beer, maybe an appetizer, but skip the main dishes.
Besides the food being great our server, Jared was awesome!  Great recommendations on beers and food items!!!

Wtf they have a rule of 6 drinks in 2 hrs but one of my party was cut off after 6 beers after 4  Hrs while they clearly served other patrons beyond the limit. I guess they wanted the table although no one was waiting. 3rd quarter of a bronco game so we moved on and barely caught the rest of the game. Food was ok bartender are limited on skill can't even float a black and tan. I. Understand you have to protect yourself but turning away good paying patrons make no sense.

I  visited Ale House with a friend for dinner tonight but I've been here a couple other times as well. They have a great beer selection and I've consistently had good service. Tonight, we got the Brussels sprouts to start which were awesome. I had the Colorado lamb pita salad for dinner and it was pretty good, though I should have asked for the dressing on the side because it came out pretty soggy. We also had the peanut butter mousse candy bar for dessert and it was delicious! I'll be back for sure, love the view and location!

Kyle is the man! The food was secondary to him. His genuine friendly nature snapped me out of a rough morning. If Kyle is the standard of service at the Ale House, then this place needs to be a must stop for everyone. 

Fish and Chips were a delight. The outside was crispy and stayed that way w out going soggy. The fish was hot on the inside. Perfectly done. 

I hope to return soon! Thank you Kyle.

This place is always great!....Though I have only been here at lunch.

The food is great, the beer selection is solid, and the scenery and vibe are great as well.

Thank you to our sever who was extremely kind this past weekend when my friend and I chatted a ton at our table for over 2hrs hogging up the table turn.

Prime rib sandwich was great with a side of sweet potato fries.  It was a large portion and I thoroughly enjoyed it although I couldn't eat it all. But was one of the few items that was lunch like on the brunch only menu during the weekend.

Will be back to enjoy some brunch another time.  My friend's French toast looked amazing!

A bit spendy but a great view of the city. I've been twice. The service had been good and the atmosphere is
fun.

It seems like more and more spots in the Highlands are losing their views, but Ale House's view is totally unobstructed and there to stay, as it's located pretty much directly over I-25.  This place is quintessential Denver with the views, brews, and modern yet laid back atmosphere.

I've been here many times, but most recently brought a friend visiting here from Manhattan.  She fell in love with Denver just from sitting on this very rooftop!
