The views are beautiful, food is good, and mixed drinks are on the stronger side.  While my friend adored the skyline views, I noticed all of the gorgeous flowers lined up along the side of the rooftop patio (I enjoyed the view too, but I'm used to it!)

My only wish for this place is to allow reservations for the rooftop patio.  I understand why they can't offer that, but eating inside just doesn't quite compare to that little slice of heaven on the roof.  I'll be back... with local friends and out of town guests alike!

Fantastic restaurant. Marybell was amazing and the atmosphere was very inviting. I was able to propose to my girlfriend 45 minutes later in the restaurant , with the help of the wonderful staff. If you love great food, this is the happening spot!

food and atmosphere was really good. our server Jared was amazing! his sarcasm, humor and great recommendations made our dinner that much better. best server we've had in a while, highly recommended location and server. thanks for a great night!

This place is a good lunch spot. I am a huge fan of the Seasame Crusted Ahi Tuna Salad, which is a large portion, fresh, and extremely tasty. The dressing is awesome. The Fried Green Tomato BLT isn't bad either. The remoulade is a nice touch. The only thing that might make it better is if the bread was toasted. Everyone that I've brought here has liked their food!

A lot beers to choose from during happy hour, but the food price is high for happy hour appetizers, not worth going all the way out of downtown for. Good space for large party. Highway noise is unavoidable.

We arrived to this restaurant and their was no hostess - so we waited about 3-4 minutes for someone to come over - only to learn that it was self seating.

We proceeded upstairs to the rooftop which has an AMAZING view and was very nice with the warm weather that night.

We literally waited 15 minutes!!!! Until someone came over and asked if someone was helping us. Their had been 2 servers who walked past us multiple times and talked to other tables, but were to much in a hurry to even ask if we needed help. 

Once we got asked if we were being helped we received waters about 4 minutes minutes after and then menus shortly after that. The waitress who helped us was very nice and friendly - just wish we could have seen her sooner.

The food was good- the Music was nice - the view was Superior - the service left ALOT to be desired!  

If the service would have been on par with the rest of the Experience this place was a 5!!

Ale house used to be a fave. We came here after a friend's graduation circa 3 PM. We walked 30 minutes from DT Denver across 3 bridges for a beautiful view at Ale House and into a hostile situation. After placing drink and food orders, we were approached by a pussyfooted manager who said we couldn't be served beverages until after we had eaten food. Keep in mind we had just walked several miles and had completely walked off the mimosas we had earlier circa 9am. After talking with us, the manager backtracked and said we could be served but we took our business to Central next door and were completely well received.  Apologies to the red headed waitress who lost a 12 top tables' tips. We will not be visiting again.

Adding a star... The consistently good food, good service and good atmosphere is starting to impress me. The salads are tasty and big, they cook burgers to perfection and you can always count on them to have a little something for everyone.

There is a large beer selection as well as a decent food menu however my buddy got cut off not for acting a fool but for having 6 beers in 3 hours so just keep this in mind when frequenting this establishment. There is a limit no matter what!! On top of it it took 20 minutes to get a beer when you finished anyway. And medium means raw!!

Laid back and casual. Food was yummy...we liked the brussel sprouts, artichoke and spinach dip, fish and chips and the very unique meatloaf. Too much food!  Service was decent but not great (kind of obvious that they would take your order but didn't seem to really care much). Not a great cider selection but thankfully they also have ok wine for non-beer drinkers.

While visiting Denver, Colorado, my friends wanted to take me somewhere that was "totally a Colorado thing." We went to Amato's Ale House. 

We sat on the lower patio since they are dog friendly! The server gave us water for the dog without us even having to ask. 

We ordered the hummus with pita bread and the pretzels knots, which were delicious. The pretzel knots had a wonderful raspberry house jam, clear your sinuses horseradish dip, and deli mustard. I liked them all. 

My friends liked the beers. I had lemonade and the server kept those coming. 

I ordered the 50/50 PB&J burger since I loved the jam. Best decision ever. I want to put PB&J on everything now. 

Friendly service provided, yet they are kind of slow since it was packed when we went. I'd go back there for sure.

The location of Ale House is perfect. The views of downtown are amazing, and the atmosphere is fun. It can be crowded, but when it's not (weekday nights), it is the perfect place to grab a beer. Although it sounds like it might just be a beer place, the food and other cocktails are great as well!

Ale House is an awesome spot to night cap your evening. Their  beer selection should be pretty great, thus the name, and it doesn't disappoint! I love stouts, and there are so many on the menu! They have great desserts as well! The toasted coconut custard is out of this world!  Also, one of the bartenders looks an awful lot like Matt Bomer, so there's that.

I was here yesterday around happy hour. I ordered the boar sliders which were very good. Any game type meat I'm worried will be tried out but these weren't dry at all. The service was good and the waitress was prompt with stopping by and refilling drinks when they got low.

I play kickball at a nearby field and this establishment will be on our list to stop by for pre-gaming for sure!

Was on a bar crawl which we really started here since we mostly missed the first stop (got there right when the group was leaving). Another customer recommended  Breckenridge vanilla beer. I unexpectedly totally loved it!  We just sat at the bar and met lots of fun people. The service was great! The ambience and energy there were uplifting. I would definitely like to go back soon.

My company had a holiday party at the ale house. The room is large and can seat 50+ people easily. Meanwhile, they offered appetizers and drinks in addition to a pre-selected menu that included
beef, chicken and salmon. For dessert, we all had donut holes that were delicious.

The food was good, and the service was really friendly and attentive. They also offer complimentary valet parking which is super helpful as that area has pretty limited parking.

I will definitely try the Ale House again on my own so that I can speak more to the menu options next time.

The only suggestion is for the Ale House to serve more of the local brewing companies products. For the Ale House, you would hope to see more local beer offerings.

I came here with 6 people and got to sit on the patio.  The staff had no problem with us pushing a couple tables together.  We had a nice view of the bridge and the sun was shining.  Good stuff.

I got a red beer michelada to drink.  It was decent, wasn't the best though.  I got the burger that had the onion crisps and the passion fruit jam on it.  I think it was called the Skyline burger?  I asked for bison meat.  This thing was fantastic.  Good perfectly, thick and crispy bacon, fresh lettuce.  Yum.  Sweet potato fries on the side. 

I was definitely a fan, as was everyone in my group.

Summary: Great view, great drink selection, delicious food, meh service.

Drinks:I'm not really a beer drinker but got the first beer I've ever loved at the Ale House. They have a quality, locally brewed selection. 

Food:The food is also very good and reasonably priced. 

Service: Both times I went, I was surprised the waitresses got my simple orders wrong. One waitress wrote my order down, one didn't. They were nice though. I don't generally pick a restaurant based only on service though.

View: The rooftop patio has heaters and has a beautiful view of the Denver sky line. Very cool vibe and fun place to be.

Went here last night for a friends birthday, and left very happy! We showed up originally only planning on five of us, but somehow our group turned into twelve? Anyway, instead of getting annoyed or rude, the wait staff was very friendly and accommodated our large group. 

I started off with the white rascal (Belgium wheat). Was great as always. My girl friend had the avalanche, and she loved it! They also have a decent wine and cocktail selection. 

The food was outstanding! I had a sausage and cheese platter and the artichoke dip this time.. I've had the burgers before and was very pleased! 

Love the ale house. However, it's a little pricey when happy hour's over ;)

Great drink selection, good food, 'meh' service.

Date of Visit: Many

I've been here a few times, and can always count on a few things: (1) Great beer list - A ton of great local crafts and unique options you can't get everywhere. (2) Solid food - Upscale bar food done well. The wings are a bit drab, but the Mile High Burger, 50/50 PB&J Burger, and Breckenridge IPA Fish & Chips are all great options. (3) Long waits - I've been here with parties in sizes from 3-6, and each time there are pretty significant waits during service. You often finish a beer and your water before getting a refill order for either, so make sure to order 2! The odd part of this is I've always sat in the area close to the service door, where most non-bar drinks are poured.

Overall Amato's is a solid upscale tavern, but needs to raise their service and timing quality to get that fourth star.

The Host at the front stand was rather snooty.  After waiting a full minute just standing there, with him just talking to the other hostess, he finally turned to us.  "Yes?", he asked.  "Table for 2", I said.  "Do you have a reservation?"  "No, we don't."  He concluded, "Then you're going to have to go to the bar or Rooftop."

Well, luckily we wanted the Rooftop anyways.  Sorry to disturb you, we've never been here before.

The Rooftop was great.  Prompt attention from an excellent waitress and pretty good food.

Our only other complaint is that November 14 is entirely too early to start playing Christmas music.  I like that stuff... but after Thanksgiving.
Great outdoor upstairs seating! Late night 10pm open A++! I recommend the chicken pot pie. White rascal Belgian whit. And dessert!

Some friends and I decided to head out for a relaxing happy hour in the near summer heat (mid-March). We went up to the rooftop to enjoy the fresh air and quickly found an open table. We were greeted quickly by the staff but after taking our order it took them quite a while to be back with either a drink or the two appetizers we ordered. 

Overall we had an OK experience, just a slow night. We only got two beers each and we were there for two hours. And we aren't very slow drinkers... 

Perhaps they just need to prepare more when it is going to be such a nice day. Denver people love their beer and patios..we need service to match!

Ale House serves good ol' American fare at dirt cheap prices.  Yes, really.  I tried a beer mimosa for $3.  The regular mimosas were also $3.  I ordered an excellent Cajun grilled chicken Cobb Salad with pesto vinaigrette.  (see photo)  It was full of fresh, yummy ingredients.  I had to finish it all:  egg, avocado, cherry tomatoes, blue cheese, Romaine lettuce 

There is an upstairs outdoor patio, but it was raining and cold.  So we were seated in the main dining area.  Our server was also very nice and attentive.  I would totally return here next time I'm in Denver to indulge in some of their beers.  Don't forget to leave without that heavenly ginger candy in the tin bucket at the front kiosk!  I must find that stuff!  -best ginger candy EVER!!

Great city views and crappy, catch as catch can parking are not the only things that this venue has to offer!  Amato's also has a wide selection of tasty menu options, a full bar, and a wide selection of beers on draft.  With a proximity within walking distance of both the highlands and downtown, it is no wonder that this is spot is a favorite for the after work crowd.

The service is poor and it took about 1/2 an hour to get a salad in the middle of the day. We are literally the only people here and still waiting.....  Our server is not friendly. I did however enjoy sitting on the patio with the misters. That was the saving grace of the place. I'm not much of a beer drinker so I would say unless you love beer and crappy service find somewhere else to go. There are several other restaurants in the area that we will be trying instead. Big thumbs down for this place. And no.... Our food is still not here.  After waiting 45 minutes we asked for our food to be packaged to go. I asked the waiter to inform the manager that it took so long. The manager came out and paid for our meal. He was very nice and apologized. He said it is not typical to wait that long for a salad at 3:00 in the afternoon. Given they managers/owners do seem to care about good service we might give it a try again. Next time I'll opt for a burger ;)

Visited the Ale House today with an old friend for Lunch.  Since we live on opposite ends of town it was a great place to meet halfway.  First off met the Chef Bob Moser.  He has made some great new food changes!  We had wonderful crab cakes with a fresh corn salsa, a fried green tomato and smoked bacon sandwich and fish tacos with a pineapple salsa.  Margaritas made with silver tequila, agave and fresh lime juice.  Let me just say this new chef is bringing some tasty fair to the Ale House!!!!

Wow, has this place gone downhill.  I have been going here since they opened.  They always had good service at reasonable prices for tasty food and drink.  This is the first time I have been there and had such a frustrating experience.  The service was sloooow and inattentive, almost nonexistent considering it was raining and no one was sitting outside and they were not that busy.  It took 30 minutes to get our first drink and that was after having to waive down the server (we were sitting a few feet from the bar).  A simple glass of rosé now costs $11.  Pinot Grigio is also $11 (they were out of this) and Chard is $12.  That is quite expensive for one glass of mediocre wine in a pub.  The food we ordered was dry and tasteless, especially the french dip.  We had to flag down our server to order our second drink which took another 20 minutes.  We will not be returning since there are so many other fabulous places in LoHi.

I've been to Ale House several times for dinner, happy hour, and brunch so it's safe to say I've tried a lot of their food.

Brunch, they have amazing bloody Mary's and I love the manmosa's here (Orange juice and beer). The green chilli and eggs here isn't my favorite but it was good. 

Lunch/ dinner is good but there's usually a wait. I really like the pulled pork sandwich with a side of cole slaw and Mac and cheese but everything else I've had here has come up short. The seafood chowder is a mix of seafood that would be good if the broth it was in had any sort of creaminess or flavor to it. 

Happy hour is a good deal on drinks but that's pretty much it. They offer strange plates like jalapenos with peanut butter and bacon (I thought it sounded funny but would be good, it's not). 

Definitely go and give this restaurant a try, especially for the rooftop patio and outdoor seating in front. Be prepared for a wait during the weekend.

I love the location and beer selection at the Ale House. If you're looking for a rooftop / patio bar with a great beer selection and view of downtown, this is your place.

I cannot, however give it above 3 stars because service can suffer a bit much during busier times, such as weekend afternoons. On one occasion, my dining companion and I waited over a half hour for an appetizer that never arrived. Apparently the kitchen staff failed to tell our waitress who failed to tell us that it was out of stock. 

I've never been disappointed by the food and beer I've actually received though, which is why it's tough for me to only give 3 stars. 

I do recommend this establishment, but be prepared to be assertive as a patron if you're there during a relatively busy time.

My Southwest burger was not good. It tasted chewy with bits of cartilage and there was one tiny piece of pepper on it. Not impressed. The service was excellent and the beer selection was above average. The wings were decent with a delish blue cheese dressing. My sister in law raved about the pb and jelly burger! Love the ambience and the place is huge with a beautiful view and tons of outdoor seating.  Other little ish is that we ordered a couple kids meals that read it included a dessert, and they didn't provide it. Bummer this place has so much potential.

We have lived nearby the Ale House at Amato's for several months and have frequented the place since we moved into the neighborhood. The food is fantastic and until last evening we always received fantastic service. So much so that my girlfriend wanted to go to Amato's to celebrate her birthday with a small party of friends. Considering it is open seating upstairs, we were lucky to find a seating that we could manipulate to make work for our party of six on the roof. Everyone was delightful to us accept the waiters, both of whom we dealt with seemed unhappy to serve us. 

After ordering several appetizers and well over a hundred dollars in food, our waiter balked and even made a rude comment regarding how he would rather pay the bill then split our tab. We literally wrote out every order, who ordered it and what the totals would be on the back of the receipt (after he instructed us to do so), and he still took over 35 minutes to ring us out. My girlfriend, whose birthday we were celebrating, was extremely disappointed in the amount of time it took for us to be rung out. After so many great experiences, it was perhaps most disappointing that this happened to us on such a special day. We have always taken guests to Amato's for their quality food and excellent views, but we will no longer be doing so in the future.

We come here a lot, and it is such a great place to be whether it be for brunch or a late dinner. Today Jona served us and she was so sweet! The view of downtown Denver is amazing. We come here at least a week, and it never fails us ever!

Great beer selections, $4. Mimosas/Bloody Mary's. 
Service was slightly slow but decent. Everyone was very friendly (maybe that's a Colorado thing and I've been in south Florida too long?) and the menu was diverse. The Brussel sprout appetizer was delish, my  hubby enjoyed the French dip, and the kids ate everything on their plate. The portions are large and the food is reasonably priced. As mentioned in previous reviews, the seating/views are spectacular. Tip- grab some gin-gin candy on the way out. Yummy!!!

Great place to meet for drinks and dinner with friends. Enjoyed the fig salad and included chicken in the order-added different flavor to the plate! Friend was disappointed in the Mac and cheese- was expecting the side Mac and cheese but was still happy with the plate. The Rockies dip was "Okay" said by another member of the group, Cobb salad(ordered by personal to my right) was enjoyed very much, chicken flat bread sandwich was given a 3.5 out of 5(ordered by personal diagonal....), the skyline burger was (ordered by this cutie at the table whom of which id like to get to know) very tasty! All and all a lovely evening with the #swagsquad.

I've been here twice and have had two totally different experiences here (both good). The first time I brought out of town guests and was told that the were having trouble with their computers so things were a bit delayed. Our group probably spent close to 2.5 hours there because things were coming out of the kitchen slowly, but we weren't in any rush, so it just made for a relaxed evening. I had the coconut crusted ahi salad which I would definitely recommend, although it didn't have a strong coconut flavor. The second time I ate here our party was in and out in 45 minutes flat. Our food came super quickly and there was hardly any waiting involved. On this visit I opted for the grilled salmon Cesar salad which was delicious. Don't miss out on the awesome brussel sprout appetizer! The homemade pretzels are awesome here too! :)

I've been to this bar & restaurant many times and every time I know that I'll return. The food is good, the beer is cold with a great variety and the service is excellent. I usually sit at the bar and the 3 bartenders, one of which always serves me are great! Friendly, attentive and efficient. As a ex-bartender and restaurant owner I really appreciate the service that I'm accustomed to receiving at the Ale House.

Beer list was great.

Nice decor and staff.

Food was fine.

I would go back for drinks, but there's better food in the neighborhood.

If your hovering game is strong, I highly recommend waiting for a table on the deck on a nice evening. Unfortunately they don't take reservations for it so you just have to stare at people until they leave. But once you sit, it's really lovely! The beer selection is pretty top notch and almost all of them are $5-6. The food is pretty decent too, especially for the price. I ordered the fish and chips and it was about as well cooked as I could want, especially for only $12. My husband had the skyline burger and, while $15 might seem like a lot, it was really worth it. He highly recommends it. Overall, we'll definitely be back soon.

Suggested to meet a friend here on a Friday night at 7pm and as expected parking sucked but I eventually found a spot on one of the side streets. Just be sure to pay attention to the 2hr parking limit signs in that area!
The main goal was beer so we found a high top table in the bar area and it didn't take long before our super cool waitress Tera greeted us. They have an extensive seasonal beer list and she had input on most of them which really helped. Just tried to look on their website for the names of what we ordered but the beers are always rotating so its not up to date. Another bonus was that Tera offered us samples on any selections that we weren't sure of.
We also ordered the chicken wings which had a pretty good spice without being overbearing and the Sausage & Cheese board which had some interesting flavors!
Great place!

I've actually never sat in the dinning room here. It is either the bar or the rooftop at the weather permits. Great view of downtown. The food is great and the beer selection is abundant. Everyone is very passionate about their beer here although they have something from the bar for everyone. The food is not to be overlooked. I've never had a bad eating experience here. In fact I really enjoy what I order. The latest thing I've had was the peanut butter and jelly jalapeño burger. Delicious!!!

This place used to serve one of the very best Veggie (chickpea) burgers in the Denver area but they just changed their menu and removed it.  Its a dam shame when a place doesn't realize how good of a dish they have just because they dont sell tons of it.  I no longer have a reason to eat here.  Excellent work Amato Ale House!

I like Ale House - I really do - however, I can safely say that today is one of the worst-feeling days I've ever had. I can barely put together a proper English sentence, waited until late afternoon to write this, and am doing so with one eye open and a wet towel on my head.

I hate to blame AH for food poisoning, but nothing else I ate yesterday was out of the ordinary for me, and this was the only place we went to. All I had was what's pictured - the smoked portobello sandwich and a bloody mary - and man, do I feel like I've been whacked by a ton of bricks.

I could carry on for a few more paragraphs about how wonderful I feel on this nice sunny day, but I will drop off. Were this any other place, it would be a 1-star review where I rant that I can't leave a -1. AH, you're lucky I wuv you. Still. Even after my sleepless night and churning stoma......

xo(I think)

Come for the view, stay for the food and brews. Robust beer selection, solid menu with well prepared food. Great lunch spot as far as quick service but parking can be hit or miss. Valet available in the evenings.
Awesome view from the rooftop patio. Came on a Monday afternoon and there were plenty of open seats. Good beer selection. Did not eat here though, so I can't comment on that. Excellent service.

I've only been here for happy hour, but from what I've experienced I have nothing bad to say. 

Great deals on beers, house wines, and wells. The food selections for happy hour are ample and tasty, too!  I had the caprese  flat-bread, the squash sliders (with tomato-basil coulis), and artichoke dip.  All were packed with flavor and well presented.  I am craving the sliders as I write this!

Bartenders were very friendly and always knew the right time to ask if I needed another drink.

Happy hour is Mon-Thurs 3-7pm and Friday 3-6pm.

Our bartender (wish I could remember his name but he was a sweetheart to my sister and I and her boyfriend Maybe upper 20s or 30? Shorter, very sweet) was amazing. He told us about Lingers happy hour prices and his favorites and steered us towards the best of the Breckenridge beers! He bought us a round of beer as well. As we began to get hungry he recommended a couple of foods from their menu as well as the HH menu. The mushroom pizza was awesome, and so were the wings! We sat at the bar and were in the restaurant  in the afternoon and early evening. The only complaint I have is the other bartender.  He was a tall dark haired tan man maybe in his late 20s to 30s. He had walked in for an evening bar shift. He was clearly athletic because of the way he pranced around and flexed his chest while holding his protein shake bottle and plastic containers of his meal prepped food. Made me giggle. He ignored almost everyone at the bar. Spoke to his friends whom were coworkers and that was about it. He had no interest in interacting with people at the bar, to which our previous bartender I spoke of talked to us about beers, fed us riddles, and joked with us. This bartender was a joke of a bartender. He clearly thought he was better than others, had a very shallow attitude. And had no interest in working with customers. The main reason people sit at the bar is to interact with their service more, to learn about the alcohol and more. He was the part that left a bad taste in my mouth.  No one likes to be served by someone who has an angry resting face, and doesn't care to have a personality. Looks aren't everything,  and no one likes a blank wall for a bartender. We get it, you're fit and have a deep manly voice.  For that I give 2 stars otherwise I would have given it 5. Had the male employee not also hit on me on my way to the bathroom (he was African American and had only one dangly earring for some reason) then I would have given 4.5 or 5 stars instead of 2.

This place feels like a local version of a Rock Bottom Brewery... in a good way!

Though I did not partake of any eats and can't speak to their quality or flavor profile blah blah blah, I did enjoy a locally-brewed Belgian IPA on their lovely rooftop patio with the one and only fantastic Frances G before departing Denver.

That Upslope Belgian IPA? Delish. The weather? Perfect. The patio? Awesome! Flowers in bloom and a view to kill.

Four stars for a solid patio and local suds in the summer sun!

If you want a view of downtown Denver, an EXCELLENT patio or rooftop deck, cold and delicious beers and good bar good, then the Ale House is the place for you.

Do yourself a favor, skip Linger and head straight to the Ale House. First of all, there is almost always parking on 15th that will leave you within walking distance to the restaurant. In addition, you won't find the battle over tables and the "I think I'm better than everyone" crowd here either. If you go during lunch, make sure to get a patio table with an excellent view of the city, and great people watching if you are into that stuff.

All of the burgers are excellent, and the beer selections is one of the best in the city. I've never had a bad experience there, which means the long lost art of consistency is alive and well. Trust me when I say you'll have the best experience you could have in the Highlands when you go to the Ale House.

We went here for brunch and it was almost perfect! Really the view on the rooftop deck is what you go here for. The brunch cocktails are pretty good - my husband had a brass monkey that was refreshing and delicious. I had a Bloody Mary which was also pretty good. The only thing that was negative about the experience was the very slow service.

Okay, I went here again last night. The place is a bit louder on the weekend! But, I had the Rigatoni Steak Salad this time and holy cow. It made me give this place another star. It was one of the yummiest salads I've ever had! The steak was cooked exactly how I ordered it, the dressing had a nice spice to it, and there was so much feta cheese! Yum! Yum! Yum! This is a salad to crave!

Three stars for the food (it was average), but an extra star for the service!

Came to Amato's for a business dinner earlier this week. There were 5 of us and based on previous visits by others in my firm, we decided to make reservations. We arrived at 5:30pm and our table was ready, but it wasn't all that busy, so we could have done without reservations, probably (although it was a Tuesday night). The beer and wine list is great, and the pretzel appetizer is delicious! Main courses were just average (fish and chips, flat iron steak, deconstructed chicken pot pie), as were the dinner salads and beer cheese soup. Nothing was bad, but nothing was extra special, either. The service? It was fan-freaking-tastic! Seriously, best service I've had in Denver for months! Parking in this neighborhood is a bit tricky, so beware before heading out! I'd definitely come back, but wouldn't consider this place a go-to or a favorite for great food.

For me, this place wins it just for the location. The atmosphere of this place is pretty cool - if you sit on the patio, you can get a nice view of the Highland Bridge; and of course they have a wide selection of beer. 

I was surprised that the Brunch menu was still available on a Saturday, after 2pm; so I ordered their Mile High Burger; however, it did not live up to my expectations. 
- burger - overcooked, not much seasoning to it
- duck bacon - this is what drew me into this menu item - however, it was tough and chewy, a lot like beef jerky
- bun, i believe was decent.

Hostesses were snotty. They told us 45 minutes for a table but it was only 5. 
Wait staff was inattentive and I had to search for someone to refill my water. 3 times other waiters walked past, looked directly at me with an empty glass and kept walking. Several times our waiter walked by without even acknowledging us until I finally got up from our table and tracked him down myself. 
We were seated out on the patio and a drunk guy down on the sidewalk was being very obnoxious and loud. 
Food was delicious. I had the rooftop turkey sandwich with sweet potato fries. Very good. 
I personally do not think looking at a group of buildings and vast amounts of concrete is a nice view, but that's just me.

We picked the Ale House for a impromptu get together for our family after our youngest son's High School Basketball game on a Tuesday evening.  We ended up with a party of 7 and the Ale house staff accommodated us at a table.  We had to wait on one of our kids, but the staff was fine with that.  We had a couple of rounds of appetizers, including the roasted brussel sprouts, which were really good.  I ordered the Lamb Pita Salad. The salad vegetables were fresh and tasty, and the lamb was fine.  Best thing about the night was the service.  Our server was attentive and pleasant.  The beer menu was vast and when I asked about the red ales, my server brought a couple of samples, which I thought was cool. We will going back!

Nice upscale bar- great views of the city.
Service was very attentive. Awesome burgers and salads. Beer selection is extensive and the waitress was knowledgeable about the beers.
Highly recommend!

My touchdown meal in Denver and it did not disappoint. We were able to eat on the patio before the rain rain rain came pouring down for the remainder of my trip in Denver. Wahhhh

Anyway, I ordered some fancy margarita-type drink that was outstanding. I will say this for Denver--they know how to craft a drink or a beer. It was tequila and lavender and grapefruit juice and mmmm yummy. If I recall it was $10? Try it, you'll like it.

For lunch I got the Black Magic--blackened chicken breast, breaded/fried avocados, pepper jack cheese. This was a hearty meal and oh-so-delicious. I would love to know how they got those avocados fried just right--every time I try to recreate something like that, it fails miserably. It was so filling that and I couldn't finish it.

I had a bite of my brother's macaroni and cheese--and this is a real winner. It's not overpowering of any one flavor, but balances out tanginess and creaminess and umami really nicely.

Among our party of five, the plates were all empty or nearly empty. I'd like to check out this place again!

They had me at great beer selection!  If you know me or are familiar with any of my yelp reviews, you KNOW I love good beer!  An entire page of drafts and bottles, with several IPAs to choose from.  Plus that view from the rooftop deck (we went on the double-rainbow day)?  Someone please slap me.

The food.. I ordered the Mile High burger.. YUM.  Goat cheese, bacon, and pomegranate.. I was in heaven.  Next time I'll try the bison, but I can't honestly believe the flavors of this burger could be enhanced any more.... that is of course until I tried my friend's PBJ burger.  Oh.  My.  God.  Only one suggestion.. hickory smoked bacon instead because the peppercorns were overpowering after the jelly taste subsided.

Horribly rude wait staff and some of the worst service we have ever received at a restaurant. Food is mediocre. Drinks are the only thing worth going for, if you're willing to deal with rude waitresses and poor service.

Breakfast King is a convenient 24/7 breakfast, lunch, and dinner spot off of Federal with a perfected authentic 70s diner atmosphere all can enjoy.

Service was courteous and prompt. Upon being seated in a plush booth water and coffee was immediately served by a charismatic waitress. 
The menu boasted traditional American diner fair - large helpings of hash browns, eggs, meats, and pancakes, greasy and bland.
There is a plethora of hot sauces and condiments to choose from to flavor your meal.
For our first visit we ordered the Special - scrambled eggs, sausage patties, hash browns, orange juice, and two large golden pancakes, and the Santa Fe Sunrise - fried potatoes, green chili with beef, scrambled eggs, and toast.
Both meals arrived less than 10 minutes after ordering. Convenient but lacking in quality. 
Total cost including tip was relatively inexpensive.

Great experience, atmosphere, simple food,   good location.

Can't go wrong with Breakfast King. 

If you're looking for some straight diner food, Breakfast King is the place to go!

So far their steak and eggs are my fave. I also like their chicken friend steak and cheeseburgers. 

Service is great! The waitresses make you feel so at home and the food come real fast even when it's a full house. 

I also dig their coffee. It's not very strong but it has a good flavor to it.. Almost caramel like. 

Plus the price is right! 

Love this place. Five stars from me!

A great place if you want good, basic breakfast. Think IHOP but 10x better. The breakfast burritos are the size of a forearm, the country fried steak is gigantic, and when you order the sausage special you get two full size sausages. 

We came at peak time on Sunday at 11am and we waited about 20 minutes to be seated. They do not take names or reservations--they call out the number they are able to seat and if your group waited the longest and fits they'll seat you. If you've ever played Diner Dash same concept. From just watching seats as I waited, I think party of 2 is the most efficient. 

Also came on a Saturday morning and we were seated immediately and had food come out quickly. Great for a quick, hearty meal.
Sleazy dinner with some of the best breakfast in Denver! Everything they make is hearty and delicious!

Quick disclaimer - I am rating this place based on the expectation that it is a greasy spoon. Please know going into a dining experience at breakfast king that this is not fancy or healthy. It is a wonderful, very flavorful breakfast that you can still feel hours later. With all of that being said, breakfast king was definitely a great experience knowing this prior to going there for breakfast.

The service was great. We went earlier in the day on a Saturday so it wasn't too busy but I could see it getting quite crowded as the morning goes on. Our server was attentive and even made sure to double check our toast (I ordered dry wheat - yes being difficult) to make sure it was what we wanted.

The food was pretty good. The hubs got a breakfast burrito smothered in green chili - definitely on the large side giving him quite a bit bang for his buck. I ordered oatmeal which was definitely warm & filling. Not my fave oatmeal but I definitely take part of the blame as it probably wasn't the right thing to order here. Next time we come back I'll most likely do an omelet or something.

I would definitely recommend this place if you want a fun greasy spoon in Denver. It has its own style for sure and is much better than some of your typical breakfast chains.

Excellent place. 24/7 makes it amazing. The waitress was great, service was fast and attentive to refills. I had the fried chicken dinner, which was a lot of food. The pancakes are the size of faces here! Very low key and casual. Large portions of everything.
Favorite breakfast spot in Denver! Great food at a cheap price. Plus a fun retro atmosphere!

Good food and atmosphere. Very busy on a Sunday at 9:30am but they seated us quickly and didn't give us any trouble when we had to wait 20 minutes for friends who were running late. My wife thought breakfast special with biscuits and gravy was very good. I had the trout and eggs with hashbrowns and toast which was also very good. Portions were perfect for the price which was pretty reasonable. Would recommend and will visit again.

If you have a late night and you need to soak up all the libations that you consumed throughout the night, or if you just want a hearty (I say that modestly) breakfast, lunch, or dinner, you need to make your way to the Breakfast King. For those of you that don't know it, this place is a staple for the breakfast and lunch crowd in the north downtown area. When I say staple, I don't mean healthy, I don't mean it is the BEST food you are going to have (even though it is pretty good) I mean it is great diner food that will leave nothing to be desired. I had the country fried steak breakfast, this plate was MASSIVE! Needless to say in my Tito's (vodka) state of mind, I still couldn't knock out the entire plate. My two buddies that were with me, they had the burger and the ham steak breakfast... you guess it, it left them in a food coma. The designated driver could barely even drive because he was so full. Good thing you can't get a DUI for being gluttonous, he definitely would have been over the limit! 

All in all, you have to give it a shot. They don't call it the "king" for nothing. Worst case scenario, you will have a full meal and left overs for about $10!

I've been here quite a few times since moving to Denver in May 2015. I've always had a good experience. The food is tasty and well priced. The staff is always friendly. This place is just as good as the touristy places in town, without the long wait! I always recommend it to my friends.

Super super good spot
Open 24/7 
Denver omelette is amazing 
I'm gonna be back a few times while I'm in town
Had a Hot Hamburger with green chilli.  The green chilli tasted awesome,  it's just right with the heat.
Authentic diner feel, massive portions and hearty food, service harkens back the the 60s with waitresses complete with old school uniforms.

I had the huevos rancheros and coffee , coffee was really bad taste like dirty water I had to push myself to drink it because I needed the little of caffeine it had and the huevos rancheros was the worst I ever had , the waiter was good and professional fast and always looking if I need something and always felling the cup up , the place is nice and clean but they need to stop vacuum right in the middle of the customers with that very loud vacuum and need a new cook.

This place is great! Nice old school diner feel. Old school portion sizes. The food was delicious! I order the Texas fried steak. It was HUGE! Great place for a late night snack and talk! The waitress was super cool!

If you are looking for an old school diner and 1000 calorie plates this is your place

The menu is massive with plenty of breakfast options from eggs any style, pancakes and waffles,huevos rancheros and all in between

The dishes are simple, get what you order, in large quantities for a reasonable price. Not greasy, not fussy, and quick

Friendly staff at bar counter where we sat very attentive to getting us coffee, butter and anything we needed
Coffee is cheap and weak, I wish they offered option of better coffee for a charge

It has been opened for decades so expect the place to look a bit tired but quaint nevertheless

Typical greesy spoon. Open 24/7. Surprisingly excellent Blue Cheese salad dressing. Try it. Pretty good pancakes for diner style. Had a really gross and disgusting  tuna melt. Stay away from that item. All in all an affordable diner with a large menu.

Corned beef hash, eggs, toast and Side of sausage patties. After a show and some drinks completely with. It and all cooked correct and delicious. Priscilla  was excellent waitress even when busy.food hit the spot a great Saturday into Sunday food spot

My boyfriend and I have eaten here a couple of times. The country fried steak is delicious and HUGE. We definitely could have just shared one. The gravy was rich but not too heavy. We've also had the onion rings and spaghetti and meatballs, both of which we've enjoyed. Overall, a pretty solid option for eating especially when it's late and you don't know where to go which is constantly our problem.

I feel like this place is a little overhyped. It's definitely got the old greasy spoon diner feel, and our waitress was awesome, but the food was not. I was also looking forward to a giant plate of shredded hash browns, which they don't have (but menu says they do). The have the country potatoes which, if you're a hash brown addict like I am, does not satisfy a craving for breakfast potatoes. They need to replace the "hash browns" with "country potatoes" on the menu. The corn beef hash was really salty, my toast was served to me black, and my eggs were cold when they arrived. Overall a disappointing experience for what was supposed to be my cheat meal for the week.

Not bad. I stopped in for an early dinner today -  Wednesday. Had the gyros plate. I was surprised how much I loved the french fries. They really stood out so much so I asked if they were cut from fresh potatoes daily like their hash browns are. My server checked and told me no.

As I was sitting in the dining room the decor had me puzzeled. About half way through my meal it dawned on me that it reminded me of the 1970's. Light colored paneling on the walls, orange chairs, booths and table tops. The free standing chairs were also orange and were a style that I have not seen for over 40 years.

So nostalgic!

It was after this that I realized walking into this restaurant was like going back in time.

I would be curious if other baby boomers felt this way?

The place did look like an old school diner and everyone seemed pretty friendly.
However, into the first bite someone in my party found hair in their food. We also ordered green chile and it was not what I was expecting. I'm from New Mexico and it was more of a green chile stew. It had little green chile taste, no heat, and little chunks of ham. The prices were also a bit high for an old school diner. 
My chicken sandwich was pretty good and did look homemade. Everyone else in my party also enjoyed their food (after the hair burrito was replaced).

It's a restaurant straight from 1950. I mean that with great affection. It's a no-nonsense breakfast place that is about as unpretentious as it gets.

The flip side to that is that recipes probably haven't changed in half a century. Portions are gargantuan and the dishes are prepared with seeming disregard for anything we have learned about healthy food in that time. I'm pretty sure the veggies in the omelets are from a can and everything is pretty buttery.

Which is delicious, don't get me wrong.

Again, it's a place that will keep me coming back thanks in no small part to how it reminds me of my grandparents. It's just so charming in its own inexplicable way.
Oh man it was super busy and for good reason. This is greasy spoon diner heaven. Service was good, but the food was great.

I ate breakfast here.  The breakfast came out of the kitchen really quick and was exactly what I ordered.  It was great. 

 The rating is only one star because I watched a server drop crackers on the floor, pick them up, then serve them to someone who in turn picked them up and put them in their mouth to open them.  Food that falls on the floor wrapped or not should be thrown out not served to someone.
Good food, but certainly not healthy.  Love the old school waitresses and the breakfast burritos, wish they had fruit that didn't come out of a can.

Most of the time the food is good but it all depends on the day. I have had some really good meals here and I've had some not so good meals. My mother love to go when she is I town she says it reminds her of an old fashioned diner she used to go to when she was a kid. How ever I walk say the staff there is soo very sweet when I first came to Denver about a year ago I didn't know any one or any thing I would regularly go and have coffee there and I was there on my birthday last year, the staff came out with big pice of chocolate cake with a candle and sang me happy birthday. I know that they don't usually do that sort of thing but it made being alone on my birthday less sad.

My waitress was extremely sweet, but my boyfriend and I ordered a pancake to share and it was soggy on the inside. Our hashbrowns which accompanied my omelet (also under-done and runny) and his chicken fried steak were not crispy at all and barely undercooked. We were pretty disappointed seeing how it was 9 pm on Thursday evening after a hard session of climbing and were hoping we had stumbled into our next late-night dinner joint. Our waitress was so kind and apologetic about our food being undercooked, but it didn't make up for our disappointment and over-priced meal. :/

Nice older diner. Definitely a Tarantino vibe. The cheese burger is underwhelming. The breakfast has good points but average overall.

Overhyped.

Very clean throwback diner with bright orange booths. Friendly waitstaff and cozy atmosphere. Food was delivered fast and tasted delicious! Very crowded, but we were seated right away. We had the Santa Fe Special and pancakes, both were perfect. This place backs up their name! We will be back.
I have been coming here since I was a child with my grandparents. I have always had a good experience there.

Stopped for breakfast this morning because my hubby had eaten here before. I had the crab cake Benedict which was delish!!  Old school type diner with more than just your bacon and egg fare. If you're looking for big portions, this is the place. Open 24 hours and would be a great place to go after the bars close or it's great to take the family to for a Saturday morning breakfast.

Traveling through from OKC to northern California, and we had to stop in Denver for a Denver omelette. We're so glad we did. Incredible food and very friendly and helpful waitstaff. The atmosphere was great. Thank you so much.

Breakfast King checks all the divey breakfast joint boxes. They are quick to bring out your food, friendly without being annoying, busy but you can always get seated quickly, the prices aren't straight out of the 1950's but very reasonable, and always open!
The hashbrowns appear to be made in house--sliced, not shredded and soft with a crispy crust.

Ordered the Denver omelet and it was amazing,  it is definitely a good size omelet, ordered 5 full meals for 50 bucks which where I'm from you don't see for such an amazing breakfast, the server was so nice and welcoming she made us feel right at home,  was great with our kid, funny and nice,

This place was so good! I came here last night and got a feta cheese omelette with hash brown potatoes and a biscuit. They actually ended up bringing out 2 biscuits with honey and butter and they were delicious! The omelette was fluffy and it was both stuffed and topped with tons of feta cheese. The ends were crispy and cheesy, it was perfect. The potatoes were some of the best I ever had! They were perfectly fried and crispy on the outside and soft and buttery on the inside. I ended up ordering a glass of orange juice as well and that was good too. I did not have a bad bite of food, and we got a ton of food for what we paid. The ambiance was unique for sure, but I liked it. Reminded me of a super old town diner. I will definitely be back.

Typical diner type food.  The portions are very large.  If you are in the mood for diner food at 3 in the morning, no problem, The Breakfast King is open 24/7.  I typically gravitate towards the Chicken Fried Steak, the portion is huge and includes hash browns and toast or a biscuit.  I would recommend ordering your hash browns crispy if you like typical crispy ones.  The hash browns here are more like cooked potato slices.  I give The Breakfast King 4 stars for ambiance and because the waitresses wear cute little "Diner Type" dresses.  The food is good, yes, for a diner.  The also have a breakfast burrito that is so big it could fit a baby inside.  I have also tried the eggs benedict, do not even think about it.  These are the worst I have ever had, sorry.

Fantastic experience!! The food was so delicious... grilled cheese with bacon and avocado, milkshake and pumpkin pie were all perfectly on point! The waitress was very sweet and attentive. The atmosphere is wonderful as well. Classic diner that reminded me of my grandma's old restaurant. 
All around perfect spot!

Everything you could ever dream of in an old school diner-breakfast joint. The food is delicious and fairly priced, the decor and seating looks straight out of a movie, and the staff are amazing. Seriously, the waitresses are so old school with their personal customer service and sweetness. Love it!
This is a nice little place to come if you're hungry at any time. The service here is great and so is the food. We normally get the tuna melt or a bacon mushroom burger, both are really delicious.
Got the hot turkey and deelish sums it up. Other side of the pic is the patty melt and fries with a side of ranch that is a must have. Definitely earns the the title of 2015 "Best Coffee Pourer".

I had the ham steak, it was HUGE! Tender and tasty. 
Everything was cooked well and the portions were great!

We stopped here after a night in Denver since this place has decent reviews. It still amazes me how a below average restaurant can receive good reviews in this city. The food is over saturated and low quality. It can make you a bit gassy, nauseous, or sick if you don't have the stomach for it. The service was good, which is why I gave it a 2 star rather than 1.....

why can't everybody do what these people do.

I ordered a steak and when the steak was ready they handed it to me at the counter.  Spot on service.   coffee is pretty good.  People were friendly and the food was hot.   Sounds like a lot but it is.

Classic diner.  Massive portions.  The coffee is see through.  The butter is whipped spread.  The syrup is Mrs. butterworths.  I had many delicious white foods topped with gravy.  Took a rigorous hike later that day to get loose.  Most of the evening was spent on the can.

I would choose this place over Dennys anyday! The customer service is amazjng, the food is good and the prices are right. The inside is retro-ish, with orange booths and wood paneling on the walls. It has a charm about it that makes you want to c ok me back. The menu is honesty let with everything from Omelets to trout and eggs, to chicken fried steak dinners. My favorite is the breakfast burrito. It is massive and they have 3 or 4 kinds of hot sauce to go on it! A must see if you are in Denver!

I LOVE THIS PLACE! My man and I went on our first date here. I take all my friends here and we all love it. I bring my service dog in sometimes and she's always welcomed and treated kind. This is a great family place that's open 24 hours. They are my favorite 3am spot. Screw Dennys, come here! Better food, and way more awesome staff!

Had such high hopes after reading the reviews and was nostalgically excited as we were seated. The place was PACKED and a line out the door.  Felt very retro.  Service was EXCELLENT; fast and very friendly.  Unfortunately the food was so-so at best.  To be fair our favorite breakfast haunts are places like Toast, Cafe Tera Cotta etc...  Maybe our bar/expectations were too high.  

My breakfast burrito had a bite that was out of the ordinary crunchy...upon further review (spit it out in a napkin) it was eggshell :-(

Biscuits and gravy were ok, biscuits heavy and gravy average at best.  No real character to either. 

My fiancée had the corned beef (right out of the can and cooked on the mushy/runny side, not crisp at all; like they'd been heated in a microwave, not in a skillet). She ordered her two eggs over-easy and they were delivered over-hard...the third strike. 

We checked the box and experienced a Denver icon but won't be returning.  Too many great options to choose from.

I have been driving past this place for as long as I can remember and now I live a few blocks away.  The other morning upon awakening I had a  craving for waffles and we decided to try it.  It was crowded and the rather surly woman at the register told us that the seating is on the honor system of first come first serve.  Looking around I saw a mass of people who were waiting for tables with no way of discerning who was first.   Fortunately I saw a couple stools at the counter in the corner and we grabbed those.  

They had some interesting variety of sausages so I ordered the alligator with my waffle.  I like alligator meat but the sausage had a very unpleasant taste.  The waffle was exactly what I expected there was nothing special about it.  The lady had the corned beef hash and again it was right in the middle of the road.  Our waitress was nice, but my first and last experience was with the woman at the front who clearly didn't want to be there. 

I had put off eating here because I thought it would be a run of the mill greasy spoon and I'm not partial to them.  Enough good reviews made me give it a shot, but there's so many places to get breakfast that overall I really didn't feel that it was worth the fuss or the rudeness at the front.

Love, love, love this place. Every time I go there the staff is always quick, friendly, warm, and makes you feel like you are part of the fam. Early mornings, late night, busy time, the service is consistant. Places like this are hard to find!
What can I say? Strong coffee, good eggs, great service. I'm in love. Marry me Breakfast King. Step above a greasy spoon. Price was right. See  you again griddle hero's!

I went here on New years day with some friends, their ultimate breakfast burrito was huge! About the size of a Chipotle burrito, smothered with green chili. Their green chili was amzing, a little heat, but delicious.

Good diner style food on par with your Denny's or Waffle House. Plus side is they have a huge menu. Everything from French Toast to bison burgers. If your looking for late night food this place is open 24/7. This will be our "go to" place after a venue that doesn't serve food and all the restaurants are closed.

If this place had a liquor license and I had a fast metabolism I would be here all of the time. There are three things I love in this world and those are being drunk, being skinny, and being fed some good food at a good price. Unfortunately you can never have all of the above, however when it comes to being fed good food at a good price this is the place to be. Big servings of good home-style cooking with friendly service that won't break the bank. There is a reason this place is still standing and that's because they can do magical things with eggs and potatoes. I only stop in once in a blue moon, unfortunately, because I can't get a buzz here that makes me forget about how much I ate. Still worth it, though because the food is just quality, simple, delicious breakfast.

Breakfast King's reviews & ratings brought me here when I was starving for a midday breakfast after a sleepy flight. It didn't disappoint! I got the chocolate chip pancakes with eggs & hash browns-- super nice staff, took awhile for our food, but we came at a busy time. Good place to go if you're looking for that typical anytime breakfast diner that isn't a nasty cookie cutter franchise. Don't come here with high expectations of classy, mind blowing, first class fancy pants & you'll be happy.

Went in at midnight. The waitress was friendly and chatted with us casually on-and-off during the meal. Funny girl and very relatable. The pecan pancakes were better than average, and the hash browns were homemade.

The only downside was they were deep cleaning the carpet while we were there, so we had to change tables partway through to accommodate for that. However, it's a 24 hour place, so I understand they have to do it sometime and it's not their fault we came in then.
We enjoy stopping in whenever we are in the neighborhood.  The service is always consistent and so is the food!  I would recommend over any other breakfast or 24-hour place around town.

Great food! Surprisingly good for a corner diner! Elk sausage was great! Friendly and efficient waitress as well!
I'll be back for sure.

This place is absolutely terrible - Why anyone would eat at a place like this when there are so many amazing places in Denver to have breakfast at the same price as this crap.  I'm normally not this harsh but everything in that place is unhealthy all he way to using styrofoam - Just what you want - Hot good melting styrofoam - Avoid !!

Breakfast King has been our family's favorite breakfast place for 10 plus years. It's like you remember grandmas cooking. My personal fav is the Big Country Ham Breakfast. Talk about D-LISH! The ham alone is larger in diameter than an average dinner plate. It's thick and juicy with a tiny bone in the middle. You get two eggs cooked to order, hash browns ANDDDDD your choice of southern biscuits and gravy or 2 scrumptious buttermilk pancakes. Pure Heaven! The Gyros plate is also amazing and is my "go to" 2nd choice. You won't be disappointed there 24 hours a day!!

Stopped by this restaurant last night because it is open 24 hours a day and breakfast is my favorite meal. The trout and eggs were very delicious. The last time I was here, we had the chicken fried steak - also good. At 3 o'clock in the morning they are still busy serving customers. Nice place for a  nice breakfast.

I grew up not far from the famous Route 66 in New Mexico.  Route 66 is famous for many things but primarily for its abundance of roadside diners.  Breakfast King reminds me of those diners in so many ways.  Breakfast the way you want it whenever you want it.  Some lunch offerings too but I've never strayed from some variety or another of breakfast.  If you're looking for vegan, gluten free, "health" food, you are in the wrong place.

If, on the other hand, you are looking for large, slightly greasy portions of classic diner fare served in a kitschy atmosphere by pretty well "seasoned" (but usually funny and always efficient) waitresses in 1950's style uniform attire - this is your place.  I have no idea how many times I've nursed a hangover successfully here over the last several decades but it's a lot.  Stick to the basics and you'll be fine.  I usually have eggs soft scrambled smothered in surprisingly tasty green chile, hashed browns, bacon crisp (or sausage of which they have some "exotic" variations) and a short stack of pancakes and waddle out fortified to face the world.  My craving for this sort of fare is infrequent but when it hits - off to BK I go.

The best old school diner. Always busy, but it has lots of seating and they move quickly. Their chicken fried steak and eggs is my favorite in town. Been coming here my whole life and will continue to.

I live for breakfast food ... and this place makes me very happy. It's an old-fashioned diner with big portions, lots of cheese, killer green chile, and friendly/efficient wait staff. It isn't fancy, you won't be getting any caviar on your eggs, and I don't recall a whole lot of health food on offer, but if you love a good old-fashioned hot breakfast, this is your place! My personal favorite is the Toro Pot smothered in green chile and cheese. Yum!!!

I loved my experience here. Stopped in after a late concert. Unfortunately I don't remember what I ordered. But I do remember finishing most of it, even though the portion was pretty large, which is rare for me (I tend to eat small portions). Our waitress was friendly and helpful... I do remember that she gave me tons of coffee, and the coffee didn't suck. So I give it a 5 star for what it is - a cute, well-priced, friendly diner. I'll go back if I'm ever in Denver again.

Big portions of decent food at a great price. The food is served on giant plates and reminiscent of every diner you have ever been to. I would avoid the omelettes as they lack flavor and need a lot of seasoning.

A very greasy good deal.
Honestly amazing diner food! The portions are huge, the decor is authentic diner style! This place is my new favorite!

We shared the Kings Omelet. It was amazing and the perfect amount to share between my boyfriend and I. Eggs, veggies, and meat all perfectly cooked and not burnt. Definitely, one of the best omelets I've had.

The staff is all very friendly and gives off a laid back atmosphere. 

When we left, I realized I lost my ring so we went back. When I went in to look, the staff showed great concern and helped me look for it. They genuinely cared and helped me look for a while. Luckily, I finally found it and we were all relieved. 

Their kindness and generosity really stood out, I look forward to my next visit!

I felt like I should've been parking a Tardis rather than a car in this parking lot, because when I walked into this restaurant I was pretty sure I'd travelled through time back to 1974. 

Everything is BRIGHT orange and the waitresses are clad in very old-fashioned stark white uniforms. The food is GREAT after a night of drinking and shenanigans, though. They gladly whipped up a plate of french fries smothered in green chile and cheese for me, and it was soooo yummy. 

This is a great greasy spoon for all your late night and morning needs!

Meh. Pasty, mushy hash browns. No wait on a Saturday AM... I understand why. Filthy. Carpets disgusting. Toilet overflowing.
No thanks.

The Breakfast King reminds me of a good ol' Southern diner, a place I might have eaten at in my childhood in Tennessee or my young adulthood in North Carolina. There's something about the lighting at night, the vinyl booths, the waitresses... that feels familiar like only childhood memories can. 

The coffee is diner coffee, light and the type that I have to drink with cream and sugar. 

The plates are greasy in a delicious way.

The waitresses are sassy in their motherly way.

And they serve breakfast 24 hours a day.

I had a hankering for breakfast for dinner this week so Sir Nicholas took me here to satisfy that craving. I had an order of pancakes that were just what the baby ordered and a side of crispy bacon. Be aware that you have to go here wanting to eat food that is not good for you. Blueberries in a pancake are frozen. A side of fruit is canned pineapples/pears/peaches. Breakfast burritos are the size of Qdoba's dinner burrito and smothered in cheese and green or red chile.  Put all that aside and focus on indulging in food that is bad for your gut and good for your soul.

And the people watching at night can be seriously fantastic.

This place is great!! The sits are comfortable and the services is fast and super friendly! I love how they have the old school outfits.. It really adds to a great diner experience. We ordered the Relleno plate which was super good with a New Mexico style green chili.. thats with no tomatoes unlike Colorado style. They were so yummy! It was only around $9 served with beans on the side. My man ordered the liver and onions that is served with a side and a salad for around $9! They never let our coffee cup go empty ... What more could you ask for? :)

Take out order on a whim, Friday around midnite. Ordered via Yelp Eat24. Easy enough to find. Large lot with plenty of parking. Food was ready upon arrival (10 min). Was greeted upon entering by an incredibly nice man who asked how my night was going. I appreciate the genuine compliment, which along with my now satisfied hunger, definitely made for a better night. Will fer sure be back when I'm in a cruddy mood and craving a french toast combo again.

Lately, my favorite thing at Breakfast King is breakfast with the big ham steak (labeled "country ham" on the menu but it is not dry, salty country ham; it is an ordinary but huge ham steak). Besides the ham you get two eggs, potatoes, and your choice of biscuit and gravy, pancakes, or toast for the unadventurous. I usually order the pancakes or biscuit and gravy to go, and I will still have plenty of ham left over. 

This is a place where some items are passable and some are really good. Ask your waitress if you are not sure what category your order falls into; they will tell you what's a good choice!

I've only been once after wanting to try it for a while.  We went for brunch on our way up to the mountains.  I had the eggs benedict and it was really good.  Their pancakes are good too -which seems more rare lately when trying other brunch places.  Big servings, old school diner vibe, good prices, good service, pretty good diner food and they had some interesting specials like alligator and elk and snake.  Doesn't appeal to me but fun right?

Remember Mel's Diner from television?  Okay if you're not  THAT old then how about the diner from Pulp Fiction?  Well... this is it.

This place is a throwback in time to the diner days of yesteryear.  The spunky apron-wearing waitresses with the pencil in the ear like Flo ready to take your order and walking around poised with kettle in hand to keep your coffee cup filled.  It's a cliche but that's why they are the King.  

I'm not particularly a hot breakfast kind of guy.  I'm more of a cold cereal man myself but holy shit... this good!  The hash brown potatoes are the best I've ever had.  EVER.  Made from big, thick spuds, not some greasy diced up hashes.  The buttermilk pancakes were delish.  This place gave me an oralgasm. 

THIS is the place you come to for a damn fine breakfast ANY time of day or night.  Open 24/7.  Not IHOP or Denny's so don't even bother.  You come and pay your respects to the King.

Hail to the King, baby.

These folks know what their doing! If you're hungry have the HUGE country ham breakfast.  This place is always busy and handle the volume like a well oiled machine.  If you are up for it, the waitress might tell you an off color joke! What a great Denver institution!
Huge portions, cheep prices, breakfast all day. WINNING.

If you desire a greasy breakfast, this is the place.   A little insider tip:

When your server comes to take your order, stand up and yell, "I want your GREASE ON ME, IN ME AND COMIN OUTTA ME!!!"  They will give you your meal for half price if you yell it loud enough.

I can only come here every few months or so because I'd be dead if I ate this way every day.  But if you had a good week of healthy living and eating and just want to get a little crazy, this place is awesome.  I get eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, country potatoes AND... onion rings.  That's right.  And coffee and OJ and water.

And then I go home and read the newspaper, if you know what I mean.

So this place has great diner food and you always wonder about the servers.  I don't wish bad fortune on anyone, but maybe I secretly hope for pure novelty that their lives are filled with drugs and jail time and stuff like that.  Just to enhance my own personal experience.  I also kind of wish they smoked cigarettes while they serve.  My personal rule is that if I have a pregnant server at a diner, I tip and extra $20 bucks.  

I'm kidding about the above paragraph.  I tip everyone the same.  Pregnant or not.

Just kidding again.

The only thing I don't like about this place is that there's not a lot of walking space.  I know what you're thinking:  "Mark, did you come to Breakfast King to walk, or eat?!?!".  

Allow me to explain.  The tables are low and very close to each other and the aisles are big enough for only 1.5 people to walk side by side.  This means that butts and groins are constantly in your FACE, close to your food on the table, etc.  And a lot of the people eating there are old, sometimes unkept and sometimes it seems that their clothes were worn the previous day, too, which means dirty groin and butt area right there in your face.  RIGHT when you are eating your breakfast.  I am a creative person and so I have to really try hard not to visualize what's on the other side of that dirty denim.  So disgusting.  Because who showers and then puts on yesterday's clothes.  

For that reason, I suggest you eat at the bar, where this will not happen.

24 hour diner done right. 

Quick service with all the hun, doll, whatcha havin service you love and expect from a joint like this. 

A long night of dancing and drag queen on the other side of the tracks are sure to get you hangry at 3am. Thank goodness Breakfast King is the king of late night eats. 

Food is good diner food. Menu is huge, portions are big and prices are just right. 

Our group ordered a variety of eats and all of us really enjoyed and it was not just bc we were famished beasts. 

I had the B&G breakfast plate that came with eggs (your choice), choice of meat (I had BACON), hash browns and a juice. Everything was tasty and hit the spot. 

I'm telling you if you are in need of eats at the better part of the wee hours of the morning visit the King and you will feast like the king himself!

Went there on a fluke. Slept in and went in search of a place that served breakfast food in the afternoon. What a great find. Retro diner atmosphere, nice staff, and the food was great! It's now a regular stop every time I'm in town.

This place is amazing. Every type of breakfast you could want and huge portions! The waitresses are awesome and are always refilling your cup of coffee and water. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

It was good unpretentious diner food. Food was A- Ok, staff was super nice and the whole experience is a blast from the past. Boyfriend got the smaller chicken fried steak, I ordered the breakfast burrito monstrosity. I had wished moments after ordering, that I had stuck to my druthers and ordered just a simple standard breakfast with toast, eggs, bacon, and hash browns. The breakfast burrito is good, the green chile if very meaty/porky. I am kind of loosing my love of breakfast burritos, because seldom are the potatoes- inside it, as awesome, as if they were standing out in the open air on my plate. The chicken fried steak, was very good in my boyfriends book, we used to live in Texas, and is pretty fussy about the art form. Portions are huge, you pay at the counter. I think the breakfast burrito was 9.99$ but two could share it, the small portion of chicken fried steak breakfast was also under 10$!
Had a damn fine lunch at the BREAKFAST KING today. Food was delicious, service was great.

Great breakfast spot, I believe open 24 hours. Don't get turned off by the outdated decor. My first experience my ex-fiance brought me here.  He's a got a great sense for all the best food places in Denver. So immediately I knew the food would be good. I've only been here a few times and both times I ordered the Chicken fried steak, eggs and hash browns. If you order the large size you'll have enough to take home or share.  The food is good and the prices are reasonable.

STILL LOVE THIS PLACE.  SEE?  I'M USING ALL CAPS!! I MUST REALLY LOVE IT!!

Late-Night craving for the world's best Hash Browns (Crispy, please)  with awesome Chili  (NOT GREEN CHILI!  Newsflash:  Breakfast King has some impressively passable Beef Chili, too!  A tad Spicy with just enough Bean Paste in it and ground beef.  Yes, Please.)  Throw it on top of a side of Hash Browns and enjoy the madness.  You're welcome.

Got a sweet tooth?  For less than $5, their French Toast fills the plate and the palette!  (Heh.  See what I did there?  Get it?? Get it??)  It's crusty and golden and I don't even mind the fake syrup.  Beat that!

Oh, and let me TELL you about their English Muffins!  Perfectly toasted and tons-o-jellies on the table to slather!  Done!


Oh, Breakfast King.  Thank you for staying open all night, in all your Bright Orange Vinyl Splendor, with your Diner Fare and People Watching.  Thank you for being near work for those Late Nights.  Thank you for being reasonable distance from downtown for THOSE "Other" Late Nights.

You're Awesome.  Never Change.  Have Your People Call My People.  We'll Do Lunch.    In the Middle of the Night.

I fucking LOVE this place. I will admit: my aging, not-so-steel guts can be upset by the grease factor, but my mouth loves it. Not only is it The Breakfast King, but (now that I work nearby) they whip out great, classic lunches: their Rueben beats the crap out of pricier versions available at hipper-than-thou establishments like Steuben's or (insert name of some other joint that charges $12 or more for a sandwich), their burgers are good and greasy, and every soup-of-the-day I've had has been delicious. The waitresses make the place awesome though: they've got that Flo-thang going for them! They just don't make them like The Breakfast King anymore...

The Breakfast King is....well....the KING of breakfasts.  Hungry, cold and seeking refuge from a Denver snowstorm, we discovered the BK.  Moreover, we discovered a retro gem complete with friendly wait staff donning white uniforms, aprons and smiles.  Jam packed on a snowy Saturday morning, everyone was friendly and striking conversations with breakfast goers sitting beside them.  The owner even took a couple moments from behind the counter to share the cafe's history.

Regarding the morning nourishment: awesome, fast and plentiful.  More than breakfast, an experience.

I am always looking for a great breakfast place...and not always just for breakfast. I had biscuits and gravy, hamburger steak, and eggs that were cooked to perfection (you would be surprised how many places can't cook over easy eggs!) It has a very retro dinner feel which I love.

This place is my favorite diner to go to!  I have gone here for years and it never changes.....which is a good thing!  Great for hangovers or just because.  The service is great and the people that work there are very down to earth and bust their ass to make sure you're happy.  It's an OLD diner that has a lot of character and is 24hrs.  The Santa Fe Sunrise is my fav.  Their hashbrowns and green chili are the bomb!  Great prices too!!

I love it here. Mike is the best ever. He tells a great story, and as a native I can appreciate a good story. The food is amazing and the staff are awesome! They treat their customers great and they are open 24/7! This is mine and my boyfriend's go to spot for just a cute late breakfast or dinner. They never have any issue with my service dog even though she's a pit. They even give her treats. It's a great family spot and has a nice atmosphere.  I love this place
Typical greasy spoon diner. The food isn't that great. My girlfriend's tortilla had mold on it. Won't see us back there.

Stepping in to The Breakfast King is like time travel-the wood paneling, orange vinyl booths and rotary phones near the one stall restrooms evoke a nostalgic feeling.

The service is always decent, the food is always decent and the waits are never long. 

Expect your typical greasy spoon fare and some top notch people watching!

i would say this place has one of the best chicken fried steaks(the texas size 11oz) the pancake sandwhich also looked really good. I chose a slightly healthier breakfast entree... the greek omelet. 

I have been here 3-4 times now, i have never waited for a table, the service is good, and the food comes quick. there are lots of choices besides breakfast but why bother.

A vintage diner feel -- and they really love the color orange here. The servers wear old-school white uniforms. That's pretty neat. A plethora of menu items, usually common for a place that's open 24 hours.

Many Yelpers reviewed this place and praised the breakfast burrito (with ham, egg, potatoes, etc.) that's smothered in green chili. Guess that was an easy choice. At $8.95 and generously sized, it was a pretty sweet deal. 

Yup, that's one damn good burrito. Panda-dancing good. The best part was the smothering green chili; it had a noticeable kick that I hadn't previously seen in other green chili concoctions. Also, big praise for the perfectly cooked potatoes. The exterior had an amazing browned crispiness that I wish all browned potatoes had. The ham lacked that mouth-watering smokiness I crave, but still left me a happy panda. No question, I'd get this again.

The coffee ($1.75) was pretty watery, mostly a lifeless, darkened cup of coffee essence. It's also very lukewarm, not fresh-piping hot. Would they allow me to zap the coffee in the microwave or something just so I can torch my taste buds? At least unlimited refills is a positive. I don't believe pedestrian coffee is a death blow for a diner/dive joint.

Overall, it's still a good place for that breakfast burrito. Unsure what else I'd get here, but hopefully it would be just as satisfying!

Great for lunch specials and take-out. I come here often since it's close by. 

Favorite entree- Singaporean noodles which comes with shrimp and chicken and is loaded with curry powder, turmeric. Goes well with the Mongolian beef and chicken.
