Definitely in an odd location but convenient! Have not dined-in so I can't speak to the service...but the food is excellent and that's all that matters.
***** Ive been going here for years, many years!!! I love this place!!!! Every time i take a friend there, they want to every time!!! Never disappoints!!

There are so few places in Denver Metro that you can get BBQ pork fried rice.  This is one of those places!!!  

I am spoiled from eating east coast Chinese most of my life and I much prefer the flavor of the BBQ pork to the seemingly chopped up pork chop thrown in as most places do. 

I have been coming to this location for years now.  It's a great stop on the way back from the Airport and really easy to get to.  My only issue with them now really isn't their fault.  A pot shop opened next door to them and unfortunately it permeates into their location. 

 I have eaten at this location several times with family and friends but now it will probably be strictly take out for me.  Don't let that deter you from stopping in.

I cannot begin to tell you how much I love this location. The years we have spent coming here is definitely amazing as we created numerous memories dining on fine Chinese food. Yes, the staff's attitude does vary, unfortunately, however, they have some delicious appetizers, entrees, and the dessert is eh... Not so much. The grab cheese wontons are exquisite and creamy, the sesame chicken is so crunchy, saucy and gourmet. The egg drop soup is nice and hot and makes a perfect appetizer idea. The vegetable dish is also fantastic and mouth watering. The dessert is alright but not highly recommended. The place itself is wholesome Chinese food and you won't regret eating there!

This Chinese restaurant is really good. I love that their lo mein is mostly noodles and only a small amount of veggies. My favorite dish so far is the general tso's chicken. My boyfriend likes the sesame chicken too. Although I have not eaten at the restaurant, the ambiance seems nice. A warning to late eaters: this restaurant WILL CLOSE EARLY IF THEY HAVE NO BUSINESS. If you're looking for a late night meal I suggest you call first. You might be able to order take out if they are closing. 

Every time we have ordered food it was been late and they have been getting ready to close. We have only gotten take out. They are very quick at filling our order. We haven't had to wait more than 10-15 min for our food.

It's always nice to find a little place hidden in the treasures of a strip mall neighborhood. I ordered the Mongolian triple delight and was surprised at the juiciness and texture of the shrimp, Chechen and steak. Cooked to perfection not overcooked like most places cook shrimp. The lunch portion was like a large and I didn't have to choose between crab rangoon and an egg roll - I got both. My favorite part of the day with the creamy egg drop soup super yummy in my tummy.

When I'm on the side of town I'll definitely come back. The service was great, the employees was really nice in the quiet atmosphere was just what the doctor ordered during the middle of a hard work day. I really enjoyed everything!

Overall, a great deal for solo ventures.

I was looking to try something new for lunch and so I did a quick Google search and found this place. The food is good - not excellent, but good. However, the pricing is what really blows the deal away. 

The lunch special includes a huge tray of food, large slot filled with meat, two smaller slots filled with your choice of side. Along with that, you get crab cheese Rangoon and veggie egg roll, all for an awesome $6.50 (before tax). When was the last time you had a meal so large, you couldn't finish it for $6.50? I also got a "small" order of soup for $1.50, but don't let that word fool you: it was probably about 16 fluid ounces of soup. For some, that could have been the meal.

I ordered the sesame chicken, as it is a favorite of mine and a common order at Chinese restaurants. Cooked to perfection, crispy, not overcooked. Sauce was a tad bit sweet, but it wasn't a deal breaker. 

Overall, an excellent deal. I am very happy and would highly recommend eating here for a cheap, tasty meal. I would not, however, recommend this as a formal dinner. As I said, the food is good, but not excellent, and the inside of the restaurant looks a little dark and damp. Best to order to-go from this place.
Delivery is always on point and delicious, my favorite Chinese in Aurora. Soup and tea when you eat in restaurant for lunch.

Pretty good food and good service. 
The menu is pretty typical for Chinese food, but they will sub sauce for you or keep an item out. They are also great about adjusting spice. 
What keeps them from a 5 star rating for me is the following: dumplings skin is way way too thick. It's gross in the wonton soup. The sesame chicken is both white and dark meat, pick one. The mooshu once had a tiny bone chip in it...cracked my tooth. Not their fault per se, but speaks to quality of ground pork.

Okies, once again, how come there are "two slotted" spot for this establishment?  Hence I'll write my review in this "slot", which was first reviewed in 2009 with the rest of the Yelpers who had reviewed this establishment.  Was here with one of my gurl fren, on TUESDAY February 21st 2012.  

First note to self, make sure if to dine out on a TUESDAY, check all the possibilities of all the restaurants, I am eyeing, to dine out especially at this part of neighborhood to be open.  Tsai Shen Garden came to our rescue coz after running errands all the way from the other part of the neighborhood aka WEST AREA and need to be in this area.  We called in, and asked TSAI SHEN GARDEN if they are OPEN.  Thankfully they are.

When we arrived for this LATE LATE LUNCH, time was : 15:15hrs ish.  Another good note, we arrived just in time for their LUNCH HOUR cut off, which was 3:30pm.  If I am not mistaken, there are like another patron dining in.

Since both of us were "starving" and from the brief "glance" of the menu, these was what I ordered :

*  Szechuan Beef ($6.25)
*  Bomber Combination (to go for Hubs) (Chef's Specials $6.95)

My friend ordered Kung Pao Three Delight ($6.95)

My order came in with, Egg Roll, and Crabmeat Cheese Wonton, and I opt for Egg Drop Soup and Fried Rice.  The Egg Roll and Crabmeat  Cheese Wonton, came out hot, crispy, a good sign, since I dont like stuffs cold or soaggy.  Another good note, if I could recall properly, we were given complimentary tea for our lunch.  My main entree of Szechuan Beef was A-OK, though I so wish it could be more spicy.

All in all, its an OK Lunch though I bet my friend bet to differ from her glowing review.  For the LUNCH price you get, its DEFINITELY a STEAL DEAL!  As with regards to flavor, its just OK for my taste bud.  Dont mind returning, when needed if I am in this part of the neighborhood.

The Bomber Combination comes with Shrimp, Beef and Chicken with a Spicy Sauce and Vegetables.  Also from the Hubs' feedback, he likes the order of his Bomber Combination, the flavor was just right and has a "unique" taste in which until now I am trying to figure well.  Oh well.  But when I had the Bomber Combination to go, I think the Kitchen staff forgot or perhaps its "their" practice NOT to include any kind of soup for that pricing.  No big deal, but just want to give a heads-up.

The service was prompt, inviting and we got our food freshly cooked, hot and fast.  While having our late lunch, there are many more patrons came in to dine in.  We left Tsai Shen Garden about 16:05hrs ish.

@27/2012

Overpriced and tastes cheap. Ive eaten ground up dog rectum that had better flavor than this cat carcass they are trying to pass off as Chinese food. I literally had to punch my dinner because it wouldn't stop meowing!
Food was on par with the prices; nothing extraordinary. We ordered the Chicken Fried Rice and a large Egg Drop soup. Beware, they will nickel and dime you ( was charged extra for hot oil).

I love the food here! It seems less greasy than some of the other chinese in the area. I had the basil chicken which was full of flavor and had an awesome kick from the jalepenos! The serving size was huge, especially the rice, I pobably threw away over 3 cups of rice. The only con is that they don't  deliver to my area.

Terrible food. The place was empty at noon for lunch.  Soup salty and bland.  Appetizers were a joke.  Entrees were awful.  At least the service was good as we were the only ones there. We left the meal over, paid $35 for a 27 bill, and walked out. Sorry

The food is great, but the customer service is horrible! I have never been so disrespected by someone. I called for delivery and they took and hour to bring me my food; and when I called the owner yelled at me and told me to wait. This place is run by two asian brothers and they are the most rude persons ever. Beware with the asian twins.
Sesame Chicken was good.

Last night we ordered the General Tso and Orange Chicken for pick-up. Underwhelmed by the quality of the food but the kicker came at 1 AM this morning. Horrible stomach cramps that can only be attributed to food poisoning. Boyfriend seems to be ok so it must've been the Orange Chicken. If you have lots of extra sick days and want to live life on the edge, go for it. As for me, I will never cheat on Pho Cafe (off Mississippi) again!

An average chop shuy house.  It is ok with nothing that really shines.   I will come back only if I really had to do so.  Friendly and efficient service rendered. The restaurant is tucked away slightly lower than the thoroughfare on the right
Very authentic. You have to leave a few coins on the little Buddha statue. Wonderful food great people. We very much enjoyed our experience there.

Was the third restaurant I tried after moving to Aurora and by far it is the best. Food is good. Prices are reasonable. I have since moved about 15 minutes away but still go there, driving past multiple other restaurants.    I am a fan!!

We absolutely love Tsai Shen! We have dined in and ordered for delivery and both are fine options. Delivery on both occasions was pretty quick considering the day and hour and everything was delicious and hot with nothing forgotten. Dining in is my preferred method however...we get the "family" dinner with the platter and I always order the Mongolian Triple.. My husband likes the Shrimp & Scallops with Garlic Sauce and I think it is very good as well. We will be very sad if we ever move from Aurora, because this one is a gem!

Dont bother! terrible business management. Ordered delivery, in the middle of moving, waited over an hour, finally called them, they never started my order because they didn't know what kind of rice I wanted!........... never even called me. Were very rude and didn't know what to say or offer much for me even though i was starving and upset. manager said they dont even take on line orders............................how they knew what I orders is interesting........confusing. Dont bother. they dont care!

I order food from Tsai Shen Garden on a semi-regular basis.  This place is very consistent.  Flavors are always good, the food always gets here quicker than the time frame quoted on the phone and the staff is very friendly.

Lately, I have been on more of a health food kick and have been eating their steamed veggies and tofu dish.  It comes with a ginger sauce that is pretty darn good!  The veggies are always fresh and well prepared.  The only con is they don't offer brown rice.  White rice or fried rice only.

For those of you that are in for the night but think you can't get healthy food delivered to you, think again!  This is a fantastic option for those of you that don't want to suck down sugar filled sauces and piles of meat.  

For those of you that aren't watching your waistlines, I recommend their Mongolian Triple Delight.  It's a combo of beef, chicken and shrimp in a very savory yet sweet sauce.  Their crab cheese wontons are also delicious!

Which ever way your diet takes you, Tsai Shen Garden is a great option for everyone in your group to get something to their liking.  I'd recommend this place to anyone in their delivery range.

We love Tsai Shen Gardens. I really love the sesame chicken and my husband always gets the Singapore rice noodles. We moved out of the delivery area but we will still drive out of our way to pick food up from here. They are fast and friendly and we are always happy with our food! Yum!

I happened to chance upon this place with a girl friend few days ago cos we have been driving ard for like 2hrs trying to go to a few of our fav restaurants but they are just not open on Tuesdays! So ya, I whipped out the phone and typed "chinese restaurant" in the area. 

Tsai shen popped up, and we decided to just go for it as we were really too hungry to think or do any more research. I did call just to make sure they're open for biz (of cos!).(There was another chinese restaurant that came up but it said 'american chinese' cuisine, and we wanted authentic chinese food, so we decided to go for this one)

We were pleasantly surprised to find the food very good. On top of that, hot chinese tea was served complimentary! Nice. The lunch came with a freshly deep-fried crunchy spring roll and a crab cheese wonton, both of which tasted great. And mind you, I had many spring rolls before, and some I would just not eat after one bite because they just taste icky. Oh yea, came with a soup too, and you even get to choose which soup you want (out of 3 options). And yes, I was even impressed with the soup - had fresh ingredients (springy tofu), something I normally wldn't think twice abt.

Count our lucky stars that 2 too-hungry-to-think girls chanced upon a great Chinese restaurant. 

Free good tea, good soup, good food, nice spring roll and wonton. Loved it, will bring my husband and come back again.

Price is high for dinner. Mongolian beef was salty. Honey walnut shrimp had good fried texture but buried under a mountain of mayo sauce so every bite was like a pre-eminent heart attack. Service was lackluster, every question I asked the waiter would shrug his shoulder and reply "ehhhh I don't know". Conclusion? I've had better elsewhere for cheaper.

Lunch is great. The lunch portions are generous and luncheon specials include soup. The price is right and the food is great.  I recommend lunch over dinner. The dinner portions are no larger than the lunch portions but cost more.  The food is still great however.

Like half of Aurora, we decided to have Chinese food delivered on a Friday night.  We pulled up our six items on their online menu and called in our order.

Plus: The food was GREAT.  The Singapore noodles had generous portions of shrimp and chicken, and overstuffed the box.  The scallion pancake was crispy but not greasy.  The crispy chicken was... crispy, but not greasy, with large pieces of white meat.  The garlic shrimp was okay, with that weird assortment of criss-cross vegetables that accompany some Chinese dishes.  The prices were reasonable -- even the seafood dish came in at less than $10 -- and we got our money's worth (none of that "food in half the container and shredded lettuce in the other" nonsense). 

Minus:  Not surprisingly, delivery time on the busiest night of the week, at the busiest time, ran to almost two hours versus the promised 60-80 minutes.  

Minus-That-Turned-Into-a-Plus:  Before I'd even had a chance to say anything, the delivery driver already had a cash discount in hand to apologize for the delay.  When we called the restaurant to let them know how good the food was (and how the wait was worth it), they were gracious and apologetic and invited us to the restaurant where they'd shower us with freebies.

All in all, we're happy we've found a great Chinese restaurant in Aurora, and we'll be coming back soon.

One of those delicious pizza places that you are glad to hear about and try.

Will be coming back for more, great prices for the product. Delicious.

-Hidden location, hard to find
-Barren, cheaply furnished dining room
-No wait staff
-No real cups
-Literally two menus available on PRINTER PAPER
-No music
-Malfunctioning TV only in Spanish
-No real silverware
-Mediocre pizza that I'd rate a 2.5
-No women's bathroom
-Dirty men's bathroom
-Overall affordable meal

So based on that, order it to go if you choose. I was not impressed.

I think I had ordered a pizza to go from this place a year or so ago & if I recall I thought it was okay. Stopping in for a quick slice recently, though, the place seemed different. Run down. Dirty. My pizza slice was mostly bread. Everything, from the floors to the drink dispenser is dirty. There was some violent movie on the tv and I had to get up and move to the far corner of the room to try to avoid the sounds of shooting while waiting for my slice. When it did arrive, it wasn't very appealing and had very little toppings. I ate a few bites and scrambled out of there. To my mind, there are far nicer places to grab a slice and a drink in town.

This was some of the best pizza I have had. The lunch special is the bomb. For about $6, I got 2 drinks and a HUGE slice that was 3 regular size slices. 
It took about 10 minutes for the slice to be delivered to the table. 
I ordered the Hawaiian slice. It was full of Canadian bacon and pineapple. It was delicious and the crust was crisp. It was like a perfect NY style gaint slice. 
Don't be discouraged by the location and that it is off the beaten path. It simple setting doesn't take away for the yummy gaint slices.
Pizza was pretty good but only if you like thick crust. Jalapeño cheese bread was really good. Prices are very good. Delivery was fast. And driver was very nice.

Severely burnt food.  Delivery issues.  

First off, my order arrived relatively quickly which I was pleased with.  However, my driver couldn't seem to understand the building number, gate code, or building code I explicitly put in the order instructions.  She asked if I could just "come to her," even though she couldn't tell me exactly where she was.  I've ordered from other local resturants where I needed no extra instructions for my food to arrive at my door.  The fact that I had to leave my home and walk further than my vehicle was parked made me wish I had saved the delivery fee and tip.  

Secondly, cinnamon knots I ordered were severely burnt.  The bottom was completely blackened and rock hard.  The cinnamon knots fused to the paper and was not edible by any stretch.  Very disappointing for my first order.  

I ordered a small Hawaiian pizza which was OK.  No major complaints, especially for the price.  Also a Taco pizza that was not what I expected in a bad way.  The pizza came with unshredded chunks of salad lettuce.  I expected the type of lettuce one would get on a typical taco which was not the case.  I've had taco pizza in the past, this was the worst.  It was either poorly or hastily prepared which showed.  Not sure if I'll order from here again.

We have ordered twice and will continue to do so. Best delivery pizza ever. Being that we live further out not many places deliver but honestly I would prefer this over any of those big box pizza places. If you are looking for delicious food, friendly staff and on time delivery this is your place!

My colleagues and I had to stay overnight to work, so our boss ordered pizza from this place.  It's hard to mess pizza up, but I have to say I was pretty let down.  The pictures just didn't look like our pizza at all.  Sparse on the toppings and cheese...  tasted like your run of the mill frozen pizza.  Super bland crust.  The only thing holding it back from 1 star, is the cheesy bread we ordered.  The cheesy bread was awesome.  If only they put that kind of cheese on the pizza.  All in all, not a fan.  Especially for the price (About 21 bucks for a xl or xxl I can't rember which size.  It looked like an XL.).  It definitely does not warrant the cost.  I'll eat it again, if it's free, and our boss orders... otherwise, I'll pass.

Actually no, I'd order the cheesy bread.  That was good.  Pizza, no thanks.

It's not delivery, it's not Digiornos, it's disappointment.

I had the made to order pizza slice. I was wary as the location is a bit dingy, but the pizza had a great taste. Very similar to real New York style pizza. The dough is thin, not as thin as NY because they are made to order, and had a sweet taste. No issues with the amount or quality of the toppings. The only negative is the pizza was a bit greasy... But that's what makes it good right? Someone stated the pizza tastes like frozen store bought pizza. I would like to know what he's buying.

All I can say is WOW! Ordered using yelp24 (very convenient). Delivery was estimated to be between 45-60 minutes. It arrived in about 30, and the food was still hot (the chains haven't managed to do that). Ordered a 14", 5 topping build your own pizza and a mini calzone. 

First the pizza: crust was perfectly done, just enough to have a crunch, but slightly chewy. The toppings were fresh, generous and bright. Honestly, this pizza was "advertisement quality".

The mini-calzone. If that's a mini I'm scared to try the regular (although I will have to now). It was only a 3 topping calzone, but it was packed! 

Both the pizza crust and the calzone crust  were infused with just enough oregano to enrich the flavor but not overwhelm. 

This is now in my list of "go to" restaurant/delivery!

Ordered two nights ago, just now had time to write a review.. but this place looked alright on the reviews.. ordered "to go". When we came in the place looked dirty, surprised that our food came out fast. The pizza didn't have much toppings, pretty good size but I rather have little Caesars then what I got. We ordered wings and that's probably what disgusted me the most. My boyfriend had mild buffalo boneless wings and I got the parmesan garlic boneless... these wings were TINY!! Tiny itty bitty pieces of chicken. My "Parmesan garlic" were little chicken pieces with parsley floating in oil! I had more oil in my box then wings! Don't order the "wings" from here, yuck!

Jalapeno cheesy bread and stromboli were delicious.  Interior lacks anything, get your order to go. Also, I would not recommend a slice, but again jalapeno cheesy bread, and stromboli were wonderful, tasty, good size and price.

AMAZING pizza, great garlic knots and great philly cheese steak sandwich! Fast and friendly delivery!HIGHLY RECOMMEND!


Updated: just ordered from them again and AWESOME food and service! Best pizza and Philly Cheesesteak I've ever had hands down!

The Pizza here is awesome! They make everything, including the sauce. The pizza had tons of meat, and a generous amount of sauce. The amount of cheese was over the top! The price? Very reasonable. I'd eat here often if I lived nearby. Even though I gave this place 4 stars, there are negatives. I don't like plastic eating utensils, the over-all look of the place is very run down... a dump really. The restroom was unkempt and dirty. You'd have to go somewhere to clean up after cleaning up here. Anyway, I'd order my food to go if I could come here again. The food is great, people are nice, but it's a dive.

We had read great things about this place so we decided to give it a try tonight. Would rather find a great small shop pizza joint rather than a big chain like papa johns to get pizza delivered from. They had a great online ordering deal for 2 medium pizzas for $10! So how could we pass it up? Well. We should have. I had no issues placing our order. Received a confirmation email time stamped for 7:28pm. At 8:40 I called to get an eta on our pizzas since it had been over an hour. I was reassured by the person I spoke to that the driver was on his way & he was going to give him a call to see where he was. 25 mins later - still no pizza. We called again asking for a manager. The cashier on the phone told us he 'couldn't find her'. He couldn't even find our order! They had no idea what we ordered & nobody could clearly answer questions. We told them to cancel the order completely (luckily we hadn't paid yet). 10 mins after we get off the phone the delivery guy shows up. We explained what happened & that we wouldn't be taking the pizzas. He explained NOBODY had called him - not for an eta. Not to let him know we cancelled. 
If after an hour a customer calls because they still haven't received their order - you should be doing what you can to figure out what's happened & possibly offer a discount or incentive to come back again. If after the second call I can't even get a manager on the phone & you have no idea about my order - then I have no interest in trying to support your business.

Ordered online through YELP to my hotel room. Me and a buddy got stuck after a canceled flight.. day 1 of the next few days....

Ordered Garlic Knots.. had to try the Philly Cheese Steaks, Large Pizza.. Ice Cream and 2 liter bottles of soda.

Yes, we have a kitchen and aren't going to eat all of this in one sitting, but for the purposes of this review and me just being me.. over the top.

We used lots of special instructions breaking up multiple quantity parts of the order.  All completed perfectly

Delivered on time... Everything Hot! Ice Cream.. still Ice Cream and the food.. well one of the best Cheese Steaks I've ever had.. bizarre.  The Pie came perfect with Anchovies on the side (how many time has delivery forgotten something) and extra containers of sauce for dipping. 

Crappy day full of disappointments, but this part is not one of them!!!

We found this place by accident and thought we give it a try.  Went inside and placed our order and waited.  We were a bit nervous about our pizza with the way the place looked.  The decor was pitiful.  I would not eat there. Glad we were taking it to go. 
We ordered a cheese pizza and got home within a half hour.  It was still hot and the pizza was great. I loved the flavor!! I actually would go back to pick up.

Our salads where brown, and the dressing was super watery. The garlic knots where hard and unflavored. Flavor of the calzones were 
.....ok. service was slow. The only enjoyably thing we ordered was the cinnamon knots. Honestly will probably never eat here again.

Today was my first time here. We thought of calling in an order but we decided to go in and see what we wanted. We went in with the intention of getting pizza but decided to get calzones and we loved them!! The crust was perfect, it was the right thickness with enough stuff inside. They also put a little olive oil, Parmesan, and herbs on the top which gave the crust a nice flavor. I am stuffed after eating half of my calzone. 

We also ordered the jalapeño cheesy bread and it was on point. The jalapeños were fresh and gave the bread a nice bite. I can't wait to go back and try more things on the menu. 

There were a few people ahead of us and some orders that came in over the phone but We got take out and it took about 15 minutes to get our food once we ordered. I recommend getting take out from here, while they have the space to accommodate a good number of people they don't have much seating. They also have ice cream but I didn't try it.
Tried to order delivery, from the comfort inn on Peoria street. We love eating local food when traveling. It's 3 miles away, was told they don't deliver to this area. Bummer

I went here because of the $9 anyway pizza check-in coupon.  I was told my order would be about 10 minutes, but it was more like 20-25 minutes.  It was okay, I wasn't in a hurry.  The pizza was a bit doughy but the toppings were very fresh and flavorful.  It was a nice change from the big pizza chains I'm used to.  The jalapeño cheese bread was amazing.

Decent pizza. If you like thick, chewy crust and lots of it, this is your place. No, really - there is a lot of crust. We ordered carry out late on a Thursday night, and it was done very quickly. The toppings were good. The cheese sticks are amazing. There could have been more cheese and the sauce could have been spread closer to the edge (hence my emphasis on there being a lot of crust). I'd recommend ordering extra dipping sauce for the crust. We'd eat here again.
Decent pizza for something quick. Crust reminds me of a local variety store pizza but with better toppings.

After reading all the hype (likely paid) reviews, and the fact that MO's is a few blocks away from the house, the wife and I had to order!

Sadly we were let down. 
The crust is dry & hard as a rock, to the point that you might chip a tooth. 

Although the toppings are $1.25 each (I got 2 toppings) you still receive a cheese pizza i.e. no toppings. 

Lastly,
This is the FIRST time in my life that I have EVER gotten food poisoning from pizza.

This leads me to believe that their food handling procedures do not comply with state and federal regulations and cross contamination as well as raw or undercooked meat is common at this establishment.
Horrible service. A few blocks away and took over an hour for pizza to arrive on a Tuesday. I called 3 times, put on hold, and they never came back. If you are hungry- don't order here.

Don't believe the hype!!! Short girl that waited on me when we went to go pick up the pizza had the WORST attitude. Very unfriendly and gave me a hard time about the check in special! Wow! 
So HUGE fail on service.
The pizza was an utter disappointment. Never saw white pizza crust before. Soooo undercooked. Very little meat. Sauce was bland but at the same time too sweet. 
I wouldn't step back in there if it was free, just based on Ms. cashier's funky attitude. Maybe she's related to the owner. I don't know. 
But the food wasn't good. It really wasn't.
Double fail. Avoid at all costs.

I really love this pizza shop. 
Their garlic knots are to DIE for oh my god. They are so delicious! The pizza I order has always been cooked perfectly and tastes delicious every time. 
The staff has been very friendly the times I've been in to the shop (I usually order delivery) 

The only reason it has 4 stars is its not my absolute favorite pizza place. Mainly because of the crust. I'm a super picky crust person.. But other than that, this place is pretty darn good
Called in an order for pickup, great pizza, friendly service. I would definitely order from here again.  The dining in area was not very inviting.

Ive been a long time customer of Mama's - we order one of the gigantor pizza's at lest once a month from them - always been happy (and full) each time. Would (and have) recommended to several local friends

This is the kind of pizza that I crave when I've had too much to drink. Nothing fancy, no unwieldy toppings falling off when you go to take a huge bite. Addictive, slightly-sweet sauce that makes you keep wanting to eat until you've finished the whole thing (which we did). Cheese thickly laid on and faintly squeaky but in a wonderful way. Prices are great. Delivery time was what they predicted (45-60 min on a Thursday evening). Yum. This is the kind of place you think of when you say "let's just order pizza." You know what I mean? And you'll be happy.

I wish I had the option to give a negative. I purchased a deal and was told that even though it doesn't say anywhere in the terms they will not honor my coupon for delivery unless I spend over $40. Horrible!!!

Well unfortunately this place is not what it is cracked up to be from the reviews. I would say average. Thick crust that wasn't cooked all the way and a bit unflavored. The pizza rolls were good though. 

A little disappointed, I was looking for new york style.

[Side note: I just looked photos of pizzas from a month up to a day ago. THOSE look NOTHING like what I got!! Maybe they slap dash for mobile orders??? Or maybe they recognize my order or name and are getting too comfy?]


I am sad to write this, but I can't let my old review stand. 

I don't know what happened. Maybe the Yelp and Eat24 deals caused their margins to shrink, but this is not the pizza I fell in love with. I've ordered consistently for years and tasted the pizza change slowly. After TWO disappointing pizzas in a row, I am compelled to do a new review. 

It's veggies and meat with a bit of sauce on an okay crust. If I wanted that, I would order from Papa John's (::shudder::). The extra cheese I always order was heavy on some parts and almost non-existent on others. The veggies were fresh and crisp. They weren't cheap with the meat, either. It just didn't taste like a good pizza should taste. 

Just to be sure I wasn't wrong, I compared this last pizza to a slice of leftover pizza. This old slice was from a new place from which I ordered the night before. Exact same ingredients. Mama O's LOST...big time. From appearance to the taste/texture of the crust alone. No more orders from me.

Step 1: Order the pizza rolls. These may not pop out at you while skimming the menu but please do yourself this favor!

Step 2: Order whatever else you are in the mood for. Pizzas are consistent and with the coupons the pizza is great value!

Step 3: Tip the delivery driver (I have always had quick and friendly service)

Step 4: Happy times!!
Pizza rolls were great!  Chorizo as a pizza topping!?  Excellent!  It really brought out the flavor too.  I really enjoyed the pizza here.  Highly recommended.
Pretty decent pizza. Quick service only had take out but if I'm In the area again. I shall indulge more. Chicken wings were delicious

One of the best Italian places I've had the privilege to dine. The sauce is amazing their jalapeno bread is the bomb garlic knots are great pizza is YUM. I am a very picky eater and I would have to say if you are craving some real Italian food don't miss out!

Two big different delicious speciality calzone to go. Me and my wife enjoyed both some what dried calzones. 

The size and price are competitive and worth every cent. Normally these go around $10, ma ma has them for $7 for the premium calzone. They are $6 normally with 3 toppings. 

If I am in the area I won't hesitate to buy again with or without a coupon deal. The calzones are just not the best but they sure beat the price and generous portion.

We came on a slow Tuesday night and judging by the location we weren't expecting anything great.  We got a large pepperoni, sausage, mushroom and tomato pizza and it was really good!  The cheese was so awesome.  We also got the jalapeño cheese bread and that was really good to.  Big chunks of jalapeño looked intimitating but had just enough heat without starting your head on fire.  We will be back!

One of our best friends just moved to Colorado for school, and this was the first year we couldn't celebrate her birthday together. 

First, we were thinking we would send her some flowers. But nah, flowers are for the basics. We wanted to make our girl feel super-san special on her birthday, so that's when we decided pizza would be the gift that would make her heart sing (with palpitations induced by cholesterol and high blood pressure). Pizza will never leave you. Pizza is eternal.

So we ordered pizza, breadsticks, and a pint of vanilla ice cream online and made a note for them to spell out '26' (she says she's forever 21) with the extra pepperoni we added to 'za. 

Before they delivered the pie to her apt, the delivery man gave me a call to double check her location. I kindly asked (forcibly demanded) him to wish her a 'happy birthday' and he made my heart melt when he replied with, "Of course!"

It gets better. When she received her order and sent us a picture--after, of course, properly blasting it on all the major social media networks--we were happily surprised: they added the extra pepperoni, but made the number '26' out of breadsticks!!! And wrote 'Happy Birthday' on the inside of the box!!! And gave her extra sauce!!!! 

THANK YOU Ma Ma Olivia for making us look like the most awesome friends ever and for making her feel special on her big day. You guys went above and beyond the call of duty and made so many people happy!

Friday Evening of October 18th 2013.  Both Hubs and I went to this establishment.  You go to the counter, made your order.  Seat yourself and wait.

We decide to dine in.

Hubs order was LARGE 14" with 4 toppings of Black Olives, Jalapenos, Green Peppers and Steak.  The LARGE 14" was $10.  Each LARGE Toppings cost were $1, and with all the 4 toppings, it was like $14.

My order was the MEDIUM 12" with 3 toppings of Steak, Jalapenos and Pineapple.  The MEDIUM 12" was $8 with all the 3 toppings, each cost were $0.75 hence, my Main Entrée Pizza was $2.25 + $8 = $10.25

Hubs also ordered the Mini Calzones which was $2.99.

I also ordered the Spicy BBQ Chicken Wings - 6 Wings were $5.

If I am NOT mistaken there are other flavors that comes with the Chicken Wings on the Main Menu Board, but NOT on the Paper Menu, that we read.

Hubs liked his order of Pizza and Calzone.  Hubs had half of his order at this establishment, while he opt to have the Calzone at home.  For me, I opt to have like 2 slices of my Pizza order, and like 2 pieces of the Chicken Wings order dining in.  The rest I take my time to eat them.

I like my order of Chicken Wings with Spicy BBQ Sauce and my order of Pizza.  The pizza that we ordered were the thin ones.  Just the kind I like my Pizza, THIN CRUST.  All the ingredients were fresh.

Its $33 well spent indeed.
 
In this establishment, you can have your Pizza or food order, dine in, TO GO or for delivery.  In the establishment alone, they can seat like about 10 people at one seating.  All in all, 4 SOLID STARS and we Definitely Do not mind returning when needed.

@219/2013
We ordered various sandwiches and all the bread was burned and rock hard. Dissatisfied and still hungry!

I am impressed!!  Came home from work and was craving pizza and I found me a new pizza joint!!  The driver showed up 10 minutes early not to mention having to walk up four flights of stairs.  The pizza was fresh and very delicious, thank you for making my Friday night.

I wish I could review  this place, but unfortunately, my pizza, wings, and garlic bread never showed up.  I was told that I could expect it in 75 min.  I don't mind waiting for a good product, but again, I couldn't tell you.  The guy I placed my order with repeated it, and asked me cash or credit.  Because he struggled with hearing me through the process, I opted for cash at delivery (I didn't want to have him and I both repeating my credit card number).  85 min. later, I called to find out about my order and they don't have it.  Can't find it.  I'm not sure what kind of ordering system they use, but they asked what my total was to track it (most ask for a phone number, name, or address)?  How can they locate my order based on the total?  That's rediculous.  Anyway, If you get your pizza, can you tell me how it was?  I'll never know!

The food here is delicious and they always get our order the right. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is nice and will show you your order to make sure things are correct. The location is a little odd because of the locals that are around but nothing that door locks cant fix :)

Made my order through yelp (first time doing so). The pizza arrived less than 30 minutes after I placed my order.

Pizza is some of the best I've had in a while. The cheese and sauce are great. I had the cheese pizza and philly cheese pizza.
Our go to pizza place. It's in a sketchy lil strip mall but it's worth it every time. We love it.

This is our first try of Ma Ma Olivia's. The pizza was delivered hot and quickly. It was really, really good! My only complaint is that the toppings are almost non-existent. It also cost more than I added up based on the prices on line. But, the 5 stars are are for taste and speed of delivery. The pizza really is very delicious and the crust is great!

Food was good (fettuccini and calzones), prices were very reasonable, ice cream available too! Manager was patient when we didn't know what to order! Garlic knots were "ehh" your typical mom/pop shopping center atmosphere.

OK update on this place. IT IS AMAZING! My girlfriend and I have firmly established this place as our go to pizza place. The pizzas are really a great value for their size and the volume of toppings they put on each one. We've ordered every size of pizza and a wide range of toppings, and have never been disappointed. My personal go to is a medium pizza with pepperoni and my girlfriend does the personal pizza with chicken and olives; we've never had a bad slice, each is always covered in toppings, smothered in cheese and cooked perfectly on a great dough (which makes an amazing crust). The delivery is always quick (besides one weird experience) and the phone service is always pleasant which is always nice. Overall, this place is amazing and if you need a slice of pizza in Aurora this is your place.
Spicy BBQ wings were really good... philly cheesesteak was surprisingly super good as well. Fast service... good deal (Especially with the yelp coupon)

Mama Olivias was a pure delight! A huge cheesy piece of pizza and some crisp fresh hot wings were a joy to munch on after I bought my $5 for $10 deal! Not only that but they are right down the street and have great customer service! I will definitely be back :))

Horrific experience. Horrible pizza. Came 2 hours after we ordered it, cold as if it just sat in a car for two hours, which it did. Then, the staff had the audacity to be rude about it. No apology, no willingness to adjust the cost. Avoid this place at all cost.
Good was great! Delivery was about an hour when estimated 45-50 min. But they were friendly
One or two times it's been inconsistent but if you go pick it up you'll get it right each time.
My go to for pizza delivery in my area! Yummy pizza and great customer service! They have good cinnamon twist thingys too!
Delivery was super fast and the Calzone was great.

Om nom nom nom...nom nom nom!  Ma Ma Olivia's is baking some good pizza pie!

Tucked away near Hobby Lobby, you'll find the unassuming storefront of Ma Ma Olivia's.  I had a tough time locating it in the maze of parking lots over here, so look for Hobby Lobby and go toward the north side of the same building.  Boom!

Teeny tiny little place, but packing a big punch.  I tried a Hawaiian calzone (for the tough price of just under $7 or so, my whole bill came to just under $8 with a small soda) and was totally in love.  The crust is fabulous:  baked perfectly and seasoned well.  They could probably just give me crust and I'd be happy with it.  But oh, the cheese plus the ham and pineapple was super tasty.  The calzone was big but I managed to eat the whole thing because it was that good.  Pizzas, pasta, salads, wings, and the like, everyone at my table enjoyed the gamut of food to be found here.  Not to mention single slices as big as your head.

How long has Ma Ma Olivia's been open?  Because man, I seriously should have got the memo ages ago.

Dah-umm. Did you see that? Look, look at the slice that guy got! That slice is as big as a whole small pie! Jumbo slice = $4 and it's huge! I had a regular slice with sausage and jalapenos and a salad and it was less than $5? Did you add that right? Alrighty then, no keep it that's fine. The regular slice is big too and was plenty for lunch for me. If you like to go all man vs food with pizza, by all means order two jumbos.  : )
I saw the lines over here when I was eating at the Pho 888 that's in the same parking lot and knew I wanted to check them out. There was a lot of pizza talk on the talk threads a bit ago and that triggered my pizza tunnel vision/target fixation. I'm so glad the Eastsiders lunch crew decided on this spot. I'll definitely be back.

Whenever we think of getting pizza, there's no question where we're getting it from. It's too bad a few rough reviews have made their way in here because we've had nothing but great experiences the last two times we've been to Ma Ma Olivia's. 

I really try to save some for lunch the next day, but both times the pizza has failed to make it past midnight. If it's not eaten at dinner, I usually sleepwalk to the fridge and finish it in the middle of the night. Our first time there, we took a reviewer's suggestion and ordered the garlic knots. You probably should do the same yourself. 

We build our own "super-pizza", veggie pizza with pineapple.
I have come full circle on this place. Where it lacked in anything special, has become out goto when ordering out in the office. It is some of the better pizza I've had lately. Keep it up.
So good. Great delivery.

This is our go-to pizza place. Even on the busiest of days, they are very nice and fast to prepare and deliver. We love the calzones and the additional options to add/ personalize your food. So good to have found our takeout pizza place

I work at a pizza place close to mama olivias and still eat here. These guys know how to do it. Decent food and great prices. I really like their pizza rolls. The delivery is pretty quick or if you go in for a pickup the staff is pretty nice. They got me in and out on my last order, I spent 26 bucks, fed 3 starving adults and I still have some leftovers. Also, the breadsticks that come with the pasta are a nice touch. Wish they stayed open later
The owner here has pizza in his blood and it shows.  Great service, great food.  If your looking for pizza or other Italian, check them out.  Stromboli is the best I've had.

I ordered in the past and forgot how good their meals were because they stopped delivering to first creek homes. Recently moved to Traditions and they are the only ones who deliver out here. Delivery was late but worth the wait. Pizza tastes great!
It good pizza for a real great price. Medium 3 topping, boneless wings, and a tip all for under $30. It was worth it for sure!

They DO serve pizza and wings- and it IS edible.  However- If you are a traveler just passing through and are not familiar with the area PLEASE AVOID THIS PLACE FOR YOUR SAFETY AND THE SAFETY OF YOUR CHILDREN.  It is in a very dangerous shopping plaza right next to a night club that has armed security with bullet proof vests.  Drunks came out of the club staring at my wife and daughter in a very uncomfortable way.  We did not realize until the order had been placed...

3.5 stars but I rounded down only cause I'm still bitter about the taxed ranch that I never got. Ordered a deluxe jumbo pizza and garlic Parmesan wings and the pizza was huge! Bigger than the size of my head, and it was enough to feed two people. One thing I didn't like about it was when the pizza got cold, it was kind of hard to finish the pizza since the crust got so hard. The wings were meh, nothing to compliment about. I would pass on the wings. Prices were reasonable.

They delivered to our terminal so I'll probably order from them again. The stromboli I ordered was good. There marinara sauce was just tomato sauce though and the garlic knots, which so many said I must get, were nice and buttery but could have used more garlic. The delivery guy and the order taker were friendly.
Comes up in Yelp's delivery search to Holiday Inn on Quebec but they don't deliver to here. Shame on Yelp.

This is my absolute favorite kind of pizza. Thick curst, sweet sauce, nice and cheesy. It's hard to find cheap, good pizza like this anymore. Also, yes, the garlic knots are amazing...gotta eat them fresh! I have only done pick-up, which seems like the right idea, and the service then was great. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for some good old classic 'zza.
I really really enjoyed the pizza here today generous toppings good. great sauce. people were very very friendly and very very nice I will have it delivered next time.

The absolutely worst pizza I've ever had. The cheese was all burnt. Tasteless and doughy. If 7-11 were to have pizza cooking all day next to the hot dog rollers it would probably taste like this. Even my young nephews who love pizza couldnt eat it. Unfortunately I figured over 50 decent reviews of this place would be indicative of a good pie. Major Yuk!
Quick, perfect amount of grease (pizza needs grease), crust is amazing, and if you get jumbo size. I promise you, it's a jumbo size. Definitely seems like a whole in the wall but so good!

It's not that hard to follow any sort of customization requests, especially when it's pointed out that you are allergic to a certain ingredient. Then when they blatantly ignore your request while playing nice to your face about taking care of you is so frustrating. I paid for items I cannot eat now. Thanks for absolutely nothing. Zero stars needs to be a thing.

The quality and flavor is usually good when it finally arrives but we are still waiting on our foods this time. $35+ order an hour and a half ago. We called at the hour mark (we were told it would be here in 45 min) and we are still waiting an hour and a half later. It's not worth the wait.
Poop. The cheese pizza tastes like ass and I was high too so that's saying something.

Have ordered from here several times since my 1st ordering and the food is on point every time. I don't even bother getting pizza from any other source. 

Mama Olivia's...please keep doing what you are doing. Because you are definitely doing it right.

Best pizza in a long time!!! And I've been traveling the world the last year. Honestly, the garlic knots weren't garlicky. Yeah, they were good, but nothing tasted like garlic. The pizza, however, was outstanding. So grateful for these reviews. I picked right!!

Who in their right minds believes Mama Olivia's is good? I decided to give this place a try after reading the reviews online and left nothing but disappointed. 

We dined in on a Saturday afternoon and the service was lackluster. The guy behind the counter was uninspired and looked less than thrilled to be working. The delivery drivers take up three tables in the dining room talking shop about their deliveries. Everyone here from employees to customers just looked sketch. 

The pizza was very bland and reminded me of Pizza Hut buffet pizza. The taco pizza we ordered was also very far from being tremendous. It was sausage pizza with salsa mixed in with onion and green peppers. What?!

I ordered boneless wings and one wing came half-raw and I had to spit it out in the napkin at my table. 

If you think this place looks promising I advise you to look elsewhere. I wouldn't return here if the meal was free.
The pizza from this place surprised me. The dough was flavorful and the toppings were generous. Will be a regular here.

I like their food a lot through grubhub. I found them one day while looking for delivery since I was too lazy to cook dinner. :) I ordered a calzone and it was pretty good. So I decided to try them again. Still great. Then one day I decided to go in person since I was nearby. Well let me tell you, don't go in person. I haven't ordered since. First off it's in a kinda off area. You go inside and it's brightly lit the employees are friendly. Some of the customers there made me uncomfortable (due to their loudness and what not). Not their fault I get it. But here's the part that sucked so I ordered and sat down. Well the whole dinning area stunk. It smelled like someone just dumped cleaning products out all over the place. Cool you're clean but the smell of chemicals was intoxicating. Then my salad was old. I mean mushy not just a few pieces here and there. So I was baffled since they always give me a great salad. My calzone was delicious as usual. I just don't order from them anymore because I can't stop thinking about the bad salad and the chemical smells. I know kind of silly but it just left that kind of impression. Maybe in a few months will order through grubhub but definitely not dinning in there again.

After the reviews I was expecting a good meal. BZZZZ wrong. 
First of all the marinara had no salt. None. I can cook tinned tomatoes myself. I ordered pizza rolls with pepperoni, calzone (chicken, spinach, red peppers), & cheesecake. 
The cheesecake did not mention flavors at all, it came smashed and with a red swirl on top. Basically Sam's Club cheesecake, ick. The pizza rolls shouldn't be called pizza if you have to pay for one topping, however, they were OK. Now for the biggest disappointment of the night, the calzone. Calzone is supposed to have ricotta and mozzarella otherwise it'd be stromboli. Not a sign of ricotta anywhere. The filling was packed in one log and had a flat crust 3" around. The crust was seasoned well, but that marinara ick. 
Basically everything I got was food service products made elsewhere and thrown together in dough they may or may not have made. 
Hugely disappointing. Not re-ordering and I do not recommend if you've ever had American Italian outside of Denver (it's not our strong point). Even Sabarro seasons their sauce. If there is a Mama O, she either lost her sense of smell or is horrified. 2 stars because I didn't get sick, just bummed that I was duped by reviews by mistaken people.

Mama Olivia's is the only delivery available where we live. It's always good! Tonight a mistake was made on our pizzas and he owner made it right.  Great locally owned business that values their customers!

Five stars based on cost, consistency, and just good ole greasy pizza.  

When I go on a food binge I crave for pizza.

I come here and get a large pie for $9 and finish it in 2 days by myself.

Crust is medium thick, cheese and toppings are fresh and plentiful. There are always yelp deals lurking around.

Tip: if you think the pizza is too greasy, dab it with napkins first to reduce some of the guilt and self-hate. Bill Nye the Science Guy says this actually does help to reduce some of the fat intake :D 

Only thing is I had the cinnamon sticks and they were not as fluffy and delicious as I expected.

The prices are reasonable, delivery was quick, the delivery guy was nice, and the pizza was decent enough. But none of that really counts for anything when you and all of your friends are reenacting the diarrhea scene from Bridesmaids. IT'S COMIN OUT OF ME LIKE LAVA!! DON'T LOOK AT ME!!!
Best pizza we have had in Denver.  Crust is fresh and crispy. Sauce is fresh and very flavorful. We will be back. We would have never found this place without yelp. Will be back
Really good pizza.  We had a custom order of pepperoni, chicken, and jalapeños and it was done in only 15 minutes.  The wings are okay but nothing special.  Overall, it's a great local pizza joint

I love their pizza!!! Is great, i order delivery and is always great i know they can get a bit busy  specially around the snowing season but everything is all right because i love eating their pizza....my favorites are the cheese crust pizzas they are soooo darn goooood!!  Love the service keep it up you guys...
Large meaty pizza for 12.50 and I used a Yelp 5 for 10 deal so paid 8 bucks. Pizza tasted great and was made quickly. Not much to complain about here!

Just visiting town and used Yelp to find a Pizza close by that could be delivered. 

Ma Ma Olivia's popped up only a mile away. They were very helpful over the phone and answered all our questions. We didn't have to wait to long for the extra large loaded pizza and wings. The hand tossed crust was dense and chewy, but had good flavor. One of the problems with big pizzas is the crust in the center doesn't support the pizza - that wasn't a problem at all. Overall the pizza was  good. The wings were excellent. We ordered medium buffalo and they were very good with surprising tasty heat.

If we were here longer, we would probably order again.
NOT TRUCKER FRIENDLY - refused to deliver to the Flying J truck stop, truckers need to eat to and by law can't drive after the 14 hr shift.

We are visiting Denver tonight for mother's day and ordered calzones for delivery, I have to tell you they were amazing! Each one of us got personalized order and it was perfection. The delivery was fast, and food was super hot when it came and the best part my soda was even ice cold in the bottle! The food was so good I would drive to Denver just to eat here! Thank you Ma Ma Olivia's for making our night complete!

So we are here in Denver, in the middle of nowhere.  My husband has the car for work and we're staying in a hotel that doesn't have a restaurant.  Fortunately I saw on Yelp that there's this diner close by (within walking distance of the Hampton Inn), so we decided to check it out.  

Nice diner, kinda feels like a Mel's.  We got a chocolate malt (sooooo good, but went down way too easily), husband got pork chops and I got the cobb salad.

The pork chops were pretty bland, so we had to ask for a side of country gravy, which helped a little (apparently the country gravy isn't very salty either, which I guess can be good, right?).  The brown gravy on his mashed potatoes was more flavorful.  

My cobb salad was pretty impressive looking!  The chicken and the bacon were a little dry though.  

Tables next to us ordered country fried steak, pizza, and breakfast scrambles and all those looked amazing!  Huge portions and they all looked pretty appetizing.  We would definitely come back again.

Since my previous review I have stopped by this place a few times - each time not as great as the first, but my last experience here is enough to make me stop coming back. I now understand the other reviews that mentioned terrible service - this waitress was easily the worst service I've had at a restaurant in awhile. She was slow to take our order and then we waited insanely long for our food to come out. The appetizer we ordered was delivered cold and about 5 minutes before our main food would come out. Our waitress simply said, "I didn't know if you wanted it beforehand." The food was also the worst we've experienced here. It was clear it had been seating for a bit. And then as if our server hadn't made us wait enough already, when she dropped off the check - we put our payment out promptly as she was nowhere to be found for a good 15 minutes. That combined with what happened earlier, we got fed up. 

I would like to say this was just a bad night, but if this was my first time here - I would never come back. And now I don't think I'll be back for awhile.

What a great "find" in Denver!  This place was near our hotel. Upon walking in, I was taken back to the fifties will all the retro style decor and memorabilia.  It was clean, organized and had a pleasant atmosphere.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  

I ordered their Meatloaf dish, (real) mashed potatoes and veggie medley. It came with a side spring mix salad.  Their ranch dressing is homemade and wonderful! !!!  

My husband ordered chicken parmesan sandwich , with beer battered onion rings. He said it was scrumptious!  I sampled the onion rings myself. Oh so GOOD they were.

Our waitress was great! 

My place for future meals when back in Denver for certain!!!!

First....GREAT FOOD!  The menu is unique, diner style for sure, pancakes are the best I've ever tasted, light fluffy and perfect!  They serve food all day, catering to the hotel community and this place is on the way to DIA. One of my favorite breakfast dishes is the corn muffin pancakes, smothered with yummy green chili, two eggs and hash browns....so unique and yummy!  The omelets are amazing too!  Don't pass by....give this place a try!

Now for why I am giving 4 stars and not 5....customer service and rude wait staff!  Takes some time to get coffee and water to the table and there are a couple of waitresses that need to be fired... For example the waitress was in the middle of taking my order, but was having an argument with another waitress, to continue the fight in mid order, she left our table and continued the fight in the kitchen (everyone could hear), it took quite awhile to get our order taken after that, I almost left, but I was hungry and figured I would YELP the concern.

Theres no doubt about it, this looks and feels like an authentic diner.

I don't usually have high gastronomic hopes when chowing down at places like this, but they serve their purpose.

Service was quick, but the waitress, while nice enough, forgot a few items like drinks. No big deal.

I had the big burrito, while it was big, it was just average in taste.

My friend had the Banana Bread French Toast, which he loves.

They have a full bar which is nice.

This is also a good place to take the kids, they have ice cream and all the stuff the little ones would enjoy.

Moonlight Diner brings back that retro feel and look. Come here for that.

It sits in between two hotels. On the way to dropping someone off at the airport we stopped for breakfast. 

When I see this description: hand made corn beef I will zero in on that and forget everything else. This came with my over easy eggs, a toast and two pancakes. The hash was covered in this red sauce. It doesn't look anything like home made. It doesn't taste anything special too. 

So- retro cool decor check, below average service from other staff check . One actually had an amazing customer service. He's he guy that brought our meal to the table. The guy that took our order was also awesome. The rest was just walking by aimlessly and ignored the big dishes clogging our table making it impossible to eat without knocking something with our elbows. 

Now we know why they have less than four stars. The staff makes or breaks a business. Enough said.

Located a stone's throw from a myriad of airport hotels, this throw-back diner gives you the All-American diner experience. It's perfectly attributed furniture, floors and 50's wall-hangings suggest a less complicated time in American life. The servers are big-smiled and friendly. The food is exactly what you want: fluffy pancakes, tender steaks, fat burgers, delicious home fries and everything in-between. If you've got some time to kill before picking up that high-school friend at the airport, the you're not really looking forward to seeing, stop at The Moonlight Diner and fill your belly with some yummy goodness. It just might carry through the day. It's great for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

We come here at least every other weekend for breakfast. It's become a tradition in our house. 

The great: 
- the breakfast portions are huge. 
- the meals are always consistent; never had a bad choice. 
- the time from order to table is fast
- on the way to the airport for those that need a nice meal
- the wait staff Patriciest, Earl, Jordan, Paul and Jen seem to be extremely attentive and always check up on us. 
- they have a full bar and happy hours 

The good:
- even when it's busy, I've never had a long wait 
- coffee is tasty
- atmosphere is cliché but cute. They just redid all the booths and chairs. 

The 'would improve':
- the temperatures in the dining area can vary a bit. 
- the bathrooms, while never 'dirty', are really showing some age. 

Overall, it's a great place.
Stopped on way to airport. Service was fast, food was good and atmosphere is 60's diner.

Stopped by without looking at reviews. We wanted to grab a bite for dinner while staying near DIA.  The staff is great, super friendly and welcoming.  The restaurant is very clean and wasnt too busy.  We were seated right away.  I thought automatically I would order breakfast.  Being from out of town, I want to try something different. I ordered the Kitchen Sink.....OMG!  Best tasting green Chile ever!  I had tasted my husband's cup of green Chile and immediately wanted to cancel my order to just get a LARGE bowl of this green chili.  Glad I didnt. The combo of the Kitchen Sink was spot on! Too much for one sitting!!!!  Will stop by anytime thru Denver!
Very good food; enjoyed the green chili... Waiter wasn't very good at taking trash and filling up creamer bowl. He also forgot my water, but he was nice.

Nope. 
Just say no.

The place looked dirty, the service was awful and the food was nothing special. Yes, the place looks like an old school diner but it also looks really random and dirty. Our server was so rude to us. Yes, she was working by herself but it really wasn't that busy. She was very polite to the man sitting behind us but to A and I she just seemed impatient. The only good thing about this place is that it's close to the airport.

Stopped by for breakfast on a Sunday Morning. Service was good, food was good, price was good. I had the banana nut pancakes with sausage and my husband had the waffle with bacon. Price for two was under $20! I gave them 3 stars because they were just ...good! Nothing too exciting but then again you can't go wrong with pancakes and waffles!

I was in Denver as part of a flight layover. My boyfriend and I decided to explore outside the airport and found this near by diner. The retro look of this place was great. Just due to looks I was excited to try it out. We got inside and were seated very quickly even though they seemed to be a bit busy.

Our waitress took a while to stop by our table. However, that wasn't too bad because it have us time to look through the full menu. I an order of pork chops and eggs with toast and hash browns. The food all together was very under seasoned. As a person who dislikes to add salt to their food I found myself piling it on. The potatoes didn't even have their natural potato taste when I got them! In the other hand, I loved the sourdough toast. Also the locals seemed to love it. Maybe it's because where I am from we do things a bit different. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would got back every couple of months if I lived in Denver.

Initially walked over here because it was the closest ice cream establishment to my hotel and I wound up ordering dinner because it smelled so great! This place is the epitome of comfort food and they have a huge menu with pretty much any diner food you could want (breakfast all day, ya'll). 

After a long day in the car I went with a grilled cheese and onion rings - greasy and delicious, exactly what I wanted. I also shared a banana split with my partner which was a great decision. They carry about 6 flavors of Dreyer's Ice Cream :)

You can keep a knock in' but ya can't come in!  Cool '50s motif on the outside. Cold on the inside. We sat at the counter where service is usual better not the case here. Our server had the personality of a mean substitute teacher from elementary school. The front door would stick and we got hammered with the cold from the outside. I had to ask for coffee refills.  When we first got there I said good morning twice to our server. I got no response for her except brief eye contact. Pancakes were decent. My Son liked the Classic Breakfast with pancakes, eggs, and bacon.  Their claim to fame was best chicken fried steak in 1999. I was afraid to try it as my gut told me the gravy was probably not made from scratch.

Good choice for a meal near the airport
We had to stay the night at the Denver airport hotel and was looking for something simple to eat.  We decided to avoid the chains and go to Moonlight Diner.  The menu is somewhat limited and not nearly as extensive as a "Greek Diner".  The food was pretty good and the service was also very good.  I had the pork chops that was large in quantity and delicious in taste.  The service was attentive and efficient.  My wife had Chef's Salad and that was OK.  The soup was very good.  The dinner hits the spot.

Saw a few reviews that stated the service was slow.  We did not experience that at all tonight.  Food was excellent.  I had the meat eaters omelette with pancakes, my wife had the French toast, and my granddaughter had the mac and cheese.  All the food was excellent.  The staff was nice and the place was clean.  Will be back for sure

I am stuck out here in hotel no man land outside Denver airport. The front desk staff here at courtyard by Marriott told me about this diner. A nice walk down the road and found a great bfast waiting for me. Jourden was a great server and while it was busy my service and food were served promptly, hot and delicious. Had the pork chop and eggs, thought it was hash browns OR pancakes but it was a heap of food in the end--chop, 3 eggs, 2 pancakes and hash browns. All for $9.49 which I think is a great value. Good coffee and free refills. I had a few leftovers for later so I don't have to eat horrible airplane food!
The manager and all staff I encountered were very helpful and welcoming. 
Thank you!

Decent meal. I ordered the "popular" chicken fried steak. It came with potatoes, greens, and a muffin? Not really sure why the muffin was included, but it was actually very good.

The meal was pretty good, definitely too heavy for my liking. Wasn't the best chicken fried steak I have had, but wasn't the worst. Average meal

The food tasted great, but it takes a long time (24 minutes) to get food.  Also, a little disappointed that the kids menu we were given said all kids meals were $1.99, but the final check showed $4.50 for each of the 3.  With the small portions we thought the 1.99 was fair, but not for double the price.  We asked the server and she just said that was the weekend menu they gave us and they were more today.  Okay.  The food tasted good so 4 stars instead of 3 though.
Good solid diner! Great atmosphere, wide variety of food options, good size portions... I recommend the Green Chili! You can't go wrong here!

Not the place to visit when you're in a hurry. Servers are nice but not enough of them to handle the diners. After finishing my meal, I waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if I needed anything else or wanted the check.

The food is okay.

The diner looks great, strait out of the past. Their is no theme or 50's uniforms, just strait up classic American. The food is decent but nothing special. I had the mountain man breakfast which included a little of everything. Yet the sausage links seemed to be the type that were already cooked and frozen. Pancakes seemed to be made in house as were the eggs. 
     This place is a great alternative to overpriced crappy airport food. The service was spot on and the staff were very friendly. I will definetly go back but I certainly won't be expecting 5 star food. You simply must visit if you are in a surrounding hotel but you shouldn't be driving more than 20 minutes to visit it.

A decent greasy spoon diner near the airport.  The food is average and the service about the same.  Convenient when picking up folks flying into Denver who are hungry upon arrival and unwilling to wait for the 30-45 minute drive into Denver. The retro design has a kitschy appeal and the the menu has a decent selection of choices and should offer something for everyone.

When it comes to diners I'm pretty picky, this place was super dirty, dead flies all over and swatting flies was most of my breakfast, food was OK, bacon burnt and priced a little high. The staff was not that friendly and they didn't bring my drinks? I won't be back unfortunately.

The food was good and our waitress was quite good.  She really impressed the table by not using a pad, and getting the entire order correct.  I had a club sandwich it was very good, although i think it was kind of pricey for the area near the airport it isn't unreasonable and a whole lot better than anything i have had on the concourse.  I would come back here again should i be in this area and finding myself hungry

Been here twice in the past four days. Food was very tasty and service was great. The reason for the 4 star not 5 was due to the fact that the Liver and Onions was somewhat dry and needed a gravy or sauce. However the second night the Artichoke Omelet was fantastic!  The servers there were more then accommodating both times I was in. I'm in Denver quite often and the Moonlight Diner gives me that warm homey feeling. I will definitely be back....

Average diner with a close proximity to Denver International Airport.  Plenty of parking. The interior needs maintenance with sticky tables that cry out for sanding, stain and a clear coat. Booths have duct tape sealing up the holes. Nice decorations for Halloween. 

We decided to stop for breakfast before our flight. Decide on your order quick as food takes a while.  Probably because the short order cook needs extra time to overcook the food.

My grilled cheese was great but the accompanying hashbrowns that were ordered crispy arrived black. The replacements weren't any better as they were very dry and had no flavor.

The scrambled eggs were poor and more like ribbon pieces;  my brother wouldn't eat them after the first taste. Sausage was good and the over easy eggs were good. Pancakes were okay but a little on they dry side. They were also out of orange juice. 

Rita, our server, was excellent.

There aren't too many choices for breakfast in the area but we won't be back.

Totally baffled by the good reviews. We were seated and had our orders taken within 10 mins. Then proceeded to wait 50 mins. for our food to arrive. We watched as people who sat down 20 mins after us got their food before us. I ordered the banana bread french toast, which was soggy. The hash browns weren't cooked, and my side of ham was both tiny and dried out. Husband ordered the Moonlight Classic, and asked for crispy hash browns and eggs over medium. What arrived were undercooked hash browns and eggs that were not only broken, but cooked "hard". We were so starving at that point that we picked at the food and ate what was edible.  I almost laughed when the waitress asked if we wanted boxes to taken the rest home with us. A truly unpleasant meal. Will not return.

Well, they say, if it's good and fast it won't be cheap. If it's good and cheap it won't be fast. And if it's fast and cheap it won't be good. This place is all three. Some restaurants idea of chorizo is nothing more than ground pork with paprika in it. This place has the real thing. Really good pancakes too.

Summary: 50's style diner with excellent service and food. They even have unrefined sugar for the coffee. We'll be back!

Where's the beef?

Ordered the Moonlight breakfast for $6

Guess I scanned the description of this breakfast too fast as it contained no meat. Just toast (pancakes optional), two eggs, and hash browns.

Kinda hard to review this place from what I ordered as the eggs and hash browns were exactly the same as any other diner. The toast however was thicker and more flavorful than expected and buttered just right. Unfortunatly the eggs were easy though I ordered over medium. 

My waitress acted as if she would rather be doing anything else but working here, which killed the warm friendly 50's atmosphere other yelpers mentioned...unless she was really into character and was playing the grumpy old wise crackin' diner waitress...but that is doubtful. 

It was nothing to write home about. The prices were all airporty (really high).

This was a great stop on the way to the Airport, I had the banana bread French toast and it was delicious. 
Husband got the chicken fried steak, we both had cold hash browns so that's the reason for the 4 stars.

After flights delays and annoyance traveling from Chicago my wife and I stopped in desperate for a feel good moment. The food we ordered looked and tasted okay but the service was horrible. No side on my wife's meal, no check backs and no desire to service the customer. I love diners but I will not be stopping by here again.
I was not expecting much since it's next to my hotel (Hampton Inn), but was pleasantly surprised! Great burger and happy hour was awesome.  My waiter was fantastic.  Cool vibe.  Coming here again.

This is my second time here. I went with the blue plate special, which happened to be a smothered pork chop. Unfortunately, it was almost too tough to eat. The veggies didn't taste cooked all the way. The mashed potatoes and muffin were delicious. I also had some wings and a beer to start - those were both wonderful - I highly recommend. 

I should have stuck with the big island bird, which I had the last time I was here. Too bad.

Service was great. Atmosphere was great. "Starlight" is who makes these cool replicas of 50's diners.. classic Reuben was tasty.. went well with chicken soup.. beer, prices, and music were great too. Maybe I was just in a good mood at 10pm after watching Deadpool in theaters.. or maybe because I didn't live in the 50's, and all I can compare the 50's to are the classic tv shows and happy/romantic music that makes one not help but love the 50's lol.  Hm. Smart..

column4: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
column13: My husband and I love stopping here when we are traveling in and out of Denver. Service is always fast and the food is delicious. A++
The food is good but the place is filthy and run down!  Whoever owns this place needs to get it cleaned up!  I won't be back until it is.
HUGE menu. They truly have something for everyone. Definitely recommend the orange cream adult beverage! Great service.

This is an A-OK place to come for a decent breakfast. They have all the staples of a classic greasy spoon, and they do those staples well. I came here with a group a few weeks ago, and most of us ordered some iteration of eggs, sausage/bacon, hash browns, and pancakes, including myself. I thought my meal was solid - everything was cooked exactly how I would expect it, but it wasn't anything special. A couple people in my party ordered egg white omelettes and didn't like them very much. They were very watery (like, sitting in a puddle of water) and did not look good to me at all. That said, the regular eggs were delicious and I would order my meal again if I ever came back.

The service was... just okay. I understand that it's difficult to serve a large group of people, but 20 minutes just to get a cup of coffee is tough, especially first thing in the morning! The waitresses were very polite and very friendly; just slow. That said, all our orders were correct and there were no mistakes on the checks, so I suppose it's worth it to have slow servers if they do everything right the first time!

Had a stellar (or should it be lunar?) experience at the Moonlight Diner in Denver last night. This stretch of Tower Road has some tired restaurants, but this is not one of them. Had eggs for dinner with the scrumptious Southwest Stack of green chile corn pancakes. Nice beer selection and my dining companions raved about the salads and the spinach omelette. Well worth a visit if you're staying near DIA. Enjoy the classic diner decor!

This place is decently located, I think they try to catch travelers on their way to and from the airport. The food here was average, the staff were friendly. I watched them clean a table with a dirty rag from a bucket full of brown water, uh, I think it's time to change the water. There were a lot of flies, it wasn't too clean, the utensils were still dirty, and the place smelled like old water. 

We probably won't come back here, it wasn't that great and besides, there's a Wendy's up the street, if that says anything.

This is a very romantic spot to go and eat delicious meals. I was so in love with their food and the size of their breakfast platter. The pancakes are amazing, and the drinks were perfect. It is styled like a 1950's diner, with their juke box, and silver seats. The staff is incredibly friendly, and I will always love this good ol' diner. Thank you, Moonlight Diner!

If you're staying in the DIA hotel compound zone, Moonlight Diner is a great place to hang out.  The old-time diner interior, complete with retro ads, is adorable.  We didn't go into the bar and the adjacent patio, but it looked like a great space. The servers are exceptionally nice (and also handsome).
