Our server offered to send me home with a Diet Coke refill... I mean, who does that? Prices were reasonable considering the huge portions.

Minus a star for the dirty, sticky booths and the abundant fly population, sadly.

The food: my daughter ordered the enormous Big Island Bird sandwich. I totally recommend this!  It's a big fried chicken breast all decked out with ham, pineapple, gooey Swiss cheese, and Teriyaki sauce.  My husband ordered the Buffalo chicken wrap, which was very spicy and delicious. He also had a cup of green chili, which was too salty but was otherwise fantastic, and an excellent chocolate shake.

Unfortunately, my fish and chips were not good.  The fish wasn't cooked long enough and they didn't salt it after frying, so it was chewy, flavorless, and kind of greasy.  The cole slaw was pretty terrible too.  Great fries though, although they have cheap generic ketchup on the tables.

It was around 3pm on a weekday afternoon.  I sat at the counter and ordered the buffalo chicken wrap.  There were only 2 other tables, yet it took forever to come.  The chicken was sort of hard and rubbery, like the cheap, pre-cooked chicken in the grocery store ... but left out a bit.  Then, it took forever for my server to notice that I was done ... and then, it took forever-er for the actual bill to come.  You'd think a place near the airport would be laser-focused on getting folks in and out.
The huevos rancheros, me gusta. #TagYaMan

Our friends were in town Overnight and staying at  hotel near DIA. We wanted to meet up for dinner and in a convenient location. The Moonlight Diner was in walking distance from the hotel. 
What a lovely surprise as They had a menu with a variety of choices for dietary preferences, they also had a full bar with cocktails. The decor is quaint like an old diner and the service was great! 
We had a nice visit with really tasty food! 
The diner offers breakfast, lunch and dinner foods as well as a large salad menu. 
My friend had the grilled cheese with sweet potato fries, (I was jealous as it looked exquisite.)
I had a blackened chicken salad that was so flavorful I barely needed salad dressing. My husband had a guacamole bacon burger, the portion was ginormous and tasty! And my vegan friend had a spinach salad with vinaigrette that was made to her specific needs and with no issues. 
The Moonlight cafe comes highly recommended by us. We will visit there again. :)

Stopped in for breakfast and shared the big burrito with a friend. I added a pancake on the side because I had been craving one and I was not disappointed. The pancake was fluffy and slightly crispy at the same time. It blew my mind. No exaggeration! We both devoured our haves of the burrito and left happy. Highly recommend this place for breakfast! We also had great service considering it was pretty busy and their wasn't much staff.

Great place! The food is amazing with some unique items such as the southwestern corn cake pancakes and banana bread French toast. The wait staff are friendly and attentive. The price is good. Just over $40 for a family of four ( two kids meals--which come with crispy tater tots!) and we all ate well.

My only negative mark is for the ladies restroom. The toilet seats all slide around like they are about to fall off and it could use a real deep cleaning, but I've been in much worse.

I have not visited the bar side, so I can't comment on it, and we've also only come for breakfast, but I highly recommend the restaurant overall.

I was at the diner with a friend, I have been there a few times before and had been greeted by a nice young man, his personal and attentiveness to my service was the reason I had come when back in. But to my surprise yesterday the young man was getting yelled at where the whole diner was disrupted because of the manage (I assume the manager)  bad behavior and judgement.  the foul language and lack of respect for the employee was unforgivable. I would hope that he doesn't treat all his employees with the lack of respect he showed that polite young man. For that reason I encourage anyone who has worked in a restaurant or has a family member to not eat at that restaurants, I would of been humiliated if my superior would of spoke to me in that Manor. To the district manager of the facility 
, if your reading this review maybe you should be a bit more selective in hiring a figure of authority.  Thank you to may one who reads this review and respect employees right to being treated with respect at there place of employment.
This place is a diamond in the rough of a very character-lacking hotel park. It looks like a cool old-school diner and serves local beer and comfort food.

As nice as the people are I was sitting at the bar when a card was dropped behind the register.  Let's just say the person who dropped the card actually said it was lost because of how dirty it was behind the counter it was on.  I AM OUT! I am sorry but if it is that dirty in the front of the house...  I don't want anything from the back.  NAUSEA

Have eaten in The Moonlight diner each time I visit the US. The meals are very very tasty and well cooked. The lady that served me and my friends each time, is called Valisha is a superb server, very friendly and made sure I and my friends had everything we needed. Five stars from me, and I'll be going there again when I visit the US next year.
Had a Reuben and a BLT with my wife the food was really good and large portions friendly service recommend it

Love this 1960's look in the restaurant the food is so good and friendly and professional waiter and waitresses accept for one this black waitress must work there a long time but she is real rude didn't like her bedside manners or table side manners she don't smile and she puts down drinks hard and she is so unprofessional and loud otherwise restaurant is very nice

A classic diner (including the building style) close to the Denver airport. The breakfast food looked good, but I went with country fried steak and potatoes.  Very nice. And the tomato basil soup was outstanding and worth the trip alone.

I recommend stopping here after landing or before leaving - the prices are decent for the amount and quality of food.

Atmosphere is great. That was the best part though. Food was just ok. I had the chicken fried steak. My son got the kitchen sink, a behemoth breakfast with everything in it. He enjoyed it. The green chili on it was pretty tasty. Service was subpar. Looked like they had 5-6 servers, the place wasn't packed, and our waitress let my coffee run out twice.

I was disappointed that I only had 4 options to choose from on the after 9pm. I ordered the breakfast and it was ok.  The brownie Sunday was just a piece and brownie and a scoop of ice cream.  No effort put into it.  The server was nice.  The inside was dirty looking and very worn.

Great place especially if you're staying at the Hampton Inn. Server staff very friendly, especially Sam. Great diner food. Full bar attached with a nice beer selection. Very limited late night menu, hope you like chicken fingers. Very clean and comfortable though I did notice the booth seats are quite bouncy. If you're looking for a true diner, this is it.

Don't. Just don't. Unless it's snowing and your hotel is in this deserted land near the airport and you're starving. And desperate....very desperate. Our server was nice. That's the only reason I gave it 2 stars. The food is a 1 or lower. I got the chicken fried steak...pretty sure meat isn't supposed to be gray. I got the dinner and it was served with mashed potatoes, vegetable medley and blueberry muffin. I don't get the muffin at all. The vegetable medley was frozen and heated up in a skillet. The mashed potatoes were standard, nothing more. The muffin had okay flavor but was dry and crumbly. The chicken fried steak was gray and tough.

Ate here for 2 straight nights as it was right by the hotel and I didn't have a car.  Pretty wide variety of food with breakfast type items being served all day.  This is definitely a diner type environment.  It was good for one night but I would have chosen something different for a second night if I had an option.  Not bad though.
Best chicken fried steak and pancakes around!! Our server was very attentive and the food came out fast. Will definitely be coming back!!

We were looking for good, fast, classic comfort food and this place hit the spot. My husband enjoyed the Philly with fries and as a vegetarian option I was able to order a BLT sub the bacon for avocado. 
The waitress was honest when asked her opinion on the homemade mashed potatoes without gravy and I am glad I listened to her as they were excellent.
The atmosphere is 50s diner but they kept it clean and were extremely nice but not overbearing.
In short I want to find a place like this back home.
If you go here ask for Rita she is awesome! She definitely knows how to take care of her customers .

My wife and I stopped in here on a Friday night.  We were met by a really nice guy that we assume was the manager.  We ordered wine, beer and burgers.  We sat outside on the patio.  The food was excellent and the service wAs good.  We were surprised that they are not busier than they are.  We will defiantly be back. This place is a hidden gem.

Outstanding diner with great pancakes and shakes!   My go to place going or coming from DIA for food.  The price seems right on, and the cooks at this place rock.  I get my burgers cooked just the way I want or special requests on desserts.  The staff goes a long way to make you happy!

Check out the daily specials and also the drinks are good as well.

I don't know what servers the other reviewers had but mine was a total bitch!! Nothing about her was endearing. I heard her say she needed to eat something because she drank too much last night. Maybe she should have a drink now!!? 
Had an omelette that was good. Reasonable prices. People go where they're invited and return where welcomed. Didn't feel very welcome!!
Oh yea, if you don't know much time to get to the airport, don't stop here. Slow!!!

Lights are on, but closed due to power outage?????  I hope the owner fires the lazy wait staff that thinks closing down over a ten minute power outage is good business.  I was giving this diner a second chance after poor service once before and will never try again!  If only there was a way to warn all of the traveling public not to waste their time on bad service for average food.

Cool exterior, place looks like a airstream mobile home on steroids. The layout inside seemed a little odd, and the booth we sat in felt a little unsteady, but the service was quick and pleasant. I imagine this place gets a lot of traffic from the 2-3 hotels close by and of course the airport... We were starving following our flight and didn't want to pay airport prices, unfortunately the prices were a little inflated here as well. We both had breakfast, and it was nothing to complain about, but nothing worth mentioning either. I did see that they have a morning happy hour, from 7-9am, I thought that was pretty unique, hopefully the pilots aren't going to breakfast there for that reason.

Stopped into the moonlight on the way out of DIA, heading into the mountains for some skiing. It was just great. If your hungry and in the area, this is the place to stop.

Located among apartment buildings and next to a hotel, it is a classic looking diner: Tables were populated by airport workers and from the moment we came in I knew we were going to leave happy.

The portions were huge, the food all homemade and the staff was super friendly. We at so much at 10am that we did not eat again until 7--and then not much.

We had breakfast, and it was clear that the pancakes were from a homemade batter. If you can eat them without syrup then its good batter. Excellent!

The eggs were very fresh tasting and I had Chorizo (Mexican sausage). Both were outstanding. Home made hash browns, and good coffee.  Everything was perfect.

I can not recommend this place more. (THANKS to other yelp-ers for helping us find this gem).
Cutie lil diner. Has the 50s look and feel. They server was great, very friendly and sweet. The serving sizes are huge. Pretty good eats!! And the food is reasonably priced.
Decent menu. Chorizo breakfast was good but served warm to cold and not hot. Nice view of mountains but very busy and loud Tower road. Service was slow maybe because I was outside.

Stopped in for a diner breakfast experience and was truly delighted. Rita. My server, was excellent and very attentive. Hot cakes were light and moist. Eggs cooked to my preference with 5 pieces of crispy bacon. To top it off, the coffee was exceptional and well above a Starbucks or Denny's. BRAVO RITA and moonlight Diner.

This place is awesome. They play really good music on their patio. The entire restaurant is authentic and the food is absolutely amazing. If you don't eat a lot you can share a burger here. The portions were huge for the moonlight burger. Staff is super friendly and attentive. Absolutely 100% recommend this place for everybody who wants to have a good time and good food!

Had lunch here for Father's Day and we enjoyed it. We were worried by the amount of cars in the parking lot but we got in without a wait. I had chicken fried chicken with veggies and it was probably too much for lunch but it sounded too good to pass up. Creamy and rich and the veggies seemed "fancier" than anything you should find at a diner. The waiter was courteous and it is a nice, casual environment. I will come back again.

Diner food, breakfast all day, and a bar! 

Walking in I wasn't sure what to expect the incredibly slick signage made be fear  this might end up being a super boring wannabe diner. I waited a moment for a waitress and she seated me immediately. There were only 2 servers on and they just traded off taking every other table. I sat on the smaller side of the diner, without the bar. 

She slid me a sticky fading menu with various items blacked out with sharpie. This wasn't encouraging. There was a separate drink menu on the table and I saw they had a bloody mary and with a mix I had never heard of. Settled on that. Choosing this to drink also sort of set the stage for what I was going to eat.

A Meatloaf entree was on the menu, and in my mind that would go well with a Bloody Mary. 

My drink and meal came out at the same time, and I didn't get my salad. The plate had two massive slabs of meatloaf that had green peppers and onion dispersed throughout it and a tomato ketchup cover. The mashed potatoes were real, even had some chunks and the skin in it. The veggies were your standard frozen mish mash, but they had been sauteed in bacon fat and served with a piece of bacon cut up in the serving. There was a nice fluffy biscuit that was cut in half and toasted for me. A few minutes into the meal the waitress brought out the most impressive side salad I've ever received. The salad had tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, fresh mushrooms, dark greens,  

The bloody mary was nice and spicy, very peppery. Though it was lacking the customary celery stalk, I did like the green olives it came garnished with. 

I finished my meal with the Fab coffee, which was a hot coffee with all sorts of booze poured in it and topped with whipped cream. Perfect. I thoroughly believe you cannot go to a diner and not have something with whipped cream.

I was staying at one of the hotels and walked over at 8 pm, they would not sit anyone...granted there was a nasty storm, but get some lightning protection and feed the hungry travelers.  

I didn't eat dinner...so, I arrived in the morning hungry and ordered the handmade chicken fried steak.  The small portion is huge, but that's it.  The hash browns were not cooked all the way.  The eggs were over cooked.  The coating would not stay on the greasy (as in a pool of grease) steak.  Gravy lacked flavor, and overall the meal sucked.

Good customer service, fun diner atmosphere...doubt any of the food is much better.

I've lived near the place for 10 years and have always wanted to try it. I wish I would have sooner! They have good food with huge portions. The service was phenomenal! Patriest was our server and she was hands down the best server I have ever had. She was super friendly and personable. The only downside is that their food is pricy compared to Village Inn which is right down the street and serves a lot of the same food. Their great service makes up for it though. We will be coming back for sure.

Good food! Super yummy bacon and eggs! Cute little atmosphere too and I LOVE a place that has mimosas! There are a LOT of choices on the menu and the food comes out fast. I'll be back!

Update: Came back and there was an incredibly rude older woman server early in the morning. She yelled at me when I asked about the mimosa glass and humiliated me in front of the restaurant. We complained and the manager was very nice and took care of it! Sadly, we came back about a week later and the same rude lady was there, and she shouted very loudly "LET ME GET SOMEONE ELSE TO SERVE YOU." Probably will have to find somewhere else so go now, she ruins it. My appetite is gone. Had to lower my rating from 4 stars to 2. Big bummer.

We were looking for a new breakfast restaurant that had great food and reasonable prices, and I must say that the Moonlight Diner fit the bill admirably!  After spending the last few days moving to a new home we were craving some good old American breakfast food. The menu has a great selection of all the classics. I went for the Chicken Fried Steak, that came with hash browns, eggs and a side of toast or pancakes. I picked pancakes - light and fluffy, just dense enough to know they were the real deal. My wife had the Kitchen Sink - a heaping portion of goodness, topped with green chile. We both took home leftovers and enjoyed them the next day. 

We'll be going back for happy hour in the coming weeks. So glad we found this place!  Great staff, food and diner ambience.

Greasy spoon. Diner. Breakfast. I must say they did everything right. Amazing hash. Hash browns perfect. Banana bread French toast crunchy on the outside and moist inside. We were pleasantly surprised by our post early morning flight meal. If you find yourself hungry leaving DIA, stop here.

I was with some relatives about four years ago it was great. Today I was with five different relatives as someone told us "We run it the way it ought to be run." Thankyou for great food and great times with family and friends

So everyone remembers the classic "Saved by the Bell" episode* where Jessie starts taking diet pills but then she can't handle them and she freaks out and starts singing "I'm So Excited" loudly and poorly, right?

Don't deny it, you remember.   Anywho, that's what I felt like after eating the biscuits and gravy here.  I'd picked up some friends from the airport and we had an hour to kill while waiting for our next friend to arrive, so thought we'd get a tiny nosh.

Ended up eating like pigs and loving every minute of it.  We started with chips and salsa.  The chips were warm and came in a variety of fashion colors.  Salsa was great.  The ladies split a giant quesadilla.  They asked for it to be beef and chicken, meaning one half put some chicken in and the other half put some beer, but they just mixed it all in together.  No matter, it was great.

My aforementioned biscuits and gravy were like a disconnected telephone because they were OFF THE HOOK!  Coffee was great, service was nice and for some reason there were a lot of good looking people there (not just us!).

If you're out in that vast wasteland where the DIA resides, this is your oasis in the desert, baby.

_____________________________
* Kind of would have been cool if Zach had given her one of those "snap out of it" slaps, although I don't advocate violence of any kind http://youtu.be/bflYjF90t7c
Very good burgers and I was impressed with how clean everything was. Thanks for the great first impression of Denver! It's what we needed after the 6 hour flight :)
Nice atmosphere with good food.  The Kitchen Sink is the bomb.  They serve breakfast all day!  Have spirits and beer too.  Staff is friendly.  We will be back
Breakfast was great.  Perfect over easy eggs, real sourdough bread, nice serving of bacon.  Very quick.  It was worth the extra stop.

Diner's a regular thing we do and this place is one of the best we've been to.

The place was clean and had appealing aesthetics.

The service could have been a little faster but we were in no hurry.

The Food was very good and cooked exactly as ordered.

I personally LOVED the home made corned beef hash!

Food was good, but today even after waiting about 30-40 minutes to be seated, we waited at our table for probably an hour and a half for the food. We arrived around 10 and it was almost one by the time we left. The staff seemed rushed and stressed the whole time, and we were seated near the kitchen and it was loud and everyone was running passed us. Food was good but not worth that wait.
Good food, great service, fun atmosphere, open late. Perfect for the delayed traveler. I had the combo pizza with a draft beer and it was very good. I would come again.
Other than 'no olives' for Bloody Mary and 'no Grand Manier' for the margarita we ordered, so far so good.    Funky little place!

Traditional diner.  Went for breakfast which was as expected. The eggs, sausage and hash browns were all just okay - hash browns were underdone, but the pancakes were huge and definitely the highlight of my meal.

My companion ordered the Kitchen Sink which was enormous - the green chili and potato squares were very flavorful but the white sausage gravy lacked anything to distinguish it.

They do offer alcohol but we didn't try anything - it was still a little too early for us.  Decent spot if you're headed in or out of DIA and want to grab a hearty meal.

Service was decent - nothing to note, good or bad.

Finding this little place was a refreshing end to a family ski trip in the mountains. It was a fun and less expensive change from the chain restaurants and the usual pre packaged foods  that dominate the roadside.

Don't let the quirky appearance turn you away.  The food was obviously home made and all of our selections were delicious and generous.  The wait staff and management were friendly and attentive.  They serve 24 hr breakfast, plus a good selection of sandwiches, home style dinners and desserts.  It's a cute mid century diner like diners should be!

Outstanding service, food, and ambiance. I had a burger and enjoyed every morsel!  The price was nice too.
If you're looking for a fun, inexpensive, good food,open late place... Go no further, this is the place.  You won't regret it... As a matter of fact, you will probably be back time and time again ;)

I had a great time here.  I got the tacos pollo and was pleased with the size and also please to get some Mexican food that wasn't SMOTHERED.

I lived in Colorado a few years back and wish I would have known about this place when I did, but at least I got to go this time around.

Good corn tortilla, fresh veggies, great salsa, and good meats.  Can't beat it.  

La California was a nice oasis while on a trip to denver from San Antonio, Texas, which is taco city USA... So it was glad to see the comforts of home and not just McDonald's and voodoo donuts.

Don't trip ese, make your way here and suck down a bowl of menudo and a plate of tacos.

A true gem in street order Authentic Mexican cuisine. A very small quaint eatery. 

We were greeted with a courteous smile upon ordering. 

After visiting, I have to say best refried beans and Chips I had. I liked them so good I ordered some for the road. The green salsa hit the spot as well. 

Truly nice to experience good food.

Thank you again to all my fellow Yelping Community.  I was looking for breakfast burritos in the area this morning and had to break out my trusty Yelp Mobile App.
I agree with most everyone else. 
No frills.
Authentic Mexican food. 
2 lb Breakfast Burritos 
I got the Chorizo which had good flavor but is complemented by refried beans, potato (not french fries ), eggs and cheese. I asked for the hotter of the Chile choices but didn't really notice that at all. 
Good value for the $$ only being a a few bucks.
Friendly staff
I just might try this place out again when I'm in the area.

My wife had the carnitas which were good. I had tamales which were real big. Had plenty of meat just not enough chili in them. I will have to come again another time and try out the other items to give a better review. Service was quick.
The breakfast burritos here are amazing! Even if this place wasn't a half mile from where I work, I would go out of my way for their burritos! Not to mention, the staff is super sweet as well!

Best breakfast burritos in town, without question! The owners are very friendly. They know that using Manteca is the only way to make the best frijoles. Please go to this place. La comida a La California es authentico y delicioso!
We had the California breakfast burrito (#2) with chorizo and the burrito smothered with carnitas. Both were delicious and we'll be going back soon to try their tacos.

YUM! Absolutely the most authentic mexican food I have tasted outside of my mother's cooking and Mexicantown, Detroit!

The tiniest little place, with only two tables inside. Get their early because you will be waiting. I went for an early lunch to beat the crowd, and the food still took around 30 minutes to prepare...only one woman cooking everything. Wowza it was worth the wait!

I ordered the enchiladas with carnitas. The plate was huge and I ate the entire thing...quite a feat for me, usually. 

I can't believe that I've been going to school next door to this place for two years, yet have never stepped foot in here. Don't make the same mistake!

This is my go-to restaurant for some authentic mexican food. I make sure to come here at least once a month! Their pozoles, menudo, and tacos are amazing, and their flan? TO DIE FOR. Best flan I've ever had in my life. The owner is really nice too. :)
Great breakfast burrito, tasted fresh and extremely well priced.  Definitely worth the visit and great as a mid study energizer.

My wife and I love this place! It is small, friendly, inexpensive and delicious authentic Mexican food. 
If you live or work near the Anschutz Medical campus and haven't been here yet, do yourself a favor and check it out! You will want to come back.

I really wanted this place to work out. The name gave me hope that this could be a glimmer of the mexican food that I am used to. I know I write in search for socal mexican food often, but I am determined to find anything that resembles all the deliciousness that I am accustomed to. This was sadly a disappointment. I tried several different dishes, from breakfast burritos to tamales. All of which fell significantly short. It was nice however to see them make the food in front of me. The salsas were just blahh. There was no kick to any of it, and I tried it all. The carne asada was pretty bland as well. So my search for delicious mexican food continues, yet again!
Great place for breakfast burritos, burritos and tortas! The exterior is unsuspecting but the food speaks for itself. This is my go-to spot for Mexican on the go!

It's a dive, though I love dives.

But it's priced like a fancy place.  $12 for a burrito and coke (Mexican imported).

I love dumpy spots and staff who can't speak English and tables you self-bus with Auto Trader, and a parking lot full of sink holes.  No chips, salsa, silverwear and I had to retrieve and open my own Coke.  I'll do all that when the burrito is $5 or 6.  But this lunch tab was on par with some of Denver's more polished Mex eateries.  

Shit for $12 you get shot at banging the cliff diver at Casa Bonita.  I'd eat there again, but it's not worthy of the current Yelp ranking in terms of value for the money.

YES! The most authentic mexican food I've been blessed enough to taste while living in CO thus far. I'm from southern NM and am on a mission to find food that is similar to what I miss oh so much-- this place nailed it. 

Ordered the green/red enchiladas which came with chips/salsa, rice, and beans. Super delicious, enough said. I could literally drink the salsa that the chips came with. 

I would give it a 4.75 if possible because it took a while to get our food---but it was made fresh right in front of my face, so it's excusable in my opinion! 

It's a "walk up and order" style restaurant and is definitely a whole in the wall (oh boy, always such hidden gems) Saw that they sell $2.00 breakfast burritos---sweet deal! If you're a fan of authentic mexican food, I'd definitely make your way at this little place.

La California is the kind of bustling in the morning with early riser swinging by for menudo or a breakfast burrito while the staff preps the carnitas, pollo, and chicharrones for the day.  As a result, the aromas filling this small spot are completely off the charts.  The menu is a bit disorienting, but the food is spot on scrumptious.  A steal at $1.59 each, La California's breakfast burritos huge vessels of breakfast glory, packing eggs, beans, salsa, cheese, potatoes, and your choice of meat into a ginormous flour tortilla. This is my new go-to spot when I need a big and cheap breakfast.  

The chicken is billed as the headliner at this establishment that touts authentic pollo asado estilo Sinaloan.  I must say, dig into the dark meat as the white meat tends run on the dry side.

Not to be overlooked and possibly the champion on this menu is La California's carnitas.  These chunks of fatty, deep fried goodness are juicy, tender and bursting with flavor.  You can eat these as an entree plate or you can burrito-ify it.  While the squeamish might hesitate at all of the giggly parts, those of us who are culinary thrill seekers will love the added flavor and recognize that fat is where it's at.

Great little Mexican joint. Food is usually excellent, although I have had them on a few off days. I'm not the biggest fan of their tortas which my coworkers usually get. Tacos are my go to here, but their plates, tamales, and burritos are great too. Always get at least one thing with carne asada and a Mexican coke
Great unknown place. The breakfast burritos are so good and very cheap. Don't let the appearance fool you.

This place has amazing carnitas. 
You can buy I think its 2 pounds of carnitas rice and beans, package of warm tortillas plus a 2 liter soda for 25 bucks. If that is not a deal I dont know what is ! Plus its super tasty.

Waited 45 minutes for a breakfast burrito. When it came I was pretty impressed, especially at $3.50, but the time it took was definitely not worth it. It's not like there were that many customers, they just don't have a good system down for making orders. That said, they have the chance to be great if they could just be faster.

Had the steak breakfast burrito and although it was a good price, it was bland. I was really excited to find a place that served great breakfast burritos that was nearby, but unfortunately this wasn't it. The staff seemed really nice though.
Omg too yummy!!! And the staff is great.  Even when you have to wait for your food, you always see them working quickly. Hope it's around forever!!

Been meaning to add in plaudits for this tiny taqueria near the school, for some time now. 

I've dined here may times, and it's always, always, top-tier.

Largest, most complex, tastiest tortas I've ever eaten, and I've torta-tized the western half of the US.

Menudo AND Posole available. Terrific.

Pollo entero and medio, amazing crispy skin, more food than one can safely consume.

All meals prepared inches away in the open kitchen, and the fresh carnitas are borne right outside the door.

Volumes of killer Northern Mexican eats for pennies.

Go hungry, leave in a bit of happy pain.

When El Pollo Tote closed, I watched the small building in which it resided transform. And on the day I saw a mural being painted on the outside of the building, I knew I was going to have to try La California. Last Saturday and one of the first days of being opened, I walked in after a ride and was completely surprised by the interior renovation. It is clean and bright and the kitchen is up front for you to observe the preparation of your meal; there is also a panderia offering fresh pan dulces. 

And what do we all like best about a new business besides tasty food? The new owners and staff, of course! I was thrilled to be greeted by the wife and given a "tour" of their meal offerings: Chilirio (a great looking stew), soups, chilies, meats for tacos, salsas. Next week the barbecue is going to be installed for Rico pollo. She said that I should first try their torta and I went with the suggestion; pollo flavored. This alone earned a star as I like being given suggestions by the owner.

And Oh, what a great tasting monster sized torta this was. YUM!!!! Perfectly seasoned chicken, slabs of avocado, great tasting beans, the whole thing was mouth watering and only $5.50. AND it really was the size of two normal sandwiches. 

Let's hope the economy is kind to this business because I would like to see it succeed so I can keep going back and actually get to taste some of those soups, tacos, and stews.

Very good food.  I had chicken and pork tamales, comes with salsa verde and roja.   All fresh tasting.  Pork was nice and spicy, as was salsa roja.  One other big family group at next table...their food looked good, too.  Quick service.  'Fast food' style and simple plating.  $2.50 for my 2 regular sized tamales.

The place is right on the corner, parking lot is small, and there was construction in front, so I almost missed it.  I did find 2 bones in my chicken tamale.  The place is very small (2 tables inside, with a few counter seats) and it seemed pretty clean and smelled good.  My tamales were from the frig and microwaved.  I've lived in New Mexico and California and have eaten a lot of good, and bad, Mexican food, so I'll stand by my 4 stars.  And maybe up it to 5 if my return visit is even better!

I've been twice for lunch and everything has been delicious. I love that you can sit at the counter and watch them make your food to order. The hotel pan of carnitas makes my mouth water. I had lengua for the first time here and it was so good. I don;t have anything to compare it to but I would order it again in a heartbeat! If you're in the area it's worth checking out. Portions are huge and cheap!

On my way back from getting an emissions test at 30th & Peoria, La California's colorful sign caught my eye. I got half of a roasted chipotle chicken with beans and rice to go for $7.95! The chipotle spices were really tasty but I'm not much of a skin eater. I recommend the dark meat, which was juicy and scrumptious. The white meat was a bit dry, (as white meat often is).

They have a good takeout family meal for $25: two whole pollos asados with beans and rice in large quantities. There might be a liter of soda in there too,  not sure.

I shared the skin and "sogs" (wiggly, jiggly parts that are slimy going down) with my faithful pups, who give this place a rating of 4 paws on the counter plus a spirited howl for good measure.

La California is worth trying if you're in the area. I'm holding back on that 4th star because I probably won't stop by again until I need another emissions test.

I have had so many friends recommend this place and I finally stopped in the other day.  What a selection!  Great service, such friendly folks!  They have an amazing selection and you get a lot of bang for your buck - huge portion sizes.  We tried 5-6 dishes and everything was yummy.  The chicken here is just great!  Give it a try you will not be sorry!

This is one of my favorite places! Whenever people come in town to visit, this is where I want to take them. They have a great selection of beers on tap, and their food is really good. I love their Southwest Cobb salad, hands-down best salad I've ever had.

The atmosphere is great. If you sit in the front area you can easily hold a conversation without having to yell to be heard. The servers are always prompt and friendly, even when they're busy. 

I can't say enough good things about this place.

I was very surprised with the superb service here. It's a local bar in Edgewater, who would have thought out server would have been so attentive? Almost overly attentive; I was too indecisive for as often as she came to check on us!

The food was half and half. It was either amazing or just okay. The wedge salad had almost no bacon. Like, I was insulted by how little bacon was on it. It tried to make up by having a crap ton of dressing, but bacon is way more important. The boyfriend's burger was delicious. French fries and onion rings, perfectly crispy. I'll skip the salad starter next time. It's a bar, why did I have high hopes for that anyway?

The consistency of the food gets a 3 but the service was so great, it gets bumped up to a 4. It was busy but not totally packed. We'll be back in hopes the service remains consistent.

Went in for brunch on Sunday and I think our group was a little overwhelming. The place was slammed because of other brunch goers and the Dragon Boat Festival was also happening, so we were expecting a bit of a wait, but we actually got in pretty easily - taking up about three 4-tops in the front bar.

Service was a bit on the slow side, but friendly. I just wasn't blown away by the food here. The burger patty was clearly from-frozen and nearly every topping has a .95 (or more) charge to it. My $6 burger easily turned into a $10 burger with no fries. Split a basket of onion rings with the BF and they were okay.

Was bummed we got the tab before we could ask to split it, but it happens. Still a pretty solid spot.

Hello Edgewater! How cute are you?!?

Providence Tavern is along the main strip of commerce on 25th. Lots of older buildings and quiet neighborhoods made it pretty idyllic. Perfect for a summer stroll, followed by a late night meal.

Kitchen stays open until 10 pm on weeknights and that's a good thing since the food is pretty much what one would expect at a spot like with a mahogany wood decor: simple, classic, delicious.

I recommend that buffalo chicken club sandwich with a side of fries. A spicy take on the OG sandwich. And you know I'm getting a side of ranch to squelch the flames in my mouth. That and a "salty dog" cocktail, which is really a greyhound with a salt rim. 

The cozy atmosphere, the friendly service, and the overall vibe won me over for sure. A nice place that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Delicious brunch and bottomless mimosas! I was so excited to find this place since living in Cheyenne brunch is nonexistent. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area. Also, there was literally zero wait for a table, which compared to other denver brunch locations made this place absolutely worth it!

I was just bullied and intimidated by the bartender and manager (shamus) after simply questioning if the IPA they poured me was actually an IPA.   It tastes like an amber.  Instead of offering an apology or different option, the bartender slowly and dramatically unscrewed the tap handle and laid it in front of me like a proud hunter.  Instead of arguing the point, I settled the tab and gave a $2 tip on a single, mispoured beer in hopes that her day gets better... deciding that I will call back later to discuss.  I did so 20 minutes later and spoke with shamus, asking if I could get the owners name to discuss the experience.   He refused and now I'm leaving a review.   I will never be back to experience the heady, hipster, bullshit vibe from their staff again.   I hope you have a grease fire.

I like the feel of this place... Inside bar as well as the spacious back patio are welcoming. Drink specials... Really good deal. I had two cucumber vodka cocktails and I was good. My husband had an old fashion, it did not come with enough ice or the large chunk of ice that it should. Our waitress was friendly, but the food was mediocre at best. This place doesn't compare to Sloans bar and grill a few blocks up if you are looking for food. Just drinks? This place is def a cool hangout, and on a hot day enjoy the misters on the patio hit the spot.

What a fun tavern to go to during football season! This place is close to the lake, has indoor/outdoor seating and a covered patio, tvs, and a great brunch!

We sat on the patio in the covered area. The weather was perfect and we even caught our Texans on TV! The waitress we had was mediocre but the brunch food made up for it.

We started with chips and salsa., which were alright. Being from Texas you realize salsa is different everywhere else. Too sweet for me, tasted more like tomato/ketchup sauce. 

BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS $8
-too orange for my liking, I like the orange to be faint. But they add pineapple juice so I could easily drink bottomless of the juice. 

I had the fried pigs in a blanket. yes, That's right. It was heavenly. Drizzled a berry sauce over the fried dough and dipped in maple syrup. I highly recommend if you want sweet and savory!!

Others at the table had the pork eggs Benedict which was served with potatoes. The pork had great flavor! 

The breakfast burrito was a schmorgus board- highly suggest it for hungry men. 

The stuffed grilled cheese was a bit too much flavor for me. It was tasty but I don't think I could eat the entire thing.. Unlike my dish.
Love the old timey, non-pretentious feel of this place. Went in for Sunday brunch and left happy. The breakfast burrito is HUGE and they had $5 old fashions and cucumber Collins on special.
Visited this place for brunch and bloodies. Their Bloody Mary was delicious with just the right zest! Brunch was good. I loved the atmosphere. Very low key and relaxing.

Took super long for food here, then someone brought a dog, which barked until they moved seats. Waiter brought my beer and spilled it, which got my shoes and my friend's purse wet. It got dark, and majority of tables had light with the exception of ours. Been here before for happy hour, tonight however, wasn't as enjoyable.

It was an OK experience. I like their outdoor patio and misters to keep cool on a hot Labor Day weekend. The $5 old fashioned, however, was awful. I think there was orange juice in it. When we asked, the waitress said that the orange had been muddled.  Either way, gross! An OF should only have bourbon or rye, simple syrup, and bitters. I like a luxardo cherry and an orange peel as garnish, but definitely not muddled in the drink. But the waitress cheerfully replaced our bad drinks with tasty beers. They have a good selection but were out of like 4 of the 12 menu options. My food was just OK. I got a grilled cheese sandwich that was supposed to have habanero cheese on it. I expected a more generous serving of cheese in general (I think grilled cheese and I want to see cheese oozing out of the sandie) but this had maybe 2 slices of cheese, one of which looked like boring plain ol' American. And the 'habanero' cheese had no spice. Maybe my palate is just too accustomed to spice, but I felt the sandwich was bland and uninspired. BF loved his buffalo chicken though.

I went here last night with my friends because it was super close to our air bnb home. The atmosphere was really nice and they have a cute outdoor set up so you can sit outside with a large group of friends. I think the only thing that was missing, was an outdoor light. I went there around evening time, so when the sun set, it was difficult to see our food! I had to use the flashlight from my phone to see what I was eating. If they had outdoor lighting, it would've been perfect! My friends are all sport lovers, so they all enjoyed watching the game while eating. I ordered the pork tacos and it was really good! Had to give a whole taco to my boyfriend because he liked it so much. I would come visit again.

Stopped in and ordered a bloody Mary diet coke some sweet potato fries. Bloody Mary was hard to drink it tasted stale. The olives were old and withered. Diet coke also stale. I guess if you live in the neighborhood and lost your license this is the place to go.

This is my new favorite hangout.  I selected it based on location and Yelp reviews, to meet with a friend.  The neighborhood is charming.  There was ample parking on the street (for free!).  The bar was nearly empty when we walked in, but started filling up.  Lea (please forgive if I spelled it incorrectly) was wonderful.  She served us with a brilliant smile and great attitude.  

The atmosphere is rustic.  The floors are old hardwood, and then brick in the back.  It is very clean, but embodies Old West charm.  They have an interesting cocktail menu (I will order just about anything with cucumber-infused vodka), along with a great local beer selection.  We started with pot stickers.  They were cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside, flavorful on the inside, and paired with a nice thick sauce.  I had a hard time choosing what to order.  They offer salads, tacos, and burgers, primarily.  I selected the pork tacos.  I was not disappointed.  The plating was nice - three tacos with hominy salsa and a salad.  It was more than enough, and I took leftovers home.  The pork was perfectly seasoned and tender.  Paired with caramelized onions, and it was lovely.  

I will definitely return.

PS - I do not generally like leftovers, but enjoyed my pork tacos so much I thought I'd heat them up for breakfast next day.  Still amazing.

Providence Tavern did not initially impress me when I moved to CO 3 years ago, but the business, service, and food has all elevated since. After receiving notoriety via WestWord, Providence Tavern has seen an uptick in business and publicity! 

Seemingly rising to the occasion, PT serves up a delicious brunch with a bunch of great options. My girlfriend absolutely loves their Pork Tostada Bowl, and I have to admit that even as a frequent vegetarian, this dish has me jones'n to cheat. While I try to hold back my temptation, I ordered the truffle grilled cheese sandwich which is rich, gooey, and one-of-a-kind. This sourdough grilled cheese is served with an over easy egg and hollandaise on top with tomato compote and bacon (if you so choose) on the inside. PT's brunch is coupled with FANTASTIC drink prices ($5 bloodies, $4 manmosa, $8 bottomless mimosas) and service worth noting. 

The only thing keeping PT from 5 stars from me is front of house hospitality. I have had 2 incidents come up here where a member of the front of house (not my server) was rude. I'll be back on account of my previous comments to see if they can squeeze that 5th star from me.

I went for brunch Sunday 2/28 and snagged a seat on the patio.  The atmosphere was lovely as well as my company, but the rest of the experience was not up to par.  

First, our waitress, although nice, was running around like a crazy person and seemed quite flustered - The manager clearly didn't staff appropriately for that day.  

Second, the brunch menu had apparently been updated, but no new menus were printed.  The first 5 things we ordered were no longer available.  If you change a menu you should time it better with the printer or take the initiative to go to Office Max in the meantime.  Management 101.

Third comes the food review.  We ordered a few items to share:  pigs in a blanket (delicious but deep fried like a churro), hummus with veggies (no complaints here), and for my meal the Caesar salad with blackened seared tuna (tasty, but....)...

I've had the worst stomach cramps since eating there - all afternoon Sunday, took a full sick day Monday, and still feeling it Tuesday.  Everything I read online points to the tuna or leafy salad greens.  I'm hoping that it was true tuna and not escolar "snake mackerel" - having to pay $5 extra, I can't really say what they are serving.  

I'd be ok to go back and stick with something safe like a beer and hummus, but would be afraid to try anything else in fear of feeling like this again.

This bar is a tragedy. 

I was in town visiting a friend from college that I hadn't seen in 2+ years and we ended up at this bar. Our bartender with short dark hair made highly offensive and passive aggressive comments about us to the patrons next to us multiple times, assuming we were too oblivious to hear. She was also extremely rude to an elderly woman who came into the bar a bit confused while we were present. We eventually paid our tab and left (no tip as none was deserved) only to be chased out of the bar and screamed at as we walked down the street.

Fast forward an hour later to another bar down the street from Providence Tavern. We were enjoying a pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff only to spot that crazy dark haired bartender talking shit about us to our new bartenders at this new bar. Yes. She followed us to the next bar. 

I don't care where you're from, but it's well known that tips are optional based on quality service. This rude psychotic woman deserved nothing and chose to threaten us based on a false sense of entitlement to a tip after treating us like dirt. I hope she finds peace in life and I hope you all steer clear of this terrible bar. Cheers.

This used to be our go-to place for a great burger, outstanding onion rings and The Best Moscow Mules.  But something has changed in the last year.  While the burgers are still pretty good, they are using a cheaper beer batter for the rings so they have a weird flavor and are a little soggy.  To top it all off, those perfect Moscow Mules now have a cheap vodka in 'em, and you have to pay extra for a decent vodka to be used.  The servers clearly know that the MM's aren't as good, because they actually say, "Is it ok with the [cheap vodka]?"

We still give it the occasional try, but are usually disappointed.

For a divey little place in Edgewater, they have some decent food. The kitchen also stays open a little later than the surrounding restaurants, so it was nice getting a bite to eat here after a long evening of unpacking boxes. The service is slow, but friendly. It was packed on the weeknight we came in, so understandable. 

I had the southwestern cobb salad, which was great and not drowning in dressing and bacon! They serve it with avocado dressing on the side, roasted peppers, and the same pork adovada my husband had in his torta. Now that I think about it, it's...not really a cobb salad at all. Still tasty though.

a solid late night spot for sure, the kitchen is open until 12 which is great. service is ok and the food is as good as you would expect it to be. but the drinks... have been horrendous. and I'm using that word selectivity. first time we ordered the special which was a raspberry mule of some sort, and somehow was the grossest drink I have ever had, before we gave this place another shot. the second time we went for a simple margarita, which was so salty that we asked to have them remade with no salt, and it didn't even help. bleh.

I brought my group of singles who go walking near by at Sloans Lake. I thought that I would bring them to Providence Tavern for dinner, and try it once again, in hopes... that my experience would improve from 2 months ago. A new oppotunity to see improvement RIGHT....

Wrong....it went from a bad B.L.T X 2 dinners at the same table, You couldn't even see the bacon nor taste it on the sandwich. They charged us for two orders of onion rings when only 1 order was given to us. 

One of the other people at the other people at our our table, was also very disappointed with her pork sandwich, and would not want to come back, she said that it was very dry and bland.

The only person that ordered a hamburger ...loved the burger....

I guess one out of 4... isn't too bad...RIGHT

Well it gets better....or rather takes a nose dive..... the manager comes out to talk to the gentleman who ask to talk to him at our table concerning his....experience....not mine....
The manager looses his temper...and proceeds to blame me and yells out at me stating that I'm  no longer welcome because I wrote a negative review on yelp....from 2 months ago....and didn't understand why I would come in the resturant anymore...This manager...totaliy tried to humilate me in front of everyone at my table..

 Well... my answer would have been to give Providence Tavern another opportunity to improve on my last visit....but he didn't giving me a chance to say it, because he wanted to prove that he was right and I was wrong!! He's reason for the poor ....quality...was his bottom-line...on food costs....not a great excuse in my business, nor any other business.

The excellant food quality, and the warm fuzzy feelings of the really nice management....has changed from a totally amazing and great neighborhood tavern, to a very average to below average pub. 

My suggestion to the owner is to re-evaluate your management during the evening shift; and your portion control and budget on a sandwich.....it was a joke of a portion, just ask your server, I she saw the size of the portion,,,  

In the future I also...will look for a place to eat.... I will look for another place that will accomidate my food sensitivities...without humiliating me in front of everyone in my party and other customers. I will not be spending my money, nor suggest that others spend their money at this establishment ever again!!.

..

.

Fan-freaking-tastic!! 

I have a limited diet. I have Crohn's disease and have to be really picky about what I eat. I was surprised to see bean burgers but NOT turkey burgers on the menu. Then the server dropped an atomic bomb on me. They had, as of two weeks ago, started serving turkey burgers. 

The food is phenomenal. The service is stellar. The experience is one I hope to repeat next time I happen to be in Colorado. LOVE this place!!!

Truffle grilled Cheese was amazing,  crispy grilled cheese with sun dried tomatoes topped with poached egg, bacon. I had the pull pork benedict , it was a little cold, not my favorite. Only came because it got voted number 1 for brunch.

My boyfriend and I go here multiple times a week. The burger has got to be the best in Denver and the ahi tuna is just delicious! I get the quinoa salad with tuna when I want something healthy and we've tried most of their dishes and they never disappoint. The prices are fair, and the happy hour is awesome. I also highly recommend the crab cakes. Honestly everything on their menu is incredible, and the brunch is AMAZING! The staff are always so sweet, we love P-Tavs!

One of my most favoritest taverns! They have tasty grub, excellent vibe, killer cocktails and great service. Plus they are located near a bunch of fun spots in and around Edgewater, so you can make a day of it! I haven't actually been at night, but hear it gets fairly busy. I recommend off hours, but that is my recommendation for almost anywhere as it is my lifestyle.  
 
They have a rad happy hour and a great menu. It helps to create or diminish your hangover depending on where you are in life at the time. The service has always been super cool and the energy always comfortable and welcoming. Even when it is busy, it is chill and comfy!

They have some fun specialty cocktail options, some tasty micro brews on tap and I have always been super happy with my drinks. The food is fab and priced reasonably. The clientele is usually a nice mix for people watching and they are located in a friendly neighborhood with ample street parking. I can dig it!

What a charming neighborhood bar.  Smack in the middle of the mighty Edgewater, the ProvTav is a skip and a hop from the corner of Sloan's Lake.  Greeted almost immediately as we sat down at the bar, menus were provided while our drink order was taken.  Quickly followed by appetizer plates and drinks.  The menu is relatively standard fare for a bar and grill; sandwiches, burgers, salads, some fried goodness.  They do know how to correctly temp a burger and for that I must applaud the chef.  Our party of four had three burgers, each with a different temperature request and I have to say that they did that perfectly.  Reasonable prices and not "too much" food also are positive qualities on display at the ProvTav.  The interior has a calming feel done up in mostly wood textures and there's an extensive patio out back.  Overall I'd say check this place out next time you are in the area.

Neighborhood bar  ... Tight quarters,, food is good , bar staff is grumpy ... Maybe tired or over worked ... Who wants  to get a drink with a grumpy bartender ... Waitstaff is cool and happy .. Just feel as though the ambiance is missing something ... We still come hoping for a little bit more excitement and flair ... Bring on a wine menu for the people that don't drink beer ...

The mimosas could have been a little more clear, but I'm giving this place five stars because of the amazing food. We got a seat outside right in front a tv to watch the football game. Hard to beat that! We will definitely be bringing friends back to enjoy this place once again.

After my cousin and I walked around Sloan's Lake, we decided to stop somewhere for a drink and something to eat when we stumbled across Providence Tavern. We loved this place! It's both rustic and charming. The prices are great, as well as the food! We got a basket of the sweet potato fries - they weren't overly greasy and the basket was huge. The burgers are awesome! A burger is only $5.95 - you can add specialty toppings for .75 cents, such as a fried egg, cream cheese, etc. Our service was excellent and we will definitely return!

My mom and I stopped in here randomly and were pleasantly surprised to be welcomed with a menu where we each could eat and be totally happy (I'm vegan and my mother is a meat eater). Their Asian chop salad was great and the server was knowledgeable about all the beers and able to bring us both something we were really happy with.

I would really give this a 3.5 if it was an option. We've been coming for the last year or so and have had mixed experiences. There are pros and cons to both, and overall it is a good spot. 

Pros:
- Awesome outdoor patio when it is nice out
- Trivia Tuesdays are a blast
- Good cocktails (Huckleberry Lemonade is my favorite)
- Good happy hour snacks and burgers
- Fun bar atmosphere 

Cons:
- Pretty standard menu (haven't had much other than the burger)
- Service is consistently sub-par

I love Providence Tavern. The happy hour is awesome, their burgers are some of the best in the city and their staff is fun and accommodating. I have been here with big groups, just a few people and even my two year old nephew (a big fan of the potstickers). 

I have been eating at Providence for the last 3 years and have never had a truly bad experience (that wasn't my own damn fault - too much drinky). I love the hummus, the flatbreads, the brunch, the cocktails.. I love it all. 

Hopefully I will have the "providence" to frequent this affordable and delicious establishment more often.. ;-D

A great neighborhood spot. Providence Tavern is dangerously close to my house but I'm certainly not complaining. 

They have a decent selection of craft beer and seem to keep things rotating which is always nice. They also have a variety of unique mixed drinks, I tried a pear mojito here once and it was really tasty. 

The service is generally attentive and for the most part everyone is very friendly. 

All the food I've had here has been good but the burgers are where it's at! $4.95 will get you a basic burger (+ lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles) and cheese, fries, etc are a la carte. Still a great deal, especially when you consider that they get their beef from local farmers. I've yet to order from their brunch menu but it sounds fantastic and any place that offers bottomless mimosas for $8 has my heart. I have no doubt that I'll be in to try it soon!

My god...the sign said "Best Burger in Denver"! I....don't.....think....so. When presented this holy burger I thought there was an error made and a slider appeared. Gosh darn it these guys are small. So small in fact there was a circumference of 1+ inches of unused bun around this little cute little guy. The bacon I had added to this beauty was arranged perfectly in corn rows, possibly exposing a chef with OCD as a handicap. Poor fella. We also dined extravagantly on the 5 mini onion rings brought to us so generously at the cost of $3.99. This place is a weak zebra and is run by laser cats. Nope.

This is hardly my review. Looks like they can take down the reviews they don't like. This place would have a much lower rating if they couldn't! 

The short of it, is that the staff are miserable, unhappy people. If you're in an abusive relationship then you might like the service here! 

Try the Edgewater inn next door if you like being served with a smile!

I like this spot a lot. The food is always good, great beer selection, and the service is always pretty decent. I really like the atmosphere as well. Definitely a place to check out close to Sloan's Lake.

The service can be a bit slow but that's generally because this place is packed full of fans- brunch fans that is. Aside from brunch- Drinks and lounging is fantastic here. They have strong wifi, indoor/outdoor seating, friendly service and great happy hour specials on drinks, as well as food. But, I think where this place really shines is in their weekend brunches. 
Bottomless mimosas, interesting menu items, DELICIOUS bloody mary's(I think the use a cucumber vodka- so that's different). Bring your dog, sit outside, load up on Bloodies, and absolutely try the pulled pork Benedict. You're bound to have an unforgettable time.

I typically have fun here. There HH apps are a great deal. The service staff is usually pretty friendly. The one complaint I have is that I can smell the beer lines. I am not sure if they are old or the need a new cleaning solution!

Our visit was Sad and disappointing. We sat and waited for a server. Then we waited again for our glass of water and cup of coffee. Then we waited again to place an order and I thought if I order the chips and salsa that it may give them time to prepare our meals. But we waited and it never came. 
I got up to let the waitress know that we are leaving and we thought it was rude to have us waiting. She said okay and blew me off. 
I asked to speak to a manager and they offered to give me a gift card, so that I may receive the same respect as I got from the waitress; I declined. 
It would have been better to have me feel her sincerity then to have been offered to pay me off.

Nice place rough neighbourhood. I tried to place an order and the waitress took my order and forgot my drink order almost immediately. I asked her again for my 'Glass of Cola' she forgot it again. I mean how hard is it to remember a 'cola'

This place is terrible! The "manager" needs a hair cut and an attitude adjustment! All the ladies that work there seem miserable. That has to be a direct results of a bad owner!  If you don't want to run a business probably shouldn't have one!  The menu is an absolute joke! THE WORST! This entire place is the worst! Oh and the entire staff should all go smoke another cigarette!

Let me start by saying that if there were a "jackass of the Year Award", this place would dominate the competition!  My fiancée and I have slogged our way through quite a few mediocre meals at this place because of the convenient location and good beer selection. I can deal with subpar service and lackluster cuisine, however, when it is apparent that all parties employed by the Providence are lazy and completely incompetent, I have to put my hoof down!  One such instance is when we accidentally stumbled upon their childlike attempt at a brunch menu. While reviewing the ten unappetizing options, I asked the server if I could simply have a B.L.T.  They had all items required on their brunch menu and they serve it on their lunch menu. The server refused to accommodate me. Additionally, my friend asked if he could have his hot wings tossed in the buffalo sauce instead of on the side which is their standard way of serving them. They refused him as well. These seem to me to be two completely reasonable requests. Moreover, these are just two issues out of about twenty. We will not be going back unless we feel the urge to heckle the staff while intoxicated as a joke because that's all this place is.

Great happy hour, great vibe and patio, love this place. The food is good, but I give it 4 stars instead of 5 as their only shortcoming is that their wine selection is pretty pathetic. Ravenswood Zin is their best red, come on now! Other than the mediocre wine this place is straight up welcoming fun with a great crowd.

The food is still good, but the service is slow. Good news, you can't get drunk sitting at a table here because the wait between seeing a server is long. Bad news is that you might starve. My past several trips here have been slow, so it isn't an anomaly.

Like, what is this place? I'd never heard of it, but driven by it, and had no idea it was such a cool little place!

Me and my roommates and my cousin and my uncle and my dad all popped in one night to watch the first night of Thursday Night Football! We had a seat out on the back patio, and other than a leaky roof during a rainstorm we really enjoyed ourselves. Server was stellar (though she thought we stiffed her, when my dad paid and put $0 for tip, intending to make the rest of us pay the tip in cash -- whoops!) and the food was pretty great too. The tacos were a TOUCH dry, but enough hot sauce and my mouth was none the wiser.

The part that I really enjoyed was the sizeable beer list. Much better than I expected for a kind of tucked out of the way place in Edgewater.

Another great little piece of the experience was the helpfulness of both our server and the manager -- it was cold, we asked him to turn a fan off -- he did immediately. Also without being asked he turned the volume on for the TVs on the patio so everyone could hear the sound for the game -- really dug that, nice touch.

Can't wait to go back because there's more food that I wanna try plus dat beer list doe.

I liked this place for the location and the patio and the fact it was not ridiculously crowded. Decent happy hour for a Saturday night. But service near the end was disappointing. Waitress disappeared and then only returned in 20-minute intervals. Took forever to get our tab and then to cash out. When I'm ready to go I want to be able to go and not be held hostage waiting for my tab.

Found this on a list of best brunch places in Denver, I live downtown, so I was like ehh, that's kinda far out there. NO! It is so worth it!! We went for bottomless mimosas on a Sunday. Only $8 and the staff always kept our glasses full. It's smart that they keep pitchers to pass around. We got tempted into having the bloody with the chaser of 90 Shilling, I am so picky about my bloodys, but this one was perfect. We sat out on the patio and it was beautiful day outside and we sat at a picnic table, two different groups of people sat at our table while we hung out and everyone was friendly and chatted, it's just that kind of place where you are nice to each other. Okay! So now for the best part. The food. We had the Truffled Grilled Cheese, it's like if you made an eggs Benidict on top of a fancy grilled cheese. That's a bad explanation, but it's really yummy and creamy. I don't even remember what else we ate because that was the best. For sure recommend.

Awesome happy hour! 3-7, 7 days a week! Great small plates that are a decent price and a serving for one! It's a great place for a bigger group in the back area or smaller groups in the cozier front area. A great atmosphere! I will definitely be back again as I am a happy hour junky. It was definitely a great find. Also, try their bacon wrapped jalapeño! I couldn't stop myself from having another one!

Agreeing with many other negative customer reviews that the service is horrible and unfortunately will keep me away from this place. My first experience with the blonde bartender here was terrible, however I chalked it off as her maybe having a bad day-Ive worked in the service world, I get it. My 2nd run in with her, worse than the time before. This is just an unhappy person that either does not like females, or just has a bad attitude in general with the world. Either way, their food is good (hence the 2 stars) but not worth having to deal with this lady again.

To me service is everything, and unfortunately that is where Providence completely bottoms out. I have given this establishment more than its fair share of business over the last year, and every time I have been left feeling like I just visited a poorly managed Applebee's in a West Virginia hill-town. The blonde bartender seems to be the main catalyst behind this issue.

Disappointing. The bar staff is unfriendly. I asked a bartender to make me her favorite cocktail to make. She sneered and proceeded to make me a vodka water. I felt very unwelcome there, and will not return.

Walked in. Sat down. Ignored. Waited. Ignored. Walked out. Not warm and welcoming. No sign of server for tables. Confusing and disappointing Cuz is heard great things about this place. It's 10:50pm Sunday night, apparently not concerned w my son and I.
This is a find. cool neighborhood bar and grill. Excellent happy hour drink and food specials. Poke and crab cakes are the start attractions! Cool area too.

A few BIG problems. Not only was the serving staff unprepared, dismissive, crass and drunk.. A party of 10 was quite literally turned away to accommodate one newly arrived guest.. I understand that every guest is important , yet shooing away the bulk of the business at the time was not the best managerial decision.. I suggest in the future that home teams and large parties that arrived far in advance garner the available media, this is simply a suggestion and in no way reflects your establishment in general, yet this most recent Sunday experience has soured a group of forgiving patrons that know the difficulty and challenge of running a successful restaurant..
Good luck in the future..

Ended up here while walking to another place.  Figured we would give it a go.

Overall cool place, very laid back vibe. I had the burger and it was good. Fresh meat and veggies.

The onion rings were almost burnt. Maybe they like them well done.

Our server was nice but slow on the refills. It was very slow so I don't think it was because she was too busy. Never like have to ask for refills.

Not bad at all but nothing special.

This is a great neighborhood bar, located in Edgewater. Providence Tavern has great bar food, and a good beer selection. The staff is very friendly and they were able to seat us, being a party of 6, without any problems. I recommend it highly for those who want to watch the game at a friendly bar.
